story:
Di cosa si tratta?

Parte del discorso è stato, negli ultimi cinque anni, un blog e un collettivo, gestito da decine di giovani e giovanissimi volontari e dedicato alle arti e alle tematiche sociali. Oggi, Parte del discorso è diventato un'associazione culturale e si propone di uscire dal World Wide Web per trasmettere l'amore per la cultura e il valore della solidarietà (in ogni loro forma) con azioni concrete: eventi, manifestazioni, dibattiti, incontri. In una parola, scambi.

Durante tutto il 2018, ogni mese Parte del discorso ha nominato un(')artista visuale da valorizzare. Oggi, nove dei nostri Artisti del mese sono coinvolti nella realizzazione del primo evento organizzato dall'associazione: una mostra collettiva delle loro opere.

9 artisti, 36 opere, 1 evento e... 9 messaggi vocali!

Uscire dall'Internet, per noi di Parte del discorso, non significa rinnegarlo: gli strumenti virtuali restano parte fondamentale della nostra attività. Come potrebbe essere altrimenti, in una società iperconessa come la nostra? D'altra parte, i social network e i moderni mezzi di comunicazione possono essere degli strumenti molto nobili, se usati con buoni, genuini propositi.

La ricetta della mostra vede allora la formula ormai rodata dell'esposizione fondersi con un elemento di novità, che pure risulterà a tutti essere molto familiare: abbiamo chiesto infatti ai nove artisti che prenderanno parte all'evento di inviarvi un messaggio vocale.

Riceverlo e ascoltarlo sarà semplicissimo! Accanto a ogni gruppo di opere, infatti, troverete un QR Code. Basterà scannerizzarlo con i vostri smartphone (e mettere le cuffie!) per lasciare che sia la voce stessa dell'autore a raccontarvi storie, curiosità e intenzioni del proprio lavoro.

Perché un messaggio vocale?

I messaggi vocali sono ormai parte della nostra quotidianità, tanto da arrivare perfino a essere un topos del modo contemporaneo di fare arte, in particolare nella musica pop: pensate a Frah Quintale, Francesca Michielin o ai Thegiornalisti, ma anche al caso più particolare di Nina Zilli, che ha presentato alla stampa il suo album Modern Art con un messaggio vocale di 7 minuti.

Che si tratti di quelli lunghi dieci minuti di Tommaso Paradiso o di brevissime registrazioni inviate mentre cerchiamo di non perdere il bus, i messaggi vocali vengono inviati sempre per la stessa ragione: sono immediati.

I nostri dieci artisti, quindi, si prestano a un esperimento volto a sintetizzare rapidità e contemplazione, confidenza e riverenza, analogico e digitale.

Tutti conosciamo qualcuno che ha «il vizio dei messaggi vocali». Se mai avete osato fargli notare che potrebbe anche scrivervi, di tanto in tanto, avrà sicuramente risposto: «Ma così faccio prima!». Stavolta, però, non saranno né l'amico narcisista né l'amica pigra a inviarvi vocali indesiderati, ma i vostri artisti preferiti. Quelli che seguite sui social e di cui comprate le opere. Quelli di cui ammirate così tanto il talento da averli sempre percepiti come irraggiungibili, distanti.

Invece no, non lo sono! Proprio come quel rompiscatole del vostro compagno di banco, anche il fotografo del cuore o l'illustratrice che tanto amate possono inviarvi un messaggio vocale e diventare, così, molto più prossimi a voi di quanto fino ad allora avevate pensato e rompere, con questo elemento di interazione diretta, quella contemplazione reverenziale tipica delle mostre classiche.

Artista #1 > selapennamidisegna

selapennamidisegna é Francesca Fusari, per tutti la Fra.

Francesca è laureta in Architettura e fa l'illustratrice freelance. È nata a Mantova, ma vive e lavora a Milano.

Su di sé scrive: «La mia linea non riuscirei a immaginarla diversa da com’è, morbida e sinuosa ma pulita, essenziale, senza esitazioni. Il mio è un mondo in bianco e nero con sfumature tutte da esplorare».

Artista #2 > Federico De Angelis

Federico De Angelis è un fotografo autodidatta. È nato a Roma, ma si immagina costantemente altrove – e, grazie ai suoi scatti, ci va anche!

Combiando la propria passione per la fotografia con l'amore per la natura, il viaggio e l'avventura, Federico cattura non solo paesaggi, ma il desiderio di prendere le distanze dall'isteria della vita moderna.

Su di sé scrive: «Non miro alla perfezione, ma a far emozionare le persone che guardano le mie foto, a trasportarle per un po' lontano dalla vita di tutti i giorni. Il mondo di oggi è caotico, frenetico, privo di valori e sentimenti. Le persone si fanno travolgere da questo fiume in piena dimenticando il vero scopo della vita e quelle piccole cose che dovrebbero avere più importanza nella vita di ognuno di noi».

Artista #3 > Camilla Cattabriga

La bolognese Camilla Cattabriga è una fotografa, classe 1995. Dopo essersi laureata al DAMS, ha intrapreso gli studi di Fotografia a Roma, presso il Centro Sperimentale di Cinematografia.

Realizza prevalentemente ritratti posati, ma dalla vena reportagistica, e dal 2015 ha cominciato a dedicarsi in particolare alle foto di nudo. Seppur giovanissima, ha già all'attivo 12 esposizioni.

Su di sé scrive: «Le mie fotografie si avvalgono frequentemente di luci naturali, coronate da uno stile sintetico e minimale, attento alle linee e alle geometrie presenti nelle inquadrature».

Artista #4 > Luca Di Martino

Luca Di Martino è nato a Napoli, dove tuttora vive. Ha studiato produzione e post-produzione cinematografica, ma ha poi deciso di dedicarsi alla fotografia e... alla ristorazione!

In italia e all'estero Luca prova a raccontare la storia delle persone che incontra e, attraverso queste, anche la sua.

Su di sé scrive: «Il mio è uno sguardo curioso, ma al tempo stesso improntato sull'armonia. Anche nelle situazioni più disagiate o complicate cerco sempre di vedere il lato estetico, cercando di non sottolineare tutto quello che potrebbe suscitare emozioni negative al fruitore. Nei lavori fatti in Malesia, sulla Transiberiana e in Nepal questo concetto credo e spero sia ben visibile».

Artista #5 > Lucia Schettino

Lucia Schettino è laureata in Grafica d'Arte presso l'Accademia delle Belle Arti di Napoli. Da giugno 2018 gestisce, insieme ad altri artisti, l'Atelier Alifuoco, nel cuore di Napoli. È anche un'arteterapeuta.

I suoi lavori sono una continua sperimentazione di forme, tecniche, materiali in libero dialogo.

Su di sé scrive: «Sono da sempre impegnata in un'attenta ricerca nel campo del disegno astratto e delle figure surreali, per soddisfare l'urgenza di una sperimentazione artistica continua, per il raggiungimento di un più completa conoscenza di me stessa».

Artista #6 > Tatiana Minelli

La fotografa Tatiana Minelli viene dalla provincia di Perugia.

È un'autodidatta di grande talento, che con i suoi ritratti dimostra di saper cogliere la bellezza unica e irruente di volti e corpi non convenzionali.

Su di sé scrive: «Amo mostrare ciò che altri non vedono o non vorrebbero vedere, tirare fuori parti "nascoste" di chi fotografo anche a costo di non piacere. Preferisco che qualcuno si giri dall'altra parte vedendo una mia foto, piuttosto che la ignori del tutto. Perché per me le foto devono far scaturire emozioni, belle o brutte che siano».

Artista #7 > Chiara Lombardi

Chiara Lombardi è una fotografa campana, laureata in Fotografia presso la Rome University of Fine Arts (RUFA). Attualmente studia a Torino, presso l'Accademia Albertina.

Le sue visioni giocano con corpi e forme, trame e punti di vista, alla ricerca di un Sensibile nascosto, che emerge da inedite fusioni.

Su di sé scrive: «Le mie sono visioni che fondono corpi, scrutano la pelle, accarezzano fugaci emozioni: sono racconti eleganti di intimità nascoste, gestualità accennate e sempre delicate».

Artista #8 > Michele Lapini

Michele Lapini vive a Bologna e nella vita fa il fotogiornalista. È laureato in Sviluppo Economico e Cooperazione Internazionale, ma è da autodidatta che ha appreso i segreti dello scatto perfetto.

Particolarmente interessato alle questioni sociali, politiche e ambientali, nel tempo ha catturato tantissimi volti tra manifestanti e politici, lavoratori e personaggi pubblici, ma anche scorci di vita quotidiana.

Su di sé scrive: «Cerco di documentare le realtà del presente, osservando le tante contraddizioni dei nostri tempi, restituendo immagini che possano far riflettere e agire. La fotografia non è mai neutra e in questo sta la responsabilità dei fotogiornalisti. C'è una citazione di Abbas Attar che amo molto: “We photojournalist are not changing the world. All we can do is show why this world has to change, sometime”».

Artista #9 > Dayana Montesano

La romana Dayana Montesano è una fotografa, classe 1985. Tra il 2014 e il 2016 ha frequestato i corsi di Ricerca personale e creativa e di Nudo fotografico presso la Scuola Romana di Fotografia.

Ossessionata dal sogno e l'inconscio, Dayana esplora questei aspetti attraverso la psicoanalisi, per capire meglio se stessa e il mondo che la circonda.

Su di sé scrive: «Quello che rappresento nelle mie fotografie è un mondo invisibile all'occhio. Questo accade suppongo per la mia tendenza a rifiutare la realtà così com’è. Tendo a manipolarla finché non diventa interessante, accettabile, piacevole ai miei occhi. Ho creato un piccolo universo illuminato, dove non esiste il nero e niente si nasconde nell’ombra».

Dove e quando si terrà l'evento?

La mostra verrà inaugurata il 1 febbraio 2019 negli spazi del Latte Creative Coworking, nel quartiere Testaccio di Roma, dove rimarrà allestita fino alla fine del mese.

Il Latte Creative Coworking è uno spazio minimale e accogliente, con una splendida terrazza che affaccia sull'area antistante al Mattatoio di Roma.

All'interno degli spazi del coworking, durante l'inaugurazione, le opere tracceranno solo l'inizio di un percorso fatto di idee, immagini e voci e che accompagnerà il visitatore dal corridoio d'ingresso fino alla ricompensa finale: la meravigliosa vista su Monte Testaccio!

Ad aiutarci nel tracciare questo percorso sarà la giovanissima curatrice della mostra, Yasmin Riyahi. Laureata con lode in Studi Storico-Artistici, è prossima alla laurea in Storia dell'Arte e frequenta il master in Economia e Management dell'Arte e dei Beni Culturali presso Il Sole24Ore Business School. L'esposizione si avvarrà del suo sguardo esperto!

Come verranno utilizzati i fondi?

I fondi raccolti dalla campagna verranno, orientativamente, così ripartiti:

  • € 1000,00 per la stampa di opere, cornici e cartoline.
  • € 500,00 per il catering, offerto da Hummustown!
  • € 300,00 per rimborsare il viaggio agli artisti presenti all'inaugurazione.
  • € 200,00 per le tasse della piattaforma e sulle transazioni.

E se raccoglieremo di più?

Raccogliere di più sarebbe un sogno! Ci permetterebbe infatti di:

  • avere un catering più ricco (con più cibo, vino e prosecco per tutti!).
  • investire sulla pubblicità dell'evento.
  • recuperare il costo di registrazione della neonata Associazione Culturale.
  • avere un fondo cassa utile a organizzare altri eventi in futuro e, più in generale, per finanziare le attività dell'associazione.

In particolare, ci piacerebbe molto investire di più nella collaborazione con il catering Hummustown, un progetto etico che desideriamo tantissimo sostenere!

Cos'è Hummustown?

Hummustown è un servizio di catering gestito da rifugiati siriani.

Lo scopo di Hummustown è permettere ai rifugiati di essere economicamente indipendenti e integrarsi nella vita romana, offrendo la loro cucina tradizionale. A loro è quindi data l'opportunità di cucinare e distribuire delizioso cibo siriano in tutta la capitale.

Hummustown, infatti, dà ai rifugiati siriani una possibilità, anziché carità, aiutandoli a integrarsi in un Paese con una lingua e una cultura diverse da quelle di origine e in cui spesso arrivano da soli, non potendo quindi contare sul supporto di nessuno.

Questi fattori sono un ostacolo nella ricerca di un impiego. Molte delle persone che oggi si impegnano nel catering hanno trovato in Hummustown la loro prima occasione di lavorare in Italia!

La tessera associativa

Sottoscrivendo la tessera associativa di Parte del discorso, puoi avere diritto a una serie di convenzioni commerciali che, in qualità di associazione, stiamo via via stipulando.

La tessera associativa 2019, sottoscrivibile a € 15,00, sarà disponibile in esclusiva per questa campagna di crowdfunding al prezzo di € 10,00!

Un ampio numero di soci ci permetterà, durante l'anno, di ottenere convenzioni sempre più numerose e vantaggiose per i nostri tesserati.

Sveleremo durante la campagna chi sono i nostri primi partner!

Le cartoline

Per finanziare l'evento e l'associazione, realizzeremo delle cartoline in nove varianti, una per ogni artista coinvolto nell'evento.

Sul fronte delle cartoline saranno riprodotte nove tra le opere esposte, mentre il retro presenterà il classico aspetto di una cartolina, con in più un collegamento al nostro sito. Spedirle ai vostri cari, quindi, non sarebbe una cattiva idea!

Sarà possibile acquistare delle copie delle cartoline anche durante l'evento.

Le opere esposte, in prevendita per Indiegogo

Durante la mostra saranno esposte 37 opere.

Si tratta prevalentemente di stampe fine art con cornici realizzate a mano e su misura, nel numero di quattro per ogni artista.

Fanno eccezione quattro lavori di Lucia Schettino, che sono invece piastre in resina e materiali misti, parte della collezione Expello dell'artista, che verranno esposte accanto alla copia di uno dei suoi lavori, appartenente alla stessa serie.

Per acquistarle, seleziona l'apposito perk, indicando artista e numero dell'opera!

Laureata con lode in Studi Storico-Artistici, è prossima alla laurea in Storia dell'Arte e frequenta il master in Economia e Management dell'Arte e dei Beni Culturali presso Il Sole24Ore Business School. L'esposizione si avvarrà del suo sguardo esperto!Come verranno utilizzati i fondi?I fondi raccolti dalla campagna verranno, orientativamente, così ripartiti:

€ 1000,00 per la stampa di opere, cornici e cartoline.

€ 500,00 per il catering, offerto da Hummustown!

€ 300,00 per rimborsare il viaggio agli artisti presenti all'inaugurazione.

€ 200,00 per le tasse della piattaforma e sulle transazioni.
E se raccoglieremo di più?Raccogliere di più sarebbe un sogno! Ci permetterebbe infatti di:
avere un catering più ricco (con più cibo, vino e prosecco per tutti!).
investire sulla pubblicità dell'evento.
recuperare il costo di registrazione della neonata Associazione Culturale.
avere un fondo cassa utile a organizzare altri eventi in futuro e, più in generale, per finanziare le attività dell'associazione.
In particolare, ci piacerebbe molto investire di più nella collaborazione con il catering Hummustown, un progetto etico che desideriamo tantissimo sostenere!Cos'è Hummustown?Hummustown è un servizio di catering gestito da rifugiati siriani.Lo scopo di Hummustown è permettere ai rifugiati di essere economicamente indipendenti e integrarsi nella vita romana, offrendo la loro cucina tradizionale. A loro è quindi data l'opportunità di cucinare e distribuire delizioso cibo siriano in tutta la capitale.Hummustown, infatti, dà ai rifugiati siriani una possibilità, anziché carità, aiutandoli a integrarsi in un Paese con una lingua e una cultura diverse da quelle di origine e in cui spesso arrivano da soli, non potendo quindi contare sul supporto di nessuno.Questi fattori sono un ostacolo nella ricerca di un impiego. Molte delle persone che oggi si impegnano nel catering hanno trovato in Hummustown la loro prima occasione di lavorare in Italia!La tessera associativaSottoscrivendo la tessera associativa di Parte del discorso, puoi avere diritto a una serie di convenzioni commerciali che, in qualità di associazione, stiamo via via stipulando.La tessera associativa 2019, sottoscrivibile a € 15,00, sarà disponibile in esclusiva per questa campagna di crowdfunding al prezzo di € 10,00!Un ampio numero di soci ci permetterà, durante l'anno, di ottenere convenzioni sempre più numerose e vantaggiose per i nostri tesserati.Sveleremo durante la campagna chi sono i nostri primi partner!Le cartolinePer finanziare l'evento e l'associazione, realizzeremo delle cartoline in nove varianti, una per ogni artista coinvolto nell'evento.Sul fronte delle cartoline saranno riprodotte nove tra le opere esposte, mentre il retro presenterà il classico aspetto di una cartolina, con in più un collegamento al nostro sito. Spedirle ai vostri cari, quindi, non sarebbe una cattiva idea!Sarà possibile acquistare delle copie delle cartoline anche durante l'evento.Le opere esposte, in prevendita per IndiegogoDurante la mostra saranno esposte 37 opere.Si tratta prevalentemente di stampe fine art con cornici realizzate a mano e su misura, nel numero di quattro per ogni artista.Fanno eccezione quattro lavori di Lucia Schettino, che sono invece piastre in resina e materiali misti, parte della collezione Expello dell'artista, che verranno esposte accanto alla copia di uno dei suoi lavori, appartenente alla stessa serie.Per acquistarle, seleziona l'apposito perk, indicando artista e numero dell'opera!

story:
SUMMARY:

[If you haven't watched the video above, do that first :D]

Hi! My name is Nōn Wels. I’m a podcaster, doggo lover, and I’m here because I almost died from shutting off my heart to the world. I don’t want that for you. I’m hoping you found this crowdfunding campaign because you were led by your heart.

I’m building The Feely Human Collective to be a safe, cozy sloth-hug of a space for celebrating the wonders of leading with and opening up our hearts, being curious about our emotions, engaging in the vulnerability that heals, and embracing the empathy that brings us all together.

But it’s not going to happen overnight, and it will take a lot of effort as well as your support.

The Feely Human Collective will consist of three distinct phases:

1. PHASE 1 - FOUNDATION:

In Phase 1, The Feely Human Collective will build the foundation of a community that values empathy, vulnerability, and emotional wayfinding—a collective of feely humans coming together and contributing their hearts by way of writing for the FHC journal, sharing stories on the new Feely Human Friday episode of the You, Me, Empathy podcast, leading free and paid online workshops to educate our communities, and designing art and illustration to sell in the FHC shop.

2. PHASE 2 - STRENGTHEN:

Phase 2 of The Feely Human Collective is about strengthening our foundation. We achieve this by building out a backlog of amazing journal content, workshops, and designs for new products. This is possible only by collaborating with other feely humans who are willing to share their ideas in a workshop, share their designs for our shop, and share their stories in our journal and podcast. That's the beautiful collaborative quality of The Feely Human Collective!

3. PHASE 3 - GROWTH:

In Phase 3, my aim is to bring The Feely Human Collective into the offline world by offering in-person workshops within brick-and-mortar businesses, schools (universities and primary/secondary schools), developing a peer-to-peer program, creating empathy-focused educational toolkits for children, hosting a quarterly live empathy-focused storytelling series, hosting retreats around the world, and launching a subscription box filled with fun games and exercises to develop empathy, vulnerability, and emotional wayfinding superpowers.

Interested to learn more? I wrote about Why I Created the Feely Human Collective here. Onward with feeling!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

My financial goal for this crowdfunding campaign is $20,000, which will go toward:

  • $8,000: Offsetting costs of product design and manufacturing pre-launch as well as allow me to invest back into the product line by developing new products for the future.
  • $4,000: Developing workshop content, create opportunity to pay workshop leaders, and invest in course-specific software.
  • $3,000: Product fulfillment (packaging, shipping, etc.)
  • $1,500: Offset increase in podcast hosting fees (with Feely Human Friday podcast episode being added each week).
  • $1,500: Hiring support in the areas of admin, social media, email, etc.
  • $1,000: Website maintenance, SEO, email, file storage, etc.
  • $1,000: Indiegogo fees, miscellaneous, etc.

THE REWARDS:

The first handful of tiers are built around products that we’ll be actually selling for The Feely Human Collective. I’ve worked with an amazing designer, Emily Poulin, to design the t-shirts, stickers, and enamel pins—all of which are included in various tiers.

Here are the oh so adorable pins!

Because the ethos of The Feely Human Collective is community, I thought it would be fun to also have an add-on tier that features some swag from some of my favorite organizations and people like Just Peachy Comics, Liz and Mollie, Amanda Stern, and others!

For the higher-priced tiers, I wanted to give one-on-one personal attention to all those feely humans who contribute at these levels (and I truly hope it’s many, not for the financial boost, but for the lovely friendships that will be forged!). These tiers will include being a featured guest on You, Me, Empathy, Skype chats, me flying out to spend the day with you, and more!

THE IMPACT:

I want to make the world a more feely place—a more empathetic place! A more emotionally intelligent place! A more vulnerable place! I want to make a bigger impact in reducing the stigma of talking about our feelings. I want empathy to be an active topic in businesses and schools. But to achieve that, I’m asking for a little financial assistance to hit the ground running with wind in my sails. Wait, that’s a mixed metaphor. How about hitting the ground running with a rocket booster strapped to my back? Yes, that. :D

I'm hoping that by reaching my goal of $20,000, this will give me wiggle room to start making real strides in building the foundation of this brand new collective. It will also help me recoup the investment I've made up front.

RISKS & CHALLENGES:

Look, I’ve never done this before. I’ve never started a business (outside of freelance writing and editing), and I’ve never crowdfunded. The challenge is a big one: will people connect with this idea around empathy, vulnerability, and emotional wayfinding as core tenets of the human experience? Will this work as a platform? Will people pay to join our online workshops? Will this scale the way I think it will? Will this truly make the world a more feely place?

In the work and research I've done leading up to this point, I feel confident enough to say "YES!" to all of the above questions. But there's always a chance that it may not work as I am envisioning it now, and I will need to prepare for that potential outcome, pivot if I need to, and hold steadfast to my why (aka the reason why I am doing this): 

The world needs more empathy. We need to see that vulnerability is a strength, not a weakness. We need to learn that our emotions are wondrous guideposts along the way. And we need safe spaces where humans can connect. That's what The Feely Human Collective aims to be. That's my why.

If I don’t reach my goal of $20,000, there will be some strategic decisions that will have to be made. Potential impacts include fewer initial products designed and available for sale in the FHC shop (I have two new shirt designs ready to be printed), potentially a bi-weekly Feely Human Friday episode of the podcast instead of a weekly episode, a delayed timeline to reach Phase 3 of The Feely Human Collective, longer fulfillment cycles for shipping and returns, etc.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

If you believe in the mission of The Feely Human Collective but you can’t contribute money (and that’s okay!), there are a few ways you can help:

  1. Share this crowdfunding campaign on social media and with your friends and family! Be sure to tag us @feelyhuman and use the hashtag #feelyhuman!

  2. Download these images and share on social media!

  3. Follow FHC on social media: Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook!

From my heart to yours,

Nōn Wels
Chief Feely
The Feely Human Collective

story:
Queer has become a commodity. 

The palatable queer; safe for consumption by straight audiences.

The Rose Festival strives to be a space to tell our stories in our own voices using and exploring our aesthetics. And while representation does matter, and we do need allies who include us in their work, we need a space where everybody is queer and therefore queer ceases to be the story leaving only amazing, boundary-pushing art.

For 3 days in May, in Montreal, The Rose Festival strives to give Queer artists the opportunity to create and show their work without apologies, to speak in their full voices, to fully embrace their Queer identity without having to straighten or subdue their art in any way for an audience. Art from an array of disciplines — from ceramics to photographs to classical piano to a drag queen poet to a storyteller to movement based theatre to tango dancing to documentary sound art. Art that foregrounds the diversity within our community, but that also shares a common aesthetic that looks at how we connect and how we make meaning within those connections.

We believe in a pay what you decide model to make our art accessible to all audiences, and make every effort to host in fully accessible spaces and enforce safe spaces policies at all of our events. 

Our festival is small, but growing. In the next five years, we hope to acquire the financial stability to offer a week-long showing of queer creations, extending and encouraging the dialogue within the queer community and among queer artists and their allies. Eventually, we dream of the day that we can own an actual, physical space - a garden bed, if you will - within which queer bodies will know that they are safe, leaving queer minds free to explore and create, and queer hearts unfettered in their abilities to follow their passions and discover their unique aesthetic language.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Are you an artist? Also on a tight budget? We totally get it. Here are some other ways that you can help:

Share this campaign. The more people who hear about us, the greater the chances of us finding people who are able to help. Spreading the word really helps us out.

Share resources. We have artists who need rehearsal space, who could benefit from the eye of a dramaturge. We need plinths to exhibit ceramics, and a piano tuned. Not to mention a microphone, a high resolution projector, folding chairs (a LOT), a temporary dance floor, someone who knows how to clean concrete, etc, etc, etc. If you have access to resources that you think the festival can use, please get in touch at festivalrose@gmail.com

Volunteer. This festival runs because of our amazing volunteers. If you have a bit of time to give -- even a couple of hours helps -- email our fabulous volunteer coordinator, Samantha, at festivalrose.volunteer@gmail.com -- and remember, you don't have to be queer to volunteer!

Come see the work. We have some amazing art crammed into 3 days. Come see us. We are pay what you decide at the door, with no one turned away for lack of funds, and all money raised at the box office goes right back to the creators. So come support queer art in our city, and celebrate our common language of creativity.

story:
Kerrville Renaissance Festival, January 26th-28th, 2018

Like Brigadoon, for one weekend a year, a quiet unassuming park is transformed into the village of Kerr, filled with a cast of characters that will entertain, interact, and amuse visitors from all around Texas and beyond!

Our Goal and How You Can Help

Together with your generosity we can uphold and enhance the magic and merriment of our village.  Your contributions will help to facilitate:

  • Advertising & Marketing
  • Office Expenses
  • Entertainment
  • Set Design
  • Site Improvements
  • Emergency Management
  • Boring Behind the Scenes Stuff

     

Let's Get Real

We all know that putting on a festival is a lot of work, and involves a group effort of passionate and committed individuals. If we could run on enthusiasm alone, it would provide all we need. But as we all know, the truth of the matter is, no matter how much we love what we do, we can't make this happen without key financial components. Here is a more detailed breakdown of what your contributions are going to:

  • $25,000 Advertising, Marketing, and PR: To create awareness of the festival through social media, radio, newspapers, brochures, posters, signs, and other media content.
  • $10,000 Office Expenses: Staff, rent, office supplies, graphics, web design, and of course postage.
  • $25,000 Entertainment: Stage acts, street cast, food and water for entertainers, lodging, and a new stage.
  • $10,000 Set Design and Site Improvements: Site crew, production staff, photo ops, banners, signs, and backdrops.
  • $5,000 Emergency Management Services: Police, security, radios, first aid, and professional services.
  • $15,000 Boring Behind the Scenes Stuff: Trash, parking staff, insurance, tickets, and site rental.

As you can see, we are attempting to gather a fraction of what our overall costs are. 

Other Things You Can Do To Help

  • Visit our website at www.KerrvilleRenFest.com to purchase tickets.
  • Like, Share, and Follow us on our social platforms (Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter)
  • Come to our festival, January 26-28, 2018 in Kerrville, Texas.

What Your Generosity Means To Us

Together, with your contribution, you are helping to grow our boutique festival into a bigger, better event. Your generosity will help bring some of the industry's top crafters, entertainers, and musicians to the Texas Hill Country, as well as maintaing our partnership with the Hill Country Youth Events Center in Kerrville, TX. By doing so you are supporting the effort to create lasting magical memories for friends and family alike. Thank you for keeping the arts alive!

story:
Here's why we are asking for your support

 

We painted the mural in 1976,  the Bicentennial of the American Revolution, thinking Berkeley should have a memorial to its own revolutionary tradition. It has survived,  free of graffiti (mostly) for 42 years because of the protection of the community. But time has taken its toll.  Colors are fading and it badly needs repainting and sealing. If we act, now we can preserve it for another 42 years or more. If not we fear it will soon be lost forever.

We feel a particular urgency to save the mural, given that the University has announced plans to build on People’s Park. Now, more than ever, it is important to preserve a memorial to the struggles that led up to its creation. It's still the only one in Berkeley.

And the movements that provided the inspiration

 

Who we are

We are Osha Neumann and O'Brian Thiele. We painted the original in 1976. Osha designed it, and the painting was done by a team of muralists including O'Brien, Hannah Kranzberg and Daniel Galvez. Osha and O'Brian restored it in 1999, and have tended it ever since. We will lead the restoration team composed of paid assistants and the many people who have volunteered to help. We are getting older, and this restoration may be our last hurrah.

Yet another reason why now is the time for your support.      

Where the money will go

The money we raise will go towards materials and labor needed to remove graffiti, repair areas of the wall that are cracked and flaking, repaint sections of the mural, which  have faded or been damaged, and finally protect the restored mural with a Sheer Coat sealer, which will removal  of graffiti without damaging the painting.

Materials:

Graffiti removal solvents and varnish sealer................ $600.00

Acrylic mural paint, brushes....................................... $1,800.00

Sheer  Coat sealer........................................................ $1,000.00

Total:...........................................................................   $ 3,400.00

Labor:

Supervising muralists  (O'Brian Thiele and Osha Neumann):

400  hours @ $30.00...............................................$12,000.00

Mural assistants:

500 hours @ $15.00..................................................$7,500.00

 

Total:........................................................................ $22,900.00

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word  -- tweet on Facebook or message or email or actually talk to your friends and let them know about our campaign. And when we're out there working, stop by and  lend a hand or drop a few coin in the bucket we will have out for contributions.
story_txt:
Here's why we are asking for your support
 
We painted the mural in 1976,  the Bicentennial of the American Revolution, thinking Berkeley should have a memorial to its own revolutionary tradition. It has survived,  free of graffiti (mostly) for 42 years because of the protection of the community. But time has taken its toll.  Colors are fading and it badly needs repainting and sealing. If we act, now we can preserve it for another 42 years or more. If not we fear it will soon be lost forever.
We feel a particular urgency to save the mural, given that the University has announced plans to build on People’s Park. Now, more than ever, it is important to preserve a memorial to the struggles that led up to its creation. It's still the only one in Berkeley.

And the movements that provided the inspiration

 
Who we are
We are Osha Neumann and O'Brian Thiele. We painted the original in 1976. Osha designed it, and the painting was done by a team of muralists including O'Brien, Hannah Kranzberg and Daniel Galvez. Osha and O'Brian restored it in 1999, and have tended it ever since. We will lead the restoration team composed of paid assistants and the many people who have volunteered to help. We are getting older, and this restoration may be our last hurrah.
Yet another reason why now is the time for your support.      

Where the money will go
The money we raise will go towards materials and labor needed to remove graffiti, repair areas of the wall that are cracked and flaking, repaint sections of the mural, which  have faded or been damaged, and finally protect the restored mural with a Sheer Coat sealer, which will removal  of graffiti without damaging the painting.
Materials:
Graffiti removal solvents and varnish sealer................ $600.00
Acrylic mural paint, brushes....................................... $1,800.00
Sheer  Coat sealer........................................................ $1,000.00
Total:...........................................................................   $ 3,400.00
Labor:
Supervising muralists  (O'Brian Thiele and Osha Neumann):
400  hours @ $30.00...............................................$12,000.00
Mural assistants:
500 hours @ $15.00..................................................$7,500.00
 
Total:........................................................................ $22,900.00
Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word  -- tweet on Facebook or message or email or actually talk to your friends and let them know about our campaign. And when we're out there working, stop by and  lend a hand or drop a few coin in the bucket we will have out for contributions.

story:
Jau suorganizavome daugiau nei 160 nemokamų muzikinių, vizualinių, sportinių, vaikiškų, savanorystės bei draugiškų aplinkai, mados, kino ir fotografijos renginių ir veiklų. Unikalios Baltijos gamtos ir autentiškos architektūros globoje sukūrėme neatkartojamą erdvę poilsiauti ir pramogauti išties plačiai auditorijai. Zuikio Daržo bendruomenės jėga ir žavesys gyvena ir tobulėja DIY (do it yourself) ir gamtos dėsniais - taigi viskas iš širdies ir tikrų idėjų. 

2019-ųjų vasarai žadiname kūrybą - didžiausią mūsų bendruomenės projektų projektą. Paklausyk ir prisijunk, nes šie metai be tavęs - tik gražus paplūdimys ir kopos.

 

GARSO NAMELIS

Jeigu muzika lengvai veikia emocijas, suburia judėjimus, nuverčia politinius režimus ir plečia žmogaus sąmonę tai kiekvienas klausytojas, o juo labiau kūrėjas gali išjausti tokios vietos svarbą. Garso Namelis - mobili studija Kuršių Nerijos pušyne su profesionalia įranga repeticijoms, kūrybai ir įrašams. Muzikantams, tai kūrybinė rezidencija, vieta naujų kompozicijų ir albumų pradžiai, įdomiems projektams ir kolaboracijoms susiburti bei terpė atrasti negirdėtus talentus. Mūsų tikslas auginti kūrybišką ir mąstančią bendruomenę. Būtent muzikos ir žmonių dėka, Zuikio Daržas yra toks fenomenalus reiškinys, koks yra dabar. Tokia muzikinė rezidencija labai reikalinga mums ir Nidai, jei norime judėti į priekį, orientuotis į naujas veiklas, plėsti pomėgius ir pramogas, kuriose gaustų ne vien naktiniai vakarėliai. Garso namelio sėkmę garantuos mainų principas: atlikėjai kviečiami reziduoti namelyje, repetuoti ir įrašinėti, o kūrybinio laikotarpio metu surengti nemokamus koncertus Nidos gyventojams ir atvykusiems. Tai naujas šuolis Zuikio Daržo istorijoje, dovana Lietuvos ateities muzikai ir rimtas įnašas Nidos kultūriniam klimatui. 

Vaikų dienos stovykla “Zuikių Vasara”

Nauja erdvė ir užimtumas mažiems. Žinome tavo atostogų svajones - daugiau įdegti, o mažajį aktyvuolį subendrinti su kitais zuikiais. Tai edukacinė, kūrybinė ir savęs pažinimo stovykla. Laukiami vaikai nuo 4 iki 10 metų. Gera žinia, stovykla – ir savaitgalio vakarais. Pažindinkis su kitais tėvukais ir tapk bendruomenės dalimi!

Sportas Kurorte

Į Nidą kviečiame bokso, Tailando bokso, karate, MMA trenerius, funkcinių treniruočių ekspertus. Aštuonių savaičių trukmės aktyvūs rytiniai ir vakariniai užsiėmimai su įžymiais Lietuvos treneriais. Kviečiame susipažinti ir įgyti naujų įgūdžių. Sportuojame nuo antradienio iki šeštadienio.

Slam ir stand-up comedy

Kviesime klausytis šiuolaikinio literatūros reiškinio – slemo – ir stand-up comedy pasirodymų. Ovacijos už socialiai aštrią poetinę improvizaciją. Programoje jau žiba slemo žvaigždė Marius Povilas Elijas Martynenko ir stand-up meisteris Olegas Surajevas. Taip pat svečių lauksime pokalbių vakaruose su įžymiais atostogautojais, kuriuos ves aktorius Marius Čižauskas.

Kinas

Nuo liepos iki rugsėjo kiekvieną trečiadienį ir sekmadienį rodome festivalio „Kino pavasaris“ filmus. Geras kinas po atviru dangumi.

Improvizacija

Norėtum išmokti gyventi be išankstinio pasiruošimo? Tai padaryti galėsi improvizacijos užsiėmimuose. Improvizacija – ne tik aktorystės technika, bet ir metodas, mokantis atsipalaiduoti, atsisakyti savikritikos ir mėgautis šia akimirka bei jos manifestuojamais turtais. Viena pagrindinių improvizacijos taisyklių – „Klaida yra gerai”. Tai įsisavinus atsipalaiduojama ir uždegama žalia šviesa kūrybai. Žaisti, klysti ir džiaugtis!

Šokių, edukacijos stovyklos jaunimui bei suaugusiems

Vasarą Nidoje atostogaus Lietuvos šokių mokykla ‘Low Air’, atstovaujanti savitoms judesio subkultūroms. Tai dinamiškos šokio edukacinės stovyklos vaikams ir suaugusiems. Kiti eksperimentiniai patirtiniai spektakliai, kūno judesio terapija, taikomasis teatras, šokis, kino, muzikos, kitų menų seminarai. 

Geri darbai gamtai

Pusiasalio mylėtojai žino, koks žavingas Kuršių Nerijos pajūrio ruožo kraštovaizdis, o ypač smėlio kopos, kurios nėra itin atsparios aplinkos įtakai. Norint jas išsaugoti, būtina žmonių pagalba. Kartu su ‘Kuršių Nerijos nacionalinio parko direkcija’ kviečiame visus savanoriškai prisidėti prie gamtotvarkos plano vykdymo, šalinant sumedėjusią augmeniją Naglių gamtiniame rezervate. Rūpinamės, kad savanoriai būtų sotūs. 

Taip pat šios vasaros didysis planas sumažinti plastiko sąnaudas ir apjungti daugiau Nidos kavinių plastiko taršai mažinti.

Lauko virtuvės svečiai

Bent kartą pas mus pasivaišinę žino, Zuikiai gamina puikiai. Įkvėpimo semiamasi iš kelionių aplink pasaulį ir į Nidą atvykstančių geriausių virtuvės šefų bei įdomiausių Lietuvos restoranų atstovų. Kviestiniai svečiai savo ruožtu vykdo kulinarinius iššūkius ir čia pat sukuria vis naują gatvės maisto patiekalą. Skanūs savaitgaliai ir laisvė skonio improvizacijoms. 

O kas už tai?

Mainais į tokio gigantiško vasaros meniu įgyvendinimą  – unikalios patirtys, renginiai, kokių dar neorganizavome ir nauja kūryba nuo jūsų mylimiausių bei dar neatrastų kūrybininkų ir edukatorių. Dėkingumą taip pat galėsite pačiupinėti: maikės, ženkliukai, džemperiai, vinilai, iliustracijos ir dar daugiau.

English

Zuikio Daržas - a multi’musical, independent movement of culture and entertainment raised in the realms of unalike nature and a homeland to magical adventures named Nida. In just five summers our little cafe-house by the beach has morphed into a specific and very fun culture, creating a new state within the minds of our friends and fans. We’ve organised over 160 musical, visual, sports events, activities for children, volunteering, environmentally-friendly happenings, fashion, film and photography occurrences. In the premisses of very unique nature and authentic architecture we’ve designed an alternative forest-scape for leisure and pleasure for variety of people. The mastery and charm of our community thrives on the fundamentals of DYI and the wildlife around - so all is for real, coming from the hearts of true dreamers and doers. Well known for a distinctive perception and alignment of atmosphere around us, we must admit we are quite an experiment and a daily surprise to ourselves too with every upcoming season. So there is a huge wave to catch in the summer of 2019 and it goes by the name of “Awake Creativity”. Listen up & please contribute because this season without you is pretty beaches and dunes only.

 

Sound Shack

Sound Shack is a yet to be mobile studio in the forests of Curorian Spit with professional sound equipment for rehearsals, jams and records. It’s a residency to express musical creativity, a place for new compositions, surprising collabs and new albums to happen. Our aim is to bring up a creatively oriented community. The reason Zuikio Daržas is such a phenomenal existence is because of all the musicians constantly fleeing to our place for creational and recreational reasons. A truly inspiring and welcoming place so we think such musical residency is a must if we are moving forward with new activities and creative processes. A success formula: during the summer season musicians from Lithuania and talents from all over the world come to the shack and get creative there. As a “thank you” gift they present a musical act for locals and tourists at the end of their session. The Sound Shack is a new leap for Zuikio Daržas, a contribution to the future of Lithuanian music scene and a key investment to Nida’s cultural climate. 

Day care camp “Rabbit’s Summer”

A new playground and activities in the nature for the little ones. We know your dream holiday includes more tan and chill so here is an opportunity to take your kids to our day care camp and be sure they get to socialise with other sea kids and get creative as well. Fun news - excuse to have fun on the weekend evenings as well. Age 4-10 years old. Get to know other parents and join the community.

Sport in the Resort

Last season was a power blast! So here we move again. Tuesday to Saturday, morning and evening sessions with best of Boxing, Muay Thai, MMA, Fitness, Movement and Yoga trainers from Lithuania. 

Movie nights

Screenings of best picks from “Kino Pavasaris” programme and our own favourites.

Impro workshops

Want to live without any prejudice and spontaneously? Join our impro classes, while it’s not for actors only but as well a great opportunity for anyone to learn how to enjoy failing and starting all over again with a smile on your face. A window to opening your creative flow and enjoying a beauty of a given moment.

Educational classes for youth and adults

Dance team “Low Air” - camp of movement’s culture.

Film-making workshop with Marat Sargsyan.

Music for all - musical education workshop with Remigijus Rančys.

Theatrical workshop for children and teens.

Environmentally friendly causes

Curorian Spit’s nature scapes are very unique however fragile. So we are always involved into aspects of preserving and taking care of it. Maximum reduction of plastic waste is our priority this season.

Open Kitchen

Chefs from famous restaurants and other gastronomical enthusiasts are invited to experiment in our open kitchen. Wild life and wild food experiments. 

So what’s in it for YOU?

Your contribution is vital for all the above to become the awesome reality of 2019. Events, activities and new places to be built and happen. What’s even cooler - you get amazing presents and experiences for your generosity - Check our perks we’ve prepared exclusively for this crowdfunding!

story:
ROOM PROJECT IS A SPACE FOR WOMEN + NON-BINARY WRITERS + ARTISTS 

Room Project felt there was a need for intersectional creative community in Detroit and responded with a call for women and non-binary writers and artists to move their artistic practices into a (semi) public sphere. The project has since evolved into a dynamic setting for programming, workshops, public conversations, and a rotating installation space for Detroit's fine artists to perform and show their work in the storefront windows. We have made affordable access for women of color and queer communities a top priority and provided a quiet workplace where safety, focus and drive can flourish. 

WE HAVE NEEDS, DESIRES, WANTS...

Well, we have to pay rent. And we're close to covering our monthly overhead. But once we have enough members/membership fees to cover that, we still need to provide honorariums for the artists who bring their talent to Room Project. We believe deeply that artists, specifically women/NB/GNC artists, are too often asked to do favors, donate, give away time, or undervalue themselves. Everybody's got to get paid if artists are going to survive, and stay.

Beyond that, we still need practical things: more shelving, books, a bulletin board, a projector, pens, a loaner laptop, coffee mugs, planters, a website with an archive, a book binder. We want to always say yes to the writers & artists of Detroit who come to us with a great project, and have a little money to get the word out about that great project. We want to say to the young, brilliant, energized, and often broke members & friends of Room Project: "Cool. Now how can you make that idea bigger?" We want to be able to fly in a few writers that make our members swoon. We want great coffee. We want to sponsor writers who can't afford membership. 

Members

First, we want you to be a member here. You write poems, but you don't show them to anyone. You publish, but you don't know where to find readings in Detroit. You dropped out of your program, and you miss the conversations you had when you were surrounded by people who loved the thing you loved. You can't write in the house when there's laundry to do. Use Room Project to do your work/meet your people/make a thing in the world that should exist. Use Room Project to play, and be just a bit bolder in the world.

$50 a month gives you 24-hour access to the space, 50% discounts on workshops and events, too much coffee, and a once-a-month meeting with other members to talk about what you're working on these days. There's no contract, it's monthly. If you can't afford $50, you can pay less and volunteer. 

Non-Members

If membership isn't right for you, or you're a cis male, you still can still participate in our public programming, workshops and help supplement other people's discounted memberships. You can help make a very cool project come to life in Detroit and help our community feel energized, supported, seen. Donate a membership to someone who can't afford it, but still manages to write between the two jobs they hold down; donate a sum in the name of a woman in your life who never had the opportunity to take her talent seriously; send this campaign to a person who needs to hear that their voice fucking matters.  

PERKS! 

Let there be perks.

–If you choose a MEMBERSHIP, or SUPPORT @ $50, you will receive a sexy tote bag where in the future someone you're a tiny bit attracted to will ask you, "Hey, where'd you get that sexy tote bag?" and then you'll tell them, and then maybe you'll fall in love. It could happen. 

–If you choose a MEMBERSHIP, you will also have a seat at our first members-only dinner. This dinner is a collaboration with social practice artist Zoe Minikes of Victory Kitchen, and will take place in a beautiful private venue and be the best night of your life. 

 

–If you SUPPORT upwards of $100, you will receive a tote AND free admission to our Fall Kick-Off Party & Reading where you will likely drink too much wine. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Pass this along, will you? Or drop off some really, really good books @ 6513 Woodward Ave.
story_txt:
ROOM PROJECT IS A SPACE FOR WOMEN + NON-BINARY WRITERS + ARTISTS 
Room Project felt there was a need for intersectional creative community in Detroit and responded with a call for women and non-binary writers and artists to move their artistic practices into a (semi) public sphere. The project has since evolved into a dynamic setting for programming, workshops, public conversations, and a rotating installation space for Detroit's fine artists to perform and show their work in the storefront windows. We have made affordable access for women of color and queer communities a top priority and provided a quiet workplace where safety, focus and drive can flourish. 

WE HAVE NEEDS, DESIRES, WANTS...
Well, we have to pay rent. And we're close to covering our monthly overhead. But once we have enough members/membership fees to cover that, we still need to provide honorariums for the artists who bring their talent to Room Project. We believe deeply that artists, specifically women/NB/GNC artists, are too often asked to do favors, donate, give away time, or undervalue themselves. Everybody's got to get paid if artists are going to survive, and stay.
Beyond that, we still need practical things: more shelving, books, a bulletin board, a projector, pens, a loaner laptop, coffee mugs, planters, a website with an archive, a book binder. We want to always say yes to the writers & artists of Detroit who come to us with a great project, and have a little money to get the word out about that great project. We want to say to the young, brilliant, energized, and often broke members & friends of Room Project: "Cool. Now how can you make that idea bigger?" We want to be able to fly in a few writers that make our members swoon. We want great coffee. We want to sponsor writers who can't afford membership. 
Members
First, we want you to be a member here. You write poems, but you don't show them to anyone. You publish, but you don't know where to find readings in Detroit. You dropped out of your program, and you miss the conversations you had when you were surrounded by people who loved the thing you loved. You can't write in the house when there's laundry to do. Use Room Project to do your work/meet your people/make a thing in the world that should exist. Use Room Project to play, and be just a bit bolder in the world.
$50 a month gives you 24-hour access to the space, 50% discounts on workshops and events, too much coffee, and a once-a-month meeting with other members to talk about what you're working on these days. There's no contract, it's monthly. If you can't afford $50, you can pay less and volunteer. 
Non-Members
If membership isn't right for you, or you're a cis male, you still can still participate in our public programming, workshops and help supplement other people's discounted memberships. You can help make a very cool project come to life in Detroit and help our community feel energized, supported, seen. Donate a membership to someone who can't afford it, but still manages to write between the two jobs they hold down; donate a sum in the name of a woman in your life who never had the opportunity to take her talent seriously; send this campaign to a person who needs to hear that their voice fucking matters.  

PERKS! 
Let there be perks.
–If you choose a MEMBERSHIP, or SUPPORT @ $50, you will receive a sexy tote bag where in the future someone you're a tiny bit attracted to will ask you, "Hey, where'd you get that sexy tote bag?" and then you'll tell them, and then maybe you'll fall in love. It could happen. 
–If you choose a MEMBERSHIP, you will also have a seat at our first members-only dinner. This dinner is a collaboration with social practice artist Zoe Minikes of Victory Kitchen, and will take place in a beautiful private venue and be the best night of your life. 
  
–If you SUPPORT upwards of $100, you will receive a tote AND free admission to our Fall Kick-Off Party & Reading where you will likely drink too much wine. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Pass this along, will you? Or drop off some really, really good books @ 6513 Woodward Ave.

story:
What in the world is Pittonkatonk?

Well...

Balkan Brass, Cumbia, Live Hip-Hop, Activist Big Bands, Social Justice Organizers: a one of a kind musical festival, free and open to all, connecting the dots between community, organizers, and euphoric musical experiences.  

Pitttonkatonk started 8 years ago as a backyard BBQ with 150 people and is now a city wide community festival that welcomes over 5,000 people and brings together performers from around the world. 

This indiegogo campaign is necessary for us to continue to provide a safe space for visitors and support the growing costs associated with the event. Each year as we welcome more performers we also have to accomodate more visitors to the park. That's where you come in. 

PIttonkatonk wasn't created to draw business, it wasn't created to sell concessions. PIttonkatonk was created provide a cultural experience that is participatory by both performers and spectators. 

What We Need 

Right now we need $10,000 to cover our expenses. This includes

  • security,
  • porta potties
  • lodging for bands
  • signage
  • cups, napkins, plates
  • insurance policy
  • artist transportation
  • marketing
  • trash & recycling removal
  • and of course that extra roll of toilet paper that you need in the bathroom

The Impact (What do we have to show for it?) 

 

  • We hosted 20+ workshops with local high schools featuring local and international performers (including exclusive performances by Xhou Family Band (China) Sessa (Brasil), Lemon Bucket Orkestra (Canada) and the beautiful Ben Barson of Afro Yaqui Music Collective)

  • Commissioned 3 new musical pieces to be premiered on May 11, 2019 by local artists 

  • Hosting 8 touring bands (4 are international performers including Los Mirlos (Peru), Dzambo Agusevi Orchestra (Macedonia), Lemon Bucket Orkestra (Canada) and Hugo Cruz & Caminos), 

Risks & Challenges Have you ever had to convince someone why an artist was important? It's not necessarily fun. 

We realize every year you hear us ramble about donating. We are sorry not sorry for this. 

In the early years it was a lot less work and required a few volunteer meetings, reserving the pavilion, we would see what was going to happen. Now it's got a bit more complicated. Pittonkatonk requires year round effort. As we grow so does the time commitment (meetings, meetings, and more meetings))

  • writing grants and fundraising (like this indiegogo)
  • Booking bands requires a lot of hours (negotiating and logistics)
  • We are creating new collaborations with local artists
  • providing touring bands with lodging,
  • Paperwork! The city has changed and now there is a lot more paperwork (permits, licenses, insurance, artist visas) 

Other Ways You Can Help

TELL A FRIEND TO TELL A FRIEND!

VOLUNTEER!

BRING A DISH TO THE POTLUCK

SHARE THIS ON SOCIAL MEDIA

story:
What's Broken?

“Out of this darkness a new world can arise, not to be constructed by our minds so much as to emerge from our dreams. Even though we cannot see clearly how it's going to turn out, we are still called to let the future into our imagination… The web of life both cradles us and calls us to weave it further.“ ~Joanna Macy 

Western culture is coming apart at the seams. Disconnection & commodification runs rampant. The old story of hyper-individualism is pulling us toward nearly-inevitable internal & external collapse. This deep transformation, though painful, is only the pain of labor, as we collectively birth what comes next… 

         

 

How Are We Helping To Fix It?

This tour is a direct cultural response to those aspects of our society breeding fear and separation. We stand for the creative integration of our pain and our desires for the world, through creating social containers that practice some of the healthiest Organizing Principles of Life:  Connection, Creativity, Diversity, Locality, Learning, Synergy, (and many others). 

When we stand together, creatively united under these principles, we inherently strengthen relationships and inner tools for navigating our present realities together. 

See www.backtolife.org to learn about who we are, and what we stand for!

 

Revival Tour Specifics:

                                                                               

Our tour will be composed of 10 stops along the coastal cities of the Salish Sea. From small intentional communities, to large venues in urban areas, we've been graciously invited into people's homes to offer workshops, facilitate dialogue, break bread, and share world changing music with people of all ages, races, and orientations. Lydia Violet's "Music As Medicine In Our Time" workshops are an offering of Joanna Macy's "Work That Reconnects" combined with exploring music as a way our communities practice resiliency, truth-speaking, and sourcing our energy for action in our time.

We've partnered with many local organizations in towns along the way, who will help bring deep community participation and dialogue about what really matters! These organizations include: NewStories, The Orcasong Alliance, The Permaculture Action Network, The Salish Sea Marine Sanctuary, The OrcaNetwork, The Compassion Games, The Thriving Communities Conference, and many others... (Please look into these beautiful efforts!)

Book-ended by 2 full day gatherings, and peppered with 8 evening events in between, we've got a robust plate of opportunity ahead of us! Permaculture projects, "Work That Reconnects" workshops, Community asset mapping, Participatory murals, Poetry workshops, & Silkscreening projects, oh my! We can't wait to hit the road and bring what's in our hearts out into the world... 

 

Imagine a World:

          

Imagine a world inspired by radical social change makers like ourselves (and YOURself!) roaming the countryside every summer in "Chautauqua-like" fashion, going to communities large and small over the years, building relationship, reviving True celebration, and bringing together people around social & environmental causes that can only be addressed at the hyper-local level.

Imagine a world of joy, connection, and action catalyzed by bards and poets and facilitators, who help to bring out the very best nature of those around them through tried & true social practices... Where children dance, where adults consult with each other, where teens express themselves, and where elders are honored for their wisdom sharing... THIS is our dream for each community we touch down in, and we can't wait to co-create it with YOU!!! 

 

Our Credentials:

          

The Revival Team is composed of many highly-accomplished people, each an artist and activist in their own right. Though we’ve come together under the same banner for this tour, as individuals we are:  trained facilitators, professional touring musicians, large-scale event coordinators, professional photographer/videographers, professional muralists, participatory governance specialists, trained activists, counselors, and so much more... You are in good hands with us, and we look forward to sharing what we have to offer with YOU!!!

Check out Lydia Violet's music and work with Joanna Macy at www.lydiafiddle.com !!

Our Mentors:

Revival has a wide cadre of mentors helping to inform our efforts. The following thought leaders are seasoned contributors in their fields, and have graciously offered their wisdom in service of our mission:

  • Joanna Macy  (eco-philosopher, author, buddhist scholar, WTR creator)
  • Tom Atlee   (collective intelligence scholar, author, facilitator)
  • Michelle Holliday  (international consultant, author, living systems scholar)
  • Michael Dowd  (eco-evangelist, best-selling author, revivalist ; )                                                                    
  • Teresa Posakony  (process/hosting expert, living systems scholar)
  • So many more than can be listed here… (We're in good hands folks!)
  • ...check out www.backtolife.org to learn more...

 

Your Campaign Contribution:

By funding this $7500 campaign, you are helping to pay for:

1. A scholarship fund to allow for a much larger diversity of Tour participants. 

2. A fair living wage for the 7 amazing artists & activists on the road for 3 weeks.

3. The creation & printing of 250 “Community Tookits” (described on website).

4. Materials for “community asset mapping” projects.

5. Paint & canvas for two participatory community murals.

6. Ink, fabric, and materials for community flag making projects.

7. Honorariums for local and regional workshop presenters.

***We’ll also be collecting donations for entry & merchandise at each stop of the Tour. These funds will go toward the hard infrastructure of our travels, such as:   van rental, gas, food, venue fees, promotions, event insurance, tent rentals, printing, etc etc etc… 

Tax Deductible Donations:

*** Revival is a 501(c)3 fiscally-sponsored project of www.NewStories.org … If you would like to make a larger tax-deductible donation to our project, we’d LOVE to put it toward the exciting works listed in the “Future” section below!  Please contact Ben Browner for NewStories tax id #... We’re sincerely appreciative of your efforts to support this project even further!

 

The Future of Revival:

In addition to this Tour Campaign, we'd like to inform you of what's happening afterwards… (which we also need sponsorship help with, outside of this campaign!)

- (SPONSOR the purchase of our new box truck by 7/31!!!) We’ll soon be acquiring our "RevivalVan", enabling us to offer our tents, sound system, art, and infrastructure to mission-aligned organizations across the Northwest! +/-$10k

- (SPONSOR the box truck buildout & beautification by 9/31!!!) We’ll be building the inside of the RevivalVan to transform into a tea & conversation lounge when it’s not hauling equipment. We’ll build awnings off the side, and fold-out furniture for pop-up festivities with local initiatives across the bioregion! +/-$5k

- (SPONSOR our Fall & Winter Trainings by 9/31!!!) We’ll be jumping-off from the Community Toolkits mentioned above, and the relationships built across the bioregion, to host a series of trainings in the off-season: Facilitation, Creativity, Direct Action, Narrative Work, Organizational Strategy, Cosmology, and Deep Dialogue will be some of our main focuses. +/-$5k

- (SPONSOR our big gathering next summer by 12/31!!!)  We’ll be gathering with about 200 community and organizational leaders on Vashon Island next July, and deeply needing some underwriting for this as the new year rolls around!  +/-$15k +loans

(PLEASE CONTACT BEN about any and all of the above… We’re a busy team, highly capable, and look forward to working with you to create synergies!!! THANK YOU… 

 

What Else You Can Do To Help:

Not all people are able or inspired to contribute financially! Luckily there are MANY forms of capital, and you can give however you feel most aligned! Contact us about anything at all, but for now we’re asking explicitly for the following:

  • spread this campaign to friends & family who’d enjoy it!
  • gather people to participate in our July events! 
  • donate a van from the Bay Area that we can use for 3 weeks!
  • what else do you feel called to offer??? : ) Nothing is too small or large! 

 

In Closing: 

We DEEPLY appreciate your support in all of the above... The 2017 Revival Tour is sure to be connective, art-filled, and radically-inspirational!!! Your contributions, your shares, and your confidence in us is all we need to relax into this summer and be able to put our best selves forward in service of social justice, environmental justice, community, and Life!!!  

Many blessings to each and every one of you, thank you from the bottom of our hearts, ~Ben, Lydia, Tannur, Julie, Alyssa, Sara, Laura, and the rest of the Revival Team!!!

story:
Keepers of the Art Needs Your Help!

For the past 8 years we’ve been able to offer programming supported by grants from Akron area foundations. With the support of those grants we have been able to showcase Hip-Hop culture’s ability to entertain, educate, and inspire through concerts, lectures, and workshops.

We decided to start this crowdfunding campaign after winning the Knight Foundation’s Knight Arts Challenge. A stipulation of winning the award is raising matching funds.

After the success of De La Soul’s crowdfunding campaign which led to the production of their Grammy-nominated album we saw the potential of crowdfunding to help produce Hip-Hop inspired projects.

We’re excited about the opportunity to get our audience directly involved in this project. From helping select artists to creating the video and the music used in our campaign video we wanted our audience to have some skin in the game.

 

(MC Lyte at the 2011 Keepers of the Art Music Showcase)

How you can help!

Every contribution helps! We need to raise $55,800 in matching funds to claim the Knight Arts Challenge Award we were recently awarded.

The funding raised from this crowdfunding campaign will be used to not only claim the Knight Arts Challenge grant but to book acts and facilitate the lectures and workshops associated with the Hip-Hop Preservation Project this September.

Artists such as Nas, Common, Public Enemy, LL Cool J, De La Soul, Busta Rhymes, J Cole, Nick Grant, and Chance The Rapper are on the short list of artists that we would like to bring to Akron, OH this September with your support.

Throughout the campaign there will be a variety of perks available to award you for your donations.

 

Why do we need $55,800?

We need $55,800 to use as the matching funds required to claim the Knight Foundation’s Knight Arts Challenge grant we were awarded to produce the Hip-Hop Preservation Project.

We intend to use the funds raised to produce the  lecture associated with the Hip-Hop Preservation Project.

We also intend to use the funds raised to produce the workshops associated with the Hip-Hop Preservation Project.

In addition to using the funds to cover the costs of  producing the lecture and workshops we also intend to use the funds raised to help produce the B-Boy competition associated with the Hip-Hop Preservation Project.

Finally, we intend to use the funds raised to cover the performance fees for the headline act of the Hip-Hop Preservation Project Concert.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is able to help in monetary fashion. But you could help us spread the word about our campaign and the work of Keepers of the Art, Inc.  With Social Media you can help us personally to spread the word about our campaign.  Do you have access to anyone in the press, bloggers, radio presenters, marketers of any kind/ Do you know of any foundations who might be interested in our mission?… Everything helps!

 

 

What are You Doing for Hip-Hop Culture?

Educating while entertaining has been the way of Keepers of the Art, Inc. for the past decade. Thanks to timely funding and a loyal fanbase Keepers of the Art, Inc. has been able to showcase hip-hop's ability to educate, entertain, and inspire.

 

 

Hip-Hop Preservation Project Logo T-Shirt

 

*Please e-mail your t-shirt or hoodie size and color to keepersoftheart@yahoo.com at the time of your donation.

  • Sizes on all shirts and hoodies range from youth small to 3XL
  • Short sleeve t-shirts come in heather grey, black, and orange
  • Long sleeve t-shirts come in black
  • Hoodies come in heather grey and black

* Use "Shirt Size & Color" as the Subject of your e-mail
story_txt:
Keepers of the Art Needs Your Help!For the past 8 years we’ve been able to offer programming supported by grants from Akron area foundations. With the support of those grants we have been able to showcase Hip-Hop culture’s ability to entertain, educate, and inspire through concerts, lectures, and workshops.We decided to start this crowdfunding campaign after winning the Knight Foundation’s Knight Arts Challenge. A stipulation of winning the award is raising matching funds.After the success of De La Soul’s crowdfunding campaign which led to the production of their Grammy-nominated album we saw the potential of crowdfunding to help produce Hip-Hop inspired projects.We’re excited about the opportunity to get our audience directly involved in this project. From helping select artists to creating the video and the music used in our campaign video we wanted our audience to have some skin in the game. (MC Lyte at the 2011 Keepers of the Art Music Showcase)How you can help!Every contribution helps! We need to raise $55,800 in matching funds to claim the Knight Arts Challenge Award we were recently awarded.The funding raised from this crowdfunding campaign will be used to not only claim the Knight Arts Challenge grant but to book acts and facilitate the lectures and workshops associated with the Hip-Hop Preservation Project this September.Artists such as Nas, Common, Public Enemy, LL Cool J, De La Soul, Busta Rhymes, J Cole, Nick Grant, and Chance The Rapper are on the short list of artists that we would like to bring to Akron, OH this September with your support.Throughout the campaign there will be a variety of perks available to award you for your donations. Why do we need $55,800?We need $55,800 to use as the matching funds required to claim the Knight Foundation’s Knight Arts Challenge grant we were awarded to produce the Hip-Hop Preservation Project.We intend to use the funds raised to produce the  lecture associated with the Hip-Hop Preservation Project.We also intend to use the funds raised to produce the workshops associated with the Hip-Hop Preservation Project.In addition to using the funds to cover the costs of  producing the lecture and workshops we also intend to use the funds raised to help produce the B-Boy competition associated with the Hip-Hop Preservation Project.Finally, we intend to use the funds raised to cover the performance fees for the headline act of the Hip-Hop Preservation Project Concert.Other Ways You Can HelpWe know that not everyone is able to help in monetary fashion. But you could help us spread the word about our campaign and the work of Keepers of the Art, Inc.  With Social Media you can help us personally to spread the word about our campaign.  Do you have access to anyone in the press, bloggers, radio presenters, marketers of any kind/ Do you know of any foundations who might be interested in our mission?… Everything helps!  What are You Doing for Hip-Hop Culture?Educating while entertaining has been the way of Keepers of the Art, Inc. for the past decade. Thanks to timely funding and a loyal fanbase Keepers of the Art, Inc. has been able to showcase hip-hop's ability to educate, entertain, and inspire.

Sizes on all shirts and hoodies range from youth small to 3XL
Short sleeve t-shirts come in heather grey, black, and orange
Long sleeve t-shirts come in black
Hoodies come in heather grey and black

story:
What Is The Infinite Love Party?

When the Bushwick Starr programmed Diana, and asked her what she wanted to create, the Infinite Love Party was born.

A gift of Diana’s is her ability to create community around her. If you saw her NYTimes Critics’ Pick show last year, {mylingerieplay}, you’ve already experienced the radical, glittery, queer joy that is Diana’s gift and the glue with which she builds community.

The goal of this project is to give the transformative experience that only the best parties can give. Think of it as the wedding of your dreams - but this wedding is based on self-love and intentionally making space for QTPOC and their allies. Our dream is to create an intentional glittery space for queer utopia, to crack open the hearts of the people who walk into our space, and to bring more love into the world through pleasure, desire, and play.

The Infinite Love Party is an intentional barefoot potluck dinner, dance party, and sleepover. There will be music, performances, dancing, and healing. The Infinite Love Party is where love is forged. A celebration of soul awakening. It's where play breeds change. It's where queer magic can do its healing. For All People. A celebration of the outskirts. A celebration of Queerness and our Allies. A celebration of POC and our Allies. A space for bare humanity to exist- where we will leave kinder and more open, more connected to our purpose, our bodies, and our hearts. A celebration of liberated selves. A celebration of liberated love. AN INFINITE LOVE PARTY!

What Can Guests Expect at the Parties?

Dance Party featuring DJ Nessuno!

Aphrodisiac Tea!

Barefoot Finger Painting!

A limited number of sleepover tickets will be available each night-- Sleepover! Hell yeah!

The evening includes a DOPE MOTHERF*CKER award given each night to a different person/organization who has made amazing contributions in the realms of sex, queerness, and collective liberation, including:

The Moon Choir (a community choir for queer/trans folks and allies) for singing into our Collective Liberation

Dawn Orlando and Funkadelic Studios for their constant support of so many independent New York based musicians

Francisco Ramirez for his relentless pursuit in providing accessible sex advice and education to the world

The First National KQTCON Organizing Committee (Korean Queer and Trans Conference)

API Rainbow Parents of PFLAG NYC for envisioning a world where diversity is celebrated and all people are respected, valued, and affirmed inclusive of their sexual orientation, gender identity, and gender expression.

Sandy Hong and New Women's Space 

Russell G. Jones and The Blind Spot

Poppy Liu and Collective Sex  

 

 

 

Who Are the Magic Makers of The Infinite Love Party?

Co-Creative Directed by Diana Oh and Kevin Hourigan 

Space Designer: Carolyn Mraz 

Lighting Designer: Kate McGee

Producers: Wednesday Derrico of Experimental Bitch Presents and Annie Middleton

And Featuring Super Queero Heart Questers (Infinite Love Docents): Bloom Davis, Shelley Fort, Leland Fowler, Kevin Hourigan, Mariah MacCarthy, Nessa Norich, Diana Oh, and (rebeca) Rad on the dance floor with you!

What Do We Need?

We have worked hard to make this project as low-budget as possible. The Bushwick Starr has provided us with a great opportunity to share this experience with you all, but our team does not receive any of the box office income, so in order to make this dream possible, we need to raise  an additional $10,000.

The funds that YOU can help us raise will go towards the following:

- Paying all of the artists who are working on this project. This includes our team of Super Queer Heart Questers (our Core Party Team), our designers, and producing team.

- The design elements that we aren't able to make ourselves. Our plan is to go as DIY with this party as possible, but we will incur some additional expenses, including insurance and design materials that will make the experience even more magical!

- This is NOT your typical theatrical experience - it's a party! Which means it requires additional staffing and support to keep the needs and safety of the attendees a top priority. Your donations will go towards supporting the additional staff. 

- Donations will go to The Bushwick Starr and will be used solely to fund The Infinite Love Party. 

- Donations are tax-deductible!

Thank you! We appreciate the support and would love to have you at one of our parties!
