story:
Send Bindlestiff to the American Circus Educators Conference!

Since 2009, Bindlestiff Family Cirkus’s free Cirkus After School program has used circus arts education to help young people become stronger learners, community members, and leaders. Cirkus After School is aligned with Social Circus theory, an international approach to circus arts instruction that uses circus training as a medium for social justice and youth development.

Unil now, Bindlestiff co-founder Stephanie Monseu has been the primary instructor for Cirkus After School, but this program is growing, and we’re excited to be bringing on circus educators Amy Chen and NaQuera Roach for the coming school year. As we evolve our staff, we’re committed to keeping up with the latest research, reporting, and development of teaching tools to work with marginalized and at-risk youth. That's why we're asking for your help sending Amy and NaQuera to the ACE Educators Conference. 

ACE, the American Youth Circus Organization (AYCO)’s American Circus Educators association, is the primary source for professional development, networking, and information about circus education for anyone who identifies as a circus parent, teacher, educator, coach, program director, or administrator. Their biannual conference takes place this October in Decatur, GA, and we want to send Amy and NaQuera there -- this is a rare chance for Bindlestiff’s new circus educators to connect with hundreds of circus educators over 4 days of workshops, keynotes, networking, training, and community building.

So we’re turning to you, Bindlestiff’s friends, fans, and youth program supporters, to ask for your assistance. Will you help us send Amy and NaQuera to the ACE Educators conference?

Your pledge to this campaign will help fund:

  • Conference registration fees
  • AYCO membership
  • Hotel accommodations
  • Airfare from NYC to Decatur, GA (plus ground transportation & baggage fees)
  • Meals for two people for 4 days

Most of all, your support will allow us to incorporate the best that circus education has to offer into our Circus After School program, making sure that we can make the greatest impact we can on the young people we serve.

If we raise more than our goal amount, all additional funds will help support Cirkus After School's FREE circus arts program serving young people in Columbia County, NY.

Why Circus After School?

Circus is a non-competitive activity that promotes self-respect, cooperation with others, creative expression, and safe, supported risk taking. Through Cirkus After School, Bindlestiff offers weekly after-school programming, summer intensives, youth performance opportunities in community events, access to Bindlestiff’s professional cast rehearsals, trips to see professional circus and variety arts performances, and more. Youth who age out of Cirkus After School are eligible to participate in teen workforce development training and work as junior counselors and mentors.

Ongoing research shows that participating in circus improves social and emotional skills in young people. In our own work we have seen the positive impact of circus arts on youth traumatized by poverty, the addiction or incarceration of a parent, abuse, or homelessness.

About American Circus Educators (ACE)

The American Circus Educators Association was formed in 2014 as a branch of the American Youth Circus Organization (AYCO) and is dedicated to supporting circus educators. ACE is the trusted authority when it comes to all things circus education. The biannual American Circus Educators Conference  (EdCon) will bring hundreds of circus educators together for 4 days of workshops, keynotes, networking, and community building in Decatur, GA from October 4-7, 2018.  

“The EdCon is one of the very few ways to observe the breadth and diversity of our industry and to learn the multitude of ways circus folk are making their programs work. There is no substitute for talking to other people that are actually doing the things you want to do.”
– 2016 EdCon participant

You can help us change lives through the magic of the circus. Thank you for your support!

story:
OokiiSoraCon is here and looking for some help from our friendly neighborhood convention-goers! Founded in the summer of 2017, after the unfortunate abrupt end of the previous Helena convention, OokiiSoraCon aims to deliver a convention to the masses. With a focus on anime, gaming, fantasy, and science fiction we hope to entrance our audience with panelists, contests, tournaments... and more!

 

It is with hope in our hearts and moths in our pockets we are turning to funders such as yourself for assistance. As a startup we are currently operating with limited funds to provide a venue for the convention, promotion and advertisements, as well as bring in guests of honor to help create a memorable experience for all attendees.

 

Descriptions of the perks:

  • Signed thank you card - A thank you card with this year's mascot signed by all of the board members!
  • Official OokiiSoraCon Lanyard - A lanyard with our logo on it!
  • "DONOR" Ribbon - A special ribbon for your badge!
  • Raffle Tickets - Enjoy some raffle tickets for our raffles, on us!
  • Weekend Registration - If you've donated $50+ you get admission to the convention!
  • VIP Pass - The VIP Pass gives you priority access to OokiiSoraCon Main Events!
  • Plus One - Bring a friend for free!
  • Green Room Access - Gives you access to the Green Room to enjoy a snack and meet our Guests of Honor!
  • Fame Boards - Donation boards will be displayed with your names on it! Own a business? Send us your logo and we'll use that!

 

Visit us at https://ookiisoracon.org/!

story:
Every spring for the past 25 years, in the city of Vitebsk – birthplace of the early modernist Marc Chagall – the Vitebsk Purimspiel Festival has offered a celebration of creativity and a modern take on a 2500-year old story – a three-day international music and theatre contest for creative and performing artists.

Your support and participation give the artists who travel from all corners of the globe a better chance to conquer Haman. This anniversary year, you can participate in the March 29-31 Purimspiel Festival in a number of exciting ways:

1. Attending and participating in the most creative Vitebsk Purimspiel Festival ever is one special option. You will be joined by teams from numerous cities, countries and Jewish organizations – performances, competition, educational events and the main contest of Purim short plays (Purimspiel).

2. Supporting the Vitebsk Purimspiel Festival and memorializing your role in this milestone event…

Special edition, limited quantity (only 125 editions) of artisan pins celebrating 25 years to Purimspeil festival.

             

You can support and receive Exclusive premiums for the Vitebsk Purimspiel festival

 50$  Bronze pin and your name will appear in the list of festival sponsors on the website (60 editions)

$100 Silver pin and your name will appear in the list of festival sponsors on the website (30 editions)

$200 Gold pin and your name will appear in the list of festival sponsors on the website (20 editions)

$500 Platinum pin (with numbers 25) and your name will appear on the festival banner as a central sponsor to be placed prominently throughout all festival events (10 editions)

 

Also Your  donation at the following levels will provide:

 $1000 Sponsorship of opening event on Friday night, mention of your name as a key festival sponsor during the ceremony, listing in the program and on the festival banner which will be placed prominently throughout the festival events and Platinum pin (with numbers 25) (1 sponsorship)

 $1,200 Sponsorship of musical entertainment for opening event on Friday night, mention of your name as a key festival sponsor during the ceremony, listing in the program and on the festival banner which will be placed prominently throughout the festival events and Platinum pin (with numbers 25) (1 sponsorship)

 $1,500 Sponsorship of main competition on Saturday night, mention of your name as a key festival sponsor during the competition, listing in the program and on the festival banner which will be placed prominently throughout the festival events and Platinum pin (with numbers 25) (1 sponsorship)

  $2,000 Sponsorship of gala event on Sunday, mention of your name as a key festival sponsor during the ceremony, listing in the program and on the festival banner which will be placed prominently throughout the festival events and Platinum pin (with numbers 25) (1 sponsorship)

$10,000 Naming opportunity of 25 Purimspeil Festival, mention of your name as a key festival sponsor during the ceremony, listing in the program and on the festival banner which will be placed prominently throughout the festival events and Platinum pin (with numbers 25) (1 sponsorship)

story:
French bellow

 

Description

« Ceci n’est pas une quille », this is the project from two young Belgians passionate about circus and juggling, but equally lovers of camp festivals.

Desiring to share our passion and our thirst for art discovering, we decided to organize the first edition of a festival with this aim.

The principle is simple: give the opportunity to attend the professional circus performances including meeting times between visitors and artists during a weekend and at very democratic prices.

With the aim to have a cosy atmosphere during the event, it will be an open-air event in a rustic and welcoming grassland.

The visitors will be free to camp for one night, all the weekend or come just for the day.

Moreover, concerts and open-stages will be organized to allow amateur artists to execute their first stage performance with a crazy atmosphere.

In addition to the performances, workshops, initiations and other occupations will be organized.

 

Why a crowdfunding?

The artist position does not exist in Belgium. Professionals have to work independently with many constraints because of this position (many costs, non-existent earnings, lack of social protection…).

This is why we want to allocate a large part of the budget to pay the artists whatever the event size.

Too little part of artists have the opportunity to be supported by the government (by 33% of their fee) and they have the opportunity to perform in many events organized by official associations. For the other artists, it is very difficult to find enough event to live on art. This is why we will focus on line-up on these skilled artists but too little known.

 

What will it use the money for? (goal 5000 €) ?

  • Pay the artists (3000€)
  • Site renting, insurance and safety (500€)
  • Site layout (stage, equipment) (1000€)
  • Decoration, catering and other spending (500€)

Place and Dates

Dates : September the 6th to the 8th 2019

Place : Saint-Aubin (Florennes - Belgium)

 

Français:

Description

"Ceci n’est pas une quille », c’est l’idée de deux jeunes belges passionnés de cirque et de jonglerie, mais également amateurs de festivals de musique sous tente.

Désirant partager notre passion et notre soif de découverte artistique, nous avons décidé de lancer la toute première édition d’un festival allant dans cette optique.

Le principe est simple : proposer durant tout un week-end, pour un prix d’entrée démocratique, et assister ainsi à la représentation de spectacles de cirque professionnels en incluant des temps de rencontre entre festivaliers et artistes.

Afin de donner une ambiance cosy à cet événement, celui-ci se déroulera en plein air  dans un milieu champêtre, au beau milieu d’une belle prairie.

Les personnes seront libres de venir y camper une nuit, tout le week-end ou même de venir seulement y assister en journée.

De plus, des concerts et scènes ouvertes y seront organisées afin de permettre aux artistes amateurs d’y effectuer leurs premières performances scéniques, devant un publique de folie !

Outre ces différentes prestations à voir, des workshops, initiations et autres animations seront proposées aux festivaliers.

 

Pourquoi un crowdfunding ?

Il n’existe pas de statut d’artiste en Belgique. Les artistes professionnels doivent travailler de manière indépendante, avec les différentes contraintes que ce statut d’indépendant engendre (nombreux frais, absence de revenus fixes, manque de protections sociales, ...).

C’est la raison pour laquelle nous tenons à consacrer une grosse partie de notre budget à leur rémunération, afin que ces artistes soient correctement rémunérés, peu importe l’ampleur de notre événement.

Une trop faible partie des artistes ont la chance d’être subsidiés par la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles (à raison de 33% de leur cachet demandé), et ont la chance de tourner dans de nombreux événements organisés par des associations. Mais qu’en est-il des autres artistes ? La majorité d’entre eux peinent à trouver suffisamment de contrats pour pouvoir en vivre correctement. C’est pourquoi nous allons focaliser notre line-up sur ces artistes, au combien talentueux mais trop peu connus à nos jours.

 

A quoi servira l’argent récolté (objectif 5000 €) ?

  • Rémunération des artistes (3000€)
  • Location du terrain, assurances & sécurité (500€)
  • Aménagement du terrain et matériel (1000€)
  • Décorations, bricolages et autres petits couts (500€)

 

Lieu et Date

Dates :du 6 au 8 septembre 2019

Lieu : Saint-Aubin (Florennes - Belgium)

story:
Project Manager Aric Parker received a Master’s Degree in Indo-Tibetan Buddhism, focusing on Tibetan and Sanskrit languages from Naropa University, and spent three years with Tsadra Foundation as an Intern working for some of the world’s best Tibetan translators. Now a student of the Shang Shung School of Tibetan Medicine, he was asked by Dr. Wangmo to head the textbook project and see it through to its completion.

Words from Aric:

"Hi, I’m Aric, with the Shang Shung Insitute School of Tibetan Medicine. This school, started by the Namkhai Norbu Rinpoche and Dr. Phuntsog Wangmo has been a beacon of Tibetan Medicine in the west. Already, there have been so many great practitioners of Tibetan Medicine that have come out of Dr. Wangmo and the Shang Shung Institute Schools’ guidance and training. It is no easy task to represent the subject material and teachings in a way that is exactly true to form, and lineage. However, Dr. Wangmo has been firm in maintaining the connection to the traditional teachings, and not deviating from the course of study that is being taught in Tibetan medical universities.

Right now the school is in need. There is a lot to be done to continue to growing as an Academic Institution in the west. Due to Dr. Wangmo’s dedication to tradition, so far, myself and the other students of the program have been using textbooks which are solely in Tibetan. In this program students are mostly required to start to learn basic Tibetan so that they can understand the concepts being presented in the rgyud bzhi. For someone like me, who has been studying Tibetan language for the past seven years, that may be a somewhat easier task. This doesn’t leave the door open to many students who don’t speak Tibetan, but could still benefit from learning the Medicine in a traditional way.

Dr. Wangmo has tirelessly given word by word commentary on our textbooks, the rgyud bzhi, which are the 4 (tantras of Tibetan medicine). Her work has amounted to countless hours of video lecture, which are needing to be be transcribed that that future students can benefit.

Dr. Wangmo asked me to head this project of transcribing and editing the lectures on the root text, so that the students here have a series of cohesive textbooks to refer to.

Later, after all the transcriptions are made, they will be sent to other branches of the Shang Shung Institute’s School of Tibetan Medicine to be translated into their respective languages, Russian, Italian, and so on. Additionally, during this second phase, we will begin formatting actual textbooks, with sections, learning objectives, quizzes, homework questions and the rest. There is a total of 25 Textbooks based on the sections of the 4 Tantras, that are in the midst of  be created, but we desperately need funding for this project to continue.

You might be wondering at this point what makes me a good candidate to coordinate this project. I have devotion, to my teachers, my lama, Dr. Wangmo, Rinpoche, and the School. Secondly, I have a Master’s degree in Buddhist Studies, with Tibetan and Sanskrit Languages from Naropa University. I feel that I understand at least more than some, what goes into structuring modern academia, and particularly have seen what it is like to integrate Tibetan Shedra materials into a western academic environment.

So, with your contribution, you are helping the Tibetan medicine teachings to flourish in the west, and you will be able to be a part of this incredible system of Medicine really landing firmly here."

Please watch this video introducing the School of Tibetan Medicine in Conway, MA  https://www.youtube.com/watch?

We appreciate your generosity in helping us manifest this immensely valuable project.

For more information on the Tibetan Medical School please go to:

http://www.tibetanmedicineschool.org

 

Thank you.

story:
(PLEASE SCROLL-DOWN FOR ENGLISH-FÜR DEUTSCH BITTE RUNTERSCROLLEN)

Meramımız basit ve somut: arkadaşlarımızın muhabbet edebileceği, aktivistlerin buluşabileceği, sanatçıların üretebileceği, aydınların tartışabileceği ve öğrencilerin çalışabileceği bir kültür evi.
Bu amaçla ilk olarak tüm kitaplarımızı bir araya getirdiğimiz bir kütüphanemiz var. Öte yanda da dostlarla buluşmayı ve edebiyat, sinema, yerel ve küresel gündem, ekoloji ve kent kültürü üzerine tematik etkinlikler düzenlemeyi planladığımız bir terasımız var. Son olarak, kulüplerin , derneklerin, küçük toplantılar yapabileceği bir asma katımız var.
Biz kimiz?
Bizler Temmuz 2016 darbe girişimini izleyen dönemde kurumlarımızdan ihraç edilen öğretim üyeleriyiz ama bizim ihraç sürecimizin tarihi olağanüstü hal rejiminin öncesine gidiyor. Hükümetin Güneydoğu’daki güvenlik politikalarını eleştiren, adalet ve barış talep eden bir metnin imzacısı olarak başta Cumhurbaşkanı Erdoğan olmak üzere iktidarın sert tepki ve müeyyidelerine maruz kalmıştık. Meslektaşlarımızdan bir düzinesi darbeden çok önce işlerini kaybetmişti bile.
Bu meslektaşlarımızın çoğu yurtdışına göç etmek zorunda kaldı zira imzacı olarak damgalanan bizlerin yeni bir iş bulma şansımız yoktu. Diğerleri kalmayı seçti ve olağanüstü halle birlikte yurtdışına çıkmak için hiç şansları kalmadı, zira kamu görevinden uzaklaştırıldılar, bu nedenle de pasaportları iptal edildi.

Niçin ‘’Kültürhane”?
Kültürhane fikri işte bu olağanüstü ortamda, kitaplar, bilim, öğrencilerimiz, meslektaşlarımız ve genel olarak kamu ile ilişkimizi sürdürme niyetiyle doğdu.
Neye ihtiyacımız var? 
Arkadaşlarımız ve ailelerimizin cömert desteği sayesinde Kültürhane’nin genel altyapısını oluşturmayı başardık. Artık zengin bir kütüphanemiz ve rahat bir kafemiz var. Bu adresten videoyu izleyebilirsiniz.
Ancak bir kafeden daha fazlası olmak olmak için hala desteğe ihtiyacımız var.

Kütüphaneyi zenginleştirmek: Kütüphanemiz şimdilik çoğunlukla sosyal bilimler üzerine ve Türkçe yazılmış kendi kitaplarımızdan oluşuyor. Ama biz kütüphanemizin tüm edebiyat ve bilim alanlarında kitaplar sunan modern bir kitaplık olmasını arzuluyoruz. Özellikle yabancı dillerdeki yayınları edinebilmek için kaydadeğer bir kaynağa ihtiyacımız var.
Hayalimiz (kent nüfusunun artık neredeyse beşte birini oluşturan) ve ülkelerindeki içsavaştan çıkıp Mersin’e sığınan Suriyeli yeni komşularımıza hitap edecek arapça bir kitaplık oluşturmak.
Elektronik kaynaklara erişim: Çevrimiçi bilimsel kaynaklar artık akademik yayın ve tartışmaların ana mecraları oldular. Genelde kurumsal aboneliklere hitap eden bu platformlara böylesi kurumsal bağlardan yoksun araştırmacıların erişimi çok pahalıya geliyor. Öğrencilerimiz ve arkadaşlarımızın yürüttükleri araştırmalara katkı sunabilmek adına bu zengin kaynaklara erişimi kütüphanemizde sunmak istiyoruz.
Menü-dergi basımı:
Menümüzün misafirlerimizin saklayabileceği bir fanzin olmasını istiyoruz. Sunduğumuz ürünlere dair bilgilerin haricinde, edebiyata, bilime, kente ve ekolojiye dair metin ve haberler içermesini planlıyoruz. Periyodik olarak güncelleyeceğimiz bu menü-faizinin basımı da kaynak gerektiriyor. 
Davetli misafirler:
Kültürhane’yi devamlı etkinliklere ev sahipliği yapan bir kamusal alana dönüştürmek istediğimiz için ülkenin ve mümkün olursa dünyanın farklı köşelerinden yazarları, sanatçıları ve araştırmacıları davet etmek istiyoruz. Bu konukların yolculuk ve konaklama masraflarını karşılamak için de kaynağa ihtiyacımız olacak.
Sonuç:
Bu hedeflere ulaşabilirsek, bizi kamu görevlerinden ihraç edenleri, işimizi yapmak için ve kamuyla ilişkimizi korumak için ünvanlara ve makamlara ihtiyacımız olmadığını göstermiş olacağız.

Who are we?

We are a group of scholars expelled from our posts in the aftermath of the failed coup of July 2016, but the history of our dismissal goes beyond the pretext of the Coup. As the petitioners of a call for justice and peace criticising the security policies of the government in the South East of the country, we had already been subjected to harsh reactions and sanctions of power holders, particularly of President Erdogan. A dozen of our colleagues in the city had already lost their academic posts well before the coup.

Most of these colleagues had to move abroad as they had no chance of finding new posts as we have been stigmatised  as "petitioners". Other chose to stay and with the state of emergency had no chance to move as we are all expelled from public function and lost our passports.

Why an "House of Culture"?

The idea of this "house of culture" was born in this extraordinary context with the primary objective of sustaining our contact with books, science, students, colleagues and the public in general.

What Do We Need?

We managed to accomplish the main infrastructure of the House thanks to the generous support of our families and friends. Now we have a rich library and a comfortable cafe (https://youtu.be/bTmy5KmvqZs).

But in order to go beyond being a cafe, we need further support.

  • Enriching the library: the library consists of our own books mainly on social sciences and in Turkish. But we want to render it to a modern library offering books on all domains of science and literature. Especially, we need significant funding for publications in foreign languages. One of our dreams is to have a section in Arabic that will address to our Syrian neighbours (almost 20% of the city population) who took refuge in Mersin since the beginning of the civil war in Syria.
  • Access to electronic sources: Online scientific resources have become the main source of academic publications and discussions. Mainly functioning on institutional subscriptions, individual access to such resources cost very expensive for those who are deprived from such institutional affiliations. We would like to offer these rich resources to our students and friends to contribute to their ongoing researches or studies.
  • Publication of a menu-newsletter: We want our menu to be a fanzine that can be kept by our visitors. Apart from information on what we serve, we want it to include short texts and news on literature, science, city and ecology. The periodical publication of such menu-fanzine requires funding.
  • Guests: As we want to render the House to a public sphere constantly hosting events, we want to invite authors, artists, scholars from different parts of the country and if possible of the World. But for further funding is essential to finance their flights and accommodation.

The Outcome

If we manage to reach to these goals, we will prove to all those who expelled us from public posts that we do not need their titles and functions to be able to do our job and to keep our relationship with the public.

 

Helfen Sie uns, unser Haus der Kultur und Hoffnung zu bauen

Geben Sie eine Hand an die Gründung eines bescheidenen Kulturzentrums mit einer Bibliothek und einem Café in Mersin / Türkei

Der Überblick

Die Idee ist einfach und konkret: die Gründung einer Haus der Kultur in der sich Freunde unterhalten, Aktivisten treffen, Künstler kreieren, Intellektuelle diskutieren und Studenten lernen. Zu diesem Zweck haben wir zunächst eine Bibliothek, in der wir alle unsere Bücher gesammelt haben. Auf der anderen Seite gibt es ein Café mit einer Terrasse, wo wir hoffen  Freunde zu treffen und thematische Veranstaltungen über Literatur, Kino, lokale und internationale Agenda, Ökologie und die Mersin Stadtkultur zu organisieren. Ausserdem haben wir eine Mezzanine für kleine Gruppenbesprechungen von Verbänden und NGO (regierungsunabhängige Organisationen) etc. Wer sind wir? Wir sind eine Gruppe von Gelehrten, die nach dem gescheiterten Coup (Putsch) vom Juli 2016 aus ihren Posten vertrieben wurden, aber die Geschichte unserer Entlassung geht weit über den Vorwand des Coups hinaus. Als die Petenten einer Forderung nach Gerechtigkeit und Frieden, die die Sicherheitspolitik der Regierung im Südosten des Landes kritisierten (Academics for Peace// Akademiker für den Frieden) waren wir bereits harten Reaktionen und Sanktionen von Machtinhabern, insbesondere von Präsident Erdogan, unterworfen worden. Ein Dutzend unserer Kollegen in der Stadt hatten bereits vor dem Putsch ihre akademischen Posten verloren. Die meisten dieser Kollegen mussten ins Ausland ziehen, da sie keine Chance hatten neue Posten zu finden, da wir als "die Petenten" stigmatisiert wurden. Andere wählten zu bleiben und hatten dann aber mit dem Ausnahmezustand keine Chance mehr sich zu bewegen da wir alle aus unserer öffentlichen Funktion vertrieben wurden verloren wir auch unsere Pässe. Warum ein "Haus der Kultur"? Die Idee dieses "Hauses der Kultur" entstand in diesem außergewöhnlichen Kontext mit dem primären Ziel, unseren Kontakt zu Büchern, Wissenschaft, Studenten, Kollegen und der Öffentlichkeit im Allgemeinen zu erhalten. Was wir brauchen

Wir haben es geschafft, die Hauptinfrastruktur des Hauses dank der großzügigen Unterstützung unserer Familien und Freunde zu erreichen. Jetzt haben wir eine reichhaltige Bibliothek und ein gemütliches Cafe (https://youtu.be/bTmy5KmvqZs). Aber um mehr als über ein Cafe zu kommen, brauchen wir weitere Unterstützung.

Bereicherung der Bibliothek:

Die Bibliothek besteht aus unseren eigenen Büchern hauptsächlich über Sozialwissenschaften und auf Türkisch. Aber wir wollen es zu einer modernen, die Bücher über alle Bereiche der Wissenschaft und Literatur anbietet umsetzen. Besonders benötigen wir eine bedeutende Beihilfe für Publikationen in Fremdsprachen. Einer unserer Träume ist, einen Abschnitt auf Arabisch zu erschaffen, der sich an unsere syrischen Nachbarn (fast 20% der Stadtbevölkerung) richten wird, die seit Beginn des Bürgerkriegs in Syrien nach  Mersin geflochten sind.

Zugang zu elektronischen Quellen:

Online-wissenschaftliche Ressourcen sind die Hauptquelle für akademische Publikationen und Diskussionen. Diese Quellen sind hauptsächlich auf institutionellen Abonnements funktioniert, Der individuelle Zugang zu solchen Ressourcen ist für diejenigen, die von solchen institutionellen Zugehörigkeiten ausgeschlossen sind, sehr teuer. Wir möchten diese reichen Ressourcen unseren Studenten und Freunden anbieten, um zu ihren laufenden Forschungen oder Studien beizutragen.

Publikation eines Menu – Mitteilungsblattes:

Wir wollen, dass unsere Speisekarte eine Fanzine ist, die von unseren Besuchern aufbewahrt werden kann. Abgesehen von Informationen über das, was wir servieren, wollen wir auch dass die Fanzine kurze Texte und Neuigkeiten über Literatur, Wissenschaft, Stadt und Ökologie beinhaltet. Jedoch fordert die periodische Veröffentlichung dieser Menü-Fanzine eine Finanzierung.

Gäste:

Da wir das Haus zu einer öffentlichen Sphäre erschaffen wollen, in der ständig Veranstaltungen veranstaltet werden, wollen wir Autoren, Künstler und Gelehrte aus verschiedenen Teilen des Landes und möglichst der Welt einladen. Aber für weitere Planungen ist es wichtig, die Flüge und Unterkünfte zu finanzieren.

Das Ergebnis

Wenn wir es schaffen, auf diese Ziele zu gelangen, werden wir allen, die uns aus unseren öffentlichen Stellen vertrieben haben beweisen, dass wir ihre Titel und Funktionen nicht brauchen um unsere Studien/ Recherchen zu machen und unsere Beziehung mit der Öffentlichkeit zu halten.

Meslektaşlarımızdan bir düzinesi darbeden çok önce işlerini kaybetmişti bile.Bu meslektaşlarımızın çoğu yurtdışına göç etmek zorunda kaldı zira imzacı olarak damgalanan bizlerin yeni bir iş bulma şansımız yoktu. Niçin ‘’Kültürhane”?Kültürhane fikri işte bu olağanüstü ortamda, kitaplar, bilim, öğrencilerimiz, meslektaşlarımız ve genel olarak kamu ile ilişkimizi sürdürme niyetiyle doğdu.Neye ihtiyacımız var? Arkadaşlarımız ve ailelerimizin cömert desteği sayesinde Kültürhane’nin genel altyapısını oluşturmayı başardık. Artık zengin bir kütüphanemiz ve rahat bir kafemiz var. Bu adresten videoyu izleyebilirsiniz.Ancak bir kafeden daha fazlası olmak olmak için hala desteğe ihtiyacımız var.
Kütüphaneyi zenginleştirmek: Kütüphanemiz şimdilik çoğunlukla sosyal bilimler üzerine ve Türkçe yazılmış kendi kitaplarımızdan oluşuyor. Ama biz kütüphanemizin tüm edebiyat ve bilim alanlarında kitaplar sunan modern bir kitaplık olmasını arzuluyoruz. Özellikle yabancı dillerdeki yayınları edinebilmek için kaydadeğer bir kaynağa ihtiyacımız var.Hayalimiz (kent nüfusunun artık neredeyse beşte birini oluşturan) ve ülkelerindeki içsavaştan çıkıp Mersin’e sığınan Suriyeli yeni komşularımıza hitap edecek arapça bir kitaplık oluşturmak.Elektronik kaynaklara erişim: Çevrimiçi bilimsel kaynaklar artık akademik yayın ve tartışmaların ana mecraları oldular. Genelde kurumsal aboneliklere hitap eden bu platformlara böylesi kurumsal bağlardan yoksun araştırmacıların erişimi çok pahalıya geliyor. Öğrencilerimiz ve arkadaşlarımızın yürüttükleri araştırmalara katkı sunabilmek adına bu zengin kaynaklara erişimi kütüphanemizde sunmak istiyoruz.Menü-dergi basımı:Menümüzün misafirlerimizin saklayabileceği bir fanzin olmasını istiyoruz. Sunduğumuz ürünlere dair bilgilerin haricinde, edebiyata, bilime, kente ve ekolojiye dair metin ve haberler içermesini planlıyoruz. Periyodik olarak güncelleyeceğimiz bu menü-faizinin basımı da kaynak gerektiriyor. Davetli misafirler:Kültürhane’yi devamlı etkinliklere ev sahipliği yapan bir kamusal alana dönüştürmek istediğimiz için ülkenin ve mümkün olursa dünyanın farklı köşelerinden yazarları, sanatçıları ve araştırmacıları davet etmek istiyoruz. Bu konukların yolculuk ve konaklama masraflarını karşılamak için de kaynağa ihtiyacımız olacak.Sonuç:Bu hedeflere ulaşabilirsek, bizi kamu görevlerinden ihraç edenleri, işimizi yapmak için ve kamuyla ilişkimizi korumak için ünvanlara ve makamlara ihtiyacımız olmadığını göstermiş olacağız.
Who are we?
We are a group of scholars expelled from our posts in the aftermath of the failed coup of July 2016, but the history of our dismissal goes beyond the pretext of the Coup. As the petitioners of a call for justice and peace criticising the security policies of the government in the South East of the country, we had already been subjected to harsh reactions and sanctions of power holders, particularly of President Erdogan. A dozen of our colleagues in the city had already lost their academic posts well before the coup.
Most of these colleagues had to move abroad as they had no chance of finding new posts as we have been stigmatised  as "petitioners". Other chose to stay and with the state of emergency had no chance to move as we are all expelled from public function and lost our passports.
Why an "House of Culture"?
The idea of this "house of culture" was born in this extraordinary context with the primary objective of sustaining our contact with books, science, students, colleagues and the public in general.
What Do We Need?

We managed to accomplish the main infrastructure of the House thanks to the generous support of our families and friends. Now we have a rich library and a comfortable cafe (https://youtu.be/bTmy5KmvqZs).
But in order to go beyond being a cafe, we need further support.


Enriching the library: the library consists of our own books mainly on social sciences and in Turkish. But we want to render it to a modern library offering books on all domains of science and literature. Especially, we need significant funding for publications in foreign languages. One of our dreams is to have a section in Arabic that will address to our Syrian neighbours (almost 20% of the city population) who took refuge in Mersin since the beginning of the civil war in Syria.

Access to electronic sources: Online scientific resources have become the main source of academic publications and discussions. Mainly functioning on institutional subscriptions, individual access to such resources cost very expensive for those who are deprived from such institutional affiliations. We would like to offer these rich resources to our students and friends to contribute to their ongoing researches or studies.

Publication of a menu-newsletter: We want our menu to be a fanzine that can be kept by our visitors. Apart from information on what we serve, we want it to include short texts and news on literature, science, city and ecology. The periodical publication of such menu-fanzine requires funding.

Guests: As we want to render the House to a public sphere constantly hosting events, we want to invite authors, artists, scholars from different parts of the country and if possible of the World. But for further funding is essential to finance their flights and accommodation.

The Outcome

If we manage to reach to these goals, we will prove to all those who expelled us from public posts that we do not need their titles and functions to be able to do our job and to keep our relationship with the public.
 
Helfen Sie uns, unser Haus der Kultur und Hoffnung zu bauen
Geben Sie eine Hand an die Gründung eines bescheidenen Kulturzentrums mit einer Bibliothek und einem Café in Mersin / Türkei
Der Überblick
Die Idee ist einfach und konkret: die Gründung einer Haus der Kultur in der sich Freunde unterhalten, Aktivisten treffen, Künstler kreieren, Intellektuelle diskutieren und Studenten lernen. Zu diesem Zweck haben wir zunächst eine Bibliothek, in der wir alle unsere Bücher gesammelt haben. Auf der anderen Seite gibt es ein Café mit einer Terrasse, wo wir hoffen  Freunde zu treffen und thematische Veranstaltungen über Literatur, Kino, lokale und internationale Agenda, Ökologie und die Mersin Stadtkultur zu organisieren. Ausserdem haben wir eine Mezzanine für kleine Gruppenbesprechungen von Verbänden und NGO (regierungsunabhängige Organisationen) etc. Wer sind wir? Wir sind eine Gruppe von Gelehrten, die nach dem gescheiterten Coup (Putsch) vom Juli 2016 aus ihren Posten vertrieben wurden, aber die Geschichte unserer Entlassung geht weit über den Vorwand des Coups hinaus. Als die Petenten einer Forderung nach Gerechtigkeit und Frieden, die die Sicherheitspolitik der Regierung im Südosten des Landes kritisierten (Academics for Peace// Akademiker für den Frieden) waren wir bereits harten Reaktionen und Sanktionen von Machtinhabern, insbesondere von Präsident Erdogan, unterworfen worden. Ein Dutzend unserer Kollegen in der Stadt hatten bereits vor dem Putsch ihre akademischen Posten verloren. Die meisten dieser Kollegen mussten ins Ausland ziehen, da sie keine Chance hatten neue Posten zu finden, da wir als "die Petenten" stigmatisiert wurden. Andere wählten zu bleiben und hatten dann aber mit dem Ausnahmezustand keine Chance mehr sich zu bewegen da wir alle aus unserer öffentlichen Funktion vertrieben wurden verloren wir auch unsere Pässe. Warum ein "Haus der Kultur"? Die Idee dieses "Hauses der Kultur" entstand in diesem außergewöhnlichen Kontext mit dem primären Ziel, unseren Kontakt zu Büchern, Wissenschaft, Studenten, Kollegen und der Öffentlichkeit im Allgemeinen zu erhalten. Was wir brauchen
Wir haben es geschafft, die Hauptinfrastruktur des Hauses dank der großzügigen Unterstützung unserer Familien und Freunde zu erreichen. Jetzt haben wir eine reichhaltige Bibliothek und ein gemütliches Cafe (https://youtu.be/bTmy5KmvqZs). Aber um mehr als über ein Cafe zu kommen, brauchen wir weitere Unterstützung.
Bereicherung der Bibliothek:
Die Bibliothek besteht aus unseren eigenen Büchern hauptsächlich über Sozialwissenschaften und auf Türkisch. Aber wir wollen es zu einer modernen, die Bücher über alle Bereiche der Wissenschaft und Literatur anbietet umsetzen. Besonders benötigen wir eine bedeutende Beihilfe für Publikationen in Fremdsprachen. Einer unserer Träume ist, einen Abschnitt auf Arabisch zu erschaffen, der sich an unsere syrischen Nachbarn (fast 20% der Stadtbevölkerung) richten wird, die seit Beginn des Bürgerkriegs in Syrien nach  Mersin geflochten sind.
Zugang zu elektronischen Quellen:
Online-wissenschaftliche Ressourcen sind die Hauptquelle für akademische Publikationen und Diskussionen. Diese Quellen sind hauptsächlich auf institutionellen Abonnements funktioniert, Der individuelle Zugang zu solchen Ressourcen ist für diejenigen, die von solchen institutionellen Zugehörigkeiten ausgeschlossen sind, sehr teuer. Wir möchten diese reichen Ressourcen unseren Studenten und Freunden anbieten, um zu ihren laufenden Forschungen oder Studien beizutragen.
Publikation eines Menu – Mitteilungsblattes:
Wir wollen, dass unsere Speisekarte eine Fanzine ist, die von unseren Besuchern aufbewahrt werden kann. Abgesehen von Informationen über das, was wir servieren, wollen wir auch dass die Fanzine kurze Texte und Neuigkeiten über Literatur, Wissenschaft, Stadt und Ökologie beinhaltet. Jedoch fordert die periodische Veröffentlichung dieser Menü-Fanzine eine Finanzierung.
Gäste:
Da wir das Haus zu einer öffentlichen Sphäre erschaffen wollen, in der ständig Veranstaltungen veranstaltet werden, wollen wir Autoren, Künstler und Gelehrte aus verschiedenen Teilen des Landes und möglichst der Welt einladen. Aber für weitere Planungen ist es wichtig, die Flüge und Unterkünfte zu finanzieren.
Das Ergebnis
Wenn wir es schaffen, auf diese Ziele zu gelangen, werden wir allen, die uns aus unseren öffentlichen Stellen vertrieben haben beweisen, dass wir ihre Titel und Funktionen nicht brauchen um unsere Studien/ Recherchen zu machen und unsere Beziehung mit der Öffentlichkeit zu halten.

story:
Your contribution would be very helpful to us if not needed.
We would need 4000$ to set up. Here is a detailed presentation of the investment needed to create our gallery.

Your contribution will help us to make this gallery a perfect place for talented yet unknown artists to showcase their work and to get one step closer to their dream !

As you can see the gallery is composed by two main spaces and an additional third small one (kitchen & toilet).

The first space will have two exhibition walls, in the middle, a table on which you can find magazines, books and catalogues dedicated to the artists exposing in the gallery. There will be a reception desk, and a library with all kinds of books about photography, architecture, art, design which will be freely available for our visitors.

The second part of the gallery is divided into 3 little spaces by two walls. It will be dedicated to a single artist in particular who will have the entire space to show his/ her work.

In order to exhibit, artists have to send us a portfolio presenting their work, but also containing a concrete personal project with an original idea. This project must count a number of artworks sufficient to fill up the gallery’s space. It will also be possible to share the exhibition space between several artists who work on a common theme.
The project must come along with a text explaining the artist’s approach and ideas. Once the project has been validated, we will, with the agreement of the artist, select the most relevant piece of work. Then we will help the artist with the installation of the exhibit (scenography, hanging …) If the artist is a photographer, we will able to assist him in the process of printing and framing.

For the artist, we will provide :

- All the communication: including flyers, social media, web content and contacting local magazines

- The organisation of an event for the launching of the exhibition; including drinks, snacks, music

- In the case of a photography exhibition: if needed, quality local printer contacts

- The possibility to accommodate him/her during his/her stay in Prague

- The production of a written and video interview of the artist that will be display on our website. The artist may then use this file for his/her own promotion.  

We will also try our best to contact other galleries and propose to them the project of the artist in order to find a new exhibition venue.

All the services listed above are supported by the gallery except the cost as far as the printing and the framing of the works. However we do have contacts with local printers and will be glad to help the artist to negotiate a reasonable price.

The duration of an exhibition will be between one and two months, depending on the artist and mostly the public’s interest.

Prices will vary and will depend on the nature of the work (photography/ screen printing/ painting, etc.). The gallery is to receive 50% of the sale price which will be fixed with the artist.

General services offered :

- Exhibition: The access to the exhibitions will be free of charge, but the option will be given to each visitor to donate the amount of money they wish, in order to support our activity

- Sales: Each piece of work exposed in room 1 of the gallery will be available to be purchased. In the second room, each piece of work will be available for sale when the exhibition is over. An online shop will be set up where you will find different pieces of work from the different artists working with us. We will also propose merchandise like postal-cards, posters and tee-shirts, also available on the website.

- Cultural bar & Library: During summer time we would like to set up a cultural bar in the first room, where students, artists and photographers can interact, exchange and work. Despite the small size of the room, we will optimise the space in an ingenious way in order to make this place comfortable, warm and welcoming. The bar will propose a menu (to be decided) that will certainly include various drinks accompanied by appetizers for the foodies. The bar will be open until 22pm during summer time. A library will be available to the public including books about architecture, photography, design and art in general.
 
- Free WiFi: Internet access will be available to the public (password secured)

- Dark Room (Available at some point in 2017): The third room (The actual kitchen) will be available for all photographers who want to develop their own work. An hourly rate will be set linked with a calendar. The gallery will only provide the basic necessary equipment.


Opening hours of the gallery :

Tuesday to Saturday - 10am to 19pm

Sunday - 14am to 20pm


Zizkov is a relatively young popular district created in the 19th century. Its picturesque look is marked by the art nouveau bourgeois architecture and its authenticity. The neighborhood, close to the city center has been experiencing a revival these last years because of the increasing number of students and artists in Prague. Today, Zizkov is considered as one of the most lively neighborhoods in town. We would like to participate to this craze by organizing various cultural events for young people and working in collaboration with local associations, shops or bars.

Nowadays social media is one of the most used ways to promote events, work and spaces like the gallery we are opening.
We will create constant hype and updates through Instagram, Facebook or Twitter to share the daily life of the gallery, and at the same time promote the artists working with us and reach out to a wider audience.

Website : www.life-is-ours.com

Instagram : @lifeisoursgallery

Twitter : @LIO_Gallery

Facebook : @lifeisoursgallery

story:
I am an adult advocate in the emergency shelter of a domestic violence advocacy group in the Florida area. We are a 501c(3) nonprofit.

Our women often come in to the shelter with little more than the clothes they are wearing. Often times there are bruises on their faces they desire to cover up in order to blend in with the world as they are turning the page on the next chapter of their lives.

In my former life, I was a freelance makeup artist (I mostly did weddings and began as a hobbyist) so I am running a weekly support group designed to teach the women how to use our donated products (mostly Mary Kay but no tools) to conceal their injuries to both blend in with the world while conducting personal business, seeking employment, etc. and regain self-confidence.

One shortage I do have is with brushes. I am trying to find a cosmetics company that would consider donating us some basic brush sets to give to the women who participate in the support group so that they can recreate looks. However, the fine ladies of reddit.com/r/makeupaddiction suggested that I set up a way for those interested to donate money so this is how you can do that.

I set the fundraiser goal at $500 as that was the lowest number the system would let me create but really anything helps. I think you guys are truly amazing for being willing to help us with this.

story:
As many of you know (and some of you financed) I took a one man show "The Letter H" on the road last Fall to help defeat Donald Trump. That effort failed. 

The loss brought some serious soul searching. And after I licked my wounds I took 6 months to write a VERY original political propaganda piece - one that could shock AND entertain.

What did I create? A soap opera satire of the Trump family. Entitled "National Anthem." 

18 episodes. All written. Absurdly funny, melodramatic and tragically prescient. It's chilling to witness. 

Trump STILL holds rallies and thousands attend. We MUST combat his narrative. THIS MEANS GENERATING OUR OWN PROPAGANDA, skillfully written and disseminated. I can do this, but I need your help.

National Anthem is just like any other show you love, like The Simpsons or South Park. Yet this is NOT an animated series nor a movie or even a graphic novel. I've considered all these forms but have settled on something different yet exciting. 

National Anthem will come alive online as part text - part visual. Images, sounds and gifs will combine with words. It's an emerging medium, cheaper than video and it can reach many, many people especially young adults. The storylines are funny (Eric Trump and Kanye fall in love!!). The storylines are tragic (a clinically depressed Donald, Jr. finds solace playing with guns). And can porn save the marriage of Jared and Ivanka? But...behind all of this, a real and sinister plot forms, involving the children pitted against the Father...like many families. Only this time the stakes are immense...the future of democracy in America. And that...is no fucking joke.

Funds raised will be spent on:

- a graphic designer/art director

- a social media strategist

- a publicist

- outreach materials

The online show will be created, promoted and shared. Posters will be designed and plastered guerrilla style in major media centers (LA and NYC ) along with postcards and stickers. We plan to have staged reading events with actors in NYC and LA and with politicians in DC (imagine Naomi Watts reading with Joe Biden!).

I promised after the election loss that I'd continue my efforts. And I've been true to that promise. 

The mistake of the last election was political messaging. Ours was tepid, theirs was dramatic. National Anthem will ignite conversation and energize our base. 

We cannot take political propaganda for granted ANYMORE. 

The Trump administration is a nightmare. Each week brings a new shocking event. The power grab is real. And it's only begun.

Please share this fundraising effort with your friends, family and work associates. Post this on Facebook. We all get hit up for donations. But this one is different. THIS is political messaging. THIS is our future. We MUST change America's narrative. And National Anthem can help lead the way.

story:
Story of My Book

Through My Eyes: Exploring The World While Being Asian is a book that explores the history and the collective rights for the Asian community in Canada from my perspective as a migrant and young Asian woman. This book also documents my stories of travelling to different parts of the world as a Chinese woman and woman of color.

拭目：以亚裔人的角度游历世界 记录了我作为一个移民和年轻亚裔女性在加拿大游学、生活的经历，以及我眼中所观察到的亚裔人在加拿大的历史及权益的发展。同时，这本书也讲述了我作为一个中国女性和有色女性游览世界多个国家的故事和历程。

My name is Vicky Zhou and I am the author of Through My Eyes: Exploring The World While Being Asian. I wrote this book because our world needs more allyship, compassion and solidarity during this unique time. I want to use my writing to empower the Asian community, battle against anti-Asian racism, and at the same time, help to foster a sense of unity across BIPOC communities. 

我的名字是周阳，我是拭目：以亚裔人的角度游历世界的作者。 我创作这本书是因为我们当今的世界需要更多的团结和互爱。我希望通过我的创作增强亚裔人的社会地位，抵抗反亚裔种族歧视，同时在有色族裔中建立团结与友谊。


My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover more about the long history of Asian people existing in Canada and how they have contributed to the wealth and development of the country. You will discover that allyship among different racial and social groups are important for a society’s wellbeing. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for empowering all people of color and eliminating anti-Asian racism. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand more about the Asian community in diaspora and imagine a collective future that builds upon allyship and compassion.

我希望通过阅读本书，你会发现更多关于亚裔人在加拿大的悠久历史以及他们为加拿大的发展所做出贡献。你会发现，不同种族和社会群体之间的同盟对于社会安逸的重要性。通过我的文字，我希望也能鼓舞你加入到支持平权和消除种族歧视的队伍中。最后，我希望你将本书视为一种工具，以帮助你更多地了解亚裔侨民，也帮助我们的社会向大同迈进。

In this book, you'll learn about my encounters from travelling to different parts of the world, the history and contribution of Asian people in Canada, and the inter-cultural and inter-racial relations between Asians and other racialized groups in Canada.

You'll hear stories such as:

  • Exploring the differences and similarities between my Chinese culture and my host families’ while I traveled to the UK and Colombia.
  • Educating myself on the subject of colorism within the Asian community from having a discussion with a colleague about having the privilege of being a lighter-skin East Asian.
  • Finding that “angry Asian” figure while navigating myself through the emotion roller coaster during the events of anti-Asian hate crimes during the pandemic and learning about the anti-Asian and Sinophobic history of Canada.

You will love this book if you care about social and racial justice, want to become an ally for the Asian community, and/or if you also come from an Asian, immigrant background and simply want to see your own stories and experience being reflected in a book.

Through My Eyes: Exploring The World While Being Asian is a nonfiction book that speaks to the Asian community in diaspora and allies who support the Asian community and want to look at Asian history in Canada and allyship in a new way.

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapter 1. The introduction provides the reasons why I am writing the book and what I hope my book to achieve. In chapter 1, I bring my audience with me to my journeys in the UK and Colombia. I share my experience on living with host families from different cultures and how those positive experiences impacted my understanding of inter-cultural and inter-racial relationship. My host families taught me a life-long lesson: when we open our minds and arms to other people, our differences become so insignificant, and that is the message that carries throughout the rest of my book.

Part 2 contains chapters 2-7. In this part of the book, I discuss the following issues that are essential to the Asian community in diaspora: the unique sense of “in-betweenness” for Asians in a racially stratified society such as Canada, the meaning white privilege to Asians, searching for “angry Asian” figures, colorism in the Asian community and the issue of “”bad English“ for Asian immigrants and immigrant children. I pose a lot of questions in these chapters. Through thinking out loud, researching history and documenting my own ideas, my goal is not necessarily to answer all those questions, but rather, to invite my readers to a journey of thinking and reflecting.

Part 3 contains chapter 8 and 9. In these final two chapters, I focus on writing about the relations between Asians and other racialized groups in Canada, especially with the Indigenous peoples and Black people. In Canada, there is a long history of Asians, especially Chinese people, interacting with the Indigenous peoples since the construction of continental railway. However, that part of the history is not so well-known and well-documented, because the Canadian history is largely centered around the white European settlers.

In my final chapter, I ended with a discussion about confronting racial bias and prejudice within my own Chinese family. I hope to encourage my readers to start a conversation with their loved ones and to address racism - often in the forms of casual racism or subconscious racism - with our most intimate circles.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author


Vicky Zhou is a young Chinese woman who moved to Toronto for university and is now graduated. She is working full-time while chasing her dream in becoming a lawyer or public policy maker. Zhou is passionate about racial and social justice, and is a believer in positive social changes and people’s power.

She is writing this book as a form of activism to battle against the anti-Asian hate that is rising overwhelmingly since the start of the pandemic. With her writing and story-telling, she also hopes to paint inter-racial and inter-cultural relationships in a positive way and encourages her readers to choose compassion in more situations in life.

She is a also a photographer when she is not writing or reading. She loves to take portrait photography, because it is a great way to document stories and showcase humanity.

For more information, you can connect with Vicky Zhou at vickyzhouzzz@gmail.com and at @vicky_zzzzzzz or @while_being_asian on Instagram.

story:
Hi Everyone! My name is Davina Pacley and I am a lifestyle influencer  & the Founder/CEO of DivinelyCROWN'D. DivinelyCROWN'D is a brand that I created in 2018 to encourage women to have self-love and confidence through faith, lifestyle and fashion.  Since I was a little girl I have always had a passion to be a positive light and influence to people and I feel with this brand I have done that so far. I truly believe that all women are Queens and that her life is her Queendom.

Growing a brand has been exciting and yet very challenging so far. It takes a lot of time, research,  and most definitely money to grow the brand of your dreams. Which is why I decided to create this crowdfunding campaign in hopes of gaining some financial support from my peers.

If you decided to support and donate to this crowdfunding campaign you are doing more than just giving financial support, but you are also saying you believe in the mission and vision of DivinelyCROWN'D.

The goal for this campaign is $6000. The funds raised will be used towards brand development, such as brand merchandise, technological equipment, promotional material, and more.

If the entire goal isn't met with in 30 days funds raised will still be used towards brand development.

I truly believe in DivinelyCROWN'D so much and I know with your support I can continue to reach women, not just in our community, but all over the world in a positive way. 

Thank you for taking the time to invest in my vision and I ask that you feel free to share this crowdfunding campaign with anyone you feel would be interested in investing as well.

Thank you for your support.

Sincerely,

Davina Pacley

Founder/CEO

story:
The Black  community has had 2 problems for centuries....
1st. There is no CENTRALIZED place 2 disseminate info 2 in and Throughout our community.
2nd. There is no way to CIRCULATE Wealth WITHIN the community.

Our Online platform seeks to eradicate this purposefull problem. We have built a GPS App 2 do just that.

  • In 2016 a group of Black Social & Community Activists decided that they should create a social platforms 4 Us By Us
  •  Our CEO Incubated with Angela Benton #NewMe #Mediastreaming
  • TheBlackpoint was launched globally to unify the #BlackLives movement

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have launched in iOS & Android platforms however we need to continue building the platform so that we can contribute to increasing funding 4 Black owned businesses who have been hurt by systemic racism that prevents them from qualifying for loans and investments, and also by COVID19.  We provide an authentic platform to build the black buying power and create jobs in the black community. 

  • We work with 100% Black owned Businesses (aka BoBs)
  • We give many services for free!
  • When we reach our goal, the funding will provide the capital needed to expand the platform to include more businesses worldwide.   The more businesses on the App the more Black businesses we all can support to show the world that #blacklivesmatter & #Blackdollarsmatter!

The Impact

Your help makes a difference:

  • Black people built the USA for free.
  • When the country didn't honor reparations to ensure that freed slaves didn't live impoverished, Blacks built their OWN Wall St.  
  • That Black Wall St. was bombed and burned to the ground in 1921.  1,200 people injured & murdered.  Exactly like we are being murdered today by police & white citizens.
  • We built this to recreate what we always KNEW we needed to build successful families & communities...a political and economic base & black economy. #powernomics

Risks & Challenges

How could there be any risks in investing in OURSELVES.

  • there are no hurdles
  • the time is NOW!!!
  • lets get a centralized platform that puts money in business owners hands so they can turn around and hire more...you guessed it...Blacks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  •  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • we will accomplish our goals of building and expanding a black social media platform

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Welcome to The Cauldron of the Celts!

Are you thirsty? Are you hungry? Pull a stump up next to the fire and share in our bounty.

Here in the Cauldron we like to bring lush glory and devotion into the everyday. We craft sacred spaces of comfort, rejuvenation, and revelry where everyone can relax, connect, and thrive in community with our Gods. In 2019 it is our goal to share our traveling feasting hall at more events and we need your help to make it happen.

Our main funding goal will cover the costs of bringing the feasting hall to PantheaCon, providing hospitality, devotional events, and growing our vibrant community. With a bit of luck, and some blessings we also hope to cover our annual Mead making for Queen Medb, and get a bit of seed fund squirreled away so that our feasting hall can travel to other events.

 

We do all of this for the love of it, and without you none of it would be possible. Thank you for being part of our merry community!  

Events Planned for PantheaCon 2019
(February 15 - 18, 2019)

The Hospitality Hall will be open open Friday, Saturday and Sunday of PantheaCon weekend from 10am -8pm. Please join us for some special events: 

Friday 9pm - A Night of Prophecy & Divination  for The Great Queen - Bring your divination tools and join us for ritual and divination saloon afterwards as we honor The Morrigan.

Saturday 10am - Dagda Porridge & Tea - Start your day off with fortification! Porridge, snacks, and some offerings to our mighty An Dagda.

Saturday 5pm - Irish Coffee Meet & Greet w/Land Sea & Sky Travel - Want to travel to far away lands with other seekers? Come meet our Maven of Liminal travel and find your next adventure.

Sunday 6pm - Making Mead for Queen Medb - 3rd annual ritual brewing for our golden Queen! In this event we will brew our 2019 batch of honeyed strength, calling in some mighty prosperity and revelry! We’ve even reserved some 2018 mead and Lughnasadh mead for tasting.

 

What Gifts We Offer!

Our Gratitude Post Card- Thank you so much for supporting us in creating our Feasting Hall! We would like to send you a hand-doodled postcard from PantheaCon. You rock!

Cauldron of Celts Prayers PDF 

The Cauldron of the Celts has been putting together newsletters for our sacred calendar days for going on 3 years. In that time we have collected prayers that were created by members and sent out in these newsletters as a resource. For the first time we have gathered those unique prayers into a pdf collection for you to enjoy at your own altar.  

Cauldron Decals

Hand designed Cauldron decals that feature a triple spiral made in Oakland California by Tinkering Productions. The decals are made of five year outdoor vinyl, perfect for your car, water bottle or notebook.

 

Red Thread Crosses 

The custom of making red thread crosses for protection at Bealtaine is one that is well documented in Ireland, this is a tradition that the Cauldron has adapted for our Northern California ecosystem and is a beloved part of our calendar year. These crosses were made at Bealtaine time out in the misty redwoods of Portola around a merry fire. They were out of Hawthorn and Firethorn, for the purpose of being protective talismans for the homestead, vehicles, and altars.

 

Witchy Soap

Clear out the ick, and bring on the Glory with this trio of handcrafted soaps by Cauldron Crafts, a collaboration between Samhain Crafts and Victory Divine. Made from organic coconut, olive, and castor oils. Infused with herbs and devotion. Consecrated by the Gods. You’ll receive three bars, one of each formulas: Prosperity, Protection, and Abundance. Each bar is 1 ounce, perfect for traveling. An Dagda approved!   

 

Devotional Sacred Site Prints 

Our Maven of travel has captured the essence of sacred spaces and you get to choose from three captivating prints to grace the walls of your treasured space. Choose from the rocky cliffs of Donn Island, Oweynagat (Cave of Cats) also known as The Morrigan’s "fit abode" or Poulnabrone Dolmen in the captivating Burren.



Devotional Oil [SOLD OUT]

Call to your Powers with an oil blend made in devotion to The Morrigan, An Dagda or Queen Medb. Each oil is a unique blend of herbs, essential oils, and stones to honor, and invoke our mighty Powers. This oil is perfect for anointing in ritual, consecrating sacred tools, dressing candles, or wearing as a divine perfume. Handcrafted in Oakland by Victory Divine.

Ancestor Candles

Ancestor worship is a grounding part of many of our practice. Remembering the lives of loved ones and spiritual ancestors, and seeking guidance from those that went before. This candle was designed five years ago by Branwen and has been a part of her personal practice ever since. May they bring a loving connection between you and your beloved dead.

 

Fairy Tale Candles

Fairy Tales have captured the minds and hearts of people for generations. They are a type of story that morphs and transforms depending on the teller and the magic they wish to weave. These candles weave their own magic using a little bit of the fairy tales you are likely most familiar with, and can make excellent additions to your own witchcraft intention.

  

  •  Right Match (4 available): Sometimes you are just looking for your right match, and sometimes you are looking for the ability to believe that love even exists. This candle can help to open your mind and heart to the possibilities.   
  • The Rose of Compassion (4 available): A candle to help us have compassion. Whether that is compassion with ourselves, another being, or the whole world. Sometimes we need a little help to believe in the goodness of the world and to make that goodness bloom.
  • Clarity on the Path (4 available): There are many roads to take in life, sometimes it is unclear which one is the path that leads us where we want to go, and which one has dangers lurking. The candle helps to bring some clarity and wisdom to be able to see where you would like to go and how to get there safely.
  • Fairest of Them All (4 available): Sometimes we struggle with finding the beauty in ourselves. This candle helps you to see the beauty that is you and reflect that beauty out into the world. It is rooted in the belief that we are ALL the Fairest and that beauty need not be a competitive struggle within or without.  
 

Cauldron Kitchen Spoons [SOLD OUT]

The power of the feast is something we talk about jokingly but also reverently. There is nothing more powerful than taking individual ingredients and transforming them into food to nourish and bring joy to your guests and loved ones. Around here we like to add to that magic by having wonderful kitchen spoons to stir in some extra intentions. These spoons are wood burned with the cauldron symbol and are each of them unique. Please note there are only 3 spoons available individually!

 

Ticket to the Land Sea Sky Medb Conference
In March of 2019 Polytheists, scholars, and witches gather on the internet to share knowledge about Glorious Queen Medb. Get your pass now!

 

Railroad Spike Protection Charm [SOLD OUT]

Claim your fortress with fierce confidence. Iron wrapped in red cord, leather, and an entwined piece of black haw. This charm comes dressed and blessed to protect the holder with an enchantment of sovereignty, sanctuary, comfort, and graceful boundaries. Witchcrafted in Oakland California. Only 3 of these Charms are available as individual items! 

 

Cauldron of Celts Recording Package

All the Cauldron goodness delivered right to your email. Over the last year of Land Sea Sky conferences, the Cauldron has presented a few talks and devotions. If you need just a little more lush Glory on-demand this is for you.

 

 

Budget

Goal: $1500 - Hospitality Hall

$1500 Covers our base costs for bringing the traveling feasting hall to PantheaCon once again. We love sharing our warm, welcoming hospitality hall; offering tasty nutritious snacks, devotional events, and lounge space to chat about our Gods, craft, devotional practice, or the latest archaeological findings. We believe in the power of feasting can change the world, and you can join us on this delicious mission.

 

Stretch Goal 1- $1750 - Golden Abundance!

Making Mead each year has become one or our favorite rituals. The idea was given in a dream, community brewing prosperity, abundance, and vitality together in honor of Queen Medb. The main ingredient, golden honey, isn’t cheap especially when buying it in tens of pounds. We like to source the honey for this event from local polytheist/pagan beekeepers and we like to compensate them fairly, so this bump helps keep the prosperity going for another glorious year!

 

Stretch Goal 2- $2500 - Cauldron of Plenty!

Our traveling feasting hall is hoping to hit the road again this year bringing feasting flavor to other fabulous events, like A Hosting at the Morrigan’s Hearth. We are mighty little group and do not take profit from our events. This seed fund will help us lighten the costs that individuals bear for travel, and add to the experiences we can offer. If there is an event near you you think would be a good fit please let us know!
story_txt:
Welcome to The Cauldron of the Celts!
Are you thirsty? Are you hungry? Pull a stump up next to the fire and share in our bounty.Here in the Cauldron we like to bring lush glory and devotion into the everyday. We craft sacred spaces of comfort, rejuvenation, and revelry where everyone can relax, connect, and thrive in community with our Gods. In 2019 it is our goal to share our traveling feasting hall at more events and we need your help to make it happen.
Our main funding goal will cover the costs of bringing the feasting hall to PantheaCon, providing hospitality, devotional events, and growing our vibrant community. With a bit of luck, and some blessings we also hope to cover our annual Mead making for Queen Medb, and get a bit of seed fund squirreled away so that our feasting hall can travel to other events. We do all of this for the love of it, and without you none of it would be possible. Thank you for being part of our merry community!  
Events Planned for PantheaCon 2019(February 15 - 18, 2019)
The Hospitality Hall will be open open Friday, Saturday and Sunday of PantheaCon weekend from 10am -8pm. Please join us for some special events: 
Friday 9pm - A Night of Prophecy & Divination  for The Great Queen - Bring your divination tools and join us for ritual and divination saloon afterwards as we honor The Morrigan.
Saturday 10am - Dagda Porridge & Tea - Start your day off with fortification! Porridge, snacks, and some offerings to our mighty An Dagda.
Saturday 5pm - Irish Coffee Meet & Greet w/Land Sea & Sky Travel - Want to travel to far away lands with other seekers? Come meet our Maven of Liminal travel and find your next adventure.
Sunday 6pm - Making Mead for Queen Medb - 3rd annual ritual brewing for our golden Queen! In this event we will brew our 2019 batch of honeyed strength, calling in some mighty prosperity and revelry! We’ve even reserved some 2018 mead and Lughnasadh mead for tasting.
 
What Gifts We Offer! 
Our Gratitude Post Card- Thank you so much for supporting us in creating our Feasting Hall! We would like to send you a hand-doodled postcard from PantheaCon. You rock!
Cauldron of Celts Prayers PDF The Cauldron of the Celts has been putting together newsletters for our sacred calendar days for going on 3 years. In that time we have collected prayers that were created by members and sent out in these newsletters as a resource. For the first time we have gathered those unique prayers into a pdf collection for you to enjoy at your own altar.   Cauldron DecalsHand designed Cauldron decals that feature a triple spiral made in Oakland California by Tinkering Productions. The decals are made of five year outdoor vinyl, perfect for your car, water bottle or notebook.  Red Thread Crosses 
The custom of making red thread crosses for protection at Bealtaine is one that is well documented in Ireland, this is a tradition that the Cauldron has adapted for our Northern California ecosystem and is a beloved part of our calendar year. These crosses were made at Bealtaine time out in the misty redwoods of Portola around a merry fire. They were out of Hawthorn and Firethorn, for the purpose of being protective talismans for the homestead, vehicles, and altars. Witchy Soap
Clear out the ick, and bring on the Glory with this trio of handcrafted soaps by Cauldron Crafts, a collaboration between Samhain Crafts and Victory Divine. Made from organic coconut, olive, and castor oils. Infused with herbs and devotion. Consecrated by the Gods. You’ll receive three bars, one of each formulas: Prosperity, Protection, and Abundance. Each bar is 1 ounce, perfect for traveling. An Dagda approved!    Devotional Sacred Site Prints 
Our Maven of travel has captured the essence of sacred spaces and you get to choose from three captivating prints to grace the walls of your treasured space. Choose from the rocky cliffs of Donn Island, Oweynagat (Cave of Cats) also known as The Morrigan’s "fit abode" or Poulnabrone Dolmen in the captivating Burren.


Devotional Oil [SOLD OUT]
Call to your Powers with an oil blend made in devotion to The Morrigan, An Dagda or Queen Medb. Each oil is a unique blend of herbs, essential oils, and stones to honor, and invoke our mighty Powers. This oil is perfect for anointing in ritual, consecrating sacred tools, dressing candles, or wearing as a divine perfume. Handcrafted in Oakland by Victory Divine. Ancestor Candles
Ancestor worship is a grounding part of many of our practice. Remembering the lives of loved ones and spiritual ancestors, and seeking guidance from those that went before. This candle was designed five years ago by Branwen and has been a part of her personal practice ever since. May they bring a loving connection between you and your beloved dead. Fairy Tale Candles
Fairy Tales have captured the minds and hearts of people for generations. They are a type of story that morphs and transforms depending on the teller and the magic they wish to weave. These candles weave their own magic using a little bit of the fairy tales you are likely most familiar with, and can make excellent additions to your own witchcraft intention.
  


 Right Match (4 available): Sometimes you are just looking for your right match, and sometimes you are looking for the ability to believe that love even exists. This candle can help to open your mind and heart to the possibilities.   

The Rose of Compassion (4 available): A candle to help us have compassion. Whether that is compassion with ourselves, another being, or the whole world. Sometimes we need a little help to believe in the goodness of the world and to make that goodness bloom.

Clarity on the Path (4 available): There are many roads to take in life, sometimes it is unclear which one is the path that leads us where we want to go, and which one has dangers lurking. The candle helps to bring some clarity and wisdom to be able to see where you would like to go and how to get there safely.

Fairest of Them All (4 available): Sometimes we struggle with finding the beauty in ourselves. This candle helps you to see the beauty that is you and reflect that beauty out into the world. It is rooted in the belief that we are ALL the Fairest and that beauty need not be a competitive struggle within or without.  
 Cauldron Kitchen Spoons [SOLD OUT]
The power of the feast is something we talk about jokingly but also reverently. There is nothing more powerful than taking individual ingredients and transforming them into food to nourish and bring joy to your guests and loved ones. Around here we like to add to that magic by having wonderful kitchen spoons to stir in some extra intentions. These spoons are wood burned with the cauldron symbol and are each of them unique. Please note there are only 3 spoons available individually!  Ticket to the Land Sea Sky Medb ConferenceIn March of 2019 Polytheists, scholars, and witches gather on the internet to share knowledge about Glorious Queen Medb. Get your pass now! Railroad Spike Protection Charm [SOLD OUT]
Claim your fortress with fierce confidence. Iron wrapped in red cord, leather, and an entwined piece of black haw. This charm comes dressed and blessed to protect the holder with an enchantment of sovereignty, sanctuary, comfort, and graceful boundaries. Witchcrafted in Oakland California. Only 3 of these Charms are available as individual items!   Cauldron of Celts Recording Package 
All the Cauldron goodness delivered right to your email. Over the last year of Land Sea Sky conferences, the Cauldron has presented a few talks and devotions. If you need just a little more lush Glory on-demand this is for you.
 
 
Budget
Goal: $1500 - Hospitality Hall
$1500 Covers our base costs for bringing the traveling feasting hall to PantheaCon once again. We love sharing our warm, welcoming hospitality hall; offering tasty nutritious snacks, devotional events, and lounge space to chat about our Gods, craft, devotional practice, or the latest archaeological findings. We believe in the power of feasting can change the world, and you can join us on this delicious mission. Stretch Goal 1- $1750 - Golden Abundance!
Making Mead each year has become one or our favorite rituals. The idea was given in a dream, community brewing prosperity, abundance, and vitality together in honor of Queen Medb. The main ingredient, golden honey, isn’t cheap especially when buying it in tens of pounds. We like to source the honey for this event from local polytheist/pagan beekeepers and we like to compensate them fairly, so this bump helps keep the prosperity going for another glorious year! Stretch Goal 2- $2500 - Cauldron of Plenty!
Our traveling feasting hall is hoping to hit the road again this year bringing feasting flavor to other fabulous events, like A Hosting at the Morrigan’s Hearth. We are mighty little group and do not take profit from our events. This seed fund will help us lighten the costs that individuals bear for travel, and add to the experiences we can offer. If there is an event near you you think would be a good fit please let us know!
