story:
（日本語で一番下に記載しております）

Japan Festival Boston

Japan Festival Boston has three simple goals- to introduce Japanese festival culture, to foster and encourage a sense of community between Japanese and American communities in the Boston Area, and to show gratitude and love towards the city of Boston.

Our sincere hope is that Japan Festival Boston will grow and be recognized not only by our local communities, but internationally as well. Not everyone has the chance to visit and experience a Matsuri in Japan, but that doesn’t have to stop anyone from experiencing our culture. We cannot achieve this goal without your help. Please join our crowdfunding campaign and contribute whatever you can to help keep this tradition alive for future generations, and to create a festival our children and grandchildren can call a “Jimoto no matsuri”, or “hometown festival”.  Your generous donation will help support the cost of our festival.

Official Website: www.japanfestivalboston.org/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JapanFestivalBoston/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/JapanFestBoston

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/japanfestivalboston/

JREX who is sponsoring this event is 501(c)3 Not for Profit Organization. All donations are tax-exempt and 100% tax-deductible. All donations will be used in running the event. If you have questions or concerns, please contact us at "info@japanfestivalboston.org". A financial statement will be published after the event.

 

How Can You Get items?

  • You can get items in exchange for the e-mail confirmation of your order.
  • At "Information booth C" in Japan Festival Boston in Boston Common. (http://www.japanfestivalboston.org/ja/wp-conten...)
  • On April 30, 2017.

 

What Can You Get?

You can see the color change at https://www.facebook.com/kei.crmx.pottery/video...

Provided by Snappy Ramen (http://snappysushi.com/), SANTOUKA (https://www.santouka.co.jp/en), Ebisuya (http://ebisuyamarket.com/index-en.php#.WMn-kRLhAmo), Yume-Wo-Katare (http://www.yumewokatare.com/)

Provided by UNIQLO(https://www.uniqlo.com/us/en/home/)

Provided by KODOKAN Boston (https://kodokanboston.org/)

Provided by Yume-Wo-Katare (http://www.yumewokatare.com/)

 

JAPAN FESTIVAL BOSTON

私たちが次世代に伝えたいこと − それは日本文化。
コミュニティが一丸となって作りあげる祭り。
それは，ボストンに対する感謝の気持ちです。

この祭りがニューイングランドにおける日本文化の発信源となること，日本に行かずにボストンで日本文化を存分に体験できることを目指しています。

そして，100年後にも子どもたちが「地元の祭り」と呼べる祭りになることを信じています。しかし，私たちの力だけではこの目標は達成できません。

みなさんと一緒に作り上げていきたいのです。今年のJapan Festival Bostonが成功するよう是非ご協力をお願いいたしま す。

Official Website: www.japanfestivalboston.org/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JapanFestivalBoston/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/JapanFestBoston

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/japanfestivalboston/

主催のJREX は米国政府認定の非営利団体です。ご献金は全て免税対象になります。また，頂いた寄付は全て祭り開催に使われます。収支報告は祭り開催後にホームページ( http://japanfestivalboston.org）上に公開されます。

なお，クレジットカードによる日本からの寄付も可能です。日本のクレジットカードですとBilling addressのzip codeは00000でも通ることが多いです。

story:
Short Summary

AIM: To start a campaign about the costs for artists of performing at the Edinburgh Festival. 

I am a fringe theatre director and producer. Having taken shows to Edinburgh in 2015 and 2017, and speaking to other artists who have, I have been shocked the year-on-year increases in venue and accommodation costs, which are already at unmanageable levels for artists on low incomes.

I share this concern with countless artists who love to perform at the Festival but struggle to afford it. We share this problem, but without clear data to prove this how can we protest about rising costs?

I am working on a survey to send out to artists who have performed at the Edinburgh Festival, to collect data anonymously on yearly venue and accommodation costs. This information will form the basis of a campaign and publication to highlight this issue to our industry and audiences.

By presenting this information in a clear and compelling way, we can gain public support for a campaign to reduce costs, and hold providers to account for rising prices.

What We Need & What You Get

To create a survey of suitable complexity requires advanced paid features in SurveyMonkey. A subscription is £35 per month, and the survey will run for 6 months - 3 to collect data, 3 to analyse the results - coming to £210 total.

You can support this campaign to make the Edinburgh Fringe fair by:

  • Donating what you can - I have put in the first £10, and if 20 people put in £10 each we'll reach the target in no time.
  • Anything raised above the £210 will go towards making this campaign as professional as possible - for example, supporting the quality of the publication or extending the SurveyMonkey subscription to allow for more advanced analysis.
  • I am passionate about making this project happen; but cannot afford the monthly subscription on my own. Please donate what you can to make this project a reality.

Note: The minimum target on IndieGoGo is £500 - however this is a keep-what-you-raise project, which means that any money raised will still go towards this campaign if it meets that target or not. My current aim is to raise £250 to cover the cost of a 6 month subscription to SurveyMonkey (see below) and crowdfunding fees (5% of total + 3% + £0.30 credit card fees + £25 transfer charge). Once complete, this campaign will stay live as an 'InDemand' page, allowing me to fundraise for future costs of this project if necessary.

The Impact

We can push for a more fair Fringe deal for artists by working together, to campaign for:

  • More transparency in venue costs across the Fringe, and accountability for rising prices
  • Fairer rates for artists performing at the festival, and greater leverage when negotiating contracts with venues
  • Greater accountability of accommodation providers for rent prices during the Festival
  • Higher awareness amongst audiences of the costs of performing at the Fringe

This is important not just for individual artists, but for the sustainability of creative culture in the UK. The more accessible the Fringe is, the more diverse, risk-taking art we will see there.

    Risks & Challenges

    The biggest challenge to an effective campaign on Edinburgh Festival costs are:

    • Lack of public awareness about this issue; for example, many audience members believe box office income covers the cost of performing at the Fringe. We need to show the real disparity between the costs and income.
    • Lack of accountability of venue and accommodation providers; by launching this campaign we are asking them to explain why costs are increasing, and what they can do to protect the performing artists that make the Festival what it is.
    • Lack of negotiating power of artists; many artists feel it is too risky to complain, or negotiate with venues about the cost of their hire/guarantee, or for a better box office split. By collecting data from numerous artists anonymously, we can start to organise a collective response to this issue which demands to be addressed.

    What are the risks?

    • A backlash by venue and accommodation providers; by creating an anonymous survey, I can protect the artists who contribute data to this campaign from any backlash. But I am prepared to go public in running this campaign, because it's a cause I believe in.
    The biggest challenges in launching this campaign are:
    • Designing a survey that yields water-tight, compelling data - I have been working with artists and professionals outside the arts to build a survey that asks the right questions, and yields the data we need for a campaign.
    • Reaching a representative sample of artists; I aim to reach 100-150 repsondents in 3 months, and will be sharing the survey far and wide online to do this. Anything you can do to help spread the word will make all the difference.
    • I am determined to start this campaign; but I can't do it alone. Your support is essential to build a campaign that can make a difference.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to donate now, there are so many ways you could still help:

    • If you are an artist who has performed at the Edinbrugh Fringe - complete the survey!
    • Share this campaign far and wide, and share the survey when it is launched.
    • Email thecostofedinburgh@gmail.com to say you want to support the campaign.

    Thank you for your time!

story:
Welcome, and Io Saturnalia!

This is our second annual Saturnalia event, and we intend to make it the best one yet! This year we are renting out the Marquis Theater in Denver, Colorado on the 29th of December. We have an exciting night planed, full of a variety of bands and entertainers sure to please anyone that may attend. We will also be holding our first Unbaptism Ritual. You are not going to want to miss this!

 

We need your help.

We hate to ask for money, but this event requires just a bit up front. The venue rental itself is a bit pricey, but renting this amazing venue allows us to relax and enjoy the event instead of working it all night. Plus, the funds raised here will benefit you in other ways as well. Some will be used towards deposit on the performers, some goes to creation of event specific merchandise that will only be available at the show, and helps create new merch with our brand new logo on them. Plus (!), anyone that donates here will receive a ticket (at certain price points), and exclusive items that we are making available to backers of this campaign only. Each higher tier of purchase includes rewards from the lower tier! We've made this worth your while.

 

Thank YOU!

We operate as a community, and we can't do any of this without your support. We are always very appreciative of all the support we receive, and we try to ask very little in return. We hope you'll consider supporting us monetarily, just this once, and if all goes well we'll not have to ask again. Hail Satan!

story:
So this happened:

 

 

The truth

We all know Tories love a good soundbite, and you will hear "highest taxed part of the UK" coming out of Tory mouths about a million times over the next 12 months. But as always, the truth is  more complicated.

The Scottish Government has introduced two new tax bands as well as changing the rates and the thresholds at which taxes start to apply. The majority of people have actually been given a tax cut. You can read the full details here.

These are the actual rates. The old ones are on the left, and the new ones (which came into force on the 6th April 2018) on the right:

 

The Institute for Fiscal Studies has put this into graph form:

Notice that the difference between the new Scottish tax rates and the Rest of the UK ones is actually quite small. But to listen to the Tories you would think that the four horsemen of the apocalypse are about to ride through your house!

 

The IFS has also done an impact assessment based on the population's income:

75% of Scots now pay less or see no change under the new tax rules.

 

Only 25% are being asked to pay a little bit more.

How much more? The estimable Colin Dunn has produced a nice infographic for that:

 

And remember, this is just on income tax. When you factor in Council Tax, the picture changes dramatically:

The average Band D (which is most houses) council tax rate in England is 39% higher than in Scotland.

Source: UK Gov

 

So "highest taxed part of the UK" is complete rubbish. The vast majority of Scots pay less and get more from the Scottish Government than people living in England.

Tories hate tax rises, especially ones targeting the rich. So they'll lie, and lie, and lie, and lie to get the public to believe that millionaires are downtrodden people who need to pay less tax than the poor because otherwise they might not be able to afford their skiing holidays.

 

So what do we do about it?

We want to produce 200,000 postcards featuring Colin's info-graphic showing that the Tories are talking complete mince on Scottish taxes. The reverse of the card will also feature the findings of a recent Ferret investigation which proves that the Tories are the biggest liars in the Scottish political firmament.

 

We'll get the cards printed, and then distribute them via the National Yes Registry to Yes groups all over Scotland. This crowdfunder is for the printing only. We'll ask the Yes groups to cover the cost of postage or courier delivery. The printing and packaging is about £1,450, and adding Indiegogo's and the payment gateways's fees brings us to £1,600. If we go over target, we'll get extra cards printed. If we don't reach target, we'll print and distribute as many as we possibly can.

That's it. Let's get the message out!
story_txt:
So this happened:
 

 
The truth
We all know Tories love a good soundbite, and you will hear "highest taxed part of the UK" coming out of Tory mouths about a million times over the next 12 months. But as always, the truth is  more complicated.
The Scottish Government has introduced two new tax bands as well as changing the rates and the thresholds at which taxes start to apply. The majority of people have actually been given a tax cut. You can read the full details here.
These are the actual rates. The old ones are on the left, and the new ones (which came into force on the 6th April 2018) on the right:

 
The Institute for Fiscal Studies has put this into graph form:

Notice that the difference between the new Scottish tax rates and the Rest of the UK ones is actually quite small. But to listen to the Tories you would think that the four horsemen of the apocalypse are about to ride through your house!
 
The IFS has also done an impact assessment based on the population's income:

75% of Scots now pay less or see no change under the new tax rules.
 
Only 25% are being asked to pay a little bit more.
How much more? The estimable Colin Dunn has produced a nice infographic for that:

 
And remember, this is just on income tax. When you factor in Council Tax, the picture changes dramatically:

The average Band D (which is most houses) council tax rate in England is 39% higher than in Scotland.
Source: UK Gov
 
So "highest taxed part of the UK" is complete rubbish. The vast majority of Scots pay less and get more from the Scottish Government than people living in England.
Tories hate tax rises, especially ones targeting the rich. So they'll lie, and lie, and lie, and lie to get the public to believe that millionaires are downtrodden people who need to pay less tax than the poor because otherwise they might not be able to afford their skiing holidays.
 
So what do we do about it?
We want to produce 200,000 postcards featuring Colin's info-graphic showing that the Tories are talking complete mince on Scottish taxes. The reverse of the card will also feature the findings of a recent Ferret investigation which proves that the Tories are the biggest liars in the Scottish political firmament.

 
We'll get the cards printed, and then distribute them via the National Yes Registry to Yes groups all over Scotland. This crowdfunder is for the printing only. We'll ask the Yes groups to cover the cost of postage or courier delivery. The printing and packaging is about £1,450, and adding Indiegogo's and the payment gateways's fees brings us to £1,600. If we go over target, we'll get extra cards printed. If we don't reach target, we'll print and distribute as many as we possibly can.
That's it. Let's get the message out!

story:
Who are we?

ReArt festival was created in 2014 when a little group of big enthusiasts decided that they all had the same ideas about culture, places to see or to hang out at in their small town. The idea started to grow and eventually, five years ago, at the start of summer, the first ReArt festival was created. Ever since then, the residents get an opportunity to see their town in a different light thrice a year; starting with the smaller spring version "ReArt Picnic", while celebrating the Earth Day, then at the main summer festival in June and during the winter ReArt enjoying the Christmas atmosphere.

What is ReArt about?

Our wish is to create an environment in which artists and creative people can present themselves to big audience but also connect with each other. Every year we invite a large number of artists; professionals and amateurs to exhibit their sculptures and installations.

Apart from a handful of works of art displayed at the festival itself, ReArt also opens to visitors completely new, different experiences of their town, historical sites or town parks. We encourage creativity and innovation of neglected spaces and thus create a new perspective of space by exploring the artistic and cultural context.

With all this content the story is also supported by all that jazz! Watching a handicraft fair, finding new hobbies among many workshops, listening to interesting lectures, or even performances is spiced up with the music performed by young, alternative but also professional bands and DJs.

Why crowdfunding?

To make sure our guests and staff have the strength for the long journey through the galaxy that is ahead of them, we would like to provide them much needed food and refreshments, good music, stellar pictures (who doesn't want to have their galactic picture framed?) etc. Since ReArt is a nonprofit festival, this year we decided to take a step forward and invite you to create this fantastic lush story with us! In order to achieve these wishes and ideas, we need your help.

Other ways you can help

You like the idea and you want to help, but your wallet doesn't want to cooperate? Not a problem! You can mention us on social networks, tell your friends about us, or support us through the whole festival by volunteering with us!

If you really want to be a part of the festival, here is your chance:

https://goo.gl/forms/s2yS563ghEN7VG573

story:
...English below...

Bienvenida a esta campaña!

Hola! Mi nombre es Nuria, una de las mujeres detrás de este jugoso proyecto!

Mi biografía me ha llevado hasta este momento, el aquí y ahora, al encontrarme compartiendo habilidades para co-crear un evento por y para mujeres. Siento el deseo de dar a la comunidad eso mismo que ella ofrece, desde esta particular posición de compartir una perspectiva personal y creativa junto con otras mujeres colaboradoras.

La propuesta es repetir un evento que se llevó a cabo el verano pasado en Madrid; las jornadas intensivas "Mujer y Autoconocimiento", un espacio donde nutrir la conciencia colectiva.

La forma se co-crea a través de una serie de actividades que se desarrollan a lo largo de 3 días, donde el Arte y la Salud son los pilares que sostienen las jornadas. Desde la Perfomance a la Medicina China, pasando por la música y la comida co-crearemos un espacio de investigación, escucha, intercambio y disfrute.

Para este segunda edición, tu colaboración ayuda a que proyectos como este, creado de forma auto-gestionada por la comunidad y para la comunidad, sigan siendo posibles. A su vez apoyas con tu generosidad a la transformación de muchas vidas, ya que este es el carácter de las jornadas. 

Te invito a continuación a tomarte un momento para disfrutar del video que reune lo que fueron algunos de los preciados momentos de la primera edición de las jornadas:

 

 

-"Apoyándonos las unas a las otras concretamos el cambio que somos".

 

Un fin de semana diferente

En Agosto de este verano 2019 nos volvemos a reunir para celebrar de nuevo este hermoso encuentro; comenzamos el viernes 2 por la tarde, tenemos un círculo de apertura donde una matrona de la Fundación  Entredós,  que acoge en su espacio el evento, nos da la bienvenida, se presentan también las colaboradoras y las actividades del fin de semana. A continuación disfrutamos de una maratón de performances donde 4 mujeres comparten su arte desde el cuerpo y el movimiento. Concluimos la tarde con un picoteo para nutrir los vínculos!

El sábado 3 empezamos el día con un taller de 4 horas enfocado a estudios energéticos abordados desde la Medicina Tradicional China a cargo de las Acupuntoras Descalzas, Escuela de Medicina Tradicional China. Después de esto disfrutamos de otro espacio de nutrición desde la alimentación consciente invitando a cada participante a compartir la comida que ha traído desde su casa hecha por ella para compartir con el resto. A continuación nos tomamos el té escuchando el testimonio de 1 mujer que se abre a la intimidad de inspirar con su biografía a otras. Finalmente cerramos la jornada con una jam de música guiada por una musicoterapeuta y una cantante, 2 mujeres que sostienen el espacio para nosotras y nuestra expresión a través del sonido.

El domingo 4 arrancamos con otro taller de 4 horas de Medicina Tradicional China, promoviendo la autogestión, cuidados y auto-responsabilidad de una misma. Volvemos a disfrutar después del espacio de la comida y concluimos las jornadas con un conversatorio y presentación del proyecto Acupuntoras Descalzas, Escuela de Medicina Tradicional China que se encargan este año de involucrarse significativamente en las jornadas, compartiendo con nosotras a su vez el proyecto de su ONG que participa en la promoción de la salud en regiones submedicalizadas, respetando las medicinas tradicionales y privilegiando la aproximación cultural entre los pueblos indígenas. En esta ocasión, contaremos con la presencia de acupuntoras de las comunidades mayas Ixil y Qiché de las CPR-Sierra de Guatemala (https://www.facebook.com/CPRsierraGUATEMALA/), proyecto de colaboración que se mantiene desde 2014. En este espacio de las jornadas se invitará a las participantes a hacer una aportación consciente y voluntaria durante la actividad. Lo recaudado irá destinado a material de acupuntura para este área.

Para saber más de las Acupuntoras Descalzas, Escuela de Medicina Tradicional China: https://acupuntorasdescalzas.org/author/acupuntorasdescalzas/

 

Forma parte de algo grande

Deseamos el apoyo de la comunidad para materializar este apetitoso evento juntas. El año pasado la financiación fue privada y todo un desafío circense para que se realizarán finalmente las jornadas, es por ello que esta vez llamamos a todas a apoyarnos en este proyecto, desde el lugar donde nos encontramos aquí, ahora, desde nuestro sentir y poder sostener de alguna manera a un grupo de mujeres posicionándose en su valía.

El sueño es recaudar 1,260€ desglosado en lo siguiente:

-440€ para pagar el alquiler del espacio, la maravillosa Fundación Entredós (http://fundacionentredos.org/ ), que nos acoge con los brazos abiertos una vez más este año en el centro de Madrid 

-250€ para pagar a las 2 colaboradoras que compartirán los talleres de salud.

-250€ para pagar a las 5 artistas colaboradoras involucradas en la parte de arte.

-120€ destinados a cubrir los gastos para la nutrición de las participantes durante el evento (picoteo y té, no comidas principales)

-100€ para pagar el trabajo de coordinación y gestión de las jornadas.

-100€ para pagar la comisión de este plataforma, Indiegogo.

La visión de este proyecto es a su vez cambiar juntas una realidad actual, el desequilibrio económico que sufre el Arte y las Terapias Alternativas. Vemos la oportunidad con esta campaña de invitar a la comunidad a concienciarse junta accionando hacia el cambio que todas deseamos en cuanto al reconocimiento de nuestros dones y servicios y su valoración monetaria. A su vez, la posibilidad de pagar a las colaboradoras y mujeres que ofrecen el espacio permite que se abran las puertas a personas que deseen participar de las jornadas independientemente de su situación económica.

Desde 1€ a todo lo que desees colaborar, desde aquí y ahora te agradecemos por tu generosidad!

 

 

Otras formas de involucrarte

Todas tenemos una amiga, prima, abuela o pariente lejana dispuestas a apoyarnos en aquellos proyectos que nos conmueven, por ello si resuenas de alguna manera con la propuesta de esta campaña y deseas compartirla con más personas adelante!!! Cualquier forma de contribución y apoyo es acogida con brazos y corazón abierto!

Que las palabras de esta visión te inspiren a creer en tus sueños y en los sueños de otras y apoyarnos confiando que SI se puede! 

Gracias, gracias, gracias!

*Gracias en especial a su vez a todas las colaboradoras de la primera y segunda edición: Rosa, Andrea, Charlotte, Nieves, Sara, Olivia, Silvia, Marta, Juana, Catarina, Magdalena, Juna, Juana, Gara y Mayte, entre otras!

-Nuria

............................................................................................

Welcome to this campaign!


My name is Nuria, one of the women behind this juicy project!

My life's path has taken me to this moment, here and now. Finding myself sharing skills to co-create an event for women made by women with the desire to share with the community exactly the same thing that it offers to all of us. From this position that enables to contribute with a personal and creative perspective along with other female collaborators.

The proposal is to repeat an event that took place last summer in Madrid "Women and Self-Knowledge"; a space to nurture collective consciousness.

The format of the event is co-created through a series of activities taking place over 3 days, where Art and Health are the pillars sustaining it. From Performance to Chinese Medicine, throughout music and food, we will co-create a space for research, listening, exchange and enjoyment.

With your collaboration, you will be supporting not only the realisation of this event but also the transformation of many lives; supporting projects such as this one, created in a self-managed way by the community for the community.

I invite you to take a moment to watch the video from last year:

"Supporting one another we become the change we envision."

 

A unique weekend

The second edition of this event takes place in August 2019, starting on Friday 2nd in the afternoon. We have an opening circle where a midwife from the Entredos Foundation (the space that will host us) welcomes us. The collaborators and the weekend activities will also be introduced following this. Then we enjoy a marathon of performances where 4 women share their art with the body and its movement. We conclude with a snack to nourish our bonds even more!

On Saturday we begin the day with a 4-hour workshop focused on energy studies from Traditional Chinese Medicine by Acupuntoras Descalzas, school of TCM. After this, we enjoy a space of conscious eating inviting each participant to share their homemade food with the rest. Then, we have a cup of tea listening to the testimony of a woman who opens herself to the intimacy of inspiring others with her biography. Finally we close the day with a music jam guided by a music therapist and a singer, 2 women who hold the space for us and our expression through sound.

On Sunday we start with another 4-hour workshop on Traditional Chinese Medicine, promoting self-management, self-care and self-responsibility. We continue enjoying another meal together and we conclude the day introducing the project Acupuntoras Descalzas, school of TCM, that this year is involved significantly in the event. They will share with us in this space their NGO's project which participates in the promotion of health in indigenous regions, respecting traditional medicines and favouring cultural exchanges between the villages. On this occasion, we will have the privilege to count with the presence of acupuncturists from the Mayan Ixil and Qiché, local CPR-Sierra Guatemala communities (https://www.facebook.com/CPRsierraGUATEMALA/). We will encourage the participants to donate a conscious and voluntary contribution during the event to send acupuncture material to this area.

To learn more about Acupuntoras Descalzas, School of TCM visit: https://acupuntorasdescalzas.org/author/acupuntorasdescalzas/

 

Take part of something bigger


We envision the support of the community to materialise this exciting event all together. Last year the funding was private therefore challenging to raise funds, which is why this time we call on everyone's contribution to support the project.

The dream is to raise € 1,260 broken down as follows:

-440€ to pay the rent of the space, the wonderful Entredós Foundation (http://fundacionentredos.org/ ), which welcomes us once again with open arms in the centre of Madrid.

-250€ to pay 2 collaborators who will lead the health workshops.

-250€ to pay 5 collaborating artists involved in the art section.

-120€ destined to cover the expenses of the nutrition of the participants during the event (snacks and tea, not main meals).

-100€ to pay the work of coordination and management of the event.

-100€ to pay the commission of this platform, Indiegogo.

The vision of this project is to change together a current reality, the economic imbalance suffered by Art and Alternative Therapies. We see the opportunity with this campaign to invite the community to become aware and act  upon the change we all want in terms of recognition of our gifts and services and their monetary value. At the same time, the possibility of paying collaborators and women who offer the space, allow everyone to join the event despite any of their financial situation.

From 1€ to your unlimited contributions, here and now we thank you for your generosity!

 

Other ways to get involved


We all have a friend, cousin, grandmother or relative willing to support us in those projects that move us, so if you feel touched by this campaign in any way and want to share it with more people please don't hesitate to do it! Any form of contribution and support is welcome with open arms and heart!

May the words of this campaign inspire you to believe in your dreams and the dreams of others and support them trusting that INDEED it can be done!

Thank you, thank you, thank you!

*Thank you specially to all the contributors from the first and second edition of this event: Rosa, Andrea, Charlotte, Nieves, Sara, Olivia, Silvia, Marta, Juana, Catarina, Magdalena, Juna, Juana, Gara and Mayte, amongst others!

-Nuria

Finally we close the day with a music jam guided by a music therapist and a singer, 2 women who hold the space for us and our expression through sound.
On Sunday we start with another 4-hour workshop on Traditional Chinese Medicine, promoting self-management, self-care and self-responsibility. We continue enjoying another meal together and we conclude the day introducing the project Acupuntoras Descalzas, school of TCM, that this year is involved significantly in the event. They will share with us in this space their NGO's project which participates in the promotion of health in indigenous regions, respecting traditional medicines and favouring cultural exchanges between the villages. On this occasion, we will have the privilege to count with the presence of acupuncturists from the Mayan Ixil and Qiché, local CPR-Sierra Guatemala communities (https://www.facebook.com/CPRsierraGUATEMALA/). We will encourage the participants to donate a conscious and voluntary contribution during the event to send acupuncture material to this area.
To learn more about Acupuntoras Descalzas, School of TCM visit: https://acupuntorasdescalzas.org/author/acupuntorasdescalzas/

 
Take part of something bigger
We envision the support of the community to materialise this exciting event all together. Last year the funding was private therefore challenging to raise funds, which is why this time we call on everyone's contribution to support the project.
The dream is to raise € 1,260 broken down as follows:
-440€ to pay the rent of the space, the wonderful Entredós Foundation (http://fundacionentredos.org/ ), which welcomes us once again with open arms in the centre of Madrid.
-250€ to pay 2 collaborators who will lead the health workshops.
-250€ to pay 5 collaborating artists involved in the art section.
-120€ destined to cover the expenses of the nutrition of the participants during the event (snacks and tea, not main meals).
-100€ to pay the work of coordination and management of the event.
-100€ to pay the commission of this platform, Indiegogo.
The vision of this project is to change together a current reality, the economic imbalance suffered by Art and Alternative Therapies. We see the opportunity with this campaign to invite the community to become aware and act  upon the change we all want in terms of recognition of our gifts and services and their monetary value. At the same time, the possibility of paying collaborators and women who offer the space, allow everyone to join the event despite any of their financial situation.
From 1€ to your unlimited contributions, here and now we thank you for your generosity!

 
Other ways to get involved
We all have a friend, cousin, grandmother or relative willing to support us in those projects that move us, so if you feel touched by this campaign in any way and want to share it with more people please don't hesitate to do it! Any form of contribution and support is welcome with open arms and heart!
May the words of this campaign inspire you to believe in your dreams and the dreams of others and support them trusting that INDEED it can be done!
Thank you, thank you, thank you!
*Thank you specially to all the contributors from the first and second edition of this event: Rosa, Andrea, Charlotte, Nieves, Sara, Olivia, Silvia, Marta, Juana, Catarina, Magdalena, Juna, Juana, Gara and Mayte, amongst others!
-Nuria

story:
HeartFire Summary

HeartFire Festival combines the best elements of great festival music and performance art with access to genuine spiritual teachers and authentic transformational workshops held in a sacred atmosphere. HeartFire is a new kind of festival-summit for exploring the intersection between art, spirituality, and ecology.

A sacred atmosphere and genuine spirituality is what HeartFire offers above all else. Festival co-founder, Yasha S. Wagner, recalls:

“I remember one massive festival, which included a large encampment of Indigenous elders and Native wisdom-keepers of various nations and tribes . . . They were keeping a large sacred fire for ceremony and prayer, and I’ll never forget the look on their faces as drunk party-goers passed by, throwing cigarette butts in their ceremonial fire and swearing disruptively in that sacred space. . . . I knew then that we needed a festival environment that could better hold and represent our sacred traditions.”

The festival culture of the United States is the living pulse of everything creative and inspiring on the growing-edge of our society—conscious art and music, and a celebration of interspiritual values. But it is also often an excuse for unbounded experimentation and partying that can diminish the profound impact of these spiritual and artistic gifts. 

Recognizing the gap and tremendous desire for genuine spirituality among today's youth, HeartFire Festival wishes to give them the best access to genuine spirituality in a truly sacred environment.

 

What We Need

To bring the best musical offerings together with genuine spiritual teaching in a sacred atmosphere for a new generation of spiritual seekers, we need to cover a variety of costs and provide access for those for whom the costs may be prohibitive. We have secured support and funding to cover most of  our infrastructure, as well as costs for our artists and teachers. Now we would like to give back to our participants by offering:

  • 10 full scholarships (free tickets) for qualified low-income participants ($2,400)
  • 100 partial scholarships (1/2 price tickets) for low-income participants ($12,000)
  • Transportation assistance for participants ($1,200)

It is with this that we need your help! So much spirituality today is 'leisure spirituality' for people wealthy enough to afford it. Please help support low-income participants by helping us to cover our costs (allowing us to provide them with free and hold price tickets).

 

HeartFire Offerings

Musical Acts:

  • Matisyahu (acoustic set with Aaron Dugan)
  • Desert Dwellers
  • Living Light
  • Liquid Bloom
  • Original Currency
  • Persian Music Ensemble
  • Incus
  • Dream Seed

Spiritual Teachers:

  • Ven. Dr, Pannavati Bhikkuni
  • Maestro Manuel Rufino
  • Rav Kohenet Taya Ma Shere
  • Pir Netanel Miles-Yépez

And many others...

story:
BOOM... BOOM... BOOM...

That's the sound of art exploding in the heart of Plaza Midwood!

What's happening? Well, cowboys and cactus are shooting it out in a trippy acid western. Mysterious maidens are sharpening their wit in an ancient pagan ritual. And a young man named Mall Goth is battling his stepfather to escape a six-week cruise to a Christian smooth jazz camp.

Want more? We got it.

How 'bout pink-haired flow dancers spinning LED-lighted hula-hoops? Or a tent full of trance tunes and art supplies where YOU become the canvas? Throw in every kind of musical style from hip hop to bluegrass to rock and sprinkle with a film festival where the director wants to hear what YOU think about their work.

Sound crazy? It is. We are. That's BOOM!

BOOM is a three-day festival of art, performance and the unexpected. We do crazy and fun and weird and beautiful like nobody else in the Queen City. But this level of creative craziness doesn't come cheap — even though many of our offerings are FREE. 

This is where YOU come in. 

Help us bring local artists working on the fringes of popular culture out of the shadows and into the spotlight. Help us rent the venues, hang the lights, build the stages, pay the insurance and cover the cost of producing a three-day festival.

How can you help? DONATE NOW!

Click on a perk to make a donation of the specified amount. 

A special perk only available here: the 18" x 24" signed BOOM 2017 poster!

If you donate at the $250 level or above, you'll get a beautiful 18" x 24" commemorative BOOM 2017 poster signed by Nico Amortegui, who created the painting especially for this year's festival. (See the poster design below) This poster is available only during this four-week campaign and supplies are limited, so DONATE NOW!

-----------------------------------------

More about the BOOM artists, performers and partner organizations:

The BOOM festival is a unique coalition of artists, volunteers, nonprofits, local businesses and neighborhood organizations who are transforming the way art is made and shared in our city. See our website for information on our artists.

Women’s Showcase                             TAPROOT

XOXO                                                         100 Words Film Festival 

ArtSi                                                           Charlotte Storytellers

Drumstrong                                             Jazz Arts Initiative

Singerismo                                              Piedmont Culinary Guild

Charlotte Lit                                            Hip Hop University

Creative Mornings                                Loose Leaves Showcase

The Light Factory                                 Tosco Music Party

Urban Zue                                               Baran Dance

AfroPop Nation                                     White Point Partners

Nico Amortegui                                     Flow 1212

Zodiac Lovers                                        Minthill

-----------------------------------------

Venue performance tickets are only $10.  
Our second annual BOOM Charlotte festival will feature 36-ticketed performances at venues in the heart of Charlotte’s Plaza Midwood neighborhood. Venue performances are within a short walk of each other at Petra’s, Snug Harbor and Rabbit Hole. Performance tickets may be purchased online, at The Intersection (our central hub) or at the door. Artists receive 80% of the ticket revenue.


Many performances and activities are FREE.  
In addition to ticketed performances, BOOM Charlotte Festival offers a central gathering place called The Intersection - a “community living room” which welcomes all ages.  This outdoor space is BOOM’s epicenter; where audience and community members can find out more about the festival, play in the children’s activity spaces, view FREE performances on the outdoor stage or chat with friends around the fire-pit. The Intersection is located across the street from Common Market and will be exploding with performances and activities all three days.
 
On Saturday only, the BOOM Charlotte festival will offer FREE music and dance performances, a film festival, visual art, vendors and food trucks at the International House and the Light Factory. 

BOOM Charlotte will also will curate an exhibition of local visual artists’ work which will be on display at Gallery Twenty-Two.  The exhibition will run throughout the festival weekend and open to the public all three days - 10am-6pm.

-----------------------------------------

Spread the word: BOOM is about to explode!

Tell your friends about us.
Share this crowd-funding page with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and -- better yet -- as a personal email invitation to support BOOM!

Become a sponsor.

If BOOM is to be an enduring, vital part of this community, we need funding partners who share our vision. We need funding partners who understand the importance of creating an environment where the arts and talent can thrive and where everyone's inner artist can be tapped and inspired.  We need funding partners like you!

If you own a business and would like to be a sponsor for BOOM, we have several levels and options available. Visit the DONATE page on our website to download our sponsorship packages.

Learn more about BOOM at our website: boomcharlotte.org

story:
Short Summary

Fragments Theatre is a cultural organization, founded in Jenin, by a group of actors, filmmakers, and technicians who were inspired by Juliano Mer-Khamis, a Palestinian /Israeli Theatre director who was assassinated in 2011.

 

Fragments Theatre wants to give young people the opportunity to express themselves using theatre, film, circus and the arts in Jenin and the surrounding areas. Over the last few years, they have organized several activates with children and young people, producing plays, short films and puppet workshops aimed at encouraging people from Jenin to learn new skills to express themselves in arts and culture.

 

The projects have trained young Palestinian artists, brought international artists and volunteers to work with the local community, built community partnerships, promoted community building, and fostered women’s empowerment. Its projects have also engaged hundreds of young people with the arts in Jenin and the surrounding isolated communities.

So far, the group has produced numerous theatre projects – “Peter Pan in Jenin” Theatre Project (2013), “Windows” Theatre Project (2014), the Cargotopia Art Festival and puppet workshops (2014) , “Chaos in the City” Theatre project (2015), and “A Madman Play (2016/2017). They have toured their work around Palestine, as well as to India and Morocco, Fragments Theatre opened the first Comedy Club in Palestine 2017, Cinema club and trained children in drama therapy.

In 2016/2017 Fragments received 2 large grants from MedCV Culture and AFAC in order to continue their important work of creating artistic productions and providing artistic opportunities for young people and emerging artists in northern Palestine.

 

What We Need 

We aim to raise 7000  dollars to achieve our plan.

The fund will cover the transportation and snack for the workshop's Participants, as well as to pay the rental space.

The rental space = 3500 USD.

Transportation and snack for 20 participants 3500 USD.

Current Projects

Fragments Theater is currently working on a number of projects, at various stages of completion.

Tunisian Film Week

Fragments Theatre will start the Tunisian – Palestinian  Film Week, 21, 22, 23 December 2018.

The project will be a screening Palestinian – Tunisian films and it will be followed  with discussions in both Palestine and Tunisia.

Standup comedy workshops.

Fragments Theatre will conduct Stand up Comedy with young people and presenting their own stories to the local community.

Upcoming projects 

continued carrying out filmmaking workshops for youth, while at the same time adding a capacity-building programme for existing and future filmmaking trainers. The courses will  consist of theoretical classes in script writing, photography and editing, in 2019 we are planning to work for women filmmaking project.

Stage one  large-scale theatre production with the children, Tales Play and it will be a collection stories of  the heritage from Arab countries.

Puppet Media:

Fragments Theatre in preparation for Media Puppet Project.

The project will be a training for puppet show and media, the participants will use media and puppet to produce a play as well as the project will host Egyptian artists to train the participants and also the play will be performed in Egypt.

Hip hope and break dance project

Fragments Theatre is working to put a plan to launch hip hop and break dance project.

Tales Play

Fragments Theatre is planning to produce Tales Play which will tells story a children story from the Palestinian heritage that we used to hear from our grandparents. Together with scenes from other famous Arabian stories a full theatre play will be created. It’s a drama and comedy theatre play which is full of wisdom and Arabian values that teaches family, the love to help others and loyalty.

 

The Impact

Fragments Theatre will continue offering activities in Jenin for the children and young people and will a space for them to express themselves freely.

Fragments Theatre respond the need of the young people and support the talented and neglected artists  and present them to the world and to the local community.

Risks & Challenges

Lack of fund toward Palestine.

The political Situation.

Fragments Theatre located in low area income.

Fragments Theatre built a great network in  a very short time  and will  collaborate with artists from Arab countries and the world  to work as volunteers to continue the activities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the campaign  with your friends, social media, Facebook, twitter and Instagram.

Tell the people about Fragments Theatre.

To learn more about us 

Facebook : Fragments Theatre مسرح شظايا 

Instagram : fragments_theatre

website:https://frgmentstheatre.org

story:
↓ Scroll down for the English translation ↓
 

Über Circus

Seit neun Jahren veranstalten wir, Tamara Mascara und das Circus Team, den Circus.

Spektakuläre Shows von Tamara Mascara und vielen anderen KünstlerInnen aus unserer Szene, sowie Top DJs aus der ganzen Welt, haben Circus zur größten Gay Party Österreichs gemacht. Über 2000 Gäste tanzen bei Circus mehrmals im Jahr bis in die Morgenstunden. Wir sind sehr stolz auf den Beitrag, den Circus für die queere Kultur und das Nachtleben in Wien leistet. Natürlich wollen wir, dass es auch in Zukunft so weitergeht!

Zu Beginn diesen Jahres haben wir mit viel Herzblut und Geld unser erstes Büro mit dazugehörigem „Creative Space“ gemietet. Der "Creative Space" ist eine echte Künstlerwerkstätte. Hier wird genäht, hier werden Kulissen gebaut, hier werden Fotos geschossen und Videos gedreht. Der "Creative Space" hat sich zum Arbeitsplatz für mehrere junge Mitglieder der LGBTIQ Community entwickelt, die wir bei Circus seit Jahresanfang angestellt haben. Leider mussten wir aufgrund der Sicherheitsmaßnahmen der Bundesregierung gegen die Ausbreitung des COVID-19 Virus den ersten Circus des Jahres absagen. Wir stehen voll und ganz hinter diesen Sicherheitsvorkehrungen, denn die Gesundheit und der Schutz unserer Gäste ist uns natürlich am wichtigsten.

Ihr könnt euch bestimmt vorstellen wie viele Ressourcen wir in dieses Projekt investiert haben. Zur Zeit erhalten wir keine Förderungen oder finanzielle Unterstützungen jeglicher Art und nun haben wir auch keine Einkommensmöglichkeiten, aber laufend weiter Kosten. Somit stehen wir und alle selbstständigen KünstlerInnen wie Drag Queens, DJs und Performer... völlig ohne Einkommen da.

Aus diesem Grund bitten wir euch dringend um Unterstützung, damit auch in Zukunft weiterhin Circus - Österreichs größte Gay Party stattfinden kann. 
 

Wofür benötigen wir deine Unterstützung?

Wir möchten voll transparent sein. Unsere Kosten lassen sich in folgende Bereiche kategorisieren:

  • diverse Anzahlungen für Circus - Fresh off the Farm, die nicht rückerstattet werden
  • Mieten (Büro, Creative Space)
  • Löhne und Gehälter 
  • Steuern & Sozialabgaben
  • Versicherungen
  • Honorare für KünstlerInnen, Drag Queens, DJs, FotografInnen, Aushilfen jeglicher Art etc. 
  • Marketing und Werbung
  • Wareneinkäufe
  • Bank- und Indiegogo-Gebühren

Zusätzlich möchten wir LGBTIQ-KünstlerInnen unterstützen, die sich in besonders prekären Situation befinden, wenn es die Summe der eingenommenen Spenden erlaubt. 


Was bekommt ihr für euren Beitrag?

Als Gegenleistung und Dankeschön für eure Spende haben wir uns diverse Rewards überlegt. Es gibt verschiedene Packages mit unterschiedlichen Belohnungen und Spendenhöhen. Wir glauben dass für jedes Budget und jedes Interessensgebiet etwas Tolles dabei ist. In jedem Fall möchten wir als Dankeschön gerne die Namen aller Spender auf unserer Website in einem eigenen Bereich "Supporter" hervorheben. (Vorname und Initiale, z.B. "Max M.") - Lass uns wissen, falls du das nicht möchtest.

Circus Art Cards

Als Danke für deinen Beitrag wird das Circus-Team drei Kunstdruck-Karten produzieren, die exklusiv an alle Spender verteilt werden. Eine schöne Erinnerung an eine Zeit des Zusammenhaltens.

Alle materiellen Rewards (Shirts, Art Cards etc.) werden bei der nächsten Circus-Veranstaltung persönlich ausgehändigt.

Natürlich sind wir auch sehr dankbar für zusätzliche Spenden - egal in welcher Höhe, denn:
auch kleine Beiträge können Großes bewirken.

 

Was bewirkt eure Spende?

Mit eurem Beitrag sichert ihr, dass Circus und die dazugehörigen KünstlerInnen auch weiterhin Österreichs größte Gay Party organisieren und euch auch in Zukunft aufregende Partynächte mit einzigartigen Erinnerung bereiten können.  

Zusätzlich tragt ihr dazu bei, dass Arbeitsplätze von queeren ArbeitgeberInnen für queere ArbeitnehmerInnen gesichert bleiben und lokale KünstlerInnen aus der LGBTIQ-Community unterstützt werden. 
 

Wie könnt ihr noch helfen?

Sharing is caring: Teilt diese Kampagne auf Social Media und mit euren FreundInnen und Bekannten. Gemeinsam als Community können wir die derzeitigen Herausforderungen meistern und mit neuer Energie und Motivation einer positiven Zukunft entgegenblicken. 

Im Namen des gesamten Circus Teams bedanken wir uns für eure Unterstützung und freuen uns sehr darauf, euch schon bald wieder auf der Tanzfläche zu sehen! Bis dahin, passt auf euch auf ♥


________________________

↓ English translation ↓
 

About Circus

Circus - Austria's biggest gay party - has been taking place since 2011 and attracts LGBTIQ-visitors from all over Europe to Vienna with a spectacular show by Tamara Mascara. We are very proud of the contribution Circus makes to queer culture & nightlife in Vienna and we would like to improve it in the future with more projects and events and offer the community more diversity, cohesion and of course entertainment.

At the beginning of this year, we rented our first office space as well as our "creative space", hired staff and have been working tirelessly over the past months to organize the next Circus event, which we now had to cancel with a heavy heart. The reason for this is the measures taken by the German government regarding the containment of COVID-19. We fully support these security measures, as the health and protection of our guests is of course our number one priority. 

You can imagine how many resources we have invested in this project. At the moment we do not receive any subsidies or financial support of any kind and now we have no income opportunities. Therefore we and all independent artists like drag queens, DJs and performers, who mostly live from hand to mouth without a safety net, are facing existential threats.

For this reason we urgently ask for your support so that Circus - Austria's biggest gay party can continue to take place in the future. 


What do we spend the donations on?

We want to be fully transparent. Our costs can be categorized in the following areas:

  • various non-refundable deposits for Circus - Fresh off the Farm
  • Rent (office, creative space)
  • wages and salaries 
  • Taxes
  • Social security contributions
  • Insurance
  • Fees for artists, drag queens, DJs, photographers, temporary staff of any kind etc. 
  • Marketing and advertising
  • Purchases of goods
  • Bank charges & Indiegogo fees


In addition, we would like to support artists who are in a particularly precarious situation, if the sum of the donations received allows it. 


What do you get for your donation?

In return and as a thank you for your donation we have thought about several rewards. There are different packages with different rewards and donation amounts. We think there is something great for every budget and every taste. In addition to getting your reward, you will also be featured in the list of supporters on our web site. (First Name and Initial, e.g. "Max M.") - Let us know if you don't want that.

Circus Art Cards

As a thank you for your contribution, the Circus team will produce three printed Art Cards, which will be distributed exclusively to all donors. A nice memory of a time when we were looking out for each other.

All material rewards (shirts, Art Cards etc.) will be handed out in person at the next Circus event.

Of course we are also very thankful for additional donations - no matter the amount, because: even small contributions can make a big difference.


What does your donation do?

With your contribution you assure that Circus and its artists will continue to organize Austria's biggest gay party and that they will continue to provide you with exciting party nights with unique memories.  
In addition, you will help to secure jobs by queer employers for queer employees and support local artists from the LGBTIQ community. 


Sharing is caring

Share this campaign on social media and with your friends and family. Together as a community we can master the current challenges and look forward to a bright future with new energy, motivation and fun. 

On behalf of the whole Circus team we would like to thank you for your support and we are looking forward to seeing you on the dance floor again soon! Until then, watch out for each other ♥
story_txt:
↓ Scroll down for the English translation ↓ 
Über Circus
Seit neun Jahren veranstalten wir, Tamara Mascara und das Circus Team, den Circus.
Spektakuläre Shows von Tamara Mascara und vielen anderen KünstlerInnen aus unserer Szene, sowie Top DJs aus der ganzen Welt, haben Circus zur größten Gay Party Österreichs gemacht. Über 2000 Gäste tanzen bei Circus mehrmals im Jahr bis in die Morgenstunden. Wir sind sehr stolz auf den Beitrag, den Circus für die queere Kultur und das Nachtleben in Wien leistet. Natürlich wollen wir, dass es auch in Zukunft so weitergeht!
Zu Beginn diesen Jahres haben wir mit viel Herzblut und Geld unser erstes Büro mit dazugehörigem „Creative Space“ gemietet. Der "Creative Space" ist eine echte Künstlerwerkstätte. Hier wird genäht, hier werden Kulissen gebaut, hier werden Fotos geschossen und Videos gedreht. Der "Creative Space" hat sich zum Arbeitsplatz für mehrere junge Mitglieder der LGBTIQ Community entwickelt, die wir bei Circus seit Jahresanfang angestellt haben. Leider mussten wir aufgrund der Sicherheitsmaßnahmen der Bundesregierung gegen die Ausbreitung des COVID-19 Virus den ersten Circus des Jahres absagen. Wir stehen voll und ganz hinter diesen Sicherheitsvorkehrungen, denn die Gesundheit und der Schutz unserer Gäste ist uns natürlich am wichtigsten.
Ihr könnt euch bestimmt vorstellen wie viele Ressourcen wir in dieses Projekt investiert haben. Zur Zeit erhalten wir keine Förderungen oder finanzielle Unterstützungen jeglicher Art und nun haben wir auch keine Einkommensmöglichkeiten, aber laufend weiter Kosten. Somit stehen wir und alle selbstständigen KünstlerInnen wie Drag Queens, DJs und Performer... völlig ohne Einkommen da.
Aus diesem Grund bitten wir euch dringend um Unterstützung, damit auch in Zukunft weiterhin Circus - Österreichs größte Gay Party stattfinden kann.  
Wofür benötigen wir deine Unterstützung?
Wir möchten voll transparent sein. Unsere Kosten lassen sich in folgende Bereiche kategorisieren:

diverse Anzahlungen für Circus - Fresh off the Farm, die nicht rückerstattet werden
Mieten (Büro, Creative Space)
Löhne und Gehälter 
Steuern & Sozialabgaben
Versicherungen
Honorare für KünstlerInnen, Drag Queens, DJs, FotografInnen, Aushilfen jeglicher Art etc. 
Marketing und Werbung
Wareneinkäufe
Bank- und Indiegogo-Gebühren

Zusätzlich möchten wir LGBTIQ-KünstlerInnen unterstützen, die sich in besonders prekären Situation befinden, wenn es die Summe der eingenommenen Spenden erlaubt. 


Was bekommt ihr für euren Beitrag?

Als Gegenleistung und Dankeschön für eure Spende haben wir uns diverse Rewards überlegt. Es gibt verschiedene Packages mit unterschiedlichen Belohnungen und Spendenhöhen. Wir glauben dass für jedes Budget und jedes Interessensgebiet etwas Tolles dabei ist. In jedem Fall möchten wir als Dankeschön gerne die Namen aller Spender auf unserer Website in einem eigenen Bereich "Supporter" hervorheben. (Vorname und Initiale, z.B. "Max M.") - Lass uns wissen, falls du das nicht möchtest.
Circus Art Cards
Als Danke für deinen Beitrag wird das Circus-Team drei Kunstdruck-Karten produzieren, die exklusiv an alle Spender verteilt werden. Eine schöne Erinnerung an eine Zeit des Zusammenhaltens.
Alle materiellen Rewards (Shirts, Art Cards etc.) werden bei der nächsten Circus-Veranstaltung persönlich ausgehändigt.
Natürlich sind wir auch sehr dankbar für zusätzliche Spenden - egal in welcher Höhe, denn:auch kleine Beiträge können Großes bewirken.
 

Was bewirkt eure Spende?
Mit eurem Beitrag sichert ihr, dass Circus und die dazugehörigen KünstlerInnen auch weiterhin Österreichs größte Gay Party organisieren und euch auch in Zukunft aufregende Partynächte mit einzigartigen Erinnerung bereiten können.  
Zusätzlich tragt ihr dazu bei, dass Arbeitsplätze von queeren ArbeitgeberInnen für queere ArbeitnehmerInnen gesichert bleiben und lokale KünstlerInnen aus der LGBTIQ-Community unterstützt werden.  

Wie könnt ihr noch helfen?
Sharing is caring: Teilt diese Kampagne auf Social Media und mit euren FreundInnen und Bekannten. Gemeinsam als Community können wir die derzeitigen Herausforderungen meistern und mit neuer Energie und Motivation einer positiven Zukunft entgegenblicken. 
Im Namen des gesamten Circus Teams bedanken wir uns für eure Unterstützung und freuen uns sehr darauf, euch schon bald wieder auf der Tanzfläche zu sehen! Bis dahin, passt auf euch auf ♥

story:
Français : Africabaie.com est une marketplace qui permet aux créateurs, artisans, artistes peintres, artistes plasticiens et écrivains d'atteindre une audience plus globale en vendant leurs créations directement sur internet. Une innovation technologique et sociale dont les médias parlent. 

English : Africabaie.com is a marketplace where creators, craftsmen, painters, visual artists and writers can reach a global audience by selling their creations directly online. A technological and social innovation that has been praised by the media.

4,000 PRODUCTS FROM 150 SELLERS

 

PLUS DE 4,000 ARTICLES DE 150 VENDEURS

MEN OUTFIT // VETEMENTS HOMME

HOME DECO // POUR LA MAISON

A SOCIAL INNOVATION AS SEEN IN THE PRESS

 

VALUE PROPOSITION

Français :   Pour les créateurs de mode, les artisans, écrivains et artistes qui manquent de visibilité à l’international et qui n’ont pas la capacité à créer et à maintenir un site e-commerce, Africabaie est une marketplace unique et inédite qui répond à ce besoin. 

English : For fashion designers, artisans, writers and artists who lack visibility internationally and who do not have the capacity to create and maintain an e-commerce website, Africabaie is a unique and unprecedented marketplace that meets this need.

Advantages

  •  Grande variété de produits : hommes, femmes, enfants, chaussures, accessoires beauté et bijoux de tous styles, décoration maison, arts, livres, etc…//ENG// Diversity of products : clothing, shoes, accessories, beauty and jewelry, home decoration, arts, books, etc...
  •  Faible commission pour les vendeurs : 5%, comparée à la concurrence qui peut monter jusqu’à 20%. //ENG// Low commission : 5% on each sales whereas some competitors can take up to 20%.
  •  Qualité irréprochable des produits, chaque vendeur est reconnu pour ces produits de qualité.  //ENG// Quality of products : each vendor has been carefully selected for the quality of its      products.
  •  Rapidité d’expédition : 5 à 7 jours en moyenne  //ENG// Shipping : 5 to 7 days
  •  Service client : 24h/24  - 7J/7 //ENG// Customer support : 24/7

100% CUSTOMER SATISFACTION

HOW IT WORKS / FONCTIONNEMENT

1. Customer places order

2. Seller & Africabaie get a notification

3. Africabaie sent a first payment to the seller

4. Seller prepares and ships the item

5. Customer confirm the reception of the item

6. Africabaie sent the second payment to the seller

NEED / BESOIN

Français : 15 000 euros ou PLUS par ce canal sur un montant total de 150 000 euros répartis comme suit.

English : We seek €15K or MORE of a total amount of €150K budget.

 

ROADMAP 2019 & 2020

Français : Les fonds seront utilisés pour 4 grands axes de développements de la plateforme. 

1. La conquête de nouveaux marchés par des actions de marketing et de communication.

2. Amélioration de la technologie. 85% du trafic actuel provient du mobile. C'est la raison pour laquelle nous misons beaucoup sur l'optimisation des performances web et mobiles et le développement d'applications mobiles...pour améliorer l'expérience utilisateur. 

3. L'augmentation du nombre de produits afin d'offrir une gamme encore plus large. Et cela implique la conquête de nouveaux vendeurs. Objectif de 50,000 produits en ligne.

4. Réduction du coût de la livraison. La livraison est un facteur déterminant dans le succès d'un site e-commerce. En effet 95% des acheteurs préfèrent des coûts de livraison très faible voir gratuit. C'est pour cela que l'optimisation du processus de livraison et la réduction des coûts pour le client est notre préoccupation. 

English : The fund collected will be used mainly in 4 axes.

1. The conquest of new markets / customers through marketing and communication actions.

2. Technology enhancement. 85% of the current traffic comes from mobile. That's why we rely heavily on  web and mobile performance optimization, development of mobile applications...to enhance the customer experience.

3. Increasing the number of products to offer an even wider game. And this involves the conquest of new sellers. Goal of 50,000 products online.

4. Lower the shipping fees. Shipping process is a determining factor in the success of a marketplace. Indeed, 95% of buyers prefer a low shipping costs, free if possible. That's why optimizing the shipping process and cut costs to increase customer's power is our main concern.

 

FUNDS VENTILATION / UTILISATION DES FONDS

 

WHY WE CARE ABOUT THE PROJECT // POURQUOI C'EST SI IMPORTANT

  • En stimulant la production locale avec des artisans et créateurs, nous favorisons ainsi la création et le maintien d'emplois. 
  • A date, avec plus de 150 vendeurs, c'est plus de 200 emplois indirects et près de 500 personnes (vendeurs, familles de vendeurs, etc) à qui profitent les revenues des ventes.
  • A moyen terme, c'est 50,000 produits attendus sur le site donc des milliers de personnes qui profiteront directement et indirectement des revenus des ventes.
  • A long terme, avec des millions de produits mis en ligne, ça sera des millions d'emplois générés de manière directe et indirecte.
  • Le développement de l'économie locale freinera les migrations démographiques. En effet, dans un milieu donné plus des personnes ont des sources de revenus réguliers, plus l'envie "d'aller voir ailleurs" diminue.

OUR VIDEO ON FRANCE TELEVISION

 

ABOUT THE FOUNDER // A PROPOS DU FONDATEUR

Sem Djeguede, à l’origine du projet Africabaie, est ingénieur informatique et Télécom de formation. Il a suivi également des études en Management de l'innovation puis en Administration des Affaires aux Etats-Unis. Avant son aventure entrepreneuriale, il a été responsable de projets informatique pendant près de huit années en région parisienne pour de grands groupes français du CAC40. Pour en savoir plus sur lui : www.semdjeguede.com

English : Sem Djeguede is a software engineer & telecom engineer. He also studied Management of Innovation and Business Administration in the United States. Before to start his own ventures, he worked as IT projects manager for nearly eight years in Paris area for two of CAC40 companies. To know more, please visit www.semdjeguede.com

Risks and challenges

Travaillant sur ce projet depuis un peu plus d'un an, les risques et les challenges sont parfaitement compris et mesurés. 
Mettre en place et développer une marketplace à grande échelle revient à résoudre l'énigme de l'oeuf et la poule. Par analogie, ici, à celui des vendeurs et des clients. D'une part il faut trouver des vendeurs pour alimenter perpétuellement le site et d'autre part il faut des consommateurs pour écouler les produits mis en ligne.

Nous misons essentiellement sur notre stratégie de communication et de marketing pour surmonter cela.

Outre cet aspect chicken-egg, qui n'est pas un risque mais plutôt un challenge, il y a celui de la livraison. Aujourd'hui, chaque vendeur s'occupe de l'expédition de ses commandes. Nous sommes conscients des coûts que cela peut engendrer aussi bien pour le client en premier que pour le vendeur notamment si l'expédition se fait depuis le continent africain.

Nous mettons progressivement en place des partenariats avec des transporteurs ainsi qu'une solution logistique pour surmonter ce challenge.

English

Working on this project over a year, the risks and challenges are perfectly understood and measured. 
Setting up and developing a large scale marketplace is like solving the chicken-egg problem (by analogy, sellers and customers). On one hand you have to find sellers to perpetually feed the site and on the other hand you need consumers to buy the products.

We rely primarily on our communication and marketing strategy to overcome this.

In addition to this chicken-egg problem, which is not a risk but a challenge, there is another one : shipping cost. Today, each seller handles the shipping of his orders. We are aware of the costs that this can cause both on the customer (primarily) and the seller. Especially if the shipment is from the African continent.

We are gradually establishing partnerships with carriers as well as a logistics solution to overcome this challenge.

Aujourd'hui, chaque vendeur s'occupe de l'expédition de ses commandes. Nous sommes conscients des coûts que cela peut engendrer aussi bien pour le client en premier que pour le vendeur notamment si l'expédition se fait depuis le continent africain.Nous mettons progressivement en place des partenariats avec des transporteurs ainsi qu'une solution logistique pour surmonter ce challenge.EnglishWorking on this project over a year, the risks and challenges are perfectly understood and measured. Setting up and developing a large scale marketplace is like solving the chicken-egg problem (by analogy, sellers and customers). On one hand you have to find sellers to perpetually feed the site and on the other hand you need consumers to buy the products.We rely primarily on our communication and marketing strategy to overcome this.In addition to this chicken-egg problem, which is not a risk but a challenge, there is another one : shipping cost. Today, each seller handles the shipping of his orders. We are aware of the costs that this can cause both on the customer (primarily) and the seller. Especially if the shipment is from the African continent.We are gradually establishing partnerships with carriers as well as a logistics solution to overcome this challenge.

story:
Background and Story

We are Maeve Athanasiadis and Dionys "Dio" Gallagher, a pair of rock-hoppers from the Belt. Born to a life of hardship, we were never very good at mining. Or engineering, really - when our ship broke down, it broke hard, and the towing fees to Tycho Station nearly wiped us out. We couldn't afford to repair our ship, the Black Moon, or Mung Belék, so we decided to follow our secret passion and converted it into a bar. Now we're parked at Dock 73Y, slinging drinks out of our cargo hold. 

It turns out we're way better at bartending than we ever were at mining, and we love it. Our creative drinks, true Belter hospitality, and novel (if cramped) location have earned us the admiration of dockworkers, engineers, and visiting customers alike. As one of the hottest bars on Tycho, we're expanding, but we need your help to keep things running and the drinks flowing.  

What We're Doing

This will be a suite party at WorldCon 76 in San Jose this August, themed around the Belter culture from the award-winning book and TV series The Expanse. The party will run on August 17th and 18th (Friday and Saturday nights). This is an expanded and improved version of the Belter Bar that some of us ran at BayCon 2017, when Daniel Abraham and Ty Franck, the authors of The Expanse were guests of honor at the con, and spent quite a while attending our bar, enjoying the decor and drinks, and generally having a good time.

When you walk in, you'll be entering the most immersive Expanse experience we can create, with great drinks made on the spot as well as Belter language and culture. We invite everyone - Belters, Martians, Earthers, and those who haven't chosen a faction - to join us in space for an evening! 

Donations will go toward:

  • Supplies of alcohol, mixers, and food;
  • Decorations that provide an immersive, atmospheric experience ("Those look like the same string lights we had on our set," observed Ty Franck, co-author of The Expanse, at the last party)
  • Safety measures and equipment for the hotel suite 
  • Transporting all this to and from the site

All our staff will be donating their time and energy. 

Who We Are and Our Experience

In real life, we're Hanne Paine and Kagan "Kai" MacTane, who work together as Paine × MacTane. Hanne is an Expanse superfan who has been a focal point for NYC Expanse fan meetups, was instrumental in the Save the Expanse effort, organized the epic 200-person Season 3 Finale party  this year, and has taught an immersive Lang Belta class at sci-fi cons in from Baltimore to Rome, Montréal, and Worldcon 75 in Helsinki. Kai hosts Lang Belta meetups in the San Francisco Bay Area, created the Lang Belta phrasebook on Memrise, and has taught a Lang Belta class at last year's BayCon, as well as being a co-host of that con's Belter Bar.

Together, we've merged our two courses and taught at this year's BayCon, co-moderate the /r/LangBelta community on Reddit , and we're best known as the duo behind the #ExpanseCocktails series of recipes honoring various characters in the series. Between our cocktail knowledge, our party hosting experience, and our deep love and knowledge of Belter culture, we're uniquely suited to make this party a success.

Risks & Challenges

These are our risks and challenges. 

  • If we don't raise enough money, we won't be able to make this event as good as it should be. We have great plans for set dressing and for food and drinks, and we'd hate to turn away thirsty people. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us out, please spread the word to other Screaming Firehawks attending Worldcon and around the world!

story:
Note - While our goal says $500 due to minimum requirements on Indiegogo, that is our stretch goal. Ideally we're hoping to raise $150 - this will help us heaps as it is!

Short Summary

Musoka Live is a group of nine teenagers (14-19) from Melbourne, Australia. We have all had involvement within the Melbourne Cosplay Community for many years through individual and group projects, but have come together to form the little family we call Musoka.

We've been working hard since November 2016, honing in our skills to give the best performances we can - and have finally come out of the shadows to announce the group and set a date for our debut. We are planning to have a meet up of cosplayers from Melbourne on the 8th of April, where we will make our debut and perform for the first time together. This is a really big step for us and will hopefully set the tone for our group to continue well into the future - this is a passion project and we've all become so close over the last few months. While organising permits with the council for our performance and meet, we hit a bit of a hurdle - the cost of the permit is $470. This may not seem like much, but for nine teen students, some who don't have jobs and live out of home, it's  a hefty amount. Not only is it a struggle to come up with this financially, but it takes away from future cosplay plans that we all want to save for - reducing the amount of performances and photoshoots we can reasonably do this year. 

What We Need & What You Get

We've been doing the calculations and worked out that if we can raise just $150 out of the total amount required, splitting the remaining total between the nine of us will bring the cost down that we have to put in to $35 each. This is much more achievable for us - and means that we can push on with practicing and performing rather than worrying about affording the permit. All the funds will go towards paying this permit, regardless of if we reach our goal or not. Any amount helps us bring down that individual cost, and in turn helps us to better afford and save for future cosplays and better practice spaces, bigger performance venues, etc. If we reach over our goal, this will continue to fund the permit, and if by chance we are funded more than the permit requires we will use this extra amount to buy future cosplays for the group.

We also have some really cool perks lined up for those of you who donate! This includes polaroid photos of the group in cosplay, updates on our practices, early previews of our performance and more! We hope you'll consider donating to us, it would mean a huge deal.

The Impact

While we simply all love performing and have similar interests in cosplay, anime and pop culture at large, Musoka is also about entertaining others and bringing a bit of positivity and friendship to the community. There's been plenty of negativity around the world lately, and we want to do our part to help remedy that. By donating to help us get this debut off the ground, you're enabling us to fully focus on giving the best performance we possibly can. It means a huge deal to us, and we hope by continuing to perform and spread Love Live's positive message of friendship, sticking together and helping one another to truly shine we can influence people within the cosplay community and the general public to be kinder, happier and to let their individuality shine. 

Risks & Challenges

The challenges we may face are less people than anticipated showing up to our debut. While there are over fifty people that have RSVP'd to our event, Facebook allows people to elect their interest rather than outright selecting that they can definitely attend so we aren't able to accurately pinpoint how many attendees we will actually have. The best way we can overcome this is by spreading the word - we are pretty actively involved in the cosplay community so are able to call in plenty of friends to make noise about our event and bring their friends, just like the characters in Love Live Sunshine had to do for their debut! We know no group debut or any performance for that matter is without risk - whether that be that our performance isn't good enough or any other reason - but we are practicing so often and planning everything to the nth degree to ensure we have the best chance of having a great performance that hopefully increases our popularity and notoriety as a group. The more people that know and like us, the more performances we can continue to have and the more new content we can bring out.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the financial capability to donate, don't stress! Even just sharing the link around is a huge help - the more people that see this the better! Statistically that would make our chances of hitting our goal so much higher - if 30 people donated $5 each we would make our goal easily. Even just coming to our Meet/Debut on April 8th at the Treasury Gardens in Melbourne, Victoria would mean a lot to us. Support of any kind is crucial to our continued success!
