story:
Flash back to the 1850s.

The neighborhood we know as Pioneer Square was a budding settlement of a thousand or so people. Its narrow dirt streets were lined not with the handsome brick buildings we see today, but with simple one- and two-story wooden structures. It was anchored by a single general store and sawmill. This was the beginning of Seattle, and Pioneer Square was at its heart.

Then it all burned down. Literally.

It was called the Great Seattle Fire, and for good reason. Blazing for several hours on June 6, 1889, it obliterated Pioneer Square and caused a whopping $20 million in damage (that would be about $527 million in today’s dollars).

Despite the devastation, Seattle’s business owners sprang into action to rebuild their city. Not only did they accomplish it within two years, they also made a fascinating decision along the way. To fix Pioneer Square’s sewer and drainage problems, they opted to raise the elevation of the street an entire floor, creating hollow spaces between the old and new sidewalks. Then, to make these spaces usable and bring in some sunlight, they embedded prism glass in sidewalks throughout the neighborhood.

And just like that, a loveable—and colorful—feature of Seattle was born.

Today, the glass prisms come in many shapes and sizes, but they all have two things in common: 1) they’re super old, and 2) they’re falling apart. When one breaks or falls through the sidewalk, property owners often fill in the holes with concrete. And in some cases, entire panels have been asphalted over.

Few cities have a collection of prism sidewalks like Seattle’s. That’s why we think they deserve some much-needed TLC, and with your help, we can make it happen.

Success! We're happy to report that our campaign raised $41,250! That's $26,250 above our original goal of $15,000!

Thanks to the generous support of our backers, we'll fully restore prisms located at the iconic Smith Tower on 2nd Avenue and Yesler Way. Additionally, we’ll reveal the paved-over panels at Occidental Avenue South and South King Street. Using these locations as examples, we’ll work with the Alliance for Pioneer Square to show downtown property owners how their prisms can be brought back to life. Through it all, we’ll demonstrate how the prisms are an integral part of both Pioneer Square’s legacy and Seattle’s story overall.

Please stay tuned to the updates section of this page for additional project news.

I claimed tickets to the Bruno Mars: 24K Magic World Tour as my perk and have questions.

Thank you for supporting our project! You will find answers to your questions in our FAQ. If you have specific questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com. Enjoy the show!

What is the National Trust for Historic Preservation?

The National Trust for Historic Preservation, a privately funded nonprofit organization, works to save America’s historic places. We are the cause that inspires Americans to save the places where history happened. The cause that connects us to our diverse pasts, weaving a multi-cultural nation together. The cause that transforms communities from places where we live into places that we love. As the leading voice for preservation, we are the cause for people saving places.

Our mission is to protect significant places representing our diverse cultural experience by taking direct action and inspiring broad public support.

Where is my donation going?

More than 90% of all funds raised will support the cities' projects and the National Trust’s ongoing work to save historic places in Seattle and around the country. Up to 10% will cover Indiegogo costs and processing fees as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.

When will I get my perk (non-ticket)?

Perks will be delivered later this summer (July/August).

Can I visit the project site?

Yes! You can visit Pioneer Square and specifically Smith Tower, where you can see existing damaged prisms wrapping around the corner on 2nd Avenue and Yesler Way. You are encouraged to visit the second location at Occidental Avenue South and South King Street. Since these prisms are asphalted over, you’ll have to suffice with a good “before” pic. Thanks to your help, you can even visit the site when these are brought back to their original, historic beauty.

When will the project be complete?

Saving places takes time! But with your generous support, we hope to get the Pioneer Square project completed as soon as possible.

How do I get support for my project? Or can I submit a project for consideration?

We at the National Trust are always interested in hearing about what is important to you. Although we may not be able to save it immediately, you can always contact your state’s historic preservation office and see how you can get started on the road to preservation!

Is the National Trust involved in other restoration projects?

Yes! We’re the country’s leading advocate for saving historic places. As such, we’re on the ground in communities across the nation. Visit our website to explore other historic places we are working to save like Pioneer Square.

Media Inquiries:

For further media inquiries about these projects, check out our Press Center.

My question wasn’t answered above. Who can I contact?

First, please see the full FAQ for the Cities Project.

If you have questions about the projects or how to claim perks other than tickets, please email cities@savingplaces.org.

If you have questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email  fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com.

If you have questions about the Cities Project, please email corporaterelations@heinekenusa.com.

story:
Route 66 is the most celebrated stretch of highway in America, where generations of open road seekers got their kicks and experienced the quintessential road trip. 

But its history runs much deeper than that.

Route 66 represents a significant moment in history that continues to define our nation’s identity: the rise of the automobile and its implications of freedom, mobility, and a uniquely American story.

Route 66 was officially commissioned in 1926 as part of America’s first federal highway system. Entrepreneur Cyrus Avery of Tulsa, Oklahoma, promoted the idea of an interregional link between Chicago and Los Angeles, where Route 66 runs today. The highway would be the shortest year-round route between the Midwest and the Pacific Coast, traveling through eight states: Illinois, Missouri, Kansas, Oklahoma, Texas, New Mexico, Arizona, and California.

As Route 66’s popularity grew, mom and pop shops, quirky roadside architecture, motels, theaters, and gas stations sprung up in main streets, urban centers, and rural areas. These unique places provided a respite for travelers on the road, and they became signifiers of their communities—whether it be a giant fiberglass statue of an astronaut in Will County, Illinois, or a row of half-buried graffitied Cadillacs in Amarillo, Texas.

Unfortunately, the development of larger, newer highways made Route 66 increasingly obsolete. Many of the towns that lined the historic road fell into economic decline, and in 1985, Route 66 was officially decommissioned when I-40 bypassed the last section of the road.

Business owners and passionate Route 66 supporters sprung to action and lobbied to commemorate this piece of Americana. In 1999, Congress created the Route 66 Corridor Preservation Program. Originally set to terminate in 2009, it was reauthorized through 2019 so it could continue providing financial and technical assistance to preserve Route 66.

With the impending sunset of this important program, the National Trust and its partners are seeking a National Historic Trail designation for Route 66. This permanent designation will bring greater public interest and investment to the communities along this iconic highway, and help revive Route 66 for generations to come.

But we can't do it without you.

This summer, the National Trust is hitting the road on an epic journey across historic Route 66. Our mission? Tell the stories of the people and places that make Route 66 so extraordinary, and build support for its designation as a National Historic Trail.

By donating to our campaign, you'll help fuel our road trip across America so we can spread the word far and wide about the importance of Route 66 and its preservation. You'll also be handsomely rewarded! In return for your donation, you will receive exclusive, limited-edition Route 66 perks designed by Mike Wolfe, creator and star of History’s “American Pickers,” and inspirer-in-chief of Two Lanes, a USA-made brand for explorers of America’s back roads.

"Preserve Route 66" T-Shirt – $30.00

Inspired by 25 years of exploring and rediscovering the often forgotten wonders of back roads, Two Lanes is Mike Wolfe’s all American-made adventure brand. This tee, made exclusively to support the National Trust's campaign, features a hand-drawn design recalling the glory days of traveling Route 66 in a vintage vehicle as it rolled past the neon signs and unforgettable scenery of this iconic roadway. It is printed on a soft, heather grey, American-made shirt. (90% Cotton and 10% Polyester, True to Size, Printed in Nashville, Tennessee by FutureShirts.)

"Preserve Route 66" Metal Water Bottle – $25.00

Two Lanes by Mike Wolfe offers quality products that are practical and durable for any level of back road travel. This bottle will stand up to the rigors of the road and the toughest use in everyday life. Both reusable and the only fully American-made water bottle on the market, this is item supports the preservation of Route 66 now and the beautiful landscapes of America for the future. It is printed in black on a matte white bottle with black sport cap featuring the same design as the tee, with some additional elements wrapping around the full water bottle. (Made of 100% Aluminum, BPA Free, Made in Union Gap, Washington by Liberty Bottleworks.)

"Preserve Route 66" T-Shirt + Metal Water Bottle – $50.00

Can't decide between the t-shirt and the metal water bottle? We don't blame you, so get both!

"Preserve Route 66" Leather Travel Journal + Keychain – $40.00

 The TwoLanesBlog.com is home to stories of small town destinations, undiscovered artisans, and untold tales. One of those artisans has been in the leather business for more than 100 years and is the creator of all of the Two Lanes leather goods. This travel journal perfectly fits inside a glovebox and holds a passport, as well as priceless memories of your journey. The keychain has “Preserve Route 66” branded into one side and Two Lanes on the other. It snaps closed to lock onto your belt loop or bag when you’re out exploring. (All Hand-Crafted in Tennessee, Real American Leather, Made in Franklin, Tennessee, by LongHollow Leather)

What is the National Trust for Historic Preservation?

The National Trust for Historic Preservation, a privately funded nonprofit organization, works to save America’s historic places. Our mission is to protect significant places representing our diverse cultural experience by taking direct action and inspiring broad public support.

Where is my donation going?

More than 90% of all funds raised will support the National Trust’s ongoing work to save historic places like Route 66. Up to 10% will cover Indiegogo costs and processing fees as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.

When will I get my perk?

Perks will be delivered in the fall of 2018 after our road trip concludes. You will receive an email from the National Trust asking you to confirm your perk, your shipping address, and any other information relevant to your perk (i.e. shirt size).

When will the project be complete?

Saving places takes time, and National Historic Trail designation literally requires an act of Congress! But with your generous support, our voice will grow even stronger in support of Route 66.

Is the National Trust involved in other restoration projects?

Yes! We’re the country’s leading advocate for saving historic places. As such, we’re on the ground in communities across the nation. Visit our website to explore other historic places that we are trying to save like Route 66.

My question wasn’t answered above. Who can I contact?

Shoot us a note at Route66@savingplaces.org, and we’ll do our best to answer your question.

Media Inquiries

For media inquiries about Route 66 and our road trip, please email Route66@savingplaces.org.
story_txt: Route 66 is the most celebrated stretch of highway in America, where generations of open road seekers got their kicks and experienced the quintessential road trip. But its history runs much deeper than that.Route 66 represents a significant moment in history that continues to define our nation’s identity: the rise of the automobile and its implications of freedom, mobility, and a uniquely American story.Route 66 was officially commissioned in 1926 as part of America’s first federal highway system. Entrepreneur Cyrus Avery of Tulsa, Oklahoma, promoted the idea of an interregional link between Chicago and Los Angeles, where Route 66 runs today. The highway would be the shortest year-round route between the Midwest and the Pacific Coast, traveling through eight states: Illinois, Missouri, Kansas, Oklahoma, Texas, New Mexico, Arizona, and California.As Route 66’s popularity grew, mom and pop shops, quirky roadside architecture, motels, theaters, and gas stations sprung up in main streets, urban centers, and rural areas. These unique places provided a respite for travelers on the road, and they became signifiers of their communities—whether it be a giant fiberglass statue of an astronaut in Will County, Illinois, or a row of half-buried graffitied Cadillacs in Amarillo, Texas.Unfortunately, the development of larger, newer highways made Route 66 increasingly obsolete. Many of the towns that lined the historic road fell into economic decline, and in 1985, Route 66 was officially decommissioned when I-40 bypassed the last section of the road.Business owners and passionate Route 66 supporters sprung to action and lobbied to commemorate this piece of Americana. In 1999, Congress created the Route 66 Corridor Preservation Program. Originally set to terminate in 2009, it was reauthorized through 2019 so it could continue providing financial and technical assistance to preserve Route 66.With the impending sunset of this important program, the National Trust and its partners are seeking a National Historic Trail designation for Route 66. This permanent designation will bring greater public interest and investment to the communities along this iconic highway, and help revive Route 66 for generations to come.But we can't do it without you.This summer, the National Trust is hitting the road on an epic journey across historic Route 66. Our mission? Tell the stories of the people and places that make Route 66 so extraordinary, and build support for its designation as a National Historic Trail.By donating to our campaign, you'll help fuel our road trip across America so we can spread the word far and wide about the importance of Route 66 and its preservation. You'll also be handsomely rewarded! In return for your donation, you will receive exclusive, limited-edition Route 66 perks designed by Mike Wolfe, creator and star of History’s “American Pickers,” and inspirer-in-chief of Two Lanes, a USA-made brand for explorers of America’s back roads."Preserve Route 66" T-Shirt – $30.00Inspired by 25 years of exploring and rediscovering the often forgotten wonders of back roads, Two Lanes is Mike Wolfe’s all American-made adventure brand. This tee, made exclusively to support the National Trust's campaign, features a hand-drawn design recalling the glory days of traveling Route 66 in a vintage vehicle as it rolled past the neon signs and unforgettable scenery of this iconic roadway. It is printed on a soft, heather grey, American-made shirt. (90% Cotton and 10% Polyester, True to Size, Printed in Nashville, Tennessee by FutureShirts.)"Preserve Route 66" Metal Water Bottle – $25.00Two Lanes by Mike Wolfe offers quality products that are practical and durable for any level of back road travel. This bottle will stand up to the rigors of the road and the toughest use in everyday life. Both reusable and the only fully American-made water bottle on the market, this is item supports the preservation of Route 66 now and the beautiful landscapes of America for the future. It is printed in black on a matte white bottle with black sport cap featuring the same design as the tee, with some additional elements wrapping around the full water bottle. (Made of 100% Aluminum, BPA Free, Made in Union Gap, Washington by Liberty Bottleworks.)"Preserve Route 66" T-Shirt + Metal Water Bottle – $50.00Can't decide between the t-shirt and the metal water bottle? We don't blame you, so get both!"Preserve Route 66" Leather Travel Journal + Keychain – $40.00 The TwoLanesBlog.com is home to stories of small town destinations, undiscovered artisans, and untold tales. One of those artisans has been in the leather business for more than 100 years and is the creator of all of the Two Lanes leather goods. This travel journal perfectly fits inside a glovebox and holds a passport, as well as priceless memories of your journey. The keychain has “Preserve Route 66” branded into one side and Two Lanes on the other. It snaps closed to lock onto your belt loop or bag when you’re out exploring. (All Hand-Crafted in Tennessee, Real American Leather, Made in Franklin, Tennessee, by LongHollow Leather)What is the National Trust for Historic Preservation?The National Trust for Historic Preservation, a privately funded nonprofit organization, works to save America’s historic places. Our mission is to protect significant places representing our diverse cultural experience by taking direct action and inspiring broad public support.Where is my donation going?More than 90% of all funds raised will support the National Trust’s ongoing work to save historic places like Route 66. Up to 10% will cover Indiegogo costs and processing fees as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.When will I get my perk?Perks will be delivered in the fall of 2018 after our road trip concludes. You will receive an email from the National Trust asking you to confirm your perk, your shipping address, and any other information relevant to your perk (i.e. shirt size).When will the project be complete?Saving places takes time, and National Historic Trail designation literally requires an act of Congress! But with your generous support, our voice will grow even stronger in support of Route 66.Is the National Trust involved in other restoration projects?Yes! story:
On Saturday, January 26th at 6 PM the 4th annual Thacker Jr. program will take place in Nutt Auditorium. Thacker Jr. is now a co-produced show between Thacker Mountain Radio Hour and the University of Mississippi's Living Music Resource™.

Featuring:

House Band: A Gust and the Septembers from Roxford University 

Literary Guest: Gloria J. Burgess, Author of Pass It On!

Special Guest: Mayor Robyn Tannehill

This event is free and open to the public and will be broadcast on the radio and live streamed.  

Please consider supporting Thacker Jr. as it enriches the lives of students and our community, and expands in new and exciting ways.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Matt Gilbert. I'm Gwich'in Athabascan. I'm 40 years old. I have a Bachelors Degree in English-Rhetoric from the University of Alaska Anchorage and a Masters of Arts in Rural Development from the University of Alaska Fairbanks. I grew up in Arctic Village, Alaska, but spent my whole youth travelling and living all over the country and driving across Canada and even visiting England.  I gave up the Modern life and travels, to come home and work for my tribe 12 years ago and this Gwich'in Regional Map is the last of my work with my people. I hope to resume my modern life in the world. 

The regional Gwich'in map project chose me, because eight years ago. I realized my grandpa's older brother Kias Peter Sr. who was my neighbor turned 95 and no one ever talked to him. I did not want him to die with all his knowledge, so I brought a traditional placename map over to him. He began working with me right away with a small grant.

What I thought was going to be a 2 week project with a local village map, turned into an eight year regional project with many adventures, obstacles, and honors.  

I gave up Ivy League Schools, jobs, potential relationships and careers to finish this project. I gave up leaving the state for great opportunities in the states for this job. It may sound bizarre, but its all true. These are the sacrifices I made to complete this project. What kept me going everyday is the reality that my life at 95 years (I hope like Kias), is nothing compared to a 10,000 year-old culture that is about to disappear. 

Its been eight years and the project is almost done.  The project bounced to every government agency in the Interior, Tanana Chiefs Conference, Council of Athabascan Tribal Governments, US Fish & Wildlife Service, and even the University of Alaska Fairbanks, but the funding has run out. 

You will help me finish this eight year project and complete the first Gwich'in Regional Mapbook in history, the University of Alaska Press has expressed strong interest in publishing it. They are already in review of my Gwich'in climate report. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $800 to pay for one more month of rent in Fairbanks, because it will take that long to get the last of the project completed. My rent is $625 and I will use the rest of the $175 for groceries. I have been renting a house by the university, so I can access the Gwich'in materials in the archives to finish this project. 

For perks I was going to do Gwich'in Postcards for anyone donating over a $100. There have already been two. I just had them printed yesterday. 

If I do not make the amount, I will use what you do contribute for groceries as I finish the project in Arctic Village. Its just better working in the city, because I don't hae to worry so much about the labor of a cabin. Hahaha. I can focus and get this done quickly, so I can have time to begin summer work and then, move on with my life. 

The Impact

I wrote briefs on the reports and I tried to move out-of-state twice, but the project haunted me into coming back to Alaska, because its so unique, special, important, and my Elders entrusted me with their knowledge and I had to disseminate it.  There hasn't been maps like this one. There are plenty of Native Placenames map made in most Native communities in Alaska, but rarely, has anyone used these placename maps like I did and go deeper to make travel narratives and document trails. I am at the last 5 feet from the Finish Line. I am one month from being done and you will assist me. 

As you all know, I have a great track record, I've built tribal libraries, courthouses, taught my Native language, assisted in saving my reservation from foreclosure, assisted Gwich'in leaders protecting the lands, and restoring Elder stories to my school, and I now have a series of books being published.  This doesn't include all the accomplishments I had in college, so I have done a lot of things in my life to draw upon to prove I am a leader who gets things done. 

I will attempt to include a photo of volume one. 

Risks & Challenges

The main obstacle is poverty and time, I don't have a lot of time, because I want to get a real job, which I had, but gave up to do this project, and lack of resources or real support from the university and tribes. Poverty is always the main obstacle, but I have overcome it for eight years to get this far, so I am confident I will go all the way despite poverty, no real support from the tribes or the university. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are no other ways you can help, but to donate to my campaign. You can buy a copy of the book when it does get released by the University of Alaska Press. 

Please don't share the campaign too much, because I targeted my fundraisers and its only a 5 day campaign.

story:
We are the Liberalist International Association (LIA), an international non-profit organization devoted to promoting and defending the central and seminal values of Western Liberal Democracy and the principles associated with the Liberalist movement as a whole. The LIA is attempting to bring the seven Liberalist Principles to Mythcon. We’re attending mostly as a liaison on behalf of the regional Liberalist groups, here to promote and represent each country, as well as ourselves, and attempt to put people from everywhere in contact with folks who can tell them more about what they can do if they’re interested in getting in on the ground floor of the movement.


With that said, we could use a little assistance. Namely the funding of this project. Spreading the word will have costs associated with it, inevitably, and in this case there are costs associated with renting a table-space, printing banners, posters and other materials for distribution. Our minimum goal for this project is $700 which is intended to cover the cost not only of the table space, but also printed materials for the table space promoting the regional groups. The stretch goal of $800 represents a more comfortable amount to make sure we have more than enough of all materials required to these same aims (additional pamphlets, promotional materials, etc.). If you could contribute something, even just a little bit, it would help us a lot, and would help us make this wonderful opportunity a success. Honestly, sometimes just $5.00 plays a bigger role than you can know.

We also intend to publish all incurred costs and spending related to this event on our website for review of the contributing regional members, or LIA members, so you can see how the funding was used. The regional groups associated with the events will also be suggesting tweaks to the materials present to best represent the regional groups.


If you want to know more about us, we have a YouTube channel, where we’ll be putting out material related to LIA and our regional organizations, as well as a website, www.LiberalistInternationalAssociation.com. Please consider following us on twitter @Liberalist_IA, or joining us on Discord or Reddit if you wish to volunteer to further the spreading of the Liberalist Principles in your own regional group, or internationally.

story:
The Project

The West Virginia Mine Wars Museum in Matewan, WV, is a grassroots people’s history museum that honors the legacy of labor organizing in the Appalachian coalfields. And right now, we are dreaming of an EPIC celebration.

Over Labor Day Weekend in 2021, we are banding together with partners from all over the state, region, and nation to commemorate the Centennial of the largest armed insurrection in U.S. History since the Civil War.

The Battle of Blair Mountain was a complicated, inspiring, and tragic event that pitted coal miners and their supporters against unfair and often illegal working and living conditions, enforced by their bosses with the support of many government officials. Over five days, 10,000 participants battled on Blair Mountain before surrendering to U.S. soldiers.  

Like you, we KNOW that this history has national significance.
We KNOW that this history can draw visitors from all over the globe to West Virginia.
We KNOW that we can only do it if, like the unionist miners, we work together.

With enough organization, planning, and $$$, we can accomplish something truly special in 2021.

The Team

To ensure that the Centennial reaches as wide an audience as possible, we’re asking you to join the ranks of big names like James Earl Jones, Chris Cooper, and David Straithern—actors in the 1987 John Sayles film "Matewan"—and many more, who have already pledged their time and support. (Fun Fact: James Earl Jones was this campaign’s first donor!)

Working behind the scenes to make it all happen is the Board of the West Virginia Mine Wars Museum, made up of UMWA leaders, history keepers, organizers, teachers, artists, and coal miners. We’ve already volunteered hundreds of hours to get this project off the ground. As well as incredible partners like the United Mine Workers of America, the National Endowment for the Humanities, and the WV Humanities Council.

Why We Need Your Help

The National Endowment for the Humanities has awarded the Museum a $30,000 matching grant to coordinate the Centennial. To bring together history reenactors, small museums, teachers, theater troupes, city councils, community development groups, and more for one BIG, BEAUTIFUL, CONCENTRATED EFFORT in 2021.

But we must match the $30,000 NEH grant dollar for dollar to unlock the funds. That means this $10,000 push will help us create a total of $60,000 in funding!

We have many solid building blocks already complete. We have already...

  • Met with key community partners to get the ball rolling on our 2021 Plan
  • Formed a Steering Committee of community partners to lead the 2021 effort
  • Hired a Centennial Coordinator to get us all organized
  • Assembled educational resources for teachers
  • Raised $15,000 of $30,000!

Your donation will help unlock the NEH funding, which will enable us to: 

  • Pay a Centennial Coordinator for two years to get us geared up for 2021
  • Continue to build partnerships among humanities organizations throughout Appalachia
  • Work with partners to plan a series of fun, educational events that will bring visitors from across the country to share in the history of the WV Mine Wars
  • Begin promoting the Blair Mountain 100th Anniversary to potential visitors

And as a way of saying Thank You for helping us promote this important piece of history, we’ve got some special treats to share...

The Perks

$1000 - Eli Kemp - You lost your life at the crest of Blair Mountain - VIP Ramp Dinner + Personal Tour of Matewan & Blair Mountain + All Perks Below

This spring, we'll cook you up a traditional Ramp Dinner at the United Mine Workers of America Local 1440 Union Hall in Matewan, WV. In addition to filling your belly, you'll rub elbows with some very special VIP guests. After dinner, we will take you on a personalized history tour of Matewan and the route that the miners marched from Marmet to Blair Mountain. Plus, you'll receive all the goodies below.

$500 - Keeney & Mooney - Pulling strings behind the scenes... - VIP Ramp Dinner

This spring, we will host a traditional Ramp Dinner for you and some very special VIP guests in Matewan, WV. Come enjoy freshly-dug ramps, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, fried apples, and more, prepared with love by experienced home cooks.

$250 - Bill Blizzard - All fire and dynamite - Autographed Copy of "Thinking in Pictures"

Receive a signed copy of "Matewan" writer and director John Sayles's book, "Thinking in Pictures." A unique book for anyone who has ever wondered how movies really get made, by America's most brilliant independent filmmaker. Using the making of his film "Matewan" as an example, he offers chapters on screenwriting, directing, editing, sound, + more.

$100 - Rev. James Wilburn - You put down your Bible and picked up your Rifle - Ballcap + Red Bandana

A limited edition, Realtree (tm) camo ballcap--wear it with pride! It’s got our official museum seal embroidered on the front panel, and “Matewan, WV” stitched into the side. Our latest 100% cotton red bandana featuring the museum’s new logo in black surrounded by a classic paisley design. Edges are serged. Bandana is 22" square.

$75 - Early Ball - Generalissimo of Hewett’s Creek - Free Museum Membership + Bandana

Your Free One Year Membership to the WV Mine Wars Museum helps ensure that the story of the Mine Wars is honored and learned from for decades to come. Includes member card, journal subscription, invitations to meet-ups, and more. Wear this 100% cotton red bandana--which features the museum’s logo surrounded by a classic paisley design in white--to show your solidarity.

$50 - Mrs. Riggs - You kept the Redneck Army fed - Bandana + Lapel Pin

Want to show people that you support this community museum wherever you go? Tie this red bandana around your neck and then stick this lapel pin on your vest, coat, hat, or blazer! Part of a limited edition of 100, this 1" die-struck metal pin has a black-nickel, antiqued finish.

$20 - Field Nurse - You bandaged and comforted injured miners - Postcard & Sticker Pack

Show your support for our grassroots history museum by slapping our new sticker on your truck, travel mug, boat, laptop, or anywhere else! And then share the story of the Mine Wars with a set of three postcards from classic, archival photos featured inside our museum.

$10 - Redneck - The call came, and you answered... - Free Admission & Personal Tour of Mine Wars Museum

Drop by the Museum in Matewan and receive free admission, plus a personal tour of the space by our docent, Kim McCoy, when you mention that you were a backer.

$1 - Witness - All hail the witness, who carries history forward... - The Satisfaction that Comes with Solidarity

As a Witness, you help carry this history into the future. And receive the satisfaction that comes with solidarity!

Spread the Word!

Want to do more than donate here? Spread the word! Share this page and tag your friends. And don’t forget to tag us too! #wvminewars

Thank you for your support!

The National Endowment for the Humanities has awarded the Museum a $30,000 matching grant to coordinate the Centennial. To bring together history reenactors, small museums, teachers, theater troupes, city councils, community development groups, and more for one BIG, BEAUTIFUL, CONCENTRATED EFFORT in 2021.

But we must match the $30,000 NEH grant dollar for dollar to unlock the funds. That means this $10,000 push will help us create a total of $60,000 in funding!
We have many solid building blocks already complete. We have already...

Met with key community partners to get the ball rolling on our 2021 Plan
Formed a Steering Committee of community partners to lead the 2021 effort
Hired a Centennial Coordinator to get us all organized
Assembled educational resources for teachers
Raised $15,000 of $30,000!

Your donation will help unlock the NEH funding, which will enable us to: 

Pay a Centennial Coordinator for two years to get us geared up for 2021
Continue to build partnerships among humanities organizations throughout Appalachia
Work with partners to plan a series of fun, educational events that will bring visitors from across the country to share in the history of the WV Mine Wars
Begin promoting the Blair Mountain 100th Anniversary to potential visitors

And as a way of saying Thank You for helping us promote this important piece of history, we’ve got some special treats to share...

The Perks
$1000 - Eli Kemp - You lost your life at the crest of Blair Mountain - VIP Ramp Dinner + Personal Tour of Matewan & Blair Mountain + All Perks Below
This spring, we'll cook you up a traditional Ramp Dinner at the United Mine Workers of America Local 1440 Union Hall in Matewan, WV. In addition to filling your belly, you'll rub elbows with some very special VIP guests. After dinner, we will take you on a personalized history tour of Matewan and the route that the miners marched from Marmet to Blair Mountain. Plus, you'll receive all the goodies below.

$500 - Keeney & Mooney - Pulling strings behind the scenes... - VIP Ramp Dinner
This spring, we will host a traditional Ramp Dinner for you and some very special VIP guests in Matewan, WV. Come enjoy freshly-dug ramps, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, fried apples, and more, prepared with love by experienced home cooks.
$250 - Bill Blizzard - All fire and dynamite - Autographed Copy of "Thinking in Pictures"
Receive a signed copy of "Matewan" writer and director John Sayles's book, "Thinking in Pictures." A unique book for anyone who has ever wondered how movies really get made, by America's most brilliant independent filmmaker. Using the making of his film "Matewan" as an example, he offers chapters on screenwriting, directing, editing, sound, + more.

$100 - Rev. James Wilburn - You put down your Bible and picked up your Rifle - Ballcap + Red Bandana
A limited edition, Realtree (tm) camo ballcap--wear it with pride! It’s got our official museum seal embroidered on the front panel, and “Matewan, WV” stitched into the side. Our latest 100% cotton red bandana featuring the museum’s new logo in black surrounded by a classic paisley design. Edges are serged. Bandana is 22" square.


$75 - Early Ball - Generalissimo of Hewett’s Creek - Free Museum Membership + Bandana
Your Free One Year Membership to the WV Mine Wars Museum helps ensure that the story of the Mine Wars is honored and learned from for decades to come. Includes member card, journal subscription, invitations to meet-ups, and more. Wear this 100% cotton red bandana--which features the museum’s logo surrounded by a classic paisley design in white--to show your solidarity.

$50 - Mrs. Riggs - You kept the Redneck Army fed - Bandana + Lapel Pin
Want to show people that you support this community museum wherever you go? Tie this red bandana around your neck and then stick this lapel pin on your vest, coat, hat, or blazer! Part of a limited edition of 100, this 1" die-struck metal pin has a black-nickel, antiqued finish.

$20 - Field Nurse - You bandaged and comforted injured miners - Postcard & Sticker Pack
Show your support for our grassroots history museum by slapping our new sticker on your truck, travel mug, boat, laptop, or anywhere else! And then share the story of the Mine Wars with a set of three postcards from classic, archival photos featured inside our museum.
$10 - Redneck - The call came, and you answered... - Free Admission & Personal Tour of Mine Wars Museum
Drop by the Museum in Matewan and receive free admission, plus a personal tour of the space by our docent, Kim McCoy, when you mention that you were a backer.

$1 - Witness - All hail the witness, who carries history forward... - The Satisfaction that Comes with Solidarity
As a Witness, you help carry this history into the future. And receive the satisfaction that comes with solidarity!

Spread the Word!
Want to do more than donate here? Spread the word! Share this page and tag your friends. And don’t forget to tag us too! #wvminewars
Thank you for your support!

story:
Artisans of India | Support Hand-made, Traditional Products

That’s the thing with handmade items. They still have the person’s mark on them, and when you hold them, you feel less alone. — Aimee Bender

The Artisan Sector of India provides the most beautiful and celebrated arts, crafts, and handloom items. Even though it is the second largest employment industry, it faces multiple challenges, which are damaging traditional art forms.

Negligible funding, lack of technology and marketing opportunities, and the flood of imitations and machine-made clothing items that don traditional designs in the tourist markets have discouraged artisans. The Indian corporate gifting sector has even become overrun with Chinese goods.

The Traditional Art Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 (TAES) serves to empower the artisan businesses of India and increase India’s share in global handmade demands.

Over 50 entrepreneurs are selected annually to participate in the TAES series of conferences, workshops and exhibition where they learn about marketing and branding to make their products export-ready. Once this is completed, they will be a part of our website TAESIndia.org. These entrepreneurs will also receive funding to participate in an organized traveling exhibition to promote and sell their goods.

Why TAES 2018? 

This campaign will financially support the multiple Artisan Organizations that participate in TAES 2018. We seek to use the power of the digital world to connect Indians to their roots and art lovers around the world to thoughtfully created Indian products. Our TAES Online Store will generate business for the participating artisans to help them achieve sustainability in future.

When you shop global, you bring the influence of another country into your life. Buying direct from artisans puts them in control of what they earn for their work, and with the opportunity to share their unique creations with the global marketplace they become empowered to manage their own success.

When you support TAES, you support our goal to involve Indian and foreign interest in this story of growth, support, and sustainability and spread knowledge of the Sanctity of Heritage Arts of India. Connecting artisans and buyers on a global scale also brings a better social life to the region and a confidence to artisans to continue in their craft.

All contributions are rewarded with a piece of handcrafted love as you become a part of the movement to take India’s artisan businesses global! Choose from beautifully handmade sculptures, paintings, sandals, jewelry, scarfs and other clothing items and make them your own!

How the Funds will be Utilized: 

The funds raised use the following distribution format:

For every 1000 USD raised:

100 USD goes toward Raw Materials,

550 USD toward Artisan Remuneration,

300 USD toward Marketing, Branding and Skill Development for global outreach 

50 USD goes toward Artisan Welfare programs.

Under the welfare component, we dedicate funds to the overall wellbeing of artisans, with a special focus on eye care, an area most affected in the handmade sector.

Risks and Challenges:

At the completion of the campaign, all products are then ordered from the participating Artisan Organizations. We will work hard to produce your desired product as close as possible to the displayed photograph. We kindly request that you celebrate any minor variations as the uniqueness of each handmade product. The production process may last up to 30 days, with an additional 12-14 working days for shipping across the world. Your reward should reach your doorstep by the end of August. If you have any questions kindly contact TAES@mithilasmita.com.

The MITHILAsmita Trust, created by Ihitashri Shandilya, has over 7 years of experience in the Artisan Sector with the guidance of industry experts, partners, and the Government of India, and is continuously working to create events that empower Traditional Artisan Organizations.

What if we do not reach the target Funds?

If target fund is not achieved, the available funds will be used only for raw materials and artisan remunerations. the handmade products will be produced for the existing limited backers. No funds will be used for marketing/branding/welfare initiatives.

What if we exceed our targets?

Any additional funds raised will be used not only for the production of handmade goods but also for better quality control, branding, marketing, and international promotions. 

If we cross 10,000 USD in this campaign, we will: 

  • Produce the ordered handmade products for our esteemed backers 
  • Send a silver celebration thank you card to all of our backers 

If we cross 50,000 USD in this campaign, we will: 

  • Produce the ordered handmade products for our esteemed backers 
  • Participate in 1 international marketing event/art fair to help these artisan organizations compete in the global markets 
  • Send a gold celebration thank you card to all of our backers  

 If we cross 75,000 USD in this campaign, we will: 

  • Produce the ordered handmade products for our esteemed backers 
  • Participate in 1 international marketing event/art fair to help these artisan organizations compete in the global markets 
  • Develop a digital platform with features to show the trail of funds to the artisans with an automatic notification system 
  • Send a diamond celebration thank you card to all of our backers  

 If we cross 100,000 USD in this campaign, we will use our funds to: 

  • Produce the ordered handmade products for our esteemed backers 
  • Participate in 2 International marketing events/art fairs to help these artisan organizations compete in the global markets 
  • Develop a digital platform with features to show the trail of funds to the artisans with 
  • an automatic notification system 
  • Send a platinum celebration thank you card to all of our backers 

So, dear Indiegogers join us in making the world a more beautiful place through art! 

Use your purchasing power to bring a change.

India's Heritage is the World's Heritage!

story:
Be part of the community!

Each year we invite the public to play a central part of the festival..

This Dublin 8 based festival showcases the best tasters of never before seen theatre, comedy and music from Ireland and beyond.

We programme a variety of wild and wonderful performances within 60 minutes at very happy prices. You, the public can then review - by Secret Ballot, Video Booth, Tablet Tale or our 4word Twitter challenge. This invaluable critique is delivered into the hands of the MAKER. And in this way the ART improves, and flourishes.

Our festival is fresh, fun but underfunded ...

We started this festival to give much needed support to fledgling artists. 5 years later, we have produced over 500 new shows that are touring internationally and in the UK, appearing on TV, Radio and showcasing at Ireland's biggest festivals. Each year in additional to our festival programme we provide Producers workshops, Design Workshops, Networking Opportunities, Resource sharing, Casting information, Insurance, Technical Support, Dramaturgy, Development and Mentoring for those taking part in the festival

Show us some love, it can't happen without you!

By taking the time here to purchase one of our PERKS, you become part of our fast growing, artistic COMMUNITY, you are affecting great CHANGE by allowing people's DREAMS to be realised and if for nothing else, you're creating positive energy for the world...

So choose from one of our fun PERKS such as Club Valentine's Date-night Dinner, our fairtrade organic-cotton Festival Tee or add a spiced rum hot-choc to your basket! Your PERK today, funds the ART of tomorrow.

Meet the Scene + Heard Stars

We are match makers too! We use our little black book of Agents, Literary Readers, Theatre Reviewers, Artistic Directors, Programme + Venue Managers to help our Artists with their next steps. There are too many to mention in detail here but click here to see what they did next

Other Ways You Can Get Involved ...

Maybe you can't afford a perk today, that doesn't mean you can't help us

  • Come meet the artists and see the SHOWS (Programme announced JAN 14)
  • Become a festival ALLY (See more about our volunteer programme)
  • Become an AMBASSADOR (Like, Share Our Campaign)
  • Give us your thoughts on the NEW WORK (Review shows by Secret Ballot / Video Booth)

And that's all there is to it.

story:
WHAT IS BURN IT DOWN?

Burn it Down is a filmmaking collective that provides emerging filmmakers the rare opportunity for experiential learning. Equally as important to us is the practice of improving set culture and the creative process by fostering a supportive, collaborative environment. We aim to demystify the filmmaking process, making it accessible and empowering. 

Now in our third season, we are leveling up! We've been getting by on our scrappiness, and for the first time ever we're fundraising to provide resources for our growing community and programming.

Burn it Down consists of two wings:

The flagship Workshop Wing is a chance for filmmakers to learn a new aspect of filmmaking or work on developing a skill by meeting regularly to make a scrappy short film. 

The new Production Wing builds on the existing goals of the Burn it Down workshops by essentially creating a fuller film production experience. We seek to do two things in its inaugural season:
Product: Create two festival-level short films.
Process: Actively work on a filmmaking process that values collaboration and support. 

 

 

WHO IS THE BURN IT DOWN COMMUNITY?

Burn it Down was founded by Jean Goto and Jessica O’Hara-Baker. Three seasons in, Burn it Down has provided free workshops and experience to over 50 emerging filmmakers. 

Our community is made up of storytellers with varying levels of filmmaking experience. Many have theatre backgrounds (we are in New York, after all!), and some are award-winning indie filmmakers. People come to Burn it Down looking to build skills, practice with a new piece of equipment, try a new genre or role, or learn on-set skills for the very first time. 

Our big ol' pie-in-the-sky hope is that Burn it Down inspires bourgeoning filmmakers to value an inclusive and wholistic creative process and that it’s a contribution to the larger progression of what’s valued in this industry. We’re proud to provide a platform that empowers filmmakers to be proactive about their learning process.

 

 

WHERE YOUR MONEY IS GOING:

  • Undervaluing sound is a rookie on-set mistake! We need some basic recording equipment for our Workshop Wing, including a microphone, recorder, boom pole and accouterments. A very basic set goes for $1,200!
  • Professional training workshops for things like editing, coloring and sound mixing
  • The Production Wing is producing two short films! We’re lucky that we have a very creative and scrappy team, but we’d love to give these folks some base funds to really let these stories shine. Funds for these films will go to:
    • Locations
    • Crafty
    • Wardrobe and art direction
    • Equipment rentals and purchases, such as cameras, lenses, hard drives, lighting, etc.
    • Post-production costs like sound editing, music and color correction
  • Administrative needs, like a Zoom account for our regular Production Wing meetings (since good communication is key to a healthy on-set culture!)

 

 

We totally understand that not everyone can support us financially. No worries! If you’re open to helping in other ways, please share this campaign.
Resources are an amazing way to help Burn it Down reach its goals! If you’d like to donate any resources such as locations, film equipment, catering, wardrobe, props, etc. please reach out and let us know!

story:
ENG/RU

What is Art-Festival 2019?

Art-Labyrinth Summer Festival is a unique event, held in Moldova in wild nature. It happens every summer for 11 years in a row. We create “5-days-world” far from public places and consuming ideology. World full of creativity, art, self-development, ecological thinking.
More than 50 workshops, 2 musical stages, team of volunteers, no entrance fee – all of these to change something in our society. To form space for community, friendship, sharing and love.


Our goals

- Create free space for creativity, art, consciousness and ecological thinking

- Give masters and artists possibility to share their knowledge, teach something interesting

- Promote community, friendship, love, closeness to nature – purity inside and around

- Inspire ecological awareness, spiritual and self-development

- Using only free donations, improve mentality of "sharing" and non-consuming values

 

What do we do?

It all started in 2008. We couldn't imagine then, that idea of getting artists and interesting people together in the wild, far away from city could have had such impact and become popular. A lot of people came around 500 people and it was "wow!" for that moment! Now we have 1000-1500 guests every year.

Every year we search for a new place. Place should be far from localities and, most important there should be wild nature and magic. The feeling of living a real life, of being in the moment, just here and now. The place is main "participant" of the Festival.

Cultural program includes over 50 workshops: fire-show, music concerts, African dances and drums, yoga, workshops for children and many other. Sometimes a person comes, makes a drum and just takes it home.

Non-commercial, non-consuming approach - this is Art Labyrinth's main idea. Being away of "buy/sell" way of thinking - that's it. It's when a person comes and feels that it's not a place where he's seen as a money bag. No advertisement banners here ever!

Art Festival is common creation, made by good people who form reality based on consciousness and beauty.

Why Indiegogo?

We've always had minimal entrance fee and, of course, it wasn't enough for ever-increasing budget. Some years ago, Festival became so big that we faced serious financial crisis. We made two more Festivals, but every time getting in serious debts. Now, in 2019, our team has to choose: either increase the fee greatly, or we tell 'no' to any compromise with commercial reality and make Festival with free contribution, being sure that people love and appreciate our work. Free contribution means that everybody gives as much as he wants to.

So now, we start a campaign on Indiegogo to raise funds for Art-Labyrinth 2019. This website is based on the main idea we appreciate so much – sharing. Collected resources will help us much to repair and buy equipment, tools, materials, to organize transport, buy tickets for artists and masters, food, make posters and many other.

The more fund we raise, the better Festival we can create with more interesting and diverse program. We open our hearts, inviting people to create this Festival with us,to become a part of our big family, our team. The very spirit of the Festival will change spirit at the root, becoming more authentic, genuine, closer to it's initial idea.

What is money spent on?

Last time due to bad weather and some organizational issues, we finished our Festival with great debts. Here you can see list of our costs.

Last years we've spent aproximately 10.000 euros to make Festival. Asking for funding, we hope to raise half of this sum, which will help us to start preparing for the Festival. Second half will consists of people's donations on Festival itself.
 What are we going to spend money on?

1200 – purchasing of supplies, instruments, repairing instruments;

600 – preventive assistance and repair of equipment (audio/sound systems, generators)

600 – advertisement, posters, flyers, programmes, web-site works

1200 – transport rent (freight transport for technique, food, transport for volunteers)

1400 – SeedCamp food (for volunteers who build the Festival (20 people for 15 days)

400 – fuel costs

800 – money for transport tickets for artists and craftsmen (masters)

We advocate for full financial transparency! List of donors is going to be posted on our web-site (http://fest.art-labyrinth.org/) and social networks. Same scheme for donations during the Festival itself.*

*At will of donor we can hide the name and leave just the sum of donation.

 

How you can help

This event is our spiritual masterpiece, unique project, based on teamwork of hundreds of people in general. We only rely upon work of volunteers and society feedback. This crowdfunding campaign is also a try to invite people from different countries and cultures to join us.

  • Become donor
  • Share our campaign
  • Come to our Festival as volunteer, or guest
  • Wish us good luck!

Any involvement is important and appreciated! Be a part of our project and help Art-Festival do become reality this year too!


RUS:

Что такое Арт-Лабиринт Фестиваль?

Летний Фестиваль Арт-Лабиринт - это уникальное событие, которое проводится каждый год в Молдове. 11 лет подряд мы создаём свой мир, на природе, вдалеке от городского шума и потребительской идеологии. 5 дней наполненных творчеством, искусством, саморазвитием и экологически осознанным отношением к природе.

Более 50 мастер-классов, 2 музыкальные сцены, большая команда волонтёров, отсутствие  фиксированной платы за вход – всё это делается для того, чтоб поменять что-то в нашем обществе. Пускай на небольшой период, но создать пространство, в котором главное – дружба, осознанность, любовь и саморазвитие.

 

Наши цели

- Создать пространство для творчества, искусства, осознанности и бережного отношения к природе

- Дать возможность мастерам, артистам и гостям поделиться своими знаниями и опытом

- Поддерживать идеи общности, дружбы, любви, близости к природе – чистота снаружи и чистота внутри

- Продвигать экологическую осознанность, саморазвитие и духовный поиск

- Используя принцип свободного взноса, уйти от потребительского отношения и создать возможность честного и чистого взаимообмена энергией

 

Чем мы занимаемся?

Всё началось в 2008 году. Мы не могли предположить, что простая идея собрать творческих людей на природе, сделать фестиваль альтернативной культуры и искусства, свободный от коммерции, рекламы, добавив йогу и эко-ценности, может быть настолько востребованной, и востребованной в Молдове!

Сразу же, на первом фестивале в 2008 году нас было около 500, сейчас нас собирается до двух тысяч. Большой фестиваль для нашей маленькой страны.

Каждый год мы ездим на разведки, чтоб найти новое место. Место должно быть как можно дальше от населённых пунктов и, главное, там должна быть дикая природа и в ней чувствоваться магия. Место – главный «участник» фестиваля.

Всё на волонтёрских началах, целая команда волонтёров, вкладывается огромное количество сил, времени и собственных финансов.

Культурная программа насчитывает более 50 мастер-классов: фаер-шоу, музыкальные концерты, африканские танцы и игра на барабанах, йога, детские мастер-классы, мастер-град, где делают изделия из кожи, глины и многое другое.

Некоммерческий подход - основной принцип Арт-Лабиринта.
Альтернатива "городской" действительности, Когда человек, приезжая к нам, чувствует - это не то место, где на нем "хотят заработать". Попадая к нам, люди чувствуют, что всё, что здесь делается и происходит, не ради заработка и выгоды, ни в коем случае. Мотивация у всей команды, артистов, волонтеров другая, более чистая.

11 лет мы творим, 11 лет собираем людей всех национальностей, рас, вероисповеданий и возрастов, чтоб создать фестиваль наполненный творчеством, осознанностью, экологичностью и душой.

 

Почему Indiegogo?

Несколько лет назад, повышая общее качество Фестиваля, мы увеличили обороты, и финансовый вопрос обострился. Плата за вход была минимальной и она не покрывала всех затрат. Мы сделали ещё два фестиваля, но каждый раз уходили в сильный минус.

Теперь же, в 2019, перед нами стал выбор - либо сильно поднимать взнос, либо отказаться от компромиссов и, поверив в то, что Арт-Лабиринт любят и ценят, сделать взнос свободным, по принципу "каждый дает сколько хочет". Эта концепция – возвращение к истокам, к базовым ценностям фестиваля. При таком подходе, вовлеченность, причастность, вся атмосфера фестиваля - всё меняется. Становится именно таким, каким нам хотелось бы видеть - большое общее дело хороших людей, создающих красивую, осознанную реальность.

Сейчас мы запускаем кампанию по сбору средств на Арт-Лабиринт Фестиваль 2019 на сайте Indiegogo. Платформа Indiegogo в основе своей содержит как раз наш самый главный принцип – помощь, обмен, дарение. Все собранные средства пойдут на закупку и ремонт материалов, оборудования, инструментов, транспортные расходы, билеты артистам и мастерам, еду, флаеры, афиши и много другого. От того, насколько успешной будет кампания, зависит масштаб самого фестиваля, разнообразие программы.

Мы открываемся людям, приглашая каждого стать частью нашей команды, нашей семьи!

 

На что пойдут ресурсы?

В прошлом году, в силу плохой погоды и проблем с организацией, мы снова вышли в большой долг после фестиваля.
Общий бюджет одного Арт-Фестиваля масштабов последних лет составляет около 10 тыс. евро. Через эту кампанию мы рассчитываем собрать около половины - сумма необходимая перед фестивалем для его запуска. Вторую половину бюджета мы рассчитываем покрыть из взносов собранных на самом фестивале. В зависимости от собранной суммы планируется масштаб фестиваля.
На что пойдут ресурсы до начала фестиваля?

1200 - закупка материалов и инструментов, ремонт инструментов
600 – профилактика/ремонт оборудования (звуковая аппаратура, генераторы)
600 - реклама (афиши, флаера, программки, работа по сайту, браслеты)
1200 – аренда транспорта (грузового, для техники, волонтёров, транспортировки еды)
1400 - еда для волонтёров во время постройки Фестиваля, сидкэмпе (20 человек, 15 дней) + закупка еды для фестиваля (команда, артисты, волонтеры)
400 – топливо (для транспорта, для генераторов)
800 – билеты на дорогу артистам и мастерам

Система будет максимально прозрачной как до, так и во время фестиваля. Список всех поучаствовавших в общем сборе будет вывешен на нашем сайте и в соцсетях.* На самом фестивале будет работать такая же система учета взносов с последующей отчетностью. Открытость, честность и осознанность.

*По желанию донора, можно указать только сумму и не указывать имя.

 

Как можно помочь?

Этот Фестиваль, наше духовное детище, уникальный проект, основанный на командной работе сотен участников в целом. Мы опираемся только на работу волонтёров и социальный отклик. Эта краудфандинговая кампания – ещё одно приглашение для жителей нашей, соседних и любых других стран и культур присоединиться.

  • Помочь финансово
  • Поделиться кампанией (рассказать, разместить в  соцсетях)
  • Приехать на фестиваль в качестве волонтёра или гостя
  • Пожелать нам мысленно удачи!

Мы ценим любое участие, принимаем все слова и любую помощь. Вместе, теплом наших сердец и мыслей мы зажжём костёр Главного огня Арт-Лабиринта и в этом году!
story_txt:
ENG/RU
What is Art-Festival 2019?
Art-Labyrinth Summer Festival is a unique event, held in Moldova in wild nature. It happens every summer for 11 years in a row. We create “5-days-world” far from public places and consuming ideology. World full of creativity, art, self-development, ecological thinking.More than 50 workshops, 2 musical stages, team of volunteers, no entrance fee – all of these to change something in our society. To form space for community, friendship, sharing and love.


Our goals
- Create free space for creativity, art, consciousness and ecological thinking
- Give masters and artists possibility to share their knowledge, teach something interesting
- Promote community, friendship, love, closeness to nature – purity inside and around
- Inspire ecological awareness, spiritual and self-development
- Using only free donations, improve mentality of "sharing" and non-consuming values
 
What do we do?

It all started in 2008. We couldn't imagine then, that idea of getting artists and interesting people together in the wild, far away from city could have had such impact and become popular. A lot of people came around 500 people and it was "wow!" for that moment! Now we have 1000-1500 guests every year.
Every year we search for a new place. Place should be far from localities and, most important there should be wild nature and magic. The feeling of living a real life, of being in the moment, just here and now. The place is main "participant" of the Festival.
Cultural program includes over 50 workshops: fire-show, music concerts, African dances and drums, yoga, workshops for children and many other. Sometimes a person comes, makes a drum and just takes it home.
Non-commercial, non-consuming approach - this is Art Labyrinth's main idea. Being away of "buy/sell" way of thinking - that's it. It's when a person comes and feels that it's not a place where he's seen as a money bag. No advertisement banners here ever!
Art Festival is common creation, made by good people who form reality based on consciousness and beauty.
Why Indiegogo?
We've always had minimal entrance fee and, of course, it wasn't enough for ever-increasing budget. Some years ago, Festival became so big that we faced serious financial crisis. We made two more Festivals, but every time getting in serious debts. Now, in 2019, our team has to choose: either increase the fee greatly, or we tell 'no' to any compromise with commercial reality and make Festival with free contribution, being sure that people love and appreciate our work. Free contribution means that everybody gives as much as he wants to.
So now, we start a campaign on Indiegogo to raise funds for Art-Labyrinth 2019. This website is based on the main idea we appreciate so much – sharing. Collected resources will help us much to repair and buy equipment, tools, materials, to organize transport, buy tickets for artists and masters, food, make posters and many other.
The more fund we raise, the better Festival we can create with more interesting and diverse program. We open our hearts, inviting people to create this Festival with us,to become a part of our big family, our team. The very spirit of the Festival will change spirit at the root, becoming more authentic, genuine, closer to it's initial idea.
What is money spent on?
Last time due to bad weather and some organizational issues, we finished our Festival with great debts. Here you can see list of our costs.
Last years we've spent aproximately 10.000 euros to make Festival. Asking for funding, we hope to raise half of this sum, which will help us to start preparing for the Festival. Second half will consists of people's donations on Festival itself. What are we going to spend money on?
1200 – purchasing of supplies, instruments, repairing instruments;
600 – preventive assistance and repair of equipment (audio/sound systems, generators)
600 – advertisement, posters, flyers, programmes, web-site works
1200 – transport rent (freight transport for technique, food, transport for volunteers)
1400 – SeedCamp food (for volunteers who build the Festival (20 people for 15 days)
400 – fuel costs
800 – money for transport tickets for artists and craftsmen (masters)
We advocate for full financial transparency! List of donors is going to be posted on our web-site (http://fest.art-labyrinth.org/) and social networks. Same scheme for donations during the Festival itself.*
*At will of donor we can hide the name and leave just the sum of donation.
 
How you can help

This event is our spiritual masterpiece, unique project, based on teamwork of hundreds of people in general. We only rely upon work of volunteers and society feedback. This crowdfunding campaign is also a try to invite people from different countries and cultures to join us.

Become donor
Share our campaign
Come to our Festival as volunteer, or guest
Wish us good luck!

Any involvement is important and appreciated! Be a part of our project and help Art-Festival do become reality this year too!
RUS:

story:
[What is "Gotiva"]

Gotiva - joy & happiness (bosnian slang)
This August, (3rd to 6th 2017) a mountain close to a central town in Bosnia & Herzegovina will host a unique eco-music gathering for the third time.

Gotiva festival is the only DIY&Soundsystem festival formed by young local DIY enthusiasts. It is all about natural sound, natural people and even more natural habitat. :)

[Who's in the background?]

In 2010 a group of friends, dub & soundsystem enthusiasts from a small industrial city in central Bosnia formed a collective called Zenicafaria Sound (link down bellow). Over the years, their passion for promoting bass music & culture grew out to become a true lifestyle, celebrating gatherings with no boundaries in what so ever.

Few years later, Zenicafaria Sound became a community - Zenicafaria Family with a newborn, handmade soundsystem. So, today we are Zenicafaria Soundsystem Family!

With the high level of collective lethargy, inactivity and lack of interest of youngsters and even higher urban pollution, we felt the urge to do something about it. We gathered and united our true loves: love for dub music and love for nature in one eco-music festival that we decided to name as Gotiva fest.

             

[Details about Gotiva festival]

             

 

 

Gotiva festival unites the diversity and freedom of alternative art, celebrating communion and love in all its forms. It promotes values of Do It Yourself concept, community and soundsystem culture amongst young people from the whole region. Through various workshops such as Zero waste – no waste way of life, 3R concept – Recycle-Reuse-Reduce, making of decorative items, create- recreate, art performances and many more, we try to educate, animate and activate young souls. Soundsystem music is also a significant form of activism and a mighty tool which presents the power of low frequencies on human body and mind.

 

It's easy to find gotiva feeling  - it is right there, on beautiful Smetovi mountains, 8 km east of Zenica with its highest peak Vis (1025 m). When you go up - you will meet an incredible horizon skimming over some of the highest bosnian mountains: Zvijezda, Vranica, Vlasic and others.

For adventure-seekers - here are the
                                                                      ⇸Coordinates 44 ° 14'42.7 "N 17 ° 58'43.2" E

          

 

[Why this campaign?]

Going DIY style means no big names, sponsors and brands, so money is an issue in most cases. We had significant local suppliers, supporters and donators over the years, as we still tend to avoid the big fish. Through this specific campaign support, we will definitely get the help we need in organizing this event.

Festival organisation demands a lot of time, blood&sweat, nerves, sacrifice, hard work, devotion, debts but most importantly - love.

If you ever visited or organised a festival, especially small DIY festivals - you know what we are talking about. This is why even in the third year, by now we still haven't established a certain source of fundraising.

...unfortunately, some costs cannot be covered by our passion and enthusiasm...

To build this festival, we need to cover some costs that include mostly:

  • costs of building the festival location (facilities, camp, decorations) - up to 1000 $
  • costs of welcoming artists & performers - 1500 $
  • costs of production, sound & lighting - 1000 $
  • costs of promotion material - 500 $
  • other costs & charges... (administration, specialized staff, security  etc.) - 500$

    These are some of the costs (not including costs of artists and performers) that need to be covered, in best case, with your help :)

Another important notice: the whole festival crew is going DIY style as volunteers (except extra expert staff we need to hire). We will issue only a limited number of tickets for sell, due to capacity of the location site (400 people max). A single festival ticket price is 7 $, which is a minimum donation we ask for the whole organization. We try to keep it as low as possible, so that everyone can afford themselves 4 days of freedom and happiness.


We hope you understand why we need additional fundraising sources, contributors and donators. We need you to continue writing this story!
 

["What's in there for me?"]

If you are asking yourself this, well, first of all:

  1. by sharing & supporting this campaign, you become an activist yourself
  2. by donating, you become a friend of the festival
  3. by visiting the festival, you get gotiva :)

To anyone who understands the tough process of this mission, first of all we offer our deepest gratitude and respect.

Perks

Also, we offer some perks as a sign of gratitude. Our biggest pleasure would be to host you at our festival! But of course, there are some other perks which you may like and find properly for yourself.

Take a look! :)

[Final thoughts..]

It's not about money , it's about the mission :) If you are just reading this and thinking "This sounds truly nice.." - THANK YOU. Spread it around, share it with your friends and community. Let us know about it. Let's stay in touch and grow together. Keep us updated of your own thoughts, ideas, tips, critics. We would be glad to hear from you!

 

Contact us:

E-mail:

gotivafest@gmail.com
udruzenje.pid@gmail.com

Website:

http://prirodaidrustvo.org

Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/Gotivafest/
https://www.facebook.com/Drustveniprirodnjaci/
https://www.facebook.com/ZenicafariaSound/

 

Give thanks & blessings for each & everyone.

Gotiva crew
story_txt:
[What is "Gotiva"]Gotiva - joy & happiness (bosnian slang)This August, (3rd to 6th 2017) a mountain close to a central town in Bosnia & Herzegovina will host a unique eco-music gathering for the third time.Gotiva festival is the only DIY&Soundsystem festival formed by young local DIY enthusiasts. It is all about natural sound, natural people and even more natural habitat. :)[Who's in the background?]In 2010 a group of friends, dub & soundsystem enthusiasts from a small industrial city in central Bosnia formed a collective called Zenicafaria Sound (link down bellow). Over the years, their passion for promoting bass music & culture grew out to become a true lifestyle, celebrating gatherings with no boundaries in what so ever.Few years later, Zenicafaria Sound became a community - Zenicafaria Family with a newborn, handmade soundsystem. So, today we are Zenicafaria Soundsystem Family!With the high level of collective lethargy, inactivity and lack of interest of youngsters and even higher urban pollution, we felt the urge to do something about it. We gathered and united our true loves: love for dub music and love for nature in one eco-music festival that we decided to name as Gotiva fest.             [Details about Gotiva festival]               Gotiva festival unites the diversity and freedom of alternative art, celebrating communion and love in all its forms. It promotes values of Do It Yourself concept, community and soundsystem culture amongst young people from the whole region. Through various workshops such as Zero waste – no waste way of life, 3R concept – Recycle-Reuse-Reduce, making of decorative items, create- recreate, art performances and many more, we try to educate, animate and activate young souls. Soundsystem music is also a significant form of activism and a mighty tool which presents the power of low frequencies on human body and mind. It's easy to find gotiva feeling  - it is right there, on beautiful Smetovi mountains, 8 km east of Zenica with its highest peak Vis (1025 m). When you go up - you will meet an incredible horizon skimming over some of the highest bosnian mountains: Zvijezda, Vranica, Vlasic and others.For adventure-seekers - here are the                                                                      ⇸Coordinates 44 ° 14'42.7 "N 17 ° 58'43.2" E           [Why this campaign?]Going DIY style means no big names, sponsors and brands, so money is an issue in most cases. costs of welcoming artists & performers - 1500 $

costs of promotion material - 500 $

other costs & charges... (administration, specialized staff, security  etc.) - 500$These are some of the costs (not including costs of artists and performers) that need to be covered, in best case, with your help :)

Another important notice: the whole festival crew is going DIY style as volunteers (except extra expert staff we need to hire). We will issue only a limited number of tickets for sell, due to capacity of the location site (400 people max). A single festival ticket price is 7 $, which is a minimum donation we ask for the whole organization. We try to keep it as low as possible, so that everyone can afford themselves 4 days of freedom and happiness.We hope you understand why we need additional fundraising sources, contributors and donators. We need you to continue writing this story! ["What's in there for me?"]If you are asking yourself this, well, first of all:
by sharing & supporting this campaign, you become an activist yourself
by donating, you become a friend of the festival
by visiting the festival, you get gotiva :)

But of course, there are some other perks which you may like and find properly for yourself.Take a look! :)[Final thoughts..]It's not about money , it's about the mission :) If you are just reading this and thinking "This sounds truly nice.." - THANK YOU. story:
Would you like to participate in the biggest Japanese festival in New England?
Do you want to contribute to connecting the Japanese community?
Do you love Japanese culture and want to help share it?

Here is your chance!

Japan Festival Boston is a non-profit event run purely by volunteers. We launched  crowdfunding that goes until April 26th 2020 to raise money for the festival in April 2020. Last year, 70,000 visitors enjoyed our event. We really appreciate your support to make the event fun again. We are providing a "Quick Pass", which will cut your waiting time at food stalls during the festival, for every $10 of your support.

Through Japan Festival Boston, we aim to bring the Boston community together. We aim to continue the festival for the next one hundred years and beyond. This festival is how we would like to show our appreciation to Boston, providing us with a place to study, research, and work. We work to make the festival enjoyable with our supporters who love Japanese culture. We really need your help to achieve this goal.


The Japanese Business Bureau of Boston, a main organizer of this event, is a 501(c)3 charitable organization authorized by the Federal government. All of your contribution will be used for the festival. We will disclose financial reports on our website after the festival.

Learn more about us at:
https://www.japanfestivalboston.org/ 
https://youtu.be/OQRVbJWcAY4

 

--------------------------

2020年度のボストン日本祭り の開催が徐々に迫ってまいりました。昨年度と同じく、支援を頂いた方にはフードブースでの待ち時間を短縮する”クイックパス”を日本祭り当日、現地でお渡しいたします。本クラウドファンディングは、4月26日まで公開予定のクラウドファンディングになります。

国際都市ボストンには、学術やビジネスのためにアメリカ各地はもちろん、世界中から多くの方々が集まリます。ボストン日本祭りはアメリカ国民をはじめ、世界中の方々に日本文化を知っていただく絶好の機会です。これまでも多くの皆様にご参加いただき、ご好評をいただいております。

私達は異なる文化の人々が日本文化を介して繋がり、お互いを尊重し合える関係を作るきっかけとなる祭りを皆様と今年も作り上げていきたいと考えております。

主催の Japanese Busines Burear of Boston（ボストン日本商業会）は、米国政府認定の501(c)(3)非営利団体です。皆様より戴いた支援金は全てボストン日本祭り開催のために使わせていただきます。収支報告は、祭り開催後にホームページにて公開いたします。

詳しくはホームページにて
https://www.japanfestivalboston.org/ja/
https://youtu.be/OQRVbJWcAY4

story:
Youngtimer Community

Vergnügt Youngtimer fahren

Automotive 65 versteht sich als Bewahrer von Fahrkultur und Qualitätsarbeit. Mit der Youngtimer Community wird ein Anlaufpunkt für jeden interessierten Autoliebhaber geschaffen: Lieblingsfahrzeuge zu nutzen, ohne sie zu kaufen.

 

Wir wollen unseren Fahrzeugpool von derzeit etwa 8 Fahrzeugen auf 20-40 Fahrzeuge erhöhen. Die Wartung der Autos übernimmt unsere angeschlossene Werkstatt, die seit Jahren besteht.

 

 

 

Mit Deinem Beitrag bekommst Du Automotive 65 Token 

Diese Token sind elektronische Voucher, die auf der Webseite von Automotive 65 gegen das Ausleihen von Fahrzeugen eingetauscht werden können.

Diese Token wurden auf der sogenannten WAVES Plattform erstellt und sind dort handelbar.

Die Token können auch anderen Nutzern innerhalb und ausserhalb der Automotive 65 Youngtimer Community angeboten werden.

 

Nach Kampagnenende werden die Token in Deine WAVES-Wallet geschickt, nachdem die Transaktionsadresse erfragt wurde.
