Youngtimer Community
Vergnügt Youngtimer fahren
Automotive 65 versteht sich als Bewahrer von Fahrkultur und Qualitätsarbeit. Mit der Youngtimer Community wird ein Anlaufpunkt für jeden interessierten Autoliebhaber geschaffen: Lieblingsfahrzeuge zu nutzen, ohne sie zu kaufen. Wir wollen unseren Fahrzeugpool von derzeit etwa 8 Fahrzeugen auf 20-40 Fahrzeuge erhöhen. Die Wartung der Autos übernimmt unsere angeschlossene Werkstatt, die seit Jahren besteht.   Mit Deinem Beitrag bekommst Du Automotive 65 Token 
Diese Token sind elektronische Voucher, die auf der Webseite von Automotive 65 gegen das Ausleihen von Fahrzeugen eingetauscht werden können.
Diese Token wurden auf der sogenannten WAVES Plattform erstellt und sind dort handelbar.
Die Token können auch anderen Nutzern innerhalb und ausserhalb der Automotive 65 Youngtimer Community angeboten werden.
 
Nach Kampagnenende werden die Token in Deine WAVES-Wallet geschickt, nachdem die Transaktionsadresse erfragt wurde.

story:
Hello there! This fundraiser is supporting the establishment of a Little Free Library in the Rogers Park-Inglewood area in Los Angeles County. My goal is to open this little library up by spring break (end of March-early April 2019) and assume the role of stewardess for this library which means I will be responsible for the upkeep of the library. I am a crafty person. However, I am not builder crafty, meaning I have no builder’s skill. I couldn’t even create a house out of Legos as a child. This campaign will support the cost of a pre-made library as sold on websites such as Etsy and the official Little Free Library Website. The location where the library will be installed has already been scouted and only needs approval from the city of Inglewood.

 

What is Little Free Library? Link to Little Free Library website: https://littlefreelibrary.org/

 

This campaign will end on March 22, 2019. If you are in support of this project, please donate and share this campaign using Indiegogo’s share tools! No amount is too small. Little amounts add up to larger amounts. Any amount is appreciated. 100% percent of the proceeds from this 45-day fundraiser will go towards the Little Free Library. This money will not be going to my personal savings. I am only honored to make a difference in the community and maintain this library as stewardess. Let’s get this fundraiser to it’s goal!

 

By donating, you are directly contributing to the establishment of a Little Free Library. If I get enough donors, I am looking to attach a plaque to commemorate all of those who helped bring this LFL to life. I appreciate everyone who donates to this cause because it is you who is bringing my vision to life. I adore Little Free Libraries in other neighborhoods. I’ve lived in Inglewood for most of my time in Los Angeles and want to give the gift of a Little Free Library to my neighbors as a permanent token of my gratitude even if I should move away one day. This will be one project that I have fulfilled and directly given to the community to support reading and free books for all. I’ve personally found hidden treasures in the Little Free Libraries, including a brand new Game of Thrones book. You never know what kind of book you will find in a Little Free Library. The motto from the Little Free Library official website is “take a book, leave a book.” That’s all there is to it. Once this library is in business, everyone is free to interact with it, as long as you treat it with care.

 

Why is this campaign raising $500? The minimum fundraising goal has to be $500 or more. I am not expecting this amount to be raised. On average, pre-made libraries on Etsy and the LFL website cost between $200-300, plus the hefty shipping cost for a large object such as this. I am partial to the one I’m eyeing on Etsy which is roughly the same cost as the one on the LFL website. There is also a fee of $40 for a LFL license which all libraries must have in order to be added to the LFL network.

 

Tentative timeline of events:

- Consult the City of Inglewood to get approval for the establishment of the LFL on the pre-designated space

- Order the library and post online (Post may be constructed separately.)

- Assemble library

- Add books collected into the library

- Spread the good news! A Little Free Library is in my neck of the woods!

Thank you,

Attallah, resident of Inglewood

story:
Our story:

 

Plus Gender is a collective of BA Photography students from the University of Westminster. In the days of gender trouble, we decided to curate an exhibition that would show what does gender mean to the young generation. Through an open call, we have sourced artists working with different media who address the idea of gender in their work. For a majority of our artists, this is the first opportunity to showcase their art.

Our first exhibition focuses on femininity as a social concept. It brings students and experienced artists together under one roof to exhibit their work to a broader audience. Within the show, there is a mixture of media ranging from photography, painting, through sculptures and other art forms. Our exhibition will be accompanied by several side events, such as a workshop concerned with LGBT+ discrimination and artists’ live performances.

 

Our Artists: 

 

  • Abbie Harris
  • Aleksandra Janowska
  • Filip Skiba 
  • Nicola Morley
  • Oliver Crown
  • Hamish McClelland

 

Our Artists’ testimonials:

 

"My last series of vulva paintings is suggesting a question to the viewer: what does it mean to be a woman in today’s world? I truly believe that it doesn’t matter what we have between our legs. Most of us have the same goal in life, which is simply being happy and we can achieve it only with respect to each other."  

 

“Gender is something I'm really passionate about especially when looking at the problems we face and trying to overcome them using art. My images aim to empower and inspire people to talk about the taboos of gender politics.”

 

What we need to fund: 

 

Rent for Matchstick Theatre, a venue in London where we will hold our exhibition

Production materials (such as tools, easels etc.)

Marketing materials (such as posters)

 

The Impact:

 

We feel that both gender discrimination and support for young artists are of great importance in the contemporary world. Our exhibition will not only contribute positively to the LGBTQ community but will give incomparable professional experience to us and our artists. However, we will not be able to achieve this without your support!

 

We will be utterly grateful for every donation you can make, every quid gets us closer to our goal of holding the Plus Gender exhibition.

 

Aside from donations, we would really appreciate it if you could spread the word about our fundraising. The more people are aware of our initiative, the better!

 

Many thanks for your time and we hope to see you at our exhibition!

 

Follow us:

 

Website: plusgender.com

Facebook: Plus Gender

Instagram: @plusgender

Twitter: @plusgender

E-mail: plusgender.info@gmail.com

story:
we expec to have a RTS game for 2021 olympics, the proper game to choose should be released in either 2013 or 2014. And this game should have the credibility and balance to be olypmic competition worthy. For now such a game that might be considered is Command & Conquer: Generals 2 which is due to be released in the middle of 2013. I am confident that this game can compete with its Blizzard counterparts for a possible e-sports 2021 olympic contest, even surpass them. Perhaps Blizzard may release a new version of Starcraft come 2014 or so and it too would be a strong candidate.
More than one franchise can be picked for RTS events, however all of these franchises should have a solid history behind them like Command & Conquer or Blizzard. The importance is that these games should be at least 2 or 3 years old for it to be used frequently in other arenas like ESL and develop its own tactics, playerbase and fanbase. My personal recommendations to nominate for Summer Olympics would be:
1) Command & Conquer: Generals 2
2) Starcraft 3
3) Company of Heroes 2

story:
Toda a campanha em português abaixo

Toute la campagne en Français ci dessous

 

01.10.19 Additional note to the campaign

As the campaign is entering its home stretch I am adding a short explanation about what the project will receive at the end of the campaign and why:

This campaign is ''fixed funds'', which means that either the target is met by the campaign's deadline and in such case the project receives the funds, or the target is not met by the campaign's deadline and in such case the project does not receive anything and each contributor is reimbursed.

Why such a system?

Because the budget for this campaign is calculated to cover real expenses.

If the project were to receive 30% of the target... it would unfortunately not be able to produce anything of quality.

We want to produce real quality work for you. So we chose all or nothing.

Let it be all :-)

----------------------------------------------------------

Alors que la campagne entre dans sa dernière ligne droite, je rajoute ces lignes pour préciser ce que le projet recevra à la fin.

À la fin de la campagne, soit elle aura atteint son objectif et le projet sera financé, soit elle ne l´aura pas atteint et le projet ne recevra aucun fonds (tous les fonds seront alors reversés à chaque contributeur).

Pourquoi un tel système?

Car le budget a été calculé pour couvrir des dépenses réelles.

Si le projet recevait 30%, il ne serait pas possible de produire quoi que ce soit de qualité.

Nous voulons produire un travail de qualité pour tous. Alors nous avons choisi tout ou rien.

A vous de jouer pour que ça soit tout :-)

 

 

The context behind Maningue, Voices of Mozambique

 

During the night of 14 to 15 March and on 25 April 2019, two consecutive cyclones, Idai and Kenneth, hit Mozambique affecting respectively about 1.5 million people and 170.000 people in 6 of the country 10 provinces.

 

Cyclone Idai:  "the worst natural disaster to hit southern Africa in at least two decades", UNICEF

Beira, a city inhabited by half a million people and surrounds were 90% "damaged or destroyed", according to the International Federation of the Red Cross

Cyclone Kenneth: "the first time in recorded history two strong tropical cyclones have hit the country in the same season", UNICEF

 

 

Where does the idea of Maningue, Voices of Mozambique come from?

 

  • The will to keep the information about the cyclones’ aftermaths alive

When both cyclones hit Mozambique, they were widely covered by worldwide news. Nowadays, it seems fair to say that there is much less coverage readily available on them. Maningue, Voices of Mozambique stems from the will to keep information alive, and hope to contribute to it.

 

  • The will to access to a different type of information

The information available has focused on the direct damages caused, and I believe it is an extremely important piece of information to know about. However, I believe it is also important to know about the personal experiences lived throughout such disasters. Maningue, Voices of Mozambique stems from the will to know about individual stories and about how the cyclones affected people’s lives, day to day activities, thoughts, and feelings.

 

  • The awareness of the importance to have timeless memories of two of the first climate related disasters

"[Beira] will go down in history as having been the first city to be completely devastated by climate change’’, Graça Machel, former first lady of Mozambique and South Africa

The intensity of the cyclones and of their damages was inexorably linked to climate change. For me, before such disasters become the norm, it is important to provide a testimony of human experiences lived in the aftermaths of two of the first climate related disasters.

 

  • The will to give back to a country that has personally given me a lot

“For me, visiting Mozambique is a matter of the heart”, UN Secretary-General António Guterres

I spent about 4 years living and working in Mozambique, and I owe a lot to this country and to its people. When the cyclones hit, I felt the impact of the shock for the country, for its people, for my friends and for their relatives deep in my bones. Today, I want to bring together all the skills and interests I have to pay my respects and do the one thing I am able to do out of all that: collect testimonies and give a voice to people´s journey and thoughts.

 

 

 

What will Maningue, Voices of Mozambique include?

 

Maningue, Voices of Mozambique will include portraits of a series of people, their testimonies, their pictures, pictures of places which were hit by the cyclones, as well as brief background chapters on Mozambique and the cyclones.

Maningue, Voices of Mozambique will depict people´s experiences, individual stories, reactions, day to day facts of life, adaptations, thoughts, and feelings in the face of the two disasters and throughout everyday life.

Maningue, Voices of Mozambique shall include portraits and testimonies of the largest range of people possible, such as:

  • people who were most directly affected by the cyclones,
  • people who first came to support them (national and international),
  • people who were/have been affected indirectly,
  • people who are now helping, etc…

 

 

What does Maningue mean?

 

‘’Maningue’’ is a colloquial word originating from the native languages spoken mostly in the south of the country. Used as an adverb, ‘’Maningue’’ means ‘’a lot’’ or ‘’very’’. Used as a noun, ‘’Maningue’’ confirms agreement with what was previously said, and can then be translated by ‘’Of course’’, ‘’Oh yeah!’’, or ‘’That´s for sure’’.

One of the sentences you are most likely to hear while visiting Mozambique would be: ‘’Mozambique é maningue nice!’’; which means: ‘’Mozambique is very very nice!’’

 

 

How will Maningue, Voices of Mozambique be done? – Four Big Steps

 

 

 

What do we need your help for?

 

Today Maningue, Voices of Mozambique needs your help to finance the second step of the project: Gathering the testimonies and portraits.

This is a crucial step for the project: a full 6 weeks working time spent within the country in order to interview people, gather their testimonies and images that will feed the book.

 

Where will the money go?

The target of this campaign covers the expenses necessary to carry out the work to be done within Mozambique over a full six weeks period as well as campaign related fees.

Large areas will be covered given that the cyclones hit large areas within the country. The distances to cover will involve national flights within the country as well as long drives with a 4X4 car and a driver used to local roads. Time spent in each area will be critical in order to gain people’s trust and allow sufficient time to conduct quality work.

 

 

Rewards to thank you for your support!

 

Maningue, Voices of Mozambique needs your help to exist, and I thought of a series of advantages and gifts designed just for you to thank you for supporting the project.

I put a lot of thought into these thank-you gifts in order to respect the essence of the project and to warmly thank you for your support, and I hope that you will enjoy to the fullest :-)

 

 

 

Know more about me

 

My name is Aude Nowak, I am a 33 years old French citizen. I am the creator and manager of the project Maningue, Voices of Mozambique. I will be the one carrying the project from A to Z. I am a multicultural person, with multiple interests and trained in various fields.

I am trained as a Development Economist, a Sociologist, and an Hypnologist.

I worked for NGOs, Ministries in developing countries, development agencies, the United Nations, and the private sector as international consultant and development economist. Throughout these positions, I organized and conducted working missions within six countries, interviewing people and drawing official reports and studies from these interviews.

I’ve always liked to take pictures and my very second job – remaining unlisted on my CV – was as a photographer. In more recent years, I have developed my own entrepreneur activities, including writing and hypno-coaching and counseling.

I speak four languages (French, English, Portuguese, and Spanish), and in total, I lived and/or worked in nine countries in my life: Mozambique, Laos, India, Sri Lanka, Zambia, Côte d´Ivoire, the United Kingdom, Switzerland, and France.

 

 

Risks and Challenges for Maningue, Voices of Mozambique, Step 2, and how to overcome them

 

While undertaking the work of Step 2 in Mozambique, the project may run into several challenges. From the experience I have organizing working missions in various countries, and from the experience I have of Mozambique, I am confident I will be able to manage arising challenges and overcome them to conduct the work as best as possible.

At this stage, I could already identify a few potential challenges and ways to overcome them. First, working at the district and province levels always carry out risks of delays and unforeseen events arising. The choice and order of the locations to visit, as well as the way to organize the interviews will both be planned keeping this in mind in order to minimize these risks and to allow for flexibilities and adaptability.

Second, on 15 October 2019, Mozambique will held general Elections for President, national parliament, provincial governors and provincial parliaments. In order to facilitate interviews’ organization and participations, the work will be started in the provinces after the Elections take place.

Security issues also exist in the Northern part of the country. In order to ensure the driver and my own safety, the final places to be visited in the Northern part of the country will be confirmed according to the updated security situation at the time of travel.

 

 

Please spread the word and support the campaign

 

If you like the project, please support it, by donating, by talking about it around you, by liking and sharing this page and the fund raising campaign page. Any level of donation, any like, any share will be one step close to making Maningue, Voices of Mozambique a reality.

 

 

On behalf on Maningue, Voices of Mozambique

Thank you very much!

Português

Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique

Retratos e testemunhos após a passagem devastadora de dois ciclones ligados à mudança climática

 

 

Visão Geral

 

Em março e abril de 2019, dois ciclones atingiram Moçambique um após o outro. Mais de 1,5 milhão de pessoas foram afectadas. Esforços nacionais e internacionais foram rapidamente implementados para resgatar e ajudar as populações afectadas.

O projecto Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique tem o objectivo de partilhar histórias e experiências individuais vividas após a passagem dos ciclones num livro fotográfico.

Através de uma série de retratos, testemunhos e fotografias, Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique pretende dar uma voz às experiências individuais e permitir que a sua memória seja transmitida no tempo.

 

 

O contexto por trás de Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique

 

Durante a noite de 14 a 15 de Março e no dia 25 de Abril de 2019, dois ciclones consecutivos, Idai e Kenneth, atingiram Moçambique afectando respectivamente cerca de 1,5 milhões de pessoas e 170.000 pessoas em 6 das 10 províncias do país.

Ciclone Idai: "o pior desastre natural a atingir a África Austral em pelo menos duas décadas", UNICEF

Beira, habitada por meio milhão de pessoas, e os seus arredores foram danificados ou destruídos a 90% de acordo com a Federação Internacional da Cruz Vermelha.

Ciclone Kenneth: "Pela primeira vez na história recordada, dois ciclones tropicais fortes atingiram o país na mesma temporada", UNICEF

 

 

Como nasceu a ideia de Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique?

 

  • A vontade de manter viva a informação sobre os ciclones e as suas consequências

Quando os dois ciclones atingiram Moçambique, eles foram amplamente cobertos pelas notícias em todo o mundo. Hoje em dia, parece que há muito menos a informação sobre os ciclones e as suas consequências é muito menos amplamente difundida. Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique nasceu da vontade de manter esta informação viva e amplamente difundida, e espera contribuir para isso.

 

  • A vontade de ter acesso a um outro tipo de informação

A informação disponível sobre os ciclones teve por enfoque os danos directamente causados ​​pelos ciclones, e é de facto uma informação extremamente importante para conhecer. No entanto, acho que é também importante saber sobre as experiências pessoais vividas no meio deste desastre. Maningue, Voices of Mozambique nasceu da vontade de saber mais sobre experiencias humanas individuais e sobre a maneira como os ciclones afectaram a vida das pessoas, as actividades do dia-a-dia, os pensamentos e os sentimentos.

 

  • A consciência da importância de deixar uma memória de dois dos primeiros desastres relacionados com a mudança do clima

"[Beira]  vai ficar na história como tendo sido a primeira cidade a ser devastada completamente pelas Mudanças Climáticas", Graça Machel, ex-Primeira Dama de Moçambique e da África do Sul

A intensidade dos ciclones e dos seus danos foi inexoravelmente ligada à mudança climática. Para mim, e antes que desastres assim se tornem a norma, é importante fornecer um testemunho de experiências humanas vividas após dois dos primeiros desastres ligado à mudança climática de modo a deixar uma memória das mesmas acessível no futuro.

 

  • A vontade de dar de volta a um país pelo que ele me trouxe

“Para mim, visitar Moçambique é uma questão de coração”, António Guterres, Secretário-Geral da ONU

Passei cerca de 4 anos a viver e a trabalhar em Moçambique, e devo muito a este país e ao seu povo. Quando os ciclones atingiram o país, eu senti o impacto do choque para o país, para o seu povo, para os meus amigos e os seus familiares no meu coração. Hoje, quero reunir todas as capacidades e interesses que tenho para prestar os meus respeitos e fazer a única coisa que possa fazer: colectar retratos e testemunhos e dar uma voz às pessoas.

 

 

 

O que Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique incluirá?

 

Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique incluirá retratos de uma série de pessoas, os seus testemunhos, as suas fotos, bem como fotos de lugares que foram atingidos pelos ciclones. Incluirá igualmente capítulos breves sobre Moçambique e os próprios ciclones.

 

Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique contará experiências de pessoas, histórias individuais, reacções, eventos do dia-a-dia, pensamentos e sentimentos após os dois desastres.

 

Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique pretende incluir retratos e testemunhos da maior diversidade de pessoas possível, nomeadamente:

  • de pessoas que foram directamente afectadas pelos ciclones,
  • de pessoas que foram das primeiras a resgata-las e apoia-las (nacionais e internacionais),
  • de pessoas que foram afectadas indirectamente,
  • de pessoas que estão agora a ajudar seis meses depois, etc

 

 

O que significa Maningue?

 

"Maningue" é uma palavra coloquial originária das línguas nativas faladas principalmente no sul do país. Como advérbio, "Maningue" significa "muito". Como nome, "Maningue" pode também ser usado para confirmar o acordo com o que foi dito precedentemente. Usado como tal, "Maningue" pode ser traduzido por "Sim!!", "Pois!!!".

Uma das frases mais rapidamente ouvida ao visitar Moçambique é: "Moçambique é maningue nice!"; o que significa: "Moçambique é muito bom!"

 

 

Como será realizado Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique? - Quatro grandes etapas

 

 

 

O que precisamos?

 

Hoje Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique precisa da sua ajuda para financiar a segunda etapa do projecto: Recolher os testemunhos e retratos.

 

Esta etapa é uma etapa de primeira importância pelo projecto: um período de 6 semanas integras de trabalho em Moçambique para entrevistar pessoas, reunir os seus testemunhos e tirar as suas fotografias e as fotografias dos lugares atingidos pelos ciclones que irão alimentar o livro.

 

Para que servirá o dinheiro?

O valor de 12 000 euros inclui as despesas necessárias para realizar o trabalho a ser feito em Moçambique durante um período de seis semanas integras, bem como as taxas relacionadas com a campanha de crowdfunding.

Uma vez que os ciclones atingiram grandes áreas dentro do país, grandes áreas serão cobertas durante este tempo de trabalho no país. As distâncias e o tipo de estrada a percorrer envolverão voos nacionais, bem como longas viagens de carro 4X4 com um motorista habituado as estradas locais. O tempo passado em cada localidade será fundamental para conquistar a confiança das pessoas e permitir um tempo suficiente para realizar um trabalho de qualidade.

 

Agradecimentos pelo vosso apoio

 

Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique precisa da vossa ajuda para existir, e pensei numa série de presentes para vos agradecer pelo vosso apoio ao projecto.

Eu pensei muito nos presentes de agradecimento a vos propor. Eu queria que eles respeitem a essência do projecto e que sejam dignos do vosso apoio. Assim sendo, espero que irão gostar deles e apreciá-los ao máximo.

 

 

 

Saibam mais sobre mim

 

O meu nome é Aude Nowak, sou uma cidadã francesa de 33 anos. Eu sou a criadora e gestora do projecto Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique. Eu serei aquela que levará o projecto de A a Z. Eu sou uma pessoa multicultural, com interesses múltiplos e treinada em várias áreas.

Sou formada em economia de desenvolvimento, sociologia e hipnose.

Trabalhei para ONGs, ministérios em países em desenvolvimento, agências de desenvolvimento, as Nações Unidas e o sector privado como consultora internacional e economista de desenvolvimento. Dentro das minhas funções, organizei e levei a cabo missões de trabalho em seis países, entrevistando pessoas e elaborando relatórios oficiais e estudos com base nessas entrevistas.

Eu sempre gostei de tirar fotos e o meu segundo emprego - permanecendo não listado no meu currículo - era como fotógrafa.

Nos últimos anos, desenvolvi as minhas próprias actividades empreendedoras, incluindo escritura, e coaching e acompanhamento com base na hipnose.

Eu falo quatro idiomas (francês, inglês, português e espanhol), e no total, vivi e / ou trabalhei em nove países na minha vida: Moçambique, Laos, Índia, Sri Lanka, Zâmbia, Costa do Marfim, Reino Unido, Suíça e França.

 

 

Riscos e Desafios para a Etapa 2 Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique, e como superá-los

 

Enquanto empreender o trabalho em Moçambique, o projecto de certeza que encontrará desafios. A partir da experiência que tenho organizando missões de trabalho em vários países, e da experiência que tenho de Moçambique, estou confiante que poderei gerir os desafios emergentes e superá-los da melhor forma possível.

Nesta fase, já consegui identificar alguns potenciais desafios e formas de superá-los. Em primeiro lugar, a realização de trabalhos a nível distrital e provincial implica sempre um risco de atrasos e imprevistos. A escolha e a ordem dos locais a visitar, bem como a forma de organizar as entrevistas, serão ambos planejados de maneira a minimizar esses riscos e a facilitar uma maior flexibilidade e adaptabilidade no plano de trabalho caso isso for necessário.

Em segundo lugar, no dia 15 de Outubro de 2019, Moçambique irá realizar eleições gerais para o Presidente, o parlamento nacional, os governadores provinciais e os parlamentos provinciais. A fim de facilitar a organização das entrevistas e participação às mesmas, o trabalho será iniciado nas províncias após a realização das Eleições.

Riscos em termos de segurança existem na parte norte do país. A fim de garantir a segurança do motorista bem como a minha, os locais a serem visitados na parte norte do país serão, portanto, confirmados de acordo com a situação de segurança actualizada no momento da viagem.

 

 

Por favor, espalhem a palavra e contribuam a campanha

 

Se vocês gostem do projecto, por favor, apoiem-o, doando, falando sobre ele ao seu redor, gostando e compartilhando esta página e a página da campanha de angariação de fundos. Qualquer nível de doação, qualquer ´´gosto´´, qualquer ´´share´´ será mais um passo para tornar Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique uma realidade.

 

 

Em nome de Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique,

Muito Obrigada!

Maningue, Voix du Mozambique

Portraits et témoignages après le passage dévastateur de deux cyclones liés au changement climatique

 

 

Vue d´ensemble

 

En mars et avril 2019, deux cyclones dévastateurs ont frappé le Mozambique l´un après l´autre. Plus de 1,5 million de personnes ont été touchées.

Le projet Maningue, Voix du Mozambique a pour but de transmettre des récits et expériences individuelles vécus à la suite du passage des cyclones dans un livre photographique.

Au travers d´une série de portraits, de témoignages et de photographies, Maningue, Voix du Mozambique vise à donner une voix et une mémoire aux vécus individuels.

 

 

Contexte de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique

 

Dans la nuit du 14 au 15 mars et le 25 avril 2019, deux cyclones liés au changement climatique, Idai et Kenneth, ont frappé le Mozambique, touchant respectivement 1,5 million et 170 000 personnes dans 6 des 10 provinces du pays.

 

Cyclone Idai: "La pire catastrophe naturelle survenue en Afrique Australe depuis au moins deux décennies", UNICEF

La ville de Beira, habitée par un demi-million de personnes, et ses environs estimés endommagés ou détruits à 90% par la Fédération internationale de la Croix-Rouge.

Cyclone Kenneth: "La première fois connue dans l'histoire que deux cyclones tropicaux violents frappent le pays au cours de la même saison", UNICEF

 

 

Comment est née l'idée de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique?

 

  • La volonté de maintenir vivante l´information sur les cyclones et leurs conséquences

Lorsque les deux cyclones ont frappé le Mozambique, ils ont été largement couverts par les médias du monde entier. Aujourd'hui, on peut dire qu´il y a de manière générale beaucoup moins d´informations largement diffusées sur ceux-ci. Maningue, Voix du Mozambique est né de la volonté de maintenir l’information sur les cyclones en vie et espère y contribuer.

 

  • La volonté d'avoir accès à un autre type d'information

Les informations disponibles sur les cyclones ont principalement porté sur les dommages occasionnés, et ce type d´informations est effectivement extrêmement important à diffuser. Néanmoins, je pense qu´il est aussi important d´en savoir plus sur les expériences personnelles vécues au cœur de cette catastrophe. Maningue, Voix du Mozambique est né de la volonté d'en savoir plus sur les expériences humaines individuelles et sur l'impact des cyclones sur la vie, les activités, les pensées et les sentiments des gens.

 

  • La conscience de l’importance de laisser une mémoire de deux des premières catastrophes liées au changement climatique

 "[Beira] restera dans l’histoire comme la première ville complètement dévastée par le changement climatique", Graça Machel, ancienne Première Dame du Mozambique et de l’Afrique du Sud

L’intensité des cyclones et leurs dégâts ont été inexorablement liés au changement climatique. Pour moi, et avant que de telles catastrophes ne deviennent la norme, il est important de témoigner des expériences humaines vécues à la suite de deux des premiers événements dévastateurs liés au changement climatique afin d´en laisser une mémoire accessible dans le futur.

 

  • La volonté de redonner à un pays pour ce qu'il m'a apporté

“Pour moi, venir au Mozambique est une affaire de cœur”, António Guterres, Secrétaire Général des Nations Unies

J'ai vécu et travaillé pendant environ 4 ans au Mozambique et je dois beaucoup à ce pays et à ses habitants. Lorsque les cyclones ont frappé, j'ai ressenti l'impact du choc pour le pays, pour ses habitants, pour mes amis et pour leurs proches au plus profond de moi. Aujourd’hui, je souhaite rassembler toutes les compétences et tous les intérêts que j’ai pour honorer le pays et faire ce que je suis capable de faire pour lui: recueillir des témoignages et donner une voix aux vécus des gens.

 

 

Qu´est ce que vous pourrez trouver à l´intérieur de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique?

 

Maningue, Voix du Mozambique comprendra des portraits d’un certain nombre de personnes, leurs témoignages, leurs photos, ainsi que des photos de lieux frappés par les cyclones. Il comprendra également de brefs chapitres sur le Mozambique et les cyclones.

Maningue, Voix du Mozambique relatera des expériences personnelles, des vécus individuels, des réactions, des événements de la vie quotidienne, des pensées, et des sentiments vécus à la suite des deux catastrophes.

Le but de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique est d’inclure des portraits et témoignages de la plus grande diversité de personnes possibles, notamment:

  • des personnes directement touchées par les cyclones,
  • des premières personnes venues à leur secours (nationaux et internationaux),
  • des personnes indirectement touchées,
  • des personnes en train d'aider six mois après, etc.

 

 

Que signifie Maningue?

 

«Maningue» est un mot familier provenant des langues autochtones parlées principalement dans le sud du pays. Utilisé comme adverbe, il signifie «beaucoup» ou «très». Utilisé comme nom, il confirme un accord avec ce qui a été dit précédemment, et peut alors être traduit par "Ouais carrément !".

Une des phrases que vous entendrez le plus facilement au Mozambique est: «Mozambique é maningue nice!»; ce qui signifie: "Le Mozambique est absolument magnifique!".

 

 

Comment Maningue, Voix du Mozambique va être realisé? - Quatre grandes étapes

 

 

 

De quoi le projet a besoin ?

 

Aujourd'hui, Maningue, Voix du Mozambique a besoin de votre aide pour financer la deuxième étape du projet: la collecte de témoignages et portraits sur place.

Ce sera un moment crucial pour le projet: six semaines complètes de travail dans le pays pour discuter avec les gens sur place, recueillir leurs témoignages et prendre les photos qui alimenteront les portraits et le livre.

 

A quoi servira l'argent?

La somme de 12 000 euros couvre les dépenses nécessaires à l'exécution du travail au Mozambique sur une période de six semaines complètes, ainsi que les frais liés à la campagne de crowdfunding elle-même.

De grandes distances seront traversées étant donné que les cyclones ont frappé de vastes régions du pays. Les distances et type de routes à parcourir impliqueront des vols nationaux ainsi que de longs trajets avec une voiture 4X4 et un chauffeur connaissant les routes locales. Le temps passé dans chaque lieu sera déterminant pour gagner la confiance des gens et avoir un temps suffisant pour effectuer un travail de qualité.

 

 

 Remerciements pour votre soutien !

 

Maningue, Voix du Mozambique a besoin de votre aide pour exister et j'ai pensé à une série de cadeaux pour vous remercier de votre soutien au projet.

J'ai beaucoup pensé au choix des cadeaux à vous proposer pour vous remercier afin qu’ils respectent l´essence du projet et qu´ils soient dignes de votre soutien. J'espère qu’ils vous plairont et que vous en profiterez au maximum.

 

 

 

En savoir plus sur moi

 

Je m'appelle Aude Nowak, je suis de nationalité française et j´ai 33 ans. Je suis la créatrice et gestionnaire du projet Maningue, Voix du Mozambique. Je serai celle qui mènera le projet de A à Z. Je suis une personne multiculturelle, je m´intéresse à beaucoup de choses différentes et ai étudié et travaillé dans divers domaines.

Je suis formée en économie du développement, en sociologie et en hypnose.

J'ai travaillé pour des ONGs, des ministères dans des pays en développement, des agences de développement, les Nations Unies et le secteur privé en tant que consultante internationale et économiste du développement. Dans le cadre de mes fonctions, j'ai organisé et géré de nombreuses missions de travail dans différents pays, réalisé de nombreux entretiens auprès de personnes sur place, et rédigé des rapports et études officiels à partir de l´analyse de ces entretiens.

J'ai toujours aimé prendre des photos et mon deuxième travail – qui reste jusqu´à aujourd´hui non précisé sur mon CV – était photographe. Ces dernières années, j'ai développé mes propres activités entrepreneuriales, notamment l'écriture, et le coaching et l´accompagnement grâce à l'hypnose.

Je parle quatre langues (français, anglais, portugais et espagnol), et au total, j'ai vécu et / ou travaillé dans neuf pays dans ma vie: au Mozambique, au Laos, en Inde, au Sri Lanka, Zambie, en Côte d'Ivoire, au Royaume-Uni, en Suisse et en France.

 

 

Risques et défis de l´ Étape 2 de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique, et comment les surmonter

 

Au cours du travail sur place, le projet rencontrera très probablement plusieurs défis. De par mon expérience d´organisations de missions de travail dans divers pays et mon expérience au Mozambique, j’ai toute confiance que je pourrais identifier et gérer au mieux les défis qui pourraient voir le jour afin de réaliser le travail de la meilleure manière possible.

A ce stade, j'ai déjà pu identifier certains défis potentiels et des moyens de les surmonter. Tout d’abord, travailler au niveau des districts et des provinces comporte toujours des risques de retards et d’imprévus. Le choix et l'ordre des lieux à visiter, ainsi que la manière d'organiser les entretiens, seront planifiés de manière à minimiser ces risques et à permettre d´être flexible et de pouvoir adapter le plan de travail si nécessaire.

Ensuite, le 15 octobre 2019, le Mozambique organisera des élections générales pour le Président, le parlement national, les gouverneurs de province et les parlements de province. Afin de faciliter l'organisation des entretiens et de maximiser la participation des gens sur place, le travail dans les provinces sera commencé après la tenue des élections.

Enfin, dans le nord du pays, il existe des risques sécuritaires. Afin de garantir la sécurité du chauffeur et la mienne, le choix final des lieux à visiter dans le nord sera donc fait en fonction de la situation sécuritaire actualisée au moment du voyage.

 

 

S’il vous plait passez le mot et soutenez la campagne

 

Si vous aimez le projet, soutenez le, en faisant un don, en en parlant autour de vous, en aimant et en partageant cette page et la page de la campagne de collecte de fonds. Tout don, tout partage, tout ´´j´aime´´ est un pas de plus pour faire de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique une réalité.

 

 

Au nom de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique:

Merci Beaucoup !

Toda a campanha em português abaixo
Toute la campagne en Français ci dessous  01.10.19 Additional note to the campaign
As the campaign is entering its home stretch I am adding a short explanation about what the project will receive at the end of the campaign and why:
This campaign is ''fixed funds'', which means that either the target is met by the campaign's deadline and in such case the project receives the funds, or the target is not met by the campaign's deadline and in such case the project does not receive anything and each contributor is reimbursed.
Why such a system?
Because the budget for this campaign is calculated to cover real expenses.
If the project were to receive 30% of the target... it would unfortunately not be able to produce anything of quality.
We want to produce real quality work for you. So we chose all or nothing.
Let it be all :-)
----------------------------------------------------------
Alors que la campagne entre dans sa dernière ligne droite, je rajoute ces lignes pour préciser ce que le projet recevra à la fin.
À la fin de la campagne, soit elle aura atteint son objectif et le projet sera financé, soit elle ne l´aura pas atteint et le projet ne recevra aucun fonds (tous les fonds seront alors reversés à chaque contributeur).
Pourquoi un tel système?
Car le budget a été calculé pour couvrir des dépenses réelles.
Si le projet recevait 30%, il ne serait pas possible de produire quoi que ce soit de qualité.
Nous voulons produire un travail de qualité pour tous. Alors nous avons choisi tout ou rien.
A vous de jouer pour que ça soit tout :-)
 
 
The context behind Maningue, Voices of Mozambique
 

During the night of 14 to 15 March and on 25 April 2019, two consecutive cyclones, Idai and Kenneth, hit Mozambique affecting respectively about 1.5 million people and 170.000 people in 6 of the country 10 provinces.
 

Cyclone Idai:  "the worst natural disaster to hit southern Africa in at least two decades", UNICEF
Beira, a city inhabited by half a million people and surrounds were 90% "damaged or destroyed", according to the International Federation of the Red Cross
Cyclone Kenneth: "the first time in recorded history two strong tropical cyclones have hit the country in the same season", UNICEF
 
 
Where does the idea of Maningue, Voices of Mozambique come from?
 

The will to keep the information about the cyclones’ aftermaths alive
When both cyclones hit Mozambique, they were widely covered by worldwide news. Nowadays, it seems fair to say that there is much less coverage readily available on them. Maningue, Voices of Mozambique stems from the will to keep information alive, and hope to contribute to it.
 
The will to access to a different type of information 
The information available has focused on the direct damages caused, and I believe it is an extremely important piece of information to know about. However, I believe it is also important to know about the personal experiences lived throughout such disasters. Maningue, Voices of Mozambique stems from the will to know about individual stories and about how the cyclones affected people’s lives, day to day activities, thoughts, and feelings.
 
The awareness of the importance to have timeless memories of two of the first climate related disasters
"[Beira] will go down in history as having been the first city to be completely devastated by climate change’’, Graça Machel, former first lady of Mozambique and South Africa
The intensity of the cyclones and of their damages was inexorably linked to climate change. For me, before such disasters become the norm, it is important to provide a testimony of human experiences lived in the aftermaths of two of the first climate related disasters.
 
The will to give back to a country that has personally given me a lot
“For me, visiting Mozambique is a matter of the heart”, UN Secretary-General António Guterres
I spent about 4 years living and working in Mozambique, and I owe a lot to this country and to its people. When the cyclones hit, I felt the impact of the shock for the country, for its people, for my friends and for their relatives deep in my bones. Today, I want to bring together all the skills and interests I have to pay my respects and do the one thing I am able to do out of all that: collect testimonies and give a voice to people´s journey and thoughts.
 

 
 
What will Maningue, Voices of Mozambique include?
 
Maningue, Voices of Mozambique will include portraits of a series of people, their testimonies, their pictures, pictures of places which were hit by the cyclones, as well as brief background chapters on Mozambique and the cyclones.
Maningue, Voices of Mozambique will depict people´s experiences, individual stories, reactions, day to day facts of life, adaptations, thoughts, and feelings in the face of the two disasters and throughout everyday life.
Maningue, Voices of Mozambique shall include portraits and testimonies of the largest range of people possible, such as:

people who were most directly affected by the cyclones,
people who first came to support them (national and international),
people who were/have been affected indirectly,
people who are now helping, etc…

 
 
What does Maningue mean?
 
‘’Maningue’’ is a colloquial word originating from the native languages spoken mostly in the south of the country. Used as an adverb, ‘’Maningue’’ means ‘’a lot’’ or ‘’very’’. Used as a noun, ‘’Maningue’’ confirms agreement with what was previously said, and can then be translated by ‘’Of course’’, ‘’Oh yeah!’’, or ‘’That´s for sure’’.
One of the sentences you are most likely to hear while visiting Mozambique would be: ‘’Mozambique é maningue nice!’’; which means: ‘’Mozambique is very very nice!’’
 
 
How will Maningue, Voices of Mozambique be done? – Four Big Steps
 

 
 
What do we need your help for?
 
Today Maningue, Voices of Mozambique needs your help to finance the second step of the project: Gathering the testimonies and portraits.
This is a crucial step for the project: a full 6 weeks working time spent within the country in order to interview people, gather their testimonies and images that will feed the book.
 
Where will the money go?
The target of this campaign covers the expenses necessary to carry out the work to be done within Mozambique over a full six weeks period as well as campaign related fees.
Large areas will be covered given that the cyclones hit large areas within the country. The distances to cover will involve national flights within the country as well as long drives with a 4X4 car and a driver used to local roads. Time spent in each area will be critical in order to gain people’s trust and allow sufficient time to conduct quality work.

 
 
Rewards to thank you for your support!
 
Maningue, Voices of Mozambique needs your help to exist, and I thought of a series of advantages and gifts designed just for you to thank you for supporting the project.
I put a lot of thought into these thank-you gifts in order to respect the essence of the project and to warmly thank you for your support, and I hope that you will enjoy to the fullest :-)
 

 
 
Know more about me
 
My name is Aude Nowak, I am a 33 years old French citizen. I am the creator and manager of the project Maningue, Voices of Mozambique. I will be the one carrying the project from A to Z. I am a multicultural person, with multiple interests and trained in various fields.
I am trained as a Development Economist, a Sociologist, and an Hypnologist.
I worked for NGOs, Ministries in developing countries, development agencies, the United Nations, and the private sector as international consultant and development economist. Throughout these positions, I organized and conducted working missions within six countries, interviewing people and drawing official reports and studies from these interviews.
I’ve always liked to take pictures and my very second job – remaining unlisted on my CV – was as a photographer. In more recent years, I have developed my own entrepreneur activities, including writing and hypno-coaching and counseling.
I speak four languages (French, English, Portuguese, and Spanish), and in total, I lived and/or worked in nine countries in my life: Mozambique, Laos, India, Sri Lanka, Zambia, Côte d´Ivoire, the United Kingdom, Switzerland, and France.
 
 
Risks and Challenges for Maningue, Voices of Mozambique, Step 2, and how to overcome them
 
While undertaking the work of Step 2 in Mozambique, the project may run into several challenges. From the experience I have organizing working missions in various countries, and from the experience I have of Mozambique, I am confident I will be able to manage arising challenges and overcome them to conduct the work as best as possible. 
At this stage, I could already identify a few potential challenges and ways to overcome them. First, working at the district and province levels always carry out risks of delays and unforeseen events arising. The choice and order of the locations to visit, as well as the way to organize the interviews will both be planned keeping this in mind in order to minimize these risks and to allow for flexibilities and adaptability.
Second, on 15 October 2019, Mozambique will held general Elections for President, national parliament, provincial governors and provincial parliaments. In order to facilitate interviews’ organization and participations, the work will be started in the provinces after the Elections take place.
Security issues also exist in the Northern part of the country. In order to ensure the driver and my own safety, the final places to be visited in the Northern part of the country will be confirmed according to the updated security situation at the time of travel.
 
 
Please spread the word and support the campaign
 
If you like the project, please support it, by donating, by talking about it around you, by liking and sharing this page and the fund raising campaign page. Any level of donation, any like, any share will be one step close to making Maningue, Voices of Mozambique a reality.
 
 
On behalf on Maningue, Voices of Mozambique
Thank you very much!

Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique 
Retratos e testemunhos após a passagem devastadora de dois ciclones ligados à mudança climática
 
 
Visão Geral
 
Em março e abril de 2019, dois ciclones atingiram Moçambique um após o outro. Mais de 1,5 milhão de pessoas foram afectadas. Esforços nacionais e internacionais foram rapidamente implementados para resgatar e ajudar as populações afectadas.
O projecto Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique tem o objectivo de partilhar histórias e experiências individuais vividas após a passagem dos ciclones num livro fotográfico.
Através de uma série de retratos, testemunhos e fotografias, Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique pretende dar uma voz às experiências individuais e permitir que a sua memória seja transmitida no tempo.
 
 
O contexto por trás de Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique
 
Durante a noite de 14 a 15 de Março e no dia 25 de Abril de 2019, dois ciclones consecutivos, Idai e Kenneth, atingiram Moçambique afectando respectivamente cerca de 1,5 milhões de pessoas e 170.000 pessoas em 6 das 10 províncias do país.

Ciclone Idai: "o pior desastre natural a atingir a África Austral em pelo menos duas décadas", UNICEF
Beira, habitada por meio milhão de pessoas, e os seus arredores foram danificados ou destruídos a 90% de acordo com a Federação Internacional da Cruz Vermelha.
Ciclone Kenneth: "Pela primeira vez na história recordada, dois ciclones tropicais fortes atingiram o país na mesma temporada", UNICEF
 
 
Como nasceu a ideia de Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique?
 
A vontade de manter viva a informação sobre os ciclones e as suas consequências
Quando os dois ciclones atingiram Moçambique, eles foram amplamente cobertos pelas notícias em todo o mundo. Hoje em dia, parece que há muito menos a informação sobre os ciclones e as suas consequências é muito menos amplamente difundida. Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique nasceu da vontade de manter esta informação viva e amplamente difundida, e espera contribuir para isso.
 
A vontade de ter acesso a um outro tipo de informação
A informação disponível sobre os ciclones teve por enfoque os danos directamente causados ​​pelos ciclones, e é de facto uma informação extremamente importante para conhecer. No entanto, acho que é também importante saber sobre as experiências pessoais vividas no meio deste desastre. Maningue, Voices of Mozambique nasceu da vontade de saber mais sobre experiencias humanas individuais e sobre a maneira como os ciclones afectaram a vida das pessoas, as actividades do dia-a-dia, os pensamentos e os sentimentos.
 
A consciência da importância de deixar uma memória de dois dos primeiros desastres relacionados com a mudança do clima
"[Beira]  vai ficar na história como tendo sido a primeira cidade a ser devastada completamente pelas Mudanças Climáticas", Graça Machel, ex-Primeira Dama de Moçambique e da África do Sul
A intensidade dos ciclones e dos seus danos foi inexoravelmente ligada à mudança climática. Para mim, e antes que desastres assim se tornem a norma, é importante fornecer um testemunho de experiências humanas vividas após dois dos primeiros desastres ligado à mudança climática de modo a deixar uma memória das mesmas acessível no futuro.
 
A vontade de dar de volta a um país pelo que ele me trouxe
“Para mim, visitar Moçambique é uma questão de coração”, António Guterres, Secretário-Geral da ONU
Passei cerca de 4 anos a viver e a trabalhar em Moçambique, e devo muito a este país e ao seu povo. Quando os ciclones atingiram o país, eu senti o impacto do choque para o país, para o seu povo, para os meus amigos e os seus familiares no meu coração. Hoje, quero reunir todas as capacidades e interesses que tenho para prestar os meus respeitos e fazer a única coisa que possa fazer: colectar retratos e testemunhos e dar uma voz às pessoas.
 

 
 
O que Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique incluirá?
 
Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique incluirá retratos de uma série de pessoas, os seus testemunhos, as suas fotos, bem como fotos de lugares que foram atingidos pelos ciclones. Incluirá igualmente capítulos breves sobre Moçambique e os próprios ciclones.
 
Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique contará experiências de pessoas, histórias individuais, reacções, eventos do dia-a-dia, pensamentos e sentimentos após os dois desastres.
 
Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique pretende incluir retratos e testemunhos da maior diversidade de pessoas possível, nomeadamente:

de pessoas que foram directamente afectadas pelos ciclones,
de pessoas que foram das primeiras a resgata-las e apoia-las (nacionais e internacionais),
de pessoas que foram afectadas indirectamente,
de pessoas que estão agora a ajudar seis meses depois, etc

 
 
O que significa Maningue?
 
"Maningue" é uma palavra coloquial originária das línguas nativas faladas principalmente no sul do país. Como advérbio, "Maningue" significa "muito". Como nome, "Maningue" pode também ser usado para confirmar o acordo com o que foi dito precedentemente. Usado como tal, "Maningue" pode ser traduzido por "Sim!!", "Pois!!!".
Uma das frases mais rapidamente ouvida ao visitar Moçambique é: "Moçambique é maningue nice!"; o que significa: "Moçambique é muito bom!"
 
 
Como será realizado Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique? - Quatro grandes etapas
 

 
 
O que precisamos?
 
Hoje Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique precisa da sua ajuda para financiar a segunda etapa do projecto: Recolher os testemunhos e retratos.
 
Esta etapa é uma etapa de primeira importância pelo projecto: um período de 6 semanas integras de trabalho em Moçambique para entrevistar pessoas, reunir os seus testemunhos e tirar as suas fotografias e as fotografias dos lugares atingidos pelos ciclones que irão alimentar o livro.
 
Para que servirá o dinheiro?
O valor de 12 000 euros inclui as despesas necessárias para realizar o trabalho a ser feito em Moçambique durante um período de seis semanas integras, bem como as taxas relacionadas com a campanha de crowdfunding.
Uma vez que os ciclones atingiram grandes áreas dentro do país, grandes áreas serão cobertas durante este tempo de trabalho no país. As distâncias e o tipo de estrada a percorrer envolverão voos nacionais, bem como longas viagens de carro 4X4 com um motorista habituado as estradas locais. O tempo passado em cada localidade será fundamental para conquistar a confiança das pessoas e permitir um tempo suficiente para realizar um trabalho de qualidade.

 
Agradecimentos pelo vosso apoio 
 
Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique precisa da vossa ajuda para existir, e pensei numa série de presentes para vos agradecer pelo vosso apoio ao projecto.
Eu pensei muito nos presentes de agradecimento a vos propor. Eu queria que eles respeitem a essência do projecto e que sejam dignos do vosso apoio. Assim sendo, espero que irão gostar deles e apreciá-los ao máximo.
 

 
 
Saibam mais sobre mim
 
O meu nome é Aude Nowak, sou uma cidadã francesa de 33 anos. Eu sou a criadora e gestora do projecto Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique. Eu serei aquela que levará o projecto de A a Z. Eu sou uma pessoa multicultural, com interesses múltiplos e treinada em várias áreas.
Sou formada em economia de desenvolvimento, sociologia e hipnose.
Trabalhei para ONGs, ministérios em países em desenvolvimento, agências de desenvolvimento, as Nações Unidas e o sector privado como consultora internacional e economista de desenvolvimento. Dentro das minhas funções, organizei e levei a cabo missões de trabalho em seis países, entrevistando pessoas e elaborando relatórios oficiais e estudos com base nessas entrevistas.
Eu sempre gostei de tirar fotos e o meu segundo emprego - permanecendo não listado no meu currículo - era como fotógrafa.
Nos últimos anos, desenvolvi as minhas próprias actividades empreendedoras, incluindo escritura, e coaching e acompanhamento com base na hipnose.
Eu falo quatro idiomas (francês, inglês, português e espanhol), e no total, vivi e / ou trabalhei em nove países na minha vida: Moçambique, Laos, Índia, Sri Lanka, Zâmbia, Costa do Marfim, Reino Unido, Suíça e França.
 
 
Riscos e Desafios para a Etapa 2 Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique, e como superá-los
 
Enquanto empreender o trabalho em Moçambique, o projecto de certeza que encontrará desafios. A partir da experiência que tenho organizando missões de trabalho em vários países, e da experiência que tenho de Moçambique, estou confiante que poderei gerir os desafios emergentes e superá-los da melhor forma possível.
Nesta fase, já consegui identificar alguns potenciais desafios e formas de superá-los. Em primeiro lugar, a realização de trabalhos a nível distrital e provincial implica sempre um risco de atrasos e imprevistos. A escolha e a ordem dos locais a visitar, bem como a forma de organizar as entrevistas, serão ambos planejados de maneira a minimizar esses riscos e a facilitar uma maior flexibilidade e adaptabilidade no plano de trabalho caso isso for necessário.
Em segundo lugar, no dia 15 de Outubro de 2019, Moçambique irá realizar eleições gerais para o Presidente, o parlamento nacional, os governadores provinciais e os parlamentos provinciais. A fim de facilitar a organização das entrevistas e participação às mesmas, o trabalho será iniciado nas províncias após a realização das Eleições.
Riscos em termos de segurança existem na parte norte do país. A fim de garantir a segurança do motorista bem como a minha, os locais a serem visitados na parte norte do país serão, portanto, confirmados de acordo com a situação de segurança actualizada no momento da viagem.
 
 
Por favor, espalhem a palavra e contribuam a campanha
 
Se vocês gostem do projecto, por favor, apoiem-o, doando, falando sobre ele ao seu redor, gostando e compartilhando esta página e a página da campanha de angariação de fundos. Qualquer nível de doação, qualquer ´´gosto´´, qualquer ´´share´´ será mais um passo para tornar Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique uma realidade.
 
 
Em nome de Maningue, Vozes de Moçambique,
Muito Obrigada!

Français

Maningue, Voix du Mozambique
Portraits et témoignages après le passage dévastateur de deux cyclones liés au changement climatique
 
 
Vue d´ensemble
 
En mars et avril 2019, deux cyclones dévastateurs ont frappé le Mozambique l´un après l´autre. Plus de 1,5 million de personnes ont été touchées.
Le projet Maningue, Voix du Mozambique a pour but de transmettre des récits et expériences individuelles vécus à la suite du passage des cyclones dans un livre photographique.
Au travers d´une série de portraits, de témoignages et de photographies, Maningue, Voix du Mozambique vise à donner une voix et une mémoire aux vécus individuels.
 
 
Contexte de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique
 
Dans la nuit du 14 au 15 mars et le 25 avril 2019, deux cyclones liés au changement climatique, Idai et Kenneth, ont frappé le Mozambique, touchant respectivement 1,5 million et 170 000 personnes dans 6 des 10 provinces du pays.
 
Cyclone Idai: "La pire catastrophe naturelle survenue en Afrique Australe depuis au moins deux décennies", UNICEF
La ville de Beira, habitée par un demi-million de personnes, et ses environs estimés endommagés ou détruits à 90% par la Fédération internationale de la Croix-Rouge.
Cyclone Kenneth: "La première fois connue dans l'histoire que deux cyclones tropicaux violents frappent le pays au cours de la même saison", UNICEF
 
 
Comment est née l'idée de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique?
 
La volonté de maintenir vivante l´information sur les cyclones et leurs conséquences
Lorsque les deux cyclones ont frappé le Mozambique, ils ont été largement couverts par les médias du monde entier. Aujourd'hui, on peut dire qu´il y a de manière générale beaucoup moins d´informations largement diffusées sur ceux-ci. Maningue, Voix du Mozambique est né de la volonté de maintenir l’information sur les cyclones en vie et espère y contribuer.
 
La volonté d'avoir accès à un autre type d'information
Les informations disponibles sur les cyclones ont principalement porté sur les dommages occasionnés, et ce type d´informations est effectivement extrêmement important à diffuser. Néanmoins, je pense qu´il est aussi important d´en savoir plus sur les expériences personnelles vécues au cœur de cette catastrophe. Maningue, Voix du Mozambique est né de la volonté d'en savoir plus sur les expériences humaines individuelles et sur l'impact des cyclones sur la vie, les activités, les pensées et les sentiments des gens.
 
La conscience de l’importance de laisser une mémoire de deux des premières catastrophes liées au changement climatique
 "[Beira] restera dans l’histoire comme la première ville complètement dévastée par le changement climatique", Graça Machel, ancienne Première Dame du Mozambique et de l’Afrique du Sud
L’intensité des cyclones et leurs dégâts ont été inexorablement liés au changement climatique. Pour moi, et avant que de telles catastrophes ne deviennent la norme, il est important de témoigner des expériences humaines vécues à la suite de deux des premiers événements dévastateurs liés au changement climatique afin d´en laisser une mémoire accessible dans le futur.
 
La volonté de redonner à un pays pour ce qu'il m'a apporté
“Pour moi, venir au Mozambique est une affaire de cœur”, António Guterres, Secrétaire Général des Nations Unies
J'ai vécu et travaillé pendant environ 4 ans au Mozambique et je dois beaucoup à ce pays et à ses habitants. Lorsque les cyclones ont frappé, j'ai ressenti l'impact du choc pour le pays, pour ses habitants, pour mes amis et pour leurs proches au plus profond de moi. Aujourd’hui, je souhaite rassembler toutes les compétences et tous les intérêts que j’ai pour honorer le pays et faire ce que je suis capable de faire pour lui: recueillir des témoignages et donner une voix aux vécus des gens.

 
 
Qu´est ce que vous pourrez trouver à l´intérieur de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique?
 
Maningue, Voix du Mozambique comprendra des portraits d’un certain nombre de personnes, leurs témoignages, leurs photos, ainsi que des photos de lieux frappés par les cyclones. Il comprendra également de brefs chapitres sur le Mozambique et les cyclones.
Maningue, Voix du Mozambique relatera des expériences personnelles, des vécus individuels, des réactions, des événements de la vie quotidienne, des pensées, et des sentiments vécus à la suite des deux catastrophes.
Le but de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique est d’inclure des portraits et témoignages de la plus grande diversité de personnes possibles, notamment:

des personnes directement touchées par les cyclones,
des premières personnes venues à leur secours (nationaux et internationaux),
des personnes indirectement touchées,
des personnes en train d'aider six mois après, etc.

 
 
Que signifie Maningue?
 
«Maningue» est un mot familier provenant des langues autochtones parlées principalement dans le sud du pays. Utilisé comme adverbe, il signifie «beaucoup» ou «très». Utilisé comme nom, il confirme un accord avec ce qui a été dit précédemment, et peut alors être traduit par "Ouais carrément !".
Une des phrases que vous entendrez le plus facilement au Mozambique est: «Mozambique é maningue nice!»; ce qui signifie: "Le Mozambique est absolument magnifique!".
 
 
Comment Maningue, Voix du Mozambique va être realisé? - Quatre grandes étapes
 

 
 
De quoi le projet a besoin ?
 
Aujourd'hui, Maningue, Voix du Mozambique a besoin de votre aide pour financer la deuxième étape du projet: la collecte de témoignages et portraits sur place.
Ce sera un moment crucial pour le projet: six semaines complètes de travail dans le pays pour discuter avec les gens sur place, recueillir leurs témoignages et prendre les photos qui alimenteront les portraits et le livre.
 
A quoi servira l'argent?
La somme de 12 000 euros couvre les dépenses nécessaires à l'exécution du travail au Mozambique sur une période de six semaines complètes, ainsi que les frais liés à la campagne de crowdfunding elle-même.
De grandes distances seront traversées étant donné que les cyclones ont frappé de vastes régions du pays. Les distances et type de routes à parcourir impliqueront des vols nationaux ainsi que de longs trajets avec une voiture 4X4 et un chauffeur connaissant les routes locales. Le temps passé dans chaque lieu sera déterminant pour gagner la confiance des gens et avoir un temps suffisant pour effectuer un travail de qualité.

 
 
 Remerciements pour votre soutien !

 
Maningue, Voix du Mozambique a besoin de votre aide pour exister et j'ai pensé à une série de cadeaux pour vous remercier de votre soutien au projet.
J'ai beaucoup pensé au choix des cadeaux à vous proposer pour vous remercier afin qu’ils respectent l´essence du projet et qu´ils soient dignes de votre soutien. J'espère qu’ils vous plairont et que vous en profiterez au maximum.
 

 
 
En savoir plus sur moi
 
Je m'appelle Aude Nowak, je suis de nationalité française et j´ai 33 ans. Je suis la créatrice et gestionnaire du projet Maningue, Voix du Mozambique. Je serai celle qui mènera le projet de A à Z. Je suis une personne multiculturelle, je m´intéresse à beaucoup de choses différentes et ai étudié et travaillé dans divers domaines.
Je suis formée en économie du développement, en sociologie et en hypnose.
J'ai travaillé pour des ONGs, des ministères dans des pays en développement, des agences de développement, les Nations Unies et le secteur privé en tant que consultante internationale et économiste du développement. Dans le cadre de mes fonctions, j'ai organisé et géré de nombreuses missions de travail dans différents pays, réalisé de nombreux entretiens auprès de personnes sur place, et rédigé des rapports et études officiels à partir de l´analyse de ces entretiens.
J'ai toujours aimé prendre des photos et mon deuxième travail – qui reste jusqu´à aujourd´hui non précisé sur mon CV – était photographe. Ces dernières années, j'ai développé mes propres activités entrepreneuriales, notamment l'écriture, et le coaching et l´accompagnement grâce à l'hypnose.
Je parle quatre langues (français, anglais, portugais et espagnol), et au total, j'ai vécu et / ou travaillé dans neuf pays dans ma vie: au Mozambique, au Laos, en Inde, au Sri Lanka, Zambie, en Côte d'Ivoire, au Royaume-Uni, en Suisse et en France.
 
 
Risques et défis de l´ Étape 2 de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique, et comment les surmonter
 
Au cours du travail sur place, le projet rencontrera très probablement plusieurs défis. De par mon expérience d´organisations de missions de travail dans divers pays et mon expérience au Mozambique, j’ai toute confiance que je pourrais identifier et gérer au mieux les défis qui pourraient voir le jour afin de réaliser le travail de la meilleure manière possible.
A ce stade, j'ai déjà pu identifier certains défis potentiels et des moyens de les surmonter. Tout d’abord, travailler au niveau des districts et des provinces comporte toujours des risques de retards et d’imprévus. Le choix et l'ordre des lieux à visiter, ainsi que la manière d'organiser les entretiens, seront planifiés de manière à minimiser ces risques et à permettre d´être flexible et de pouvoir adapter le plan de travail si nécessaire.
Ensuite, le 15 octobre 2019, le Mozambique organisera des élections générales pour le Président, le parlement national, les gouverneurs de province et les parlements de province. Afin de faciliter l'organisation des entretiens et de maximiser la participation des gens sur place, le travail dans les provinces sera commencé après la tenue des élections.
Enfin, dans le nord du pays, il existe des risques sécuritaires. Afin de garantir la sécurité du chauffeur et la mienne, le choix final des lieux à visiter dans le nord sera donc fait en fonction de la situation sécuritaire actualisée au moment du voyage.
 
 
S’il vous plait passez le mot et soutenez la campagne
 
Si vous aimez le projet, soutenez le, en faisant un don, en en parlant autour de vous, en aimant et en partageant cette page et la page de la campagne de collecte de fonds. Tout don, tout partage, tout ´´j´aime´´ est un pas de plus pour faire de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique une réalité.
 
 
Au nom de Maningue, Voix du Mozambique:
Merci Beaucoup !

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
In 2013, a group of us were at Animethon in Edmonton, AB when the idea was pitched to do a sort of mini-con ourselves.

As we were part of the University of Regina's Anime Club, and most of us had been going to conventions for years, we thought it'd be a pretty neat thing to do.

In 2017, two of us finally said "Let's do this."

And so the Queen City AniFest was created.

What started out as an idea to help promote the many nerd-related fan groups on campus turned into a larger event that brought in local artists and talents.

In 2018, we went even bigger, and moved the Queen City AniFest to the Conexus Art Centre. It was a fantastic choice: the location offered us more space, better amenities, more staff, and we developed a solid relationship with the CAC staff.

For 2019, we want to be bigger, better, and have even more to offer. 

And that's where you come in.

An event like this doesn't happen overnight; nor does it happen on its own. It takes a dedicated core of volunteers, time, effort, and, of course, money.

As we are a non-profit organization, the majority of our funds are raised by admission sales and fundraising events; last year, there were also donations by staff and volunteers.

Space rental and advertising are our biggest costs, which is what we are asking for your help to offset. 

We want to make the Queen City AniFest an event that people will come to not only from all over Saskatchewan, but from all over the Prairies.

We want to show people that Regina boasts fandom communities and local artists and talents just as amazing as any you'd find in a city like Edmonton, Saskatoon, or Winnipeg.

story:
Hello you! 

Hello possible backer! You are awesome for checking this out! Let me quickly introduce myself; I am Lorence Cramwinckel, chair of this year's MSc Business Information Management (BIM) study trip committee. Together with Rick van 't Hof, Mateusz Bochenczak and Gabriel Müller Adade we are organizing this year's MSc BIM study trip to San Francisco and Silicon Valley! 

 

A little bit about the committe: We are all MSc BIM students ourselves at the Rotterdam School of Management, which is part of the Erasmus University. In the beginning of the academic year we were selected and asked to fulfill the challenging task of organizing a mind blowing trip to Silicon Valley with 28 students. 

That's us, from left to right we have: Gabriel, Lorence, Rick and Mateusz

A little bit about the MSc BIM study trip: The 19th of June we will fly to San Francisco to stay in the area for about 2 weeks and then we wil fly back to The Netherlands on the 4th of July again. During our time abroad we will visit numerous companies (from big corporates to small companies) to show our participants how they work, what they do and what they stand for. This is super valuable to students since they get a real understanding of different company cultures and are therefore more likely to make the right decisions when it comes to finding a job. Furthermore, this trip also includes a lot of bonding through group activities and it can also serve as great cultural introduction for those who have never been in the San Francisco bay area! 

 

Campaign

As you've read, we are organizing the MSc BIM study trip to Silicon Valley for 28 students, which will take place this summer. Due to some unforeseen circumstances the flight ticket prices to San Francisco have increased tremendously compared to previous years and funding has been cut by our study association. This resulted in more expenses than we can cover and to solve this we have been raising money like crazy! However, it is still not enough unfortunately and that is where you come in: You can help us close that scary gap in our budget! To the right you can find some awesome perks that might incentivize you to support us. We will continue our wild acquisition and in the end, we can make this happen together! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We. Need. Money. Simple as that! But what do you get? We thought of some very special perks for you and here's what we can offer you! 

  • Micro Sponsor Deal: you basically support us for only €5 (every penny counts!), in return we will always be grateful, and the universe will grant you some good karma! 
  • Postcard from San Francisco: That says it all, you receive a signed postcard from the committee!
  • Official Aftermovie Download in HD: One of our participants is well-known for his recording and editing skills and he won't dissapoint you!
  • A3 sized Poster with group photo: An A3 sized poster of an amazing group photo will be send to your home.
  • Special Closing Credits: In addition to receiving the aftermovie download your name/short message shall appear in the closing credits!
  • Souvenirs from San Francisco: Yes baby, you can get a super cool fridge magnet and a keychain delivered to your home!
  • Super Sponsor package: ALL IN! You receive a postcard, the official aftermovie HD download AND souvenirs from San Francisco! Get in while you can. 
  • Logo on Official Sweater: This is a sweet deal if you own a company that is looking to get in contact with MSc BIM students, or that wants exposure in America! This sweater will be worn and absolutely loved by our participants and your logo can be printed on it! 

 

We want to raise a minimum of €500. This together with our own acquisition should be enough to provide the participants with a carefree trip. This money will help to cover some of the costs in the US (accommodation is our main constraint). If however, we fail to reach this goal there is a chance our participants have to pay more than they are already paying for the trip. So every penny helps!

 

The Impact

As graduate master students a scary part of our lives will begin in a very short period of time: we will have to start our professional careers. Some students (like myself) have no clue yet about where they want to work or what they want to specifically. Our trip helps to form understanding of the company culture, especially in the tech area, and it provides profound insights to what these companies actually do.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you really can't contribute any monetary means not to worry! You can still help us by sharing this campaign with your family and friends who might be interested as well! Make some noice for us on social media or on your school/university. Every action counts, just remember that when you drop even the smallest pebble in a pond, it will create a thousand ripples

Thank you for reading this and thank you once again for making a difference!
