story:
Hey-ho, I'm Coco and I've cerebral palsy: The part of my brain which controls the walking was damaged at my birth due to a lack of oxygen. Doctors used to tell me I'd need a wheelchair one day. I didn't give up, though, and trained hard. And now I can walk, run, dance and: act.

I wanna be a professional actress both despite and because of my disability. I wanna show that we don't have to hide behind disability. It's time for a change: Disabled actors should be something ordinary and natural in the business. Just like their colleagues. That's my goal. Are you with me?

Now I've the chance to pave the way: I'm accepted at the New York Film Academy to an 8-month Conservatory-year Acting for Film in September 2017. I've some believers at the NYFA already. As I've passed the audition, I've got a scholarship. I've got the key to the door already. Since March I've already raised 11,000$ for #NYCoco.

Now I need you to get to New York and keep it going: Be a part of my dream and donate for my studies. I truly believe: Together we can make me walk, run, dance and act in New York. Anything goes — just like the wind blows, right? Let's change the world for the better!

Starting a film revolution? Be a part of it!

More info you can find on my website: www.nycoco2017.com
_______________________________________________________________

Hey-ho, ich bin Coco und habe eine Spastik von Geburt an: Der Teil meines Gehirns, der das Laufen steuert, wurde durch einen Sauerstoffmangel beschädigt. Die Ärzte sagten mir, dass ich eines Tages einen Rollstuhl brauchen würde. Ich gab aber nicht auf und trainierte hart. Jetzt kann ich laufen, rennen, tanzen und: schauspielen.

Ich möchte professionelle Schauspielerin werden—trotz und gerade wegen meiner Gehbehinderung. Ich möchte zeigen, dass man sich nicht hinter der Behinderung verstecken muss. Es ist Zeit: Behinderte Schauspieler sollten in der Schauspielbranche etwas Selbstverständliches werden. Geneau wie ihre Kollegen. Das ist mein Ziel. Siehst Du das auch so?

Denn jetzt habe ich die Chance, den Weg zu ebnen: Ich wurde an der New York Film Academy für eine 8-monatigen Conservatory-year Acting for Film Schauspielkurs im September 2017 angenommen. An der NYFA glauben sie schon an mich. Das Vorsprechen war erfolgreich. Ich habe ein Stipendium. Und den Schlüssel zur Tür sozusagen. 11.000$ habe ich schon seit März für #NYCoco gesammelt.

Damit's weitergeht und ich nach New York kommen kann, brauche ich Dich: Sei ein Teil meines Traumes und spende für mein Studium. Ich glaube wirklich: Zusammen können wir mich schauspielen, tanzen, rennen und laufen lassen — so schnell wie der Wind, richtig? Lass uns die Welt verbessern!

Eine Film-Revolution starten? Sei ein Teil davon!

Weitere Infos findest Du auf meiner Website: www.nycoco2017.com

story:
Right to left, speakers from the 2017 symposium: The late Kevin Behan, founder of the Immediate Moment Theory, Host Willem Larsen, and Adrian Bejan, Mechanical Engineer and founder of Constructal Law.

UPDATE: This year’s event will be dedicated to the memory of our dear friend and mentor, Kevin Behan, who passed away in February of this year.

It's the 21st century and we're still coming to terms with the primary organizing force of living systems - emotion.

At the crossroads of the Constructal Law (discovered by Adrian Bejan), Immediate Moment Theory (developed by Kevin Behan), Human Systems Dynamics (developed by Glenda Eoyang), and Concentric Ring Theory (from the lineage of animal trackers Tom Brown, Jr. and Jon Young), you'll find the Thermodynamics of Emotion Symposium.

Attendees of the 2019 Symposium

We are a small, intimate conference with the drive to...

* Learn the physics of all life.

* See and understand the patterns of emotions as real physical forces that shape our daily lives.

* Influence how these patterns drive and structure our relationships and organizations.

Where this conversation takes us is wide-ranging - from medicine to technology, from the corporate world to the wildest natural ecosystems, from old-time traditional wisdom to bleeding-edge science. 

Every year we produce media on our keynote speakers to inform and educate. Watch all our keynotes on our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGMtLuS-tT0OG0gvtW6uJGw

See our extensive archive of community resources at our website: http://thermodynamicsofemotion.com

The Historic Kennedy School Hotel

A Portland landmark, the Kennedy School is a former elementary school refurbished into a hotel packed with nooks and crannies and plentiful bars and meeting spaces, in a beautiful residential neighborhood in northeast Portland. A perfect location for our small conference.

THE HISTORIC KENNEDY SCHOOL HOTEL IN PORTLAND, OR - A perfect location for our small conference. Hotel stay is not included in conference fee.

 

We wish to grow this normally self funded collective for 2020. 

 

Goals for this years symposium:

Increase access to conference by lowering ticket cost.

Add new speakers to the conversation by covering travel expense.

GLENDA EOYANG, NEW GUEST SPEAKER works with public and private organizations to help them thrive in the face of overwhelming complexity and uncertainty. She is a pioneer in the field of human systems dynamics (HSD), which she founded. Through Human Systems Dynamic Institute, Glenda uses her Models and Methods to help others see patterns in the chaos that surrounds them, understand the patterns in simple and powerful ways, and take practical steps to shift chaos into order.

KEVIN BEHAN, GUEST SPEAKER 2018 KEYNOTE: “INTELLIGENCE OF THE HEART” Author of Your Dog is Your Mirror, Natural Dog Training, developer of the Immediate Moment Theory of human/animal emotion, and one of the nation’s foremost experts in the rehabilitation of aggressive and problem dogs.

ADRIAN BEJAN, GUEST SPEAKER 2017 KEYNOTE: CONSTRUCTAL LAW THERMODYNAMICS OF EMOTION Professor Bejan's research covers engineering science and applied physics: thermodynamics, heat transfer, convection, design, and evolution in nature. Professor Bejan was ranked in 2001 among the 100 most highly cited authors worldwide in engineering (all fields, all countries), the Institute for Scientific Information. Professor Bejan has received 18 honorary doctorates from universities in 11 countries.

BRANDT STICKLEY, GUEST SPEAKER 2019 KEYNOTE: “I THINK I FEEL” Brandt Stickley is an Assistant Professor in the College of Classical Chinese Medicine, National University of Natural Medicine. He has become an integral member of the event due to his insights on the mutually supportive connection between Classical Chinese Medicine and Immediate Moment Theory.

 

Please be aware: this is a fundraiser to make the event happen so cancellations won't be accepted once your card is charged, though you can always transfer your registration to another attendee.
story_txt: Right to left, speakers from the 2017 symposium: The late Kevin Behan, founder of the Immediate Moment Theory, Host Willem Larsen, and Adrian Bejan, Mechanical Engineer and founder of Constructal Law.UPDATE: This year’s event will be dedicated to the memory of our dear friend and mentor, Kevin Behan, who passed away in February of this year.It's the 21st century and we're still coming to terms with the primary organizing force of living systems - emotion.At the crossroads of the Constructal Law (discovered by Adrian Bejan), Immediate Moment Theory (developed by Kevin Behan), Human Systems Dynamics (developed by Glenda Eoyang), and Concentric Ring Theory (from the lineage of animal trackers Tom Brown, Jr. and Jon Young), you'll find the Thermodynamics of Emotion Symposium.Attendees of the 2019 SymposiumWe are a small, intimate conference with the drive to...* Learn the physics of all life.* See and understand the patterns of emotions as real physical forces that shape our daily lives.* Influence how these patterns drive and structure our relationships and organizations.Where this conversation takes us is wide-ranging - from medicine to technology, from the corporate world to the wildest natural ecosystems, from old-time traditional wisdom to bleeding-edge science. Every year we produce media on our keynote speakers to inform and educate. Watch all our keynotes on our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGMtLuS-tT0OG0gvtW6uJGwSee our extensive archive of community resources at our website: http://thermodynamicsofemotion.comThe Historic Kennedy School HotelA Portland landmark, the Kennedy School is a former elementary school refurbished into a hotel packed with nooks and crannies and plentiful bars and meeting spaces, in a beautiful residential neighborhood in northeast Portland. A perfect location for our small conference.THE HISTORIC KENNEDY SCHOOL HOTEL IN PORTLAND, OR - A perfect location for our small conference. Hotel stay is not included in conference fee. We wish to grow this normally self funded collective for 2020.  Goals for this years symposium:Increase access to conference by lowering ticket cost.Add new speakers to the conversation by covering travel expense.GLENDA EOYANG, NEW GUEST SPEAKER works with public and private organizations to help them thrive in the face of overwhelming complexity and uncertainty. She is a pioneer in the field of human systems dynamics (HSD), which she founded. Through Human Systems Dynamic Institute, Glenda uses her Models and Methods to help others see patterns in the chaos that surrounds them, understand the patterns in simple and powerful ways, and take practical steps to shift chaos into order.KEVIN BEHAN, GUEST SPEAKER 2018 KEYNOTE: “INTELLIGENCE OF THE HEART” Author of Your Dog is Your Mirror, Natural Dog Training, developer of the Immediate Moment Theory of human/animal emotion, and one of the nation’s foremost experts in the rehabilitation of aggressive and problem dogs.ADRIAN BEJAN, GUEST SPEAKER 2017 KEYNOTE: CONSTRUCTAL LAW THERMODYNAMICS OF EMOTION Professor Bejan's research covers engineering science and applied physics: thermodynamics, heat transfer, convection, design, and evolution in nature. Professor Bejan was ranked in 2001 among the 100 most highly cited authors worldwide in engineering (all fields, all countries), the Institute for Scientific Information. Professor Bejan has received 18 honorary doctorates from universities in 11 countries.BRANDT STICKLEY, GUEST SPEAKER 2019 KEYNOTE: “I THINK I FEEL” Brandt Stickley is an Assistant Professor in the College of Classical Chinese Medicine, National University of Natural Medicine. He has become an integral member of the event due to his insights on the mutually supportive connection between Classical Chinese Medicine and Immediate Moment Theory. Please be aware: this is a fundraiser to make the event happen so cancellations won't be accepted once your card is charged, though you can always transfer your registration to another attendee.

story:
Trump in Hollywood

As we all know, Trump’s star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame has faced an onslaught of attacks like no other star ever has before. Accused murderers’, thieves’, and embezzlers’ keep their stars intact, while assailants continue to destroy Trump’s star. While we can be sure that Trump himself pays little mind to the people who have taken the time to commit these acts of vandalism, we also know what each attack symbolizes. Every time someone goes down to the Hollywood Walk of Fame and destroys Trump’s star, they are making a statement about their values, and every time we let this destruction slide, we are making a statement about ours.

In order to finally do something, we are committed to replacing the Trump Hollywood star with one that more accurately defines who Trump is to all of us. Our gold-plated steel Hollywood star will not crumble under the jackhammers or pickaxes that vandals take to it. Rather, it will stand strong, just like Trump and just like all of us, no matter how vicious and no matter how aggressive the attacks may grow. It will stand strong in the face of everything.

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, we have come to you, Indiegogo, for help raising the funds that we need to purchase a gold-plated steel Hollywood star for Trump and then install it on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. To show our appreciation for your support, we are offering a special, limited-edition Trump Loyalty Pendant to all those who support our initiative. Plated in gold or silver, these pendants will serve as a daily reminder to you just how much you support our president!

The Impact

Trump’s agenda comes first. I know it, you know it, and everyone knows it. Still, symbols matter. This star matters. Our efforts will send a bold message to anyone who thinks about threatening us or our president!

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to making a monetary contribution, you can help us by sharing a link to our campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. The more people are aware of what we are doing, the smoother our efforts to install Trump’s new star will go. We appreciate all your support, monetary and otherwise, and we thank you for your time.

story:
I am an amateur writer and a professor of language, and I started a project to promote reading to preschool and lower grades school children and share audio books with them. I like to think of myself as a new sort of superhero – a Book Women. Since my journey is not supported like the ones of my fellow colleagues Batman and Ironman, I would like to invite you to provide financial support to my project.

How I thought of this project? We are witnessing that children today spend more time using computers, smartphones and other electronic devices, instead of enjoying books, play and crafts, which badly affects their brain development and ability of creative thinking and expressing.

My very unique project "Čigralište" (pretty untranslatable, and close to a hybrid of words whirligig and playground) is focusing on children and adults who believe in power of fairy tales, short stories and poetry.

On my website www.bajke.me you can find audio tales/books. Together with my enthusiastic family and friends I also organize hands-on, action-oriented workshops for pre-schoolers and children of lower grades of primary schools.

From May 2018, we organized more than 30 workshops, presenting different children books from all over the globe. We discussed these books with children aged 4-8 years, emphasizing the most important messages and always letting children express themselves through drawing, painting, colouring and other forms of art.

Reading to children has a positive impact on concentration, thinking processes and speech development, while creative activities increase attention, patience, and positively influence the development of fine motor skills. Through our workshops, we have brought culture to children and hopefully inspired them to read more and be creative.

We have also learnt a lot from them, and we will share just some of the beautiful thoughts we heard during the workshops:

  • “Of all emotions, I love the emotions I have for ice cream the most”, Maxim J., 4.5 years;
  • “Before we mock somebody, we have to think about the feelings of that friend”, Petra V., 6.5 years;
  • “We all get scared sometimes, but we have to talk about these fears with Mom and Dad, they will know what to do”, Balša M., 5 years;
  • “Frida (Kahlo) is wonderful because she taught us to never give up”, Martina V. 5 years;
  • “I was afraid of the heights, but then I climbed onto the scaffold and saw that it was not terrible”, Dejan J., 7.5 years old;
  • “Santa Claus is thinking of both bad and good children, but we should always try to be good”, Sofia I, 5.5 years old.

Our main goals when working with children and the once you will be supporting through your contributions are:

  • Connect verbal and written aspects and enrich children’s vocabulary;
  • Support the development of observing, analysing and memorizing facts;
  • Support the development of creative thinking and imagination;
  • Support understanding of others' and our own feelings;
  • Encourage children to demonstrate how they understood the stories through drawing, painting, modelling, movement, singing and acting;
  • Encourage the development of moral values ​​and humanitarian messages;
  • Support the parents to understand the importance of reading to young children.

We made a plan for 20 activities – workshops and book presentations starting from October 2019 to August 2020.  We also plan to make super cool art prints, postcards, t-shirts with project logo and unique art projects made by the children during the workshops. At the end of the project we will make a book about our workshops, with short stories about each workshop, as well as art made by the children.

In order to buy more books, travel and organize more workshops in different cities, buy all the necessary materials for kids crafts and arts, design and print certificates and prepare a book with stories from our journey, we need 12,000 $. If you are not able to financially contribute, please use Indiegogo share tools and share the information about the campaign with your friends and acquaintances.

All of our workshop participants will be promoted to superheroes: Book Girls and Book Boys because everybody loves a Book Hero!

The “Tilt Town” Flag

The collision of fields is the specific timemoment that the glaciers pull away, leaving the lake with it. The exact point where Indigenous People and European Immigrants established a trading Post. This originating the fixed settlement that has become Duluth.

The green triangle inserts the tilted city of trees. The blue table shows the connected water. And the unstandard white trapezoid reminds us Winter Is Coming lest we forget.

The “Tilt Town” Flag
The collision of fields is the specific timemoment that the glaciers pull away, leaving the lake with it. The exact point where Indigenous People and European Immigrants established a trading Post. This originating the fixed settlement that has become Duluth.
The green triangle inserts the tilted city of trees. The blue table shows the connected water. And the unstandard white trapezoid reminds us Winter Is Coming lest we forget.

story:
Summary

Hello from the Litchfield County Zine Fest organizer team! I'm Olivia M., and I'm the one who came up with the idea for the fest. I've been involved in zine culture since Fall of 2014, and since I discovered zines I've made over 25 zines of my own, traded hundreds of zines with other zine-makers, tabled at several zine fests and other art events, run several zine workshops teaching about zines and how to make them, and almost completed work on a zine-trading social network Android app called Let's Trade Zines, to be launched in the near future. Basically, my life revolves around zines!

Sometime around March of this year, I had the idea to organize a zine fest in my neck of the woods; Northwest Connecticut. I ran a survey looking for people who might be interested in tabling at such an event, and got over 30 responses from people in Connecticut, Massachusetts, New York, Rhode Island,  Pennsylvania, and even Ohio! 

I am passionate about spreading zine culture in my area, as it has incredible potential for inspiring creativity in people of all ages, facilitating new friendships, promoting the arts, and giving voice to unheard artists, particularly those from traditionally marginalized groups.

I've done my research, and I believe I can get the Kent Community House in Kent, CT for the Litchfield County Zine Fest. This venue comes with tables and chairs, enough for about 50 people to table at the fest. The space is accessible and has a gender-neutral bathroom, as well as a coatroom that would work as a quiet space. Given that I have experience with disability myself, I am determined to make this event as accessible as possible. Here is a video exploring the space: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYUrIgQcPuE

We applied for an arts grant to cover 3/4 of the costs of this event, but arts grants are on hold in CT because the state hasn't decided on a budget yet. There would have been an Indiegogo campaign either way, but it seems that the arts grant may not work out in time for the event. In the event that we get the arts grant in time for the event, the extra money will be spent on reach goals and paying organizers for their time and work.

I'm going to go ahead with plans for the zine fest no matter what, but your donation can help more artists be able to afford to come out and table (if we reach our goal, we won't have to charge tabling fees), help us to advertise the event so more local people know it's happening, and allow us more wiggle room for decorations, workshops, handouts, and freebies.

The zine fest will likely be held in October or early November, but there is no set date as of the start of this campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $1700, but we can run on less by charging tabling fees to vendors. We also have a few reach goals as well if we manage to raise more money than the base goal. Here's a breakdown of how we'll use the money:

  • Venue rental: $525 (rents Kent Community House for 7 hours, including set-up and clean-up; price includes tables and chairs)
  • Security deposit: $250 (will be returned if there is no damage to the property, in which case it will be used to pay organizers for their work)
  • Event insurance: $200
  • Newspaper ads and posters: $575
  • Other materials: $150 (this includes workshop materials, decorations, handouts, and other miscellaneous expenses)

Here's a breakdown of how we'll spend the advertising money:

Banner

$20

4 Week Ad in “Compass” Section of The Millerton News, The Lakeville Journal, and The Winsted Journal – 2 columns by 2”

$156

Two Week Ad in Shoppers Guide – 2 columns by 2”

$72

1 Day Ad (Thursday Before Event) in “Weekend” Section of the Republican-American – 1 column by 2.5”

$111

1 Day Ad (Sunday Before Event) Register Citizen – 1 column by 3”

$62

1 Day Ad (Sunday Before Event) in the Berkshire Eagle – 2 columns by 2”

$73

2 Week Ad in the Foothills Trader (price yet to be confirmed with advertising dept.)

$60

This adds up to $554, which we've rounded up to $575 to allow for any fluctuations in price. We would have added $50 for posters, but one of our organizers' contacts has agreed to donate them.

Reach Goals:

  • We don't have exact dollar amounts for these, but any extra money will go towards gas for driving some artists to and from the train station, potentially paying for non-organizers to give workshops, or to print free zines for attendants of the main Zines 101 workshop (run by me, Olivia M.)

Now, here's what you can get by donating!:

  • A donation of any dollar amount will get your name printed on the zine fest banner which will be hung outside the venue on the day of the event.
  • A $5 donation will get you a handmade Litchfield County Zine Fest pinback button
  • A $10 donation will get you a printed copy of a zine I made on zines and how to make them (48 pages long, 1/4 size). (This zine is available as a free download here for those who want to read it, but can't afford to donate $10: http://oliviaszines.tumblr.com/post/163371392859/free-zines-101-zine)
  • A $15 donation with get you a button and the zine from the $10 tier
  • A $50 donation will get you a mystery pack of zines from the zine fest organizers, as well as the items from the previous tiers
  • A $100 donation will guarantee you a full table spot at the zine fest

Risks & Challenges

We've never run a zine fest before, so there is some risk in this project, but we believe we can do it! Having experience attending and tabling at other zine fests, as well as running workshops, we believe we are capable of running this event.

Potential challenges would include not getting the Kent Community House for the zine fest, in which case we have a back-up venue, as well as ensuring that enough people show up to the event. This challenge is perhaps the scariest, but we believe a combination of advertising through newspapers, local posters, Facebook, email, and other social media will solve this potential problem.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute, spread the word about this campaign! If you live within driving distance of the fest, you could volunteer to either help with set-up, clean-up, greeting visitors, or driving artists to and from the train station (about ten miles each way). Email me at metaparadox11 AT gmail DOT com if you're interested in volunteering!

If you make zines, self publish, or do other indie art and might be interested in tabling/vending at the fest, fill out this form to show your interest: https://goo.gl/forms/GWO7au4Zwb0eJ1B22

Check out our website at: http://litchfieldcountyzinefest.wordpress.com/

Check out our Facebook page at: http://fb.me/litchfieldcountyzinefest

story:
Tulsa Gun Show, November 2017

We will be raising funds to secure a Gun Channels House in Tulsa for :

  • the Wanenmacher Gun Show
  • the J. M. Davis Firearms Museum tour
  • a Shooting Event at a Tulsa Range?

What We Need & What You Get

Here's how it breaks down:

  • Let's secure a house for the Gun Channels folks who will attend the Tulsa Gun Show
  • We will do a limited run of "Tulsa or Bust" Gun Channels perks

The Goal

Lets expand the frequency and scale of the Gun Channels get togethers
Not every gun channels member can attend the gun show, but together, we can make the event better than the attendees can achieve on their own:

  • LIVE shows from the Gun Channels house
  • Photos from the gun show & museum
  • Videos & Reviews of the Gun Show & Museum
  • Collaborations & Projects
  • Growth of the members Gun Channels

Risks & Challenges

We will apply all funds raised to the Tulsa Gun Show Gun Channels Meet Up.

  • No Risk, all funds will support Gun Channels members in Tulsa

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to help with this effort:

  • Help get the word out
  • Make some noise about our campaign and the Tulsa Gun Show.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools

Thank You

story:
• Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
After performing on international stages across Europe, US and Asia for charity concerts and official events, I have now been selected as Tenor soloist to perform with the HK Philharmonic as part of their annual fundraising event.

This event will be held at the HK Cultural Center Concert Hall on Feb 10th 2018 and is giving the opportunity for promising singers to be on stage with the prestigious HK Philharmonic orchestra based on sponsorship "by the minute". This is a great chance for me to sing in front of a large audience and with a renowned orchestra, while being a key participant to their fundraising.

Your contribution will give me the opportunity to sing 1, or more, song from my Opera repertoire depending on the total amount raised for this occasion: I need to raise at least USD 8,000 to perform 1 piece of music, and for every USD 8,000 an additional one.

About HK Philharmonic :
http://www.hkphil.org/eng/aboutus/orchestra/Pro...

About my work:
http://www.matthieusachot.com/

---

The Goal:

*To take full advantage of this opportunity I need to raise ideally USD 25,000 to sing 3 songs from my Opera repertoire, including music arrangements with the orchestra (extra USD 1,000).
*IMPORTANT: IF I DON'T REACH THE MINIMUM OF USD 8,000 NEEDED FOR PERFORMING 1 SONG, ALL YOUR SPONSORING WILL BE REFUND.

In return for your generous support, I will offer various perks:
- Concerts / recitals with musical instruments - in Hong Kong - in the form of Private Concert or a fundraising/ charity event.
- Your name on the programme of the concert.
- Singing lessons via Skype (if not in Hong Kong) or at your chosen location.
- VIP Tickets for the Concert (Value of HKD 1,500) > VIP tickets include VIP seating and ticket for the after-party at 'Al Molo' restaurant http://www.diningconcepts.com/restaurants/Al-Molo
- Tickets for the Concert (Value of HKD 500) 
​- Digital recording of the songs from the Concert
​- A personal Thank you Card from me

-------

Deadline:
All the sponsorship should be confirmed by JANUARY 8TH (less than 3 WEEKS FROM NOW!) to lock the opportunity and also for organisation and printing purposes.

It would be a great honor to share with you songs from my repertoire of Lyric music, world-known French, Italian opera arias or other Opera pop music along with the HK Philharmonic's grandiose accompaniment. 

Every participation will be greatly appreciated to make this beautiful opportunity happen, so please don't hesitate to share with music lovers and potential sponsors in your network!

story:
What is Saturdays in Saxapahaw?

Saturdays in Saxapahaw is a free, independent music series and farmers market which takes place every Saturday between May and August, from 5-8pm in Saxapahaw, North Carolina. 

What is this campaign all about?

We've been running Saturdays in Saxapahaw for 15 years, bringing excellence in music, food and art to residents in North Carolina. And oh how it has grown! We're going to keep it free, but we need your help to sustain and improve Saturdays in Saxapahaw.

All these years, we've relied on donations by passing a "Swan Bucket." However, 100% of those donations always go straight to the band; we need to raise funds to ensure that we can support everything and everyone else that makes Saturdays in Saxapahaw a unique experience.

Your donation helps to make sure Saturdays in Saxapahaw continues strong; it will help to improve the facilities as well as the quality of the sound and support the local wizard of oz operation & homemade three ring circus that is Saturdays in Saxapahaw!

What We Need:

Our goal is to raise $6,000. These funds will be used to:

Make sure our hard-working staff in the kids zone, our safety folks, sound engineers and market managers are all paid for their work as well as help cover insurance, portapotties, equipment and supplies! And Improve facilities in and around the market area! If we can raise the total amount we can have local police in place to help with crossing the street, parking and traffic.

What You Get:

Good Feelings All Over AND we have tons of exciting rewards: everything from private guided kayak rides on the Haw River to Oktoberfest Beer Passes, Annual passes for shows at the Haw River Ballroom, and more! Check out all our great perks!

The Impact:

Saturdays in Saxapahaw provides a platform for excellent North Carolina musicians, high-quality artists, foodies and farmers as well as craftspeople.  

Saturdays in Saxapahaw is a free, open-to-everyone, welcoming and non-discriminatory program where families from all over central North Carolina gather to relax, listen to great music and sample all that North Carolina has to offer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and share our campaign! Tweet, post and talk about it to your friends. If you've ever been to Saturdays in Saxapahaw, then you know!  Let's keep it going and keep it growing!

story:
Pride Rock offers these youth a unique opportunity to find a sense of community and express themselves together. Although Iowa has made positive steps towards supporting LGBTQIA+ youth, these young people continue to be at disproportionate risk of bullying and violence than their heterosexual and cisgender counterparts. Despite this, there remain few resources that are geared towards their needs and allow them to gather together and express themselves creatively.

Providing spaces for them to express themselves not only helps foster their own self-empowerment, but also provides opportunities to form communities with each other and connections with trusted adults. 

Your donations will help us:

-Provide campers with instruments! 
-Buy supplies for camp! 
-Cover administrative costs!
-Pay for food at camp! 
-Book a venue for our showcase! 
-Make sure that camp continues to be financially accessible to everyone!

Please consider supporting this amazing opportunity for LGBTQIA+ youth! And please spread the word about this fundraiser and about Pride Rock Camp. 

If you are interested in attending camp or joining as a volunteer, you may sign up through these links:

Volunteer application:  https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfvc6E...

story:
Donald’s coming to town. Don’t get angry. Get a tiny orange foam hand and protest.

We are producing 300 hands, selling them at a cost price of £5 each - this includes postage and packaging.

The first 10 with come with a special super deluxe So Great sticker pack and instructional sleeve.

HANDS UP - WE'RE ONLY SHIPPING TO THE UK.

story:
Fashion For Everyone

We believe fashion is inclusive. We have style for miles and love to create for all people. 

Jessica is the clothing designer of 808GyptsyLove. Jessica is the visionary of this entire collection.

Kenyetta is an all around designer for Creo by Keca. Kenyetta also designs our bags. 

Megan, also known as All Around Artist, screen prints fabric and garments. She also makes jewelry as All Around Style. 

The opportunity to showcase 808GyptsyLove's Spring/Summer 2018 Collection in New York is a testament to our collaborative abilities and will bring us, as well as our community, much needed recognition. 

When you support this campaign you are contributing to changing the fashion industry and beauty standards for good. Jessica, Kenyetta and Megan's mission is to create an inclusive culture that supports all shapes, sizes, identities, etc.

Our passion for creativity, design, expression and fashion is infectious. It is also much needed. We are building a unique community in the midwest encouraging people to be unapologetically themselves and up lifting artists.

We Need Your Help

We are humble artists. Will you help us get there?

We are traveling to New York and bringing our team with us. That means models, photographers, model coach, and of coarse the designers. We are raising a minimum of $2000 to accommodate our team. That means travel, lodging, and food. 

This opportunity will raise our entire community to another level. The exposure and experience of New York Fashion Week will grant us access to much needed networking and new opportunities. 

This is not just about 808GyptsyLove. We are tired of seeing one standard of beauty represented in mainstream media, the fashion industry, and our culture. Aren't you? We stand with body positivity, free the nipple, Fashion Revolution, and our pieces encourage self esteem, self confidence and self love. We want to change the world for the better.

About The Collection

Our collection has original screen printed fabrics by Megan LaCroix, All Around Style. The design on the print is called Death By Obsession. This design is a representation of how hard every single person works to achieve their goals and passions. We are literally killing ourselves for what we need. This print incorporated into Spring/Summer clothing is a metaphor of rebirth and resilience required to pick yourself back up after being knocked down or when a piece of us dies. The seasons we experience in the midwest are a constant reminder of our mortality and the ephemeral. We are required to sacrifice pieces of ourselves to progress. Death is part of nature, even though it is challenging as emotional beings to accept. The pain makes us grow and this is where the garments come into play. 

We are building from the ground up. The fabrics are mostly donated to us. In combination with the print these garments are, in a sense, created out of the death we experience. By creating something new from something old or dead, we are honoring the past, growing from the pain of living, and creating new life from these experiences. These pieces are the new growth out of the hibernation of winter. When spring rolls around, the neutral, dead environment soon sprouts with greens that turn to flowers. A reminder that there is life in death, strength in pain, change in discomfort, etc. This also plays into our persistence on changing the fashion industry and beauty standards. 

We are conscious of our impact on the world. That means humanity and the environment. Our mission is to uplift all, create new culture, and protect our inspiration which is this planet. This collection is also a call to all to get inspired, ask questions, challenge the norm, embrace your pain, grow from your struggle, share your story, and express yourself. Be an ally to the earth and all its living things.

Please Share Our Story

We know everyone can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

We ask that folks help us get the word out. You can do that by making some noise about our campaign on all your social media platforms. :D

Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools and share everyday please. 

 Jessica Hadley - 808GyptsyLove

 Kenyetta Caldwell - Creo by Keca

 Megan LaCroix - All Around Style

story:
Hi everyone,
My name is Siyabonga Vusumuzi Ndlozi  and I am second year medical student at the University of Stellenbosch, Cape Town. The goal of this post is to raise money to fund my travelling costs to Paraguay for an internship with YFU Paraguay. 

Little background:

As of 2016, I was privileged to visit Germany, in the province of Hessen-Mittelkalbach as an exchange student with Youth for Understanding South Africa (YFU SA). This has to be by far one of the greatest and proudest moments of my life as it has allowed me to do great things, learn from others, meet great people and enrich the lives of those I met on the way- for this, I will forever be grateful.

2016 not only marks the year I visited Germany but also the year I became part of a family bigger than my own- the International YFU Family. When I came back from my exchange year I decided to become one of the volunteers for the organization. Volunteering for YFU has been one of the most rewarding things I have ever done- The gravity of this decision has made everything possible for me today- I am now proud to say that at the tender age of 19, I am one of the National Board of Directors for YFU South Africa. I am hoping that the volunteer work will make it possible for me to reach far and wide, with a ripple effect that begins within and extends beyond the larger community, benefiting everyone in its wake. 

I will truly appreciate any contributions to make this opportunity possible- no matter how big or small.
If you can't make a contribution, but still want to be involved with YFU, find more info on (https://yfu.org/)

In appreciation,
Siyabonga Vusumuzi Ndlozi

“The best way to find yourself, is to lose yourself in the service of others.” – Mahatma Gandhi

story:
What We Need

We are raising funds to help us pay for a combination of speaker fees, film rights, catering, guest artists and teachers across the various events in the month. These funds help us to keep most of the Black History Month Celebration free to the public and therefore accessible to all.

The Impact

Now in its fourth year, Saxapahaw Black History Month is an important and impactful way to celebrate the unique contributions of Black people to American Society. At a moment when many of our communities are more divided than ever, the opportunity to come together as neighbors to celebrate the achievements of those who have been traditionally marginalized by mainstream American society, serves a vision for a more just and equitable world in which we all may live.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please let your friends and neighbors know about our campaign by sharing it on social media or by email. Be an ambassador for the Saxapahaw Black History Celebration, and by all means, please come and participate!

story:
After a number of people were alerted to the very poor state of this much loved windmill in 2018, a voluntary group was created to establish contact with the owners and try and find a way to at the very least undertake repairs that would correct major structural defects which could lead to its collapse.  Additionally we are attempting to waterproof and weatherproof the mill, and also pigeon-proof it.  

Much structural work has been done with the help of professional millwrights, and this appeal is a final one to top up funds for a third and final 'work-in' this year.  It is important we do this, as Winter is often harsh up there!

story:
The aim of this Project is to increase economical skills of ixtle producers of  El Bingu, La Vega and El Decá communities of Cardonal Municipality, Hidalgo, México, through the construction of a training center, built with local materials and intented to be used as a productive and training community space where they can transmit traditional and innovative techniques of their cultural heritage.

The sooner we finish the training center, the sooner producers will start increasing their skills.

 

Resume

Cooperación Comunitaria es una organización sin fines de lucro con sede en la Ciudad de México. En los últimos 7 años hemos trabajado con más de 2,800 personas de comunidades rurales y marginadas en México. Nuestros programas se centran en la gestión de la habitabilidad con un enfoque integral que toma en cuenta los factores sociales, económicos y ambientales para el desarrollo sostenible. Ejemplos de nuestros proyectos incluyen la autoconstrucción de viviendas con técnicas tradicionales y materiales locales, el apoyo a proyectos productivos que involucran el uso racional de los recursos locales y la promoción de las habilidades de construcción para asegurar la autosuficiencia y sostenibilidad de las comunidades.

Si desea saber más sobre nosotros y nuestros programas, visite:
http://cooperacioncomunitaria.org

 

Cooperación Comunitaria is a non–profit organization based in Mexico City. In the past 7 years we've worked with over 2,800 people from rural and marginalized communities in Mexico. Our programs focus on the management of habitability as a comprehensive approach that takes into account the social, economic and environmental factors for sustainable development. Common examples of our projects include the self–construction of dwellings with traditional techniques and local materials, the support of productive projects that involve the rational use of local resources, and the promotion of capacity building to ensure the self-suficiency and sustainability of the communities. 

If you want to know more about us and our programs, please visit our webpage, Facebook and Twitter: http://cooperacioncomunitaria.org/

 

Nuestro primer encuentro con los artesanos de El Decá tuvo lugar hace casi cuatro años mientras trabajábamos en otra comunidad cercana. Una familia de artesanos buscaba nuevas alternativas para producir y vender sus artesanías, ya que no tienen la infraestructura ni los medios financieros para aumentar su producción y transmitir sus conocimientos a otros habitantes.

En 2015, el grupo de artesanos de El Decá empezó a reunirse con grupos de otras comunidades para reforzar las habilidades de organización. Desde entonces, las comunidades de El Decá, El Bingú y La Vega trabajan juntas para lograr estos objetivos. Como parte de la labor integral, hemos estado trabajando con ellos impartiendo talleres de comercio justo, cadena de valor y economía solidaria.

Our first encounter with ixtle craftmen in El Decá took place almost four years ago while working in another community nearby. A family of craftsmen was looking for new alternatives to produce and sell their handicrafts since they don't have the infrastructure nor the financial means to increase their production and pass their knowledge on to other inhabitants.

In 2015, the group of artisans of el Decá started meeting with groups of other communities to enforce the organizational skills. Since then, El Decá, El Bingú and La Vega communities are working together to achieve these goals. As a part of the comprehensive work, we’ve been working with them, giving workshops of fair trade, value chain, solidary economy.

Reunión de talleres de las 3 comunidades / Workshops Meeting of producers of the three communities

 

Dado que los habitantes de estas comunidades dependen de la venta de productos de ixtle para su sustento, la necesidad de un centro de producción y capacitación se ha convertido en una prioridad. Su construcción promueve el rescate del conocimiento de las técnicas tradicionales de construcción y el uso de materiales locales para reducir el costo y el impacto ambiental. El diseño arquitectónico del centro toma en cuenta los usos culturales de los espacios rurales, cada habitación está diseñada de acuerdo con los hábitos de los productores y las necesidades para la producción adecuada de los objetos de ixtle.

Since the inhabitants of these communities rely on the sale of ixtle products for their livelihood, the need for a production and capacity training center has become a priority. The construction promotes the knowledge rescue of traditional construction techniques and through the use of local materials so as to reduce the cost and environmental impact of the construction. The architectural design of the center takes into account the cultural uses of rural spaces, as every room of the center is designed according to the producers' habits and needs for the appropriate production of the ixtle objects.

 

A finales de 2016 obtuvimos una subvención para construir el Centro de Capacitación y Producción de Ixtle para las comunidades y comenzamos la construcción en diciembre de ese mismo año. Estimamos un presupuesto, pero desafortunadamente, durante el proceso de construcción, la economía nacional sufrió una crisis generando el aumento de los precios de los materiales de construcción. Es por eso que necesitamos más fondos, para no tener que detener la construcción sin terminarla.

By the end of 2016, we earned a grant to build the Ixtle Production and Training Center for the communities. And we started the construction since December of 2016. We estimated a budget, but unfortunately, during the building process, national economy suffered a crisis generating the increase of the prices of building materials. That’s why, we need more funds, lest have to stop the construction without finishing it.

Iniciando la construcción del Centro de Capacitaciòn y Producción de Ixtle / Beginning the construction of the Ixtle Production Center

 

¿Por qué es tan importante este proyecto para la comunidad? / Why is this project important to the community?

El ixtle es una fibra natural que ha sido utilizada por las comunidades indígenas durante siglos. Hoy en día, los usos más comunes que se dan a la ixtle son la fabricación de cuerda, bolsas, zapatos, así como accesorios de baño y limpieza en general. Entre 1941 y 1991, la industria del ixtle en México fue organizada a través de la creación de 745 cooperativas y un gobierno único que poseía las plantas de procesamiento. En la década de los ochenta, después del aumento de la inversión para la industrialización, la producción de ixtle se distribuyó en pocas plantas hasta que la demanda comenzó a disminuir considerablemente con la llegada de materiales alternativos como el plástico, que comenzaron a obstaculizar los esfuerzos de los artesanos por posicionar sus productos en el mercado. Viendo que no podían competir con los nuevos costos de producción, los nuevos productores se vieron obligados a cesar esta actividad manual, hasta que un grupo de habitantes de El Decá decidió hace unos años volver a iniciar el proceso, al darse cuenta de que aún había demanda de estos productos.

Ixtle is a natural fiber that has been used by indigenous communities for centuries. Nowadays, the most common uses given to the ixtle are for manufacturing rope, bags, shoes, as well as cleaning, scrubbing and bathing accessories. Between 1941 and 1991, the ixtle industry in Mexico was organized through the creation of 745 cooperatives and a single government owned processing and selling plants. But in the 80´s decade, after the increase of investment for industrialization, the ixtle production was distributed in only few plants until the demand for it started to decrease considerably when alternative materials, such as plastic, began to hinder the craftsmen´s efforts to position their products on the market. Seeing that they couldn´t compete with the new production costs, ixtle producers were forced to cease this manual activity,  until a group of inhabitants from El Decá decided few years ago to start the process again when they realized that there was still demand for these products.

 

Este proyecto tendrá un impacto positivo directo en las condiciones de vida de los pueblos indígenas de estas comunidades marginadas, ya que podrán transmitir sus conocimientos y tradiciones a todos los miembros del municipio interesados ​​en aprender el arte de trabajar el ixtle. El nuevo centro también permitirá a los artesanos maximizar su producción ya que reducirá las cansadas horas de trabajo diario gracias a la disponibilidad de más espacio y materiales. Los objetos se venden actualmente en un mercado cercano a la comunidad y en un mercado de agricultores en la Ciudad de México, pero los artesanos desean alcanzar un mercado más grande para que su esfuerzo general sea recompensado de manera justa.

Obtendrán herramientas para fijar precios justos y eliminar intermediarios. Acrecentar la venta directa favorecerá sus ingresos y estimulará el ahorro. Todo esto les permitirá obtener recursos para invertir en los consumibles y bienes de capital que necesitan para impulsar la venta de sus productos.

This project will have a direct positive impact on the living conditions of the indigenous people from these marginalized communities as they will be able to pass their knowledge and tradition on to every member of the municipality interested in learning the art of making ixtle objects. The new center will also allow the craftsmen to maximize their production as they will reduce the tiresome hours of daily work thanks to the availability of more and adequate space and materials. The objects are currently sold in a local market in a Municipality near the community and in a farmer’s market in Mexico City, but the craftsmen wish to reach a bigger market so that their overall effort be rewarded fairly.

They will get tools to set fair prices and to eliminate brokers. So, they could enhance direct sell, which, in turn, will be favored by the income raising and saving stimulation.  All these will allow them to get resources to invest on the consumables and capital assets that they need to boost the sell of their products.   

También estamos trabajando en la promoción activa de la sensibilización de los consumidores y la sociedad civil sobre el proceso productivo y su valor social, cultural y económico. Fomentamos el consumo responsable, posicionando estos productos en el esquema de comercio justo para generar mayores ganancias para los productores y mejorar su nivel de vida.

We are also working in the active promotion of awareness of consumers and civil society about the productive process and it’s social, cultural and economic value. Encouraging responsible consumption, positioning these products in the fair trade scheme to generate higher profits for producers and improving their living standards.

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes /  What We Need & What You Get

Necesitamos al menos $ 5,100 dólares para terminar la construcción del centro de producción con materiales locales como hojas de maguey, piedra y quiotes (tallos de la flor del maguey).

* Construcción de todo el centro (164 m²) con materiales locales: $ 21,270 USD

We need at least $5,100 to finish the construction of the production center with local materials such as maguey leaves, stone and quiotes (stems of the maguey flower).  

* Construction of the entire center (164 m²) with local materials: $ 21,270

Esto incluye la mano de obra, la compra de materiales como concreto, madera, baldosas de arcilla y piedra si no hay suficientes en el sitio. El resto del material será utilizado directamente por la comunidad.

Los habitantes de las comunidades rurales de México dependen en gran medida de los recursos naturales para vivir y producir. Las plantas de maguey por lo general tardan entre 8 y 10 años para crecer plenamente en esta región semi-desértica, por lo que es necesario evaluar y promover el uso racional de la tierra y el maguey como una estrategia ambiental local. Alrededor de 50 habitantes asistirán al taller de planificación ecológica del uso de la tierra. A medida que sus conocimientos teóricos se fortalezcan, también lo hará su capacidad de gestionar su territorio inmediato una vez que el proyecto esté concluido.

This include the labour, the purchase of materials such as concrete, wood, clay tiles and stone if  there isn´t enough on site. The rest of the material will be directly used from the community. 

Inhabitants of rural communities in Mexico heavily rely on natural resources to live and produce. The maguey plants usually take 8 to 10 years to grow fully in this semi–desert region, therefore it is necessary to assess and promote the rational use of land space and maguey plants as a local environmental strategy. Around 50 inhabitants will attend the ecological land use planning workshop. As their theoretical knowledge will be strenghtened, so will be their ability to manage their immediate territory once the project is concluded.

 

Nuestras recompensas / Our perks

Cada producto de ixtle que usted recibirá será hecho cuidadosamente a mano por los productores de esta comunidad. Los objetos son respetuosos con el medio ambiente, más resistentes y tienen innumerables usos. Usted puede conocer más sobre cada uno (tiempo de producción, tipo de maguey utilizado) al leer la descripción de la recompensa. Además, como somos una organización sin fines de lucro, podemos emitirle un recibo deducible de impuestos pos su contribución.

Each ixtle object you will receive will be carefully handcrafted by the producers of this community. Ixtle objects are eco–friendly, extra resistant and have countless uses! You can learn about each ixtle object (time of production, and type of maguey used) when reading the perk´s description! Plus, as we are a non–profit organization we can issue you a tax–deductible receipt for each contribution.

Recompensa por donativo de $145 / Our $145 perk:

Tarjeta postal personalizada, video del proyecto y zacate corporal + llavero + limpiador  de cara./ Personalized postcard, project video and body scrubber + keychain + face scrubber.

 

Recompensa por donativo de $450 / Our $450 perk:

Postal personalizada, vídeo del proyecto, bolso, billetera, llavero, zacate corporal y limpiador de cara. / Personnalized postcard, project video and handbag, wallet, key–chain, body scrubber and face scrubber.

 

Recompensa por donativo de $1,000 / Our $1,000 perk:

Postal personalizada, vídeo del proyecto, bolso, billetera, llavero, zacate corporal, limpiador de cara, jabón del maguey, exfoliador de espalda, cepillo para cuerpo y cepillo para vajilla.

Personalized postcard, project video and handbag + wallet + key–chain +body scrubber + face scrubber + maguey soap + back exfoliator + body brush + dish brush.

 

El Inmpacto / The Impact

En las comunidades del Valle del Mezquital, los otomíes se han avocado a estas actividades productivas que han sido durante varias décadas su única fuente de ingresos. Con el nuevo centro:
- Los artesanos podrán preservar los conocimientos tradicionales de la cultura otomí, así como ser social y económicamente autosuficientes.
- Se fortalecerá el conocimiento práctico de las técnicas tradicionales de construcción y producción y se transmitirá a otros habitantes, a fin de promover la replicabilidad del proyecto una vez terminada la construcción.
- Se tejerá una red de productores de Ixtle, evitando intermediarios.
- En alianza con el Municipio, el edificio funcionará como un centro demostrativo del proceso de producción y los objetos finales.

 

In the communities of Mezquital Valley, the Otomí people have been relying on this productive activities for several decades as their only source of income. With the new center,

- The crafstmen will be able to preserve the traditional knowledge of the Otomi culture as well as be socially and economically self-sufficient.  

- Practical knowledge of traditional construction and production techniques will be strengthened and passed on to other inhabitants, so as to promote the replicability of the project once the construction is over.

- Ixtle producers' network to avoid intermediaries. 

- In aliance with the municipality, the building will function as a demonstrative center  of the production process and the final objects.

Además, dado que este proyecto es el punto de partida de un programa integral para la producción sostenible de maguey orgánico y productos de maguey como ixtle, pulque e inuline, para 9 comunidades del Valle Mezquital, su ejecución permitirá beneficiar a más de 2,900 personas en la región.

Moreover, as this project is the starting point of a comprehensive program for the sustainable production of organic maguey and maguey products such as ixtle, pulque and inuline for 9 communities in the Mezquital Valley, its execution will allow to benefit over 2,900 people in the region.

 

Nuestros proyectos / Our projects

Durante 2013-2015, Cooperación Comunitaria llevó a cabo la Fase 1 del proyecto integral de reconstrucción del hábitat en la comunidad de Obispo, en la región de la Montaña de Guerrero. Mejoró las condiciones de vida de los habitantes, reduciendo los riesgos de desastre a través de la elaboración técnica de un mapa de riesgo de deslaves. A través de talleres sobre técnicas reforzadas de construcción de adobe y la construcción colaborativa de un centro comunitario que capacitó a 210 familias para autoconstruir casas de adobe resistentes al viento y los temblores. 33 viviendas recuperaron los métodos tradicionales de construcción y el uso de materiales regionales. La estabilidad se incrementa a través del análisis sísmico, evaluación de la resistencia del material y elementos estructurales para reforzar el modelo tradicional. La autogestión sostenible de los bienes naturales se promovió a través de talleres teórico-prácticos sobre la reforestación para reducir los deslaves de tierra; autoconstrucción de 31 estufas ahorradoras de leña para reducir la deforestación y el riesgo de derrumbes; 24 inodoros ecológicos; y la recuperación de cultivos de maíz con técnicas agroecológicas.

In 2013-2015, Cooperacion Comunitaria conducted Phase 1 of the comprehensive habitat reconstruction project in Obispo community, at the Mountain region of Guerrero. It improved living conditions of the inhabitants, by reducing risks of disaster through the community and technical elaboration of a landslides risk map. Through workshops on reinforced adobe construction techniques and collaborative construction of a community center that prepared 210 families for self-construct adobe homes resistant to wind and earthquakes. The 33 homes regained traditional building methods and the use of regional materials. Their stability is increased through seismic analysis, material strength evaluation, and structural elements in order to reinforce the traditional model. The sustainable self-management of natural goods was promoted through theoretical-practical workshops about reforestation to reduce landslides; Self-construction of 31 firewood saving stoves to reduce deforestation and landslide's risk; 24 ecological toilets; and corn crops recovery with agroecological techniques.

 

Debido al éxito obtenido, replicamos el modelo en tres comunidades adicionales de la región montañosa, San Miguel, Laguna Seca y Moyotepec. En el presente año, construiremos centros comunitarios de educación indígena con maestros y personas de las comunidades de La Cienega y Ojo de Agua.

La metodología participativa a través de un equipo interdisciplinario asegura la adecuación de los objetivos y actividades del programa a las necesidades particulares de la comunidad. El proyecto considera las condiciones culturales, económicas y ambientales de las comunidades. Combina técnicas tradicionales con tecnología probada, que se adapta a las condiciones locales, garantizando la aceptación y participación de los habitantes del Proyecto.

Due to its success, we replicated it in three additional communities of the mountain region, San Miguel, Laguna Seca and Moyotepec. 

In the current year, we will build community centers for indigenous education with teachers and people of the communities of La Cienega and Ojo de Agua.

The participative methodology through an interdisciplinary team, assures the adequacy of the objectives and activities of the program to the community particular needs. The project considers the cultural, economic and environmental conditions of communities. It combines traditional techniques with tested technology, which adapts to local conditions, guarantying the acceptance and participation of the inhabitants in the Project.

 

¡Otras formas de ayudar! / Other Ways You Can Help!

Si no puedes hacer una contribución pero realmente quieres ayudar, comparte nuestro proyecto en Facebook y Twitter. También puedes decirle a tus amigos y familiares que formen parte de esta gratificante experiencia invitándolos a visitar el proyecto en nuestra página web o aquí en Indiegogo.

Además, ¿has probado las herramientas de intercambio de Indiegogo? ¡Son fáciles de utilizar y también muy eficaces!

If you cannot make a contribution but you really want to help, you can share our project on Facebook and Twitter! You can also tell your friends and family to be part of this rewarding experience by inviting them to visit the project on our webpage or here on Indiegogo!

Also, have you tried the Indiegogo sharing tools? They are easy to use and also very effective!

Jamädi!

¡Muchas gracias!

Thank you so much!
story_txt: The aim of this Project is to increase economical skills of ixtle producers of  El Bingu, La Vega and El Decá communities of Cardonal Municipality, Hidalgo, México, through the construction of a training center, built with local materials and intented to be used as a productive and training community space where they can transmit traditional and innovative techniques of their cultural heritage.The sooner we finish the training center, the sooner producers will start increasing their skills. ResumeCooperación Comunitaria es una organización sin fines de lucro con sede en la Ciudad de México. En los últimos 7 años hemos trabajado con más de 2,800 personas de comunidades rurales y marginadas en México. Nuestros programas se centran en la gestión de la habitabilidad con un enfoque integral que toma en cuenta los factores sociales, económicos y ambientales para el desarrollo sostenible. Ejemplos de nuestros proyectos incluyen la autoconstrucción de viviendas con técnicas tradicionales y materiales locales, el apoyo a proyectos productivos que involucran el uso racional de los recursos locales y la promoción de las habilidades de construcción para asegurar la autosuficiencia y sostenibilidad de las comunidades.Si desea saber más sobre nosotros y nuestros programas, visite:http://cooperacioncomunitaria.org Cooperación Comunitaria is a non–profit organization based in Mexico City. In the past 7 years we've worked with over 2,800 people from rural and marginalized communities in Mexico. Our programs focus on the management of habitability as a comprehensive approach that takes into account the social, economic and environmental factors for sustainable development. Common examples of our projects include the self–construction of dwellings with traditional techniques and local materials, the support of productive projects that involve the rational use of local resources, and the promotion of capacity building to ensure the self-suficiency and sustainability of the communities. If you want to know more about us and our programs, please visit our webpage, Facebook and Twitter: http://cooperacioncomunitaria.org/ Nuestro primer encuentro con los artesanos de El Decá tuvo lugar hace casi cuatro años mientras trabajábamos en otra comunidad cercana. Una familia de artesanos buscaba nuevas alternativas para producir y vender sus artesanías, ya que no tienen la infraestructura ni los medios financieros para aumentar su producción y transmitir sus conocimientos a otros habitantes.En 2015, el grupo de artesanos de El Decá empezó a reunirse con grupos de otras comunidades para reforzar las habilidades de organización. Desde entonces, las comunidades de El Decá, El Bingú y La Vega trabajan juntas para lograr estos objetivos. Since then, El Decá, El Bingú and La Vega communities are working together to achieve these goals.
