Plus, as we are a non–profit organization we can issue you a tax–deductible receipt for each contribution. Recompensa por donativo de $145 / Our $145 perk:Tarjeta postal personalizada, video del proyecto y zacate corporal + llavero + limpiador  de cara./ Personalized postcard, project video and body scrubber + keychain + face scrubber. Recompensa por donativo de $450 / Our $450 perk:Postal personalizada, vídeo del proyecto, bolso, billetera, llavero, zacate corporal y limpiador de cara. / Personnalized postcard, project video and handbag, wallet, key–chain, body scrubber and face scrubber. Recompensa por donativo de $1,000 / Our $1,000 perk:Postal personalizada, vídeo del proyecto, bolso, billetera, llavero, zacate corporal, limpiador de cara, jabón del maguey, exfoliador de espalda, cepillo para cuerpo y cepillo para vajilla.Personalized postcard, project video and handbag + wallet + key–chain +body scrubber + face scrubber + maguey soap + back exfoliator + body brush + dish brush. El Inmpacto / The ImpactEn las comunidades del Valle del Mezquital, los otomíes se han avocado a estas actividades productivas que han sido durante varias décadas su única fuente de ingresos. Con el nuevo centro:- Los artesanos podrán preservar los conocimientos tradicionales de la cultura otomí, así como ser social y económicamente autosuficientes.- Se fortalecerá el conocimiento práctico de las técnicas tradicionales de construcción y producción y se transmitirá a otros habitantes, a fin de promover la replicabilidad del proyecto una vez terminada la construcción.- Se tejerá una red de productores de Ixtle, evitando intermediarios.- En alianza con el Municipio, el edificio funcionará como un centro demostrativo del proceso de producción y los objetos finales. In the communities of Mezquital Valley, the Otomí people have been relying on this productive activities for several decades as their only source of income. With the new center,- The crafstmen will be able to preserve the traditional knowledge of the Otomi culture as well as be socially and economically self-sufficient.  - Practical knowledge of traditional construction and production techniques will be strengthened and passed on to other inhabitants, so as to promote the replicability of the project once the construction is over.- Ixtle producers' network to avoid intermediaries. - In aliance with the municipality, the building will function as a demonstrative center  of the production process and the final objects.Además, dado que este proyecto es el punto de partida de un programa integral para la producción sostenible de maguey orgánico y productos de maguey como ixtle, pulque e inuline, para 9 comunidades del Valle Mezquital, su ejecución permitirá beneficiar a más de 2,900 personas en la región.Moreover, as this project is the starting point of a comprehensive program for the sustainable production of organic maguey and maguey products such as ixtle, pulque and inuline for 9 communities in the Mezquital Valley, its execution will allow to benefit over 2,900 people in the region. Nuestros proyectos / Our projectsDurante 2013-2015, Cooperación Comunitaria llevó a cabo la Fase 1 del proyecto integral de reconstrucción del hábitat en la comunidad de Obispo, en la región de la Montaña de Guerrero. Mejoró las condiciones de vida de los habitantes, reduciendo los riesgos de desastre a través de la elaboración técnica de un mapa de riesgo de deslaves. A través de talleres sobre técnicas reforzadas de construcción de adobe y la construcción colaborativa de un centro comunitario que capacitó a 210 familias para autoconstruir casas de adobe resistentes al viento y los temblores. 33 viviendas recuperaron los métodos tradicionales de construcción y el uso de materiales regionales. La estabilidad se incrementa a través del análisis sísmico, evaluación de la resistencia del material y elementos estructurales para reforzar el modelo tradicional. La autogestión sostenible de los bienes naturales se promovió a través de talleres teórico-prácticos sobre la reforestación para reducir los deslaves de tierra; autoconstrucción de 31 estufas ahorradoras de leña para reducir la deforestación y el riesgo de derrumbes; 24 inodoros ecológicos; y la recuperación de cultivos de maíz con técnicas agroecológicas.In 2013-2015, Cooperacion Comunitaria conducted Phase 1 of the comprehensive habitat reconstruction project in Obispo community, at the Mountain region of Guerrero. It improved living conditions of the inhabitants, by reducing risks of disaster through the community and technical elaboration of a landslides risk map. Through workshops on reinforced adobe construction techniques and collaborative construction of a community center that prepared 210 families for self-construct adobe homes resistant to wind and earthquakes. The 33 homes regained traditional building methods and the use of regional materials. Their stability is increased through seismic analysis, material strength evaluation, and structural elements in order to reinforce the traditional model. The sustainable self-management of natural goods was promoted through theoretical-practical workshops about reforestation to reduce landslides; Self-construction of 31 firewood saving stoves to reduce deforestation and landslide's risk; 24 ecological toilets; and corn crops recovery with agroecological techniques. Debido al éxito obtenido, replicamos el modelo en tres comunidades adicionales de la región montañosa, San Miguel, Laguna Seca y Moyotepec. En el presente año, construiremos centros comunitarios de educación indígena con maestros y personas de las comunidades de La Cienega y Ojo de Agua.La metodología participativa a través de un equipo interdisciplinario asegura la adecuación de los objetivos y actividades del programa a las necesidades particulares de la comunidad. El proyecto considera las condiciones culturales, económicas y ambientales de las comunidades. Combina técnicas tradicionales con tecnología probada, que se adapta a las condiciones locales, garantizando la aceptación y participación de los habitantes del Proyecto.Due to its success, we replicated it in three additional communities of the mountain region, San Miguel, Laguna Seca and Moyotepec. In the current year, we will build community centers for indigenous education with teachers and people of the communities of La Cienega and Ojo de Agua.The participative methodology through an interdisciplinary team, assures the adequacy of the objectives and activities of the program to the community particular needs. The project considers the cultural, economic and environmental conditions of communities. It combines traditional techniques with tested technology, which adapts to local conditions, guarantying the acceptance and participation of the inhabitants in the Project. ¡Otras formas de ayudar! / Other Ways You Can Help!Si no puedes hacer una contribución pero realmente quieres ayudar, comparte nuestro proyecto en Facebook y Twitter. También puedes decirle a tus amigos y familiares que formen parte de esta gratificante experiencia invitándolos a visitar el proyecto en nuestra página web o aquí en Indiegogo.Además, ¿has probado las herramientas de intercambio de Indiegogo? ¡Son fáciles de utilizar y también muy eficaces!If you cannot make a contribution but you really want to help, you can share our project on Facebook and Twitter! You can also tell your friends and family to be part of this rewarding experience by inviting them to visit the project on our webpage or here on Indiegogo!Also, have you tried the Indiegogo sharing tools? They are easy to use and also very effective!Jamädi!¡Muchas gracias!Thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

The Intercollegiate Psychedelics Network is organizing the second-ever Intercollegiate Psychedelics Summit (IPS) from April 17-20th at Harvard University. Across the country, IPN members are founding and growing clubs that seek to responsibly introduce psychedelics back into academia, the clinic, and society at large with measured optimism. IPN is uniting a diverse array of stakeholders, including activists, scientists, and artists, to discuss the renaissance of psychedelic research and awareness and to envision a more equitable and compassionate society. Pioneers of this movement will be present, such as Rick Doblin, Founder of the Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS). Attendees will come from the Boston area as well as across the country. 

The theme of IPS 2020 is "The Convergence: Co-creating the Future.” As psychedelics become decriminalized and integrated into our healthcare system and broader society, our goal is to envision how the landscape of psychedelics and consciousness research will change in the coming decades. We hope to inspire college students across America who want to make a lasting impact on humanity by properly harnessing the potential of psychedelics. 
Emerging research illustrates psychedelics’ ability to alleviate suffering, including treatments for depression, anxiety, addiction, PTSD, eating disorders, and OCD.

You can purchase tickets here.

What We're Funding

This summit is completely student-organized, and we rely on donors and grants to make it happen! 

While any funds we raise are greatly appreciated, our goal is $20,000. 

Here is a breakdown of our expenses:

  • Marketing materials 

  • Event materials (posters, graphics, etc) 

  • Food and beverages 

  • Speaker travel and accommodation 

  • Scholarships for students’ transportation

  • Subsidizing tickets

 

We hope to lower ticket costs as much as possible and provide scholarships to students who cannot afford transportation, but we will prioritize covering the costs that are essential to the event operations.

The Impact

The so-called ‘Psychedelic Renaissance’ has ushered in a new era of psychedelic research that has the potential to literally save lives. However, in order to reintroduce, we must have measured discourse and integration for all parts of the psychedelic community. Our impact is to create a space for this discourse and allow the fertilization of ideas and community. We are grass-roots and student-run. We need your help to create impact.

Our first conference was an inspiring and illuminating experience, and we want IPS 2020 to reach new heights. We have put together a rockstar speaker lineup, incredible workshops across a variety of topics, and a mix of experiences like live art and music. We hope to bring together even more people this year in spirit of co-creating our future. 

Day 1 - 4/17: Convergence

Psychedelics and Medicine (Part I):

David Rabin, MD/PhD, leading the world's largest study on psychedelics

Albert Garcia-Romeu, PhD, psychedelics as therapy for Alzheimer's

Matt Johnson, PhD, psychedelics and addiction

Jerry Rosenbaum, MD, establishing a psychedelics research center at Massachusetts General Hospital

Psychedelics, Policy, and Economics:

Anna Martin, Pennsylvania Harm Reduction Coalition

Students for Sensible Drug Policy, psychedelic policy

Kane Dickinson, psychedelics and corporate business

Workshops:

-Art of scientific story-telling / how to give an elevator pitch

-Psychedelic careers

-Poster Session

Reception + Speaker Dinner

Day 2 - 4/18: Contemplation

9:00 AM - 7:00 PM, Harvard SOCH (59 Shepard St., Cambridge)

Mechanisms of Psychedelics:

David Olson, PhD, psychedelics as inspiration for plasticity-promoting neurotherapeutics

Katharina Glomb, PhD, connectome harmonics

Charles Nichols, PhD, anti-inflammatory effects and animal modeling of depression therapeutics using psilocybin

Chris Timmerman, PhD candidate, entropic brain theory

Gul Dolen, MD, PhD, oxytocin-dependent reopening of a social reward learning critical period with MDMA

Manoj Doss, PhD, the acute and enduring effects of hallucinogenic drugs on brain function and cognition

Psychedelics, Trauma, and Equity:

Kwasi Adusei, psychedelic harm reduction and peer support

Clancy Cavnar, PsyD, the influence of ayahuasca on identity and self-perception for gay and lesbian people

Psychedelics and Medicine (Part II):

Daniel McQueen, MA, cannabis as a psychedelic / cannabis-assisted psychotherapy

Paul Summergrad, MD, psychedelics and mental health

Katya Malievskaia, MD, COMPASS Pathways' commercialization of psychedelic medicine

Thomas Roberts, PhD, psychedelics as "ideagens" that enrich the liberal arts

Elizabeth Nielson, PhD, and Ingmar Gorman, PhD, psychedelic integration in psychotherapy

Workshops:

-Alex Aliume, the process of creating a psychedelic painting

-Lev Natan, MA, sound healing

-Matty Peru and Leia Friedman, integration circle

After Party

Day 3 - 4/19: Co-creation

Psychedelics and Spirituality:

David Yaden, PhD, psychedelics and self-transcendent experiences

Bia Labate, PhD, ritual ayahuasca use and shamanism

Kilindi Iyi

Derek Anderson, PhD, altered states as sources of new knowledge

Mike Crowley, PhD, secret drugs of Buddhism

Bryan McCarthy, PhD, psychedelics and responsible God-talk

The Theory and Exploration of Consciousness:

Andrés Gómez Emilsson, M.A., intelligent strategies for mapping out the state-space of consciousness

Räph Millière, PhD candidate, multidimensional views of consciousness

James Kent, PhD, psychedelic information theory

Michael Schartner, PhD, neural correlates of consciousness in the psychedelic state

Mike Tompkins, PhD, transcendental meditation as a vehicle for expanding consciousness

Tom Ray, PhD, mental entourage: from mechanisms of consciousness to mind design

Closing Remarks:

David Pearce, psychedelics, the future of humanity, and engineering paradise

Workshops:

-Carl H. Smith, psychedelic Virtual Reality

-Kathryn Devaney, PhD, metta meditation

-Miles Bukiet, interpersonal meditation

-Thomas Roberts, PhD, how to start a course on psychedelic studies

-How to write a policy memo

Day 4 - 4/20: Constellation

IPN Student Retreat

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you a business in the Boston area whose mission aligns with IPS? Email dionmackenzie7@gmail.com if you would like to showcase your products or donate food or beverages. We have several options available for companies who want to help sponsor IPS on a larger scale.

If you are unable to donate to IPS 2020 but would like to help in other ways, here are some suggestions: 

  • Share this campaign with your network 
  • Tell your friends about the conference. 
  • Consider buying a ticket when they go on sale. 
  • If you are a student, see if there is a psychedelic club at your school.

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Michael Hughes and I work with Northwest Rafting Company. Every November we adventure halfway around the world to share and explore the small mountain kingdom of Bhutan. While there we embrace the culture, explore famous Dzongs, monasteries, and watched as western culture blends with the long standing traditions of Bhutan. A handful of our guides have gotten to know the guides and formed long term friendships. We would love to return the hospitality and share our culture and rivers with them. 

The whitewater industry in Bhutan is fairly small and new, but growing rapidly as tourists come to visit and want some excitement in their trip. Getting a crew of Bhutanese guides here would help expose them to new whitewater and give them the opportunity to expand their knowledge of what it is to be a professional river guide.

What We Need 

We need $8,000 to get these boys from Bhutan to the U.S.A. 

A huge portion of that money will be used in airfare and visas from Bhutan's capital city of Thumphu, to Portland Oregon. 

Funds will also be used to help pay for food, lodging, and fuel to keep the adventure mobile going.

What You Get

There are a handful of excellent perks from a simple handwritten thank you to your own traditional Buddhist Thangka painting.

The Impact

Not everyone can afford, the time or money, to adventure around to world for new experiences. Helping this crew of young professions will help build and change their view of what it means to be a professional river guide. They will get the opportunity to travel outside of Asia and see what else the world has to offer. 

Risks & Challenges

This is probably the biggest project I have even taken on. I have never tried to raise thousands of dollars, and there is so much that needs to get done.

There are visa forms to be filled out and obtains, flights to figure out, and of course the adventure route. Lots of paperwork and hoops to jump through.

With a strong backing of friends, family, and outfitters I think we can raise the funds to help share a small slice of the American Whitewater community with our Bhutanese friends. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be excellent if you could help spread the word about our project on Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and any other social media you use. It would also be great if you could share with your friends and family that aren't connected via social media. Any and every little bit helps! Thanks!

story:
ABOUT US

We are an association that deals with the study of history and its revival. We have been active for 15 years throughout Croatia and Central Europe. The knowledge we gain from historians and researches is turning to reality. So today we have skilled people who know how to handle the weapons that was used 500 years ago. 

The Association annually organizes a large medieval festival last weekend in July. The event has been organized for 9 consecutive years. The attendance of our event is about 10,000 people but only about 2000 people can watch our battle on fortress because we are limited by space. Associations from Croatia and Europe are coming to help us make the battle and we have, more or less, 300 actors in our show. Fortress Klis is then theater for the event. 

We are doing the reconstruction of the battle of 1532 when Klis briefly fell into ownership of Ottoman Empire. Uskoks were guerrilla unit guarding the way to Adriatic Sea for 30 years against the Ottoman Empire. The goal of Sulejman I. Magnificent was to build a navy on the Split area because of the easier access to Christian capital of Rome. The pope Lion X, calls Uskoks " Antemurale Christianitatis" which means The bastion of the Christianity. The Uskoks have been top soldiers throughout history. The last time they were mentioned was in the time of the Great War after which they have disbanded. We can safely say that their existence as a soldiers is over 400 years old and today we cherish that story of our forefathers. 

 

WHY WE NEED FUNDS?

We need this money to improve our festival and to have a better offer for all future visitors. Our plan is to build stable, buy horses and donkeys and maybe other animals. We will also build a medieval  children's park with wooden carousel, the pool of shame and another game for children. We will complete the construction of blacksmith where we will make souvenirs on the spot. We'll get more weapons and uniforms. We'll buy armors so the view of our history is even better. We will create a training zone for learning martial arts with swords, spears, bows and arrows, axes and gunpowder weapons. The place for inns where to pour wine from our islands and prepare authentic delicacies of our climate will be made. Our plan is to move visitors away from reality and bring them to medieval history.

WHAT YOU GET?

First of all you will get your name on the memorial board because your support to realize the idea is very appreciated. Now, you have the chance to come to our fortress Klis and enjoy all that. We enjoy to share time with our visitors and every visit is an ideal opportunity for a new experience. Our passion is best to shown to you what we share our knowledge with you.

 Amateur archery tournament with traditional bow

Wedding day

 

THE IMPACT

This will greatly improve our presentation and hopefully people will recall what value can be found in natural life in today's world of contemporary and exaggerated technology. This will raise additional motivation for the members and the interest of the beginner, in one place you will have so much to see, try and gather some new skills. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you are not able to push us financially, you can share our video or project to your Facebook, Twitter, or another social networks profile.  If you have any question, contact us on info@kliskiuskoci.hr or visit our Facebook site (https://www.facebook.com/kliskiuskoci/ ). Also, if you have any ideas for us, we will be grateful for that.

Please follow our Facebook page and share the same.

We hope for a successful campaign and great support, and we thank you in advance!

WHY WE NEED FUNDS?
We need this money to improve our festival and to have a better offer for all future visitors. Our plan is to build stable, buy horses and donkeys and maybe other animals. We will also build a medieval  children's park with wooden carousel, the pool of shame and another game for children. We will complete the construction of blacksmith where we will make souvenirs on the spot. We'll get more weapons and uniforms. We'll buy armors so the view of our history is even better. We will create a training zone for learning martial arts with swords, spears, bows and arrows, axes and gunpowder weapons. The place for inns where to pour wine from our islands and prepare authentic delicacies of our climate will be made. Our plan is to move visitors away from reality and bring them to medieval history.
WHAT YOU GET?
First of all you will get your name on the memorial board because your support to realize the idea is very appreciated. Now, you have the chance to come to our fortress Klis and enjoy all that. We enjoy to share time with our visitors and every visit is an ideal opportunity for a new experience. Our passion is best to shown to you what we share our knowledge with you.
 Amateur archery tournament with traditional bow
Wedding day
 
THE IMPACT
This will greatly improve our presentation and hopefully people will recall what value can be found in natural life in today's world of contemporary and exaggerated technology. This will raise additional motivation for the members and the interest of the beginner, in one place you will have so much to see, try and gather some new skills. 
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you are not able to push us financially, you can share our video or project to your Facebook, Twitter, or another social networks profile.  If you have any question, contact us on info@kliskiuskoci.hr or visit our Facebook site (https://www.facebook.com/kliskiuskoci/ ). Also, if you have any ideas for us, we will be grateful for that.
Please follow our Facebook page and share the same.
We hope for a successful campaign and great support, and we thank you in advance!

story:
I politici rispettano le promesse? È sempre più difficile rispondere a questa domanda e distinguere il vero e il falso tra i tanti annunci, critiche e dichiarazioni. CheckPoint Promesse nasce per questo: fornire risposte semplici e chiare sull’operato della classe politica, metterci un punto. Fondato da studenti universitari e giovani professionisti, CheckPoint è un progetto giornalistico indipendente che traccia l’attività del governo italiano e monitora le promesse dei suoi componenti. Un osservatorio, unico nel suo genere in Italia, che attraverso gli strumenti del fact-checking – controllo delle fonti, uso di dati e trasparenza – fornisce un nuovo strumento di controllo ai cittadini che si vogliono informare. Perché ogni promessa è un debito.

 

CheckPoint è stato fondato a settembre 2018, e sarà lanciato fra il 17 ed il 19 settembre 2018, in occasione del traguardo dei 100 giorni del Governo presieduto da Giuseppe Conte. Farà riferimento ai valori di correttezza sostanziale e formale, trasparenza e rispetto per i lettori e per le loro osservazioni e critiche (più che benvenute). Non a caso sarà possibile segnalare nuove promesse ed errori come anche collaborare per lo sviluppo del sito.

La redazione di CheckPoint è formata da Bernardo, Lorenzo, Marco, Matteo e Mauro, cinque giovani studenti e professionisti italiani con la passione della politica e del racconto della realtà dei fatti.

Le promesse saranno raccolte in quattro categorie (mantenuta, in corso, in attesa e non mantenuta) e per ognuna di essa sarà presente una descrizione, con la possibilità per i lettori di approfondire la materia, ovviamente anche con riferimenti a link esterni. Sul sito e sui social saranno costantemente indicati gli aggiornamenti sulle promesse monitorate, con possibilità quindi per i lettori di poter essere informati in tempi molto brevi sullo stato dell'opera. 

CheckPoint è ancora in fase beta. Trattandosi di un progetto auto-finanziato e basato sull’impegno volontario, le tante novità in cantiere potranno essere aggiunte lentamente. Indici di affidabilità dei singoli politici, nuovo materiale video, infografiche, tante altre promesse già raccolte vedranno man mano la luce sul sito. Se speri che il sito offra al più presto tutte le sue potenzialità, puoi contribuire con una piccola donazione. Non potremmo che ringraziarti di cuore!

story:
Om oss & varför vi gör det här

Vi som dragit igång hela det här projektet heter Marit Norin och Torbjörn Zakrisson. Vi driver företaget Rockdale natur- och kulturupplevelser ekonomisk förening, där vi jobbar med upplevelser och guidningar, med stort fokus på porfyren och dess historia. Sedan juni 2015 driver vi även Porfyr- och Hagströmmuseet, på uppdrag av Älvdalens kommun. 

Transporten av Karl XIV Johans sarkofag från Älvdalen 1856 väckte mycket uppmärksamhet. Det var en stor historisk händelse som påverkade många socknar under resans gång. Den transporten är inte så väl dokumenterad och vi vill återskapa en liten bit av denna historiska händelse så historien ska bli lite mer levande. Vi tror och tycker att porfyrern och sarkofagens historia förtjänar lite större plats i rampljuset. Detta eventet inleder också det jubileumsår som vi firar 2018, med olika typer av aktiviteter under hela året.

Ditt bidrag gör att vi kan göra eventet mycket större och skapa en större upplevelse för alla, både för besökarna och för Kungshästarna (dragarna) och andra deltagare i eventet.

Vad vi behöver & Vad du får

Vår målsättning i den här kampanjen är att få ihop 80 000 kronor. Kostnaderna för hela eventet är mycket högre, och vi vill här passa på att tacka de fantastiska företagare vi har i Älvdalen, som bidrar med tjänster, saker och pengar. Pengarna vi samlar in här går till kostnader som är svårt att få sponsring till av företag. Det är tex:

  • Vissa transportkostnader
  • Visst material till bygget av kälken
  • Skyltar och informationsmaterial till eventet
  • Marschaller och andra "mysfaktorer"/stämningshöjande faktorer
  • Hyra av ljud- och ljusutrustning
  • Minnespokal till det företag/den förening som bidrar med flest dragare
  • Reseersättning för resor som görs i olika förberedelser 
  • Lunch till Kungshästarna när vi har "provdragning"

Alla som bidrar får något tillbaka! Beroende på hur stort ditt bidrag är så får man entrébiljett eller årskort till Porfyr- och Hagströmmuseet, en bok om porfyren, vykort med porfyrmotiv och/eller en porfyrsten. 

Varje krona vi får in kommer att användas till kostnader kring eventet. Om vi inte får in hela beloppet som vår målsättning är, får vi se över och dra ner på bitar som ej är absolut nödvändiga, såsom stämningshöjare. 

Risker & Utmaningar

Ibland går det inte exakt som planerat. "Det stora sarkofagdraget" är ett stort event där en del saker är ganska komplexa och en stor utmaning. Vi försöker alltid hitta lösningar på hinder och motgångar som kommer upp. Vårt motto, "Failure is not an option" (Ett misslyckande är inte ett alternativ), ledsagar oss och peppar oss när saker och ting är motigt och känns tungt, och därför brukar vi hitta vägar för att nå våra mål.

Andra sätt du kan hjälpa till på

Om du inte kan bidra med pengar, hjälp oss gärna med att sprida den här kampanjen till andra som kanske kan bidra. Använd gärna delningsfunktionerna som finns här på Indiegogo.

Du kan även hjälpa till med att sprida vårt Facebook-event "Det stora sarkofagdraget", så att fler personer får veta vilket galet roligt event som händer i Älvdalen den 10 februari 2018.

story:
We create a book for Ukrainian children to study French at the base of English.
This book will contain all the necessary elements (grammar, vocabulary, rules) to understand and remember the subject easily. We want to make the study book useful and colorful, modern and attractive to children. / We are creating a book to help Ukrainian children study at the base of English and their native language.

story:
Short Summary

Capital City Wrestling was started by a group of wrestling fans from around Montgomery and the surrounding areas. We all love watching and going to wrestling shows, and we wished there was a way we could enjoy it on a regular basis right in our home town. So we decided to do something. We are working with a great promotion out of Munford, AL Victory Championship Wrestling. We have worked out a deal with them to come to Montgomery and put on shows. Our goal for 2020 is to run one show every other month starting in February or March, but this will not be possible unless we have the full support of the Montgomery area wrestling fans. Capital City Wrestling was started by fans and is 100% for the fans. By contributing to and sharing this campaign you are helping ensure Montgomery will have great wrestling for many years to come.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $3000. After paying fees this will leave us enough to put on our first show. We want to put on the absolute best show possible for all the fans and that is going to take some money. We have to secure a suitable venue that can handle an event like ours, we have to pay for security, cleaners, people to help set up and break down the ring, and of course we have to pay the wrestlers. Victory Championship Wrestling has some of the best wrestlers around, from veteran wrestlers who have competed all around the world including WWE to up and coming stars like the Alabama Wrestling Rookie Of The Year. When you contribute you can be proud to know you were here from the beginning and helped make this possible. Besides just being proud we are also offering some great rewards for everyone who contributes. Here are just some of the amazing perks: online shout outs, ringside* seats, In ring photo ops, and even being part of the show. All this and much more. We also have perks available for Sponsors.

The Impact

We are all wrestling fans, and we all wish it was easier to enjoy live wrestling. Montgomery gets to enjoy live wrestling once or twice a year when WWE comes to town, and while that is fun it still leaves a huge hole. We will be providing high quality Independent Wrestling to our community at a much more affordable price year round.

Risks & Challenges

There is no risk for our supporters. We are running this as an All or Nothing campaign. That means as long as we reach our goal we will be putting on at least one show, and with the support of the wrestling fans many more after that. If we fail to reach our goal all backers will be refunded.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still help. If you want to support Capital City Wrestling you can do so by sharing this with all your friends. Share this on all your social media platforms and tell your friends and family. We need everyone's help to make sure everyone knows about what we are trying to do. We can't thank everyone enough for all the support. We know with the help of the Wrestling community we will succeed.

Notes *

Ringside seats are considered the first 3 rows.

All seats will be first come first serve.

All merchandise vouchers are good during the first show only, and cannot be redeemed for any cash.

Lifetime pass is only good for future CCW shows. and is non-transferable.

You may purchase any perk as a gift, please let us know if this is what you are doing.

Contacts / Links

Capital City Wrestling on FB

Victory Championship Wrestling on FB

Victory Championship Wrestling Website

Email

ccwmontgomery@gmail.com
